story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Brooke and as a former child welfare case manager I have seen first hand what families go through when they enter the Dependency Court process.  It is confusing, embarrassing and frustrating.  Something has to change!  A part of the process is visitation with the parents and children, which can be difficult due to a shortage in personnel who can monitor the visits, availability of a room to hold the visits and also the lack of time available.  Most parents work and cannot make it to visitation between 9-5, so they lose their opportunity to see their kids.This has a devastating effect on the children who are already angry and confused about what is happening. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need money for rent on a space large enough to comfortably accommodate ten families at a time.
  • We need to pay the salaries of the workers who will monitor the visits.
  • We need to provide comfy couches, toys and other fun things to break the ice at the family visits.

The Impact

There are over 500 families involved in the Dependency Court system in Collier County.  That is an incredible amount of children who are either living in foster care or relative care.  Not being able to see their parents during this process has negative effects on their education, mental health and physical health.

Seeing your child while you are working a case plan encourages you to keep going. 

Risks & Challenges

There is nothing like this center in Collier County at present.  We would be open seven days a week and after normal working hours to accommodate working parents and children who have after school activities. 

Start up funding for a non profit is very difficult to achieve.  Once the Center is up and operating, we can apply for grants and show our success.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help me get the word out and make some noise about this center.
  • Volunteer time to fix up the center once we find our spot!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Problem 



The Solution: DelightWipes 

The sexual wellness and intimacy company creating

1) Consumer Products, 

2) Content, and 

3) Mobile Applications 

to help Gen X'ers and Millennials make love more and make love better. 


Welcome to our launch product page for our first product, DelightWipes. 

In one simple sentence, DelightWipes are pre and post coital wipes to use after you and your lover get naughty. 

And another explanatory sentence.... You will use them to clean up before and after sex. 

It's pretty simple. There are a lot of products on the market that are labeled intimate wipes, and none of them are of the quality or made with the types of ingredients we want to put on our bodies. Intimacy doesn't end after the orgasm and post-coital hygiene is a critical part of keeping yourself and your lover healthy.

  • Our founder, Summers McKay is a former automotive reality tv show producer, MBA, turned UCLA Anderson instructor, and perpetual entrepreneur with an obsession for helping people live their best, most passionate, adventurous lives. 
  • DelightWipes will start by creating high quality, sustainable, biodegradable, natural post-coital wipes and expand into other intimate care products. In order to do this, we need to raise $15,000 to place our first product order.  
  • Our next immediate goal is to create the #MakeLoveMore app when we raise $50k. This private, personal app will offer you resources on enhancing intimacy, increasing the quality of your relationship and offering all the benefits that a happy, open and passionate relationship can bring. 


  • This company isn't just about making your love life better. It's about improving sexual health education throughout the world and increasing opportunities for women worldwide through that education. 
  • DelightWipes is important to Summers and her team because we believe that happy relationships, passionate intimacy, and respect for your body and the world will make the world a better place. Every contributor to DelightWipes helps us advance our goal of changing the way intimacy is discussed, improving sexual health education and helping the world #MakeLoveMore

What We Need & What You Get

We need $15,000 to work with our manufacturer to develop and distribute a high quality sustainable, biodegradable, natural product. 100% of the funding will go directly to product development. That's it. No gimics. We are launching this company and we need your help getting started.

When we earn more than our goal, the funding will go to product line expansion, product sampling, and marketing. There's no question in order to enter the market with a new product, we need money to help spread the word. 

When we exceed $50,000, we will develop the #MakeLoveMore app and everyone that has contributed will receive a free download of the app to their phones. 

Every contributor over $25 will receive a three month subscription to DelightWipes. That's an EarlyBird Discount on the product which is priced at $9.69 per month. 

There are a lot of other perks for various contribution levels. We'll raise the bar on perks as you raise the bar on contributions. Here's a quick taste of what will grow. 

Contributor Levels

$6.99 - A lovely thank you in our "This Week In Love" newsletter.

$25.00 - 3 month EarlyBird subscription to DelightWipes.

$69.00 - The previously mentioned perks AND honorable mention on our DelightWipes Wall of LOVE page.

$169 -  The previously mentioned perks AND a customized "pawtographed" picture from our Spokeskitty #DistinguishedCat

$690 - Things get really crazy here!!! You will receive your very own DelightWipes #DistinguishedCat Calendar with a year's worth of #MakeLoveMore inspiration from DelightWipes all in a very cute cat calendar. He'll pawtograph that for you too. 


AND SO MUCH MORE

Risks & Challenges

There is nothing easy about launching a new company and a new personal care product. We are a dedicated team of passionate entrepreneurs determined to bring this product line to fruition. There are risks and we are working to mitigate those risks. By collaborating with industry experts, we are building a company that will succeed. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Are you a cash strapped entrepreneur? Yeah, we get that. SOOOO we don't just want your help with contributions. You can help us out by sharing our campaign, joining us on social media, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and YouTube. By participating in all the fun stuff we are building over the next forty days, you will be an invaluable member of the team. 

Check in for updates and we promise, you'll find a way to help the world #MakeLoveMore!

Are you a cash strapped entrepreneur? Yeah, we get that. SOOOO we don't just want your help with contributions. Check in for updates and we promise, you'll find a way to help the world #MakeLoveMore!

story:
Who are we?

At the Infertility Awareness Association of Canada, we reach out to patients experiencing infertility. Front line assistance is a key part of IAAC’s mission, and we work through two main avenues: our help line, for basic information or for a listening ear and our national network of support groups. Another important outreach initiative, Canadian Infertility Awareness Week, was instated in 2007 to raise awareness and hope in the community.

IAAC exists today to meet needs that may go unaddressed in the course of medical treatment, to reach out to those who may not be aware of the treatment options available, and to raise public awareness of infertility and the difficulty for some to access treatment. IAAC is a national organization, providing educational material, support and assistance to individuals and couples who are experiencing the anguish of infertility, the reproductive health disease that affects over half a million Canadian men and women.

To learn more about fertility and how infertility can affect patients, please visit www.iaac.ca

We are are registered Canadian charity.

Charity Registration Number: 128921459RR0001

The Ask:

Infertility can be an isolating experience and because of social stigma surrounding it, many patients suffer in silence. Our peer-led support groups offer a way for patients to connect with each other and offer mutual support.

We have 38 support groups across Canada that meet once a month. Our support group network is continuously growing and we are asking for funds to :

·  Provide facilitation training to group leaders. We are planning to develop online training videos as well as better resource guides for facilitators.

·  Provide more educational materials for groups, including funding for guest speakers, a budget to mail out patient resources, and improve online resources.

·  Organize events for Canadian Infertility Awareness Week in each of our Support Group cities.

·  Add to our online patient resources for those who unable to access support groups

**We will soon announce exciting perks for different donation levels.**

Your support MATTERS.Thank you for supporting the 1 in 6 Canadians struggling to build their families. You may have just helped someone you know.

Follow our #1in6 campaign on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

We will issue receipts for donations over $20. Please be sure to include your full name and mailing address to receive for a tax receipt.

story:
How Camp Cheesecake Came to Be.


I'm Tami Cabrera, founder of the Muddy Paws Cheesecake Co in St Louis Park, MN.

 I grew up making and eating perfect cheesecake in the Chicago area. When I moved to Minnesota in 1991, I couldn't find cheesecake. I started bringing cheesecake into work and people kept asking me to make more. I left my job and put all of my savings on one large full page ad (talk about risky!). It worked! Over 20 years later, I'm still doing what I love: making people smile with cheesecake. We make over 222 flavors of cheesecake including gluten free and vegan options. We make cheesecake the old fashioned way: using whole ingredients, carefully monitored baking, and in small batches. We use many local ingredients and free range farm ingredients. We serve weddings, corporations, the general public, mail orders, fundraisers and restaurants. We also give a large portion back to the community in the way of donations and events we put on. We are actively involved in many Minnesota charities.

I am also a proud single mom to 4 incredible children.


Now it's time to give our little bakery new wings er um wheels. It's time for Camp Cheesecake! SO many people say "I wish you were closer!" Or "How can I get your cheesecake by me?".  We love connecting with community and Camp Cheesecake gives us even more ability to share our creamy delicious cheesecake.

 We can't wait to hit the streets of the Twin Cities with it! 

The extra cool thing about Camp Cheesecake is that because our products will be pre-packaged, we will be licensed to go just about anywhere (kind of like an ice cream truck)! We will come to your wedding, business, after school activities, sports games, street, driveway, private party, fundraiser, church and so many other activities. Cheesecake is a America's favorite treat! And our cheesecake food truck is the first of it's kind, it's CHEESECAKE on WHEELS! We will even have camping chairs available plus hooks bolted on the camper for your dog so you have two hands free to eat cheesecake. We'll offer 10 rotating cheesecake flavors daily including vegan and gluten free options.

Funding this project will make this all happen! If all goes to plan for the first year, we plan to roll out several more Camp Cheesecakes across the midwest next year! AND of course, giving back to the community will be a running theme thru it ALL. Cheesecake makes the world go round!

Where Does the Money Go?

Money will go to pay off the camper and for a vehicle (used) to pull it, the individual city licenses, incorporation and trademark fees, storage, an official office, insurance, music installation, build out, refrigeration equipment and staffing.  We will also have branding and marketing expenses, green serve ware to purchase, and transportation expenses. And of course we cool perks for those who donate! (Like a monthly tasting club, a flask, and VIP seating status ON the camper!) And EVERYONE who donates will be invited to our LAUNCH PARTY! One day we'd also really love a brick n' mortar location to park our campers and build out a Camp Cheesecake Cafe at. But for now: we just need to roll out ONE! Can you help? A cheesecake food truck? It doesn't get any better!

THANK YOU SO MUCH for coming to our page and for donating. Please share share share using the Indiegogo tools. Tell your company about it too - they'll be listed on our website, we'll shout them out online often and we'll bring Camp Cheesecake there (if in the Twin Cities)! Post on Facebook and Twitter. Tell everyone you know. I can't do this without your help!

Camp Cheesecake: bringing cheesecake to you anywhere you are.

story:
The #1 Go-To Resource for 

Bicycling the Roads of Colorado

Hello, I'm Michael Seeberg, the author and photographer of Road Biking Colorado -The Statewide Guide.


My book is a road cyclist's resource featuring 7,000 miles of Colorado's paved roads. The 2nd edition of this guide is already considered the leading resource for cycling in Colorado. Its content is a result of decades of dedication, providing you with statewide illustrated maps, profiles, photos and detailed descriptions of Colorado’s cycling roads.

 


Soon to be released
Road Biking Colorado – 3rd Edition (2 Volume Set)

I am currently working on my 3rd edition of Road Biking Colorado which is under contract with Fixed Pin Publishing. This new edition is well on its way, but stepping up an already great resource takes some time. Thanks to input from my readers, I've added numerous new roads with commentary, as well as expanding and refining my book's layout for easy route building. With a new larger page format and full color printing, the 2 volume third edition will continue to be the most comprehensive guide of its kind!


Colorado Cycling Website

I am very excited to have the support and enthusiasm of the community to take RBC to the next level.  I have assembled a team to develop an interactive website for members to create, communicate, network, share, and contribute to the Colorado biking community in a variety of ways.

  • Updates to Road Segments Online
    Our website will provide route updates between printings, so that members have access to the most up-to-date Colorado cycling information available.
  • Colorado Cycling Social Network
    Members will be able to connect and collaborate with other cycling enthusiasts including posting photos, maps, and sharing ride experiences online. Members will be able to share content about their rides.   Member’s shared photos will be featured on the website and considered for placement in future editions of the book.
  • Road Biking Colorado Blog
    Continuing with the spirit of cycling, I will be posting stories and other contributions on my blog and sharing links to other cycling blogs.

Trip Planning Services

My team also plans to offer one-stop shopping for planning cycling trips in Colorado. We will work with you personally to assemble customized multi-day route packages, that also include recommendations for accommodations, eateries, bike shops, transportation, and other special needs to create the cycling adventure of your dreams.


Photography Services

Are you planning or going to be a part of a special Colorado cycling event that needs professional photography services? Capture your personal day rides, cycling vacations and organized events forever in photos. That's right, I'll meet you at your ride destination and photograph you and your buddies out on the road. All services will be available for scheduling on the RBC website.



How you can help?

You can help bring Road Biking Colorado to the community through your generous contribution and by sharing this campaign. It has been my dream and lifetime pursuit to continue to provide professional, reliable information and guidance not only for the many tens of thousands of Colorado cyclists, but also for the several million visitors who come to our state every year. Together we can create an amazing multifaceted experience for the cycling community.

Your contributions are critical!  The funding I am seeking is certainly substantial. When I wrote my first edition of Road Biking Colorado, I left my home, my job, and my friends. I jumped off a cliff with the faith and conviction that I would create something that people would enjoy and would stand the test of time. I’ve since accomplished that goal and my readers have rewarded me with kind words, rave reviews, and heartfelt testimonials. With your support, we can build something that is truly a one-of-a-kind resource.

Tell others what I am up to! 

 

Instagram — @roadbikingcolorado Take a look at some of the roadscapes that I have captured over the years. These and many others in the current edition of RBC.

 

RBC Registration — Visit my website and register to stay informed with updates and other useful information.


 

RBC Facebook — Visit my Facebook page to see my latest  adventures in Colorado.

Road Biking Colorado
Funding Requirements

$168,000  PHASE 1 GOAL: Finish book, build and launch website, and market both of them - first year. 
  
$10,000 - 3rd Edition Production & Marketing Expenses 
$25,000 -  Event Vehicle/Mobile Office.  I will sell my FJ Cruiser 4X4 and get a used utility vehicle.  I'll be living and working out of this vehicle for a large portion of the next couple of years, the size I need will cost upwards of $25-30,000 plus taxes and licences (slightly used - it must be reliable).  So, with my truck sale and some help from all of you, I'll have a home/office on wheels, this way I'll be able to be out on Colorado's backroads finishing the book, bringing in fresh content, photos, and updates, and covering events for you 
$50,000 - RBC Website Development.  This is a large chunk, it's a fairly complex concept to put together, technically speaking.  My media team will do most of the work, but we will also need to hire out some of the html code writing.  With building and testing plus launch costs, it simply adds up to a lot of very expensive labor hours. 
$40,000 – Business startup/Overhead/Operating Expenses (first year)  This will include business licencing fees, account set ups, monthly software licencing fees, Cell, internet, and cloud storage backup costs.  There is also photography and video supplies and equipment upkeep, vehicle insurance, gasoline, and maintenance to pay for.  Lots of miscellaneous stuff too like basic office supplies and business cards.   
$8,400 – Rent and utilities for one year.  I will be moving out of my condo, I have a room arranged for cheaper, and will put most of my belongings in storage.  If I need to go without a "home" for a while, that's fine, that's what it takes.  I did it for the first edition, I camped out every night and bathed in backcountry streams to eliminate lodging costs.  Because you all are so awesome and generous, I want to cut costs as much as possible, so now I will gladly do it again for the third edition.
$20,000- Personal Expenses  Since it is necessary to go part-time at my workplace, I'll have to start paying for health insurance.  My current vehicle is paid for but I do have a very small credit card payment, I should be able to cover those things with part-time work.  That leaves food, clothing, and personal hygiene supplies for a year. 

$13,806 –The price tag for Phase 1 is $153,400, a 9% Indiegogo fee would amount to $13,806, which explains the $168,000 figure.


Campaign Summary

$168,000 is needed to launch Phase 1

Ultimately, the revenues created will sustain the endeavors of this project.  We will also be looking for additional financing to quickly expand our capabilities.  This is why our campaign goal is $250,000, we want to create a complete experience for our members and guests.  My 3rd edition is only a few months from submission to my publisher, that is, if I am allowed the necessary time away from my job, and the website can follow right along if you will please help now.  If you feel our goal is too much at once, then please allow us the first phase and we will show you what we can do.

  • Mobile Route Building Tool
    Imagine having route information from my guide at your fingertips.  Mobile integration with our website will allow cyclists to string biking road segments together to create unique routes with detailed documentation, color photos, maps, and profiles.  Cyclists will be able to share their unique journeys with others in the community, including photos and comments of their ride.

Phase 2 will involve creating and marketing our mobile app, website, and book together as one.  Getting the word out to the community will be integral to our growth. Accomplishing Phase 1 will give us a great starting placed for something really special. I know that you and others who get involved will want to continue playing a special part in this worthwhile journey.


Your Impact on Road Biking Colorado

The truly comprehensive nature of my book has spawned emails from people all over the world thanking me for creating such an invaluable guide.  Time and time again I am told how my book has helped them discover the most amazing rides of their lives, or how it lives on their nightstand, or in their car's glove box.

I cannot overstate how important your help is to the future success of Road Biking Colorado. Help me pursue this opportunity and complete my life's work.  My dream to share Colorado’s incredible cycling destinations began over three decades ago. There are currently no one-stop shop resources for Coloradans and the millions of vacationing cyclists coming to visit each year. Together we can change that!
story_txt:
The #1 Go-To Resource for Bicycling the Roads of Colorado





Hello, I'm Michael Seeberg, the author and photographer of Road Biking Colorado -The Statewide Guide.



      My book is a road cyclist's resource  featuring 7,000 miles of Colorado's  paved roads. The 2nd edition of this guide is already considered the leading  resource for cycling  in Colorado. Its content is a result of decades of  dedication, providing you with statewide illustrated maps, profiles, photos and detailed descriptions of Colorado’s cycling roads.
    

 










Soon to be released
Road Biking Colorado – 3rd Edition (2 Volume Set)

I am currently working on my 3rd edition of Road Biking Colorado which is under contract with Fixed Pin Publishing. This new edition is well on its way, but stepping up an already great resource takes some time.  Thanks to input from my readers, I've added numerous new roads with commentary, as well as expanding and refining my book's layout for easy route building. With a new larger page format and full color printing, the 2 volume third edition will continue to be the most comprehensive guide of its kind! 

Colorado Cycling Website
I  am very excited to have the support and enthusiasm of the community to take RBC  to the next level.  I have assembled a  team to develop an interactive website for members to create, communicate, network,  share, and contribute to the Colorado biking community in a variety of ways.


Updates to Road  Segments Online
    Our website will provide route updates between printings, so that members have access  to the most up-to-date Colorado cycling information available.

Colorado Cycling  Social Network
    Members will be able to connect and collaborate with other cycling enthusiasts  including posting photos, maps, and sharing ride experiences online. Members will be  able to share content about their rides.    Member’s shared photos will be featured on the website and considered  for placement in future editions of the book.

Road Biking Colorado Blog
  Continuing with the spirit of cycling, I will be posting stories and other  contributions on my blog and sharing links to other cycling blogs.


Trip Planning Services
  My  team also plans to offer one-stop shopping for planning cycling trips in  Colorado. We will work with you personally to assemble customized multi-day route packages, that also include recommendations for accommodations, eateries, bike shops, transportation, and other  special needs to create the cycling adventure of your dreams.

Photography Services
Are you planning or going to be a part of a special Colorado cycling event that needs professional photography services?  Capture your personal day rides, cycling vacations and organized events forever in photos.  That's right, I'll meet you at your ride destination and photograph you and your buddies out on the road.  All services will be available for scheduling on the RBC website.


How you can help?
You can help bring Road Biking Colorado to the community through your generous contribution and by sharing this campaign. It has been my dream and lifetime pursuit to continue to provide professional, reliable information and guidance not only for the many tens of thousands of Colorado cyclists, but also for the several million visitors who come to our state every year.  Together we can create an amazing multifaceted experience  for the cycling community. 
Your contributions are critical!  The funding I am seeking is certainly substantial.  When I wrote my first edition of Road Biking Colorado, I left my home, my job, and my friends. I jumped off a cliff with the faith and conviction that I would create something that people would enjoy and  would stand the test of time.  I’ve since accomplished that goal and my readers have rewarded me with kind words, rave reviews, and heartfelt testimonials. With  your support, we can build something that is truly a one-of-a-kind  resource.
Tell others what I am up to! 







 


Instagram — @roadbikingcolorado Take a look at some of the roadscapes that I have captured over the years.  These and many others in the current edition of RBC.







 


RBC Registration — Visit my website and register to stay informed with updates and other useful information.








 


RBC Facebook — Visit my Facebook page to see my latest  adventures in Colorado.






Road Biking ColoradoFunding Requirements
$168,000  PHASE 1 GOAL: Finish book, build and launch website, and market both of them - first year.   
$10,000 - 3rd Edition Production & Marketing Expenses $25,000 -  Event Vehicle/Mobile Office.  I will sell my FJ Cruiser 4X4 and get a used utility vehicle.  I'll be living and working out of this vehicle for a large portion of the next couple of years, the size I need will cost upwards of $25-30,000 plus taxes and licences (slightly used - it must be reliable).  So, with my truck sale and some help from all of you, I'll have a home/office on wheels, this way I'll be able to be out on Colorado's backroads finishing the book, bringing in fresh content, photos, and updates, and covering events for you $50,000 - RBC Website Development.  This is a large chunk, it's a fairly complex concept to put together, technically speaking.  My media team will do most of the work, but we will also need to hire out some of the html code writing.  With building and testing plus launch costs, it simply adds up to a lot of very expensive labor hours. $40,000 – Business startup/Overhead/Operating Expenses (first year)  This will include business licencing fees, account set ups, monthly software licencing fees, Cell, internet, and cloud storage backup costs.  There is also photography and video supplies and equipment upkeep, vehicle insurance, gasoline, and maintenance to pay for.  Lots of miscellaneous stuff too like basic office supplies and business cards.   $8,400 – Rent and utilities for one year.  I will be moving out of my condo, I have a room arranged for cheaper, and will put most of my belongings in storage.  If I need to go without a "home" for a while, that's fine, that's what it takes.  I did it for the first edition, I camped out every night and bathed in backcountry streams to eliminate lodging costs.  Because you all are so awesome and generous, I want to cut costs as much as possible, so now I will gladly do it again for the third edition.$20,000- Personal Expenses  Since it is necessary to go part-time at my workplace, I'll have to start paying for health insurance.  My current vehicle is paid for but I do have a very small credit card payment, I should be able to cover those things with part-time work.  That leaves food, clothing, and personal hygiene supplies for a year. $13,806 –The price tag for Phase 1 is $153,400, a 9% Indiegogo fee would amount to $13,806, which explains the $168,000 figure.



Campaign Summary
$168,000 is needed to launch  Phase 1Ultimately, the revenues created will sustain the endeavors of this project.  We will also be looking for additional financing to quickly expand our capabilities.  This is why our campaign goal is $250,000, we want to create a complete experience for our members and guests.  My 3rd edition is only a few months from submission to my publisher, that is, if I am allowed the necessary time away from my job, and the website can follow right along if you will please help now.  If you feel our goal is too much at once, then please allow us the first phase and we will show you what we can do.

Mobile Route Building ToolImagine having route information from my guide at your fingertips.  Mobile integration with our website will allow cyclists to string biking road segments together to create unique routes with detailed documentation, color photos, maps, and profiles.  Cyclists will be able to share their unique journeys with others in the community, including photos and comments of their ride.
Phase  2 will involve creating and marketing our mobile app, website, and book together as one.  Getting the word out to the community  will be integral to our growth. Accomplishing Phase 1 will give us a great starting  placed for something really special. I know that you and others who get  involved will want to continue playing a special part in this worthwhile journey.



Your Impact on Road Biking Colorado
The truly  comprehensive nature of my book has spawned emails from people all over the world  thanking me for creating such an invaluable guide.  Time and time again I am told how my book has  helped them discover the most amazing rides of their lives, or how it lives on their  nightstand, or in their car's glove box.


  I cannot overstate how  important your help is to the future success of Road Biking Colorado. Help me pursue this opportunity and complete my  life's work.  My dream to share  Colorado’s incredible cycling destinations began over three decades ago. There are  currently no one-stop shop resources for Coloradans and the millions of vacationing  cyclists coming to visit each year. Together we can change that!

story:
What is Recreate, Recycle, Recover?

We are an innovative upcycling textile project that supports women suffering complex mental, emotional and physical health difficulties back towards employment.

Based at Sweet Arts Norwich, our exciting social enterprise empowers women, giving them new skills as well as a safe and welcoming place to make friends and build confidence.

We believe in the power of creative engagement and by investing in this project we are able to effectively re-engage women who have enormous skills to offer and be realised but have, for whatever reason, suffered difficulties engaging with mainstream services and employment. Here at Sweet Arts we rise to this challenge in a holistic creative arts and wellbeing environment offering a rich and nurturing experience, building self esteem to ensure women begin to tap into their potential and become engaged, involved, happy members of society and their community.


How can you help this fantastic project continue?

We need funds to put into the development of this project to give Recreate, Recycle, Recover the materials needed to become a sustainable social enterprise. By doing this we can continue to empower women and make our projects accessible to more.

The sewing machines we use for our textile and soft-furnishings are old and many are broken beyond repair. To ensure our social enterprise can continue we hope to raise money to invest in five new sewing machines.

We also need funds for additional materials such as cottons, needles, scissors, fabrics and more.

Advertising and promoting the products we create is also key to the success of this ongoing project and so we need money to invest in the effective marketing of our textile creations.

We are hoping to raise a total of £3000 to invest in this project.


What will you get in return for your donations?

We've been busying designing and creating lots of beautiful goodies to give you (our lovely funders) in return for your donations!

£5 will get you a Sweet Arts 'Heart' Bookmark created from up-cycled fabrics.
(Example bookmarks. Patterns and colour of fabrics will vary).

                                     


£10 gets you a Gorgeous Glasses Case with draw string pull.
(Fits all kinds of glasses. Fabrics and patterns will vary).

                     


Fund us £20 and you will receive a Sweet Arts Trendy Tote Bag!

(Created from up-cycled fabrics, patterns and colours will vary)


  


For just £30 you will receive a lovingly hand-crafted Cushion Cover (no insert).

Cushion covers come in various designs with two main themes: Country or Beach.
You may request the theme you prefer when funding our project.
Here are some examples of the fantastic cushion covers you could receive!

          



£100 will get you a place on one of our brilliant Cr'after Hours Evening Classes!
Details are listed below.
You can choose which evening class you would like to attend when funding our project.



Please share our campaign with friends and family!


Thank you for your support!

Salutations

I'm Carrie

a.k.a Caring Cook

a.k.a The Vegan Food Alchemist!

https://www.facebook.com/caring.cook

My story is as follows:

Emotional Disclaimer, it contains love, heart break, death, grief & resurrection.

Coming from a large family I was always the nurturer of four siblings.

I was an independent person that led a full and active life from the challenges of adolescence and my early 20's.  When I met the Love of my many lives Paul, my life changed for the better when we had our first child Sebastian. We were overjoyed with love at this amazing soul that we created.  Becoming a mother to my first born was the most beautiful and heart-warming experience and I felt that a new lease in life at creating an abundant and fulfilling life for myself and my family.

Life was fantastic, my beautiful boy was growing up fast, he had the most charming sense of humour and had a smile that made you fall in love with him at first sight.

The name Sebastian has latin origins and means: venerable and revered. He certainly "accorded a great deal of respect" and was cherished beyond imagination.

Our beautiful family life took an unexpected turn when we found out when Sebastian was 3.5 that he had an inoperable, incurable brain tumour. The doctors gave him 3-6 months to live.

The devastation that followed was immense and intense on our beautiful family. This healthy, gorgeous little boys time on this planet was coming to an end. The angel who gave me a reason for living and taught me so much about self worth was going to be lucky to reach his fourth birthday.  

There was nothing we could do. No medical intervention was available to us.  Despite our attempts at various alternative therapies we were forced to watch our son leave us behind. 

My heart was broken. Sebastian died on August 10th 2009, in my arms in our lounge room at 9:47AM.

At the time I was 12 weeks pregnant with our second son. The grief was overwhelming but we held it together for our unborn baby. As the nurturer in my family I knew I had to hold it together for everyone. If I allowed myself to let go succumb to  the sadness and despair I was afraid I’d never return.

I went through the cycles of grief, anger, guilt and shame.  As a result I felt it necessary to punish myself, for not being able to save my son through means of self sabotage, self loathing, guilt and emotionally cutting myself off from love.  The opposite of everything that Sebastian had taught me.  I was no longer honouring myself or my family.

We had our second baby boy in March 2010, this was a bittersweet occasion which fluctuated from joyous occasionally was racked with despair, and my inability to find happiness in being a mother again.

I choose to return to full time work in Animal Welfare whilst Paul became a full time stay at home parent. We made this decision together as a coping mechanism because I could not bring myself to do this.  I could not allow myself to fail at being a mother again.

Ptolemy was my distraction baby, he distracted me from what had happened and allowed me to function through life despite feeling hollow and robotic.

I worked long hours in a very emotionally challenging management position 7 settled on being an after hours mother.  This enabled me to ignore the growing void within me.

In 2012, I had another boy, Gabriel.  At first I planned a short leave from work but the universe decided I needed to stop. The universe can be quite strong in sending a message, particularly since I nearly died a few weeks after giving birth from a blood clot.

I choose to take time out from the pressure and punishment I had accumulated upon myself and it was time to enjoy life again and being a mother!

Gabriel was my healing baby. He brought joy back into my life, a sense of self-worth and love. I was able to fully step into my role as a mother again.

As my journey evolved a number of further life changing events occurred.  My management employment ceased which was a blessing in disguise.  I donated a kidney to save my sister.  My health deteriorated again & I had a break down.

I also nearly lost my husband and boys, the most vital part of my healing.

I did seek help and in the process I met some beautiful and awe inspiring sisters.

I found my tribe and FINALLY I decided to follow my true path and passion.
What is my true Path and Passion: I became Caring Cook, The Vegan Food Alchemist.

Since I can remember I have always loved to cook, bake, make and create delicious food. Food that can be enjoyed by everyone that is healthy, hearty & nourishing.

From a typical western background of food consumption to an awakening of consciousness to a vegan lifestyle I am now exploring the  depth of potentials of raw food,I am passionate about creating sumptuous, healthy, vitality producing vegan food and sharing  this to the world .

I incorporate into my food, truth, integrity, compassion & a little bit of magic to create delicious and nourishing foods for body, mind & spirit.

Caring Cook is about how easy it is to maintain a healthy vegan diet for all the family and embodying the true nature of the spirit of non-violence towards all sentient beings and a healthy planet. Never has there been a time in human history when it is more important to tread lightly on the planet and I can help show you how.

A plant based diet is not only good for the environment but also is about empowering and embodying the highest spiritual principles of compassion, empathy, love and vitality.

I am now ready to take the leap in running my own Cafe where my skills and passion for healthy food can be enjoyed by a far greater audience.

I have gained much experience of cuisine from all over the world and have traveled to a number of countries including Thailand, Cambodia, Bali, China and The United States to learn the art of Vegan & Raw foods. Which compliments my current studies in Nutritional Medicine.

Sebastian's Place will be a cafe of Nourishment, Love and Healing.

A safe place where people can gather for healthy meals, connect with like minded people, learn the culinary skills of vegan & raw cooking, seek holistic counseling , energy healing and grief / trauma support. 

A place to reconnect to people, to food, and to oneself!

What We Need & What You Get

Here is a breakdown of what we need to get this going!

*Business Purchase

* Signage & Marketing

* Fit out & set up

*Kitchen upgrade, including new oven, fridge, freezer

*Furniture for both eating area and healing room, comfy couches & bean bags

*Massage table

*Cold Press Juicers

*Sandwich Press

*Commercial Dish washer

*Wall hangings

* Two months rent to help get us started

* Water Filter

* Water Dispenser

Our goal is to raise $90,000 as this would cover the above and get things rolling nice and quickly. The sooner I can get in the kitchen and start cooking, the sooner I can contribute to healing this earths inhabitants!

My amazing husband Paul is a Holistic counselor and will be utilizing the healing space to work his magic allowing us to work side by side and compliment each others passions and talents. And also provide the very best advice, care and support for those in need!

If there's anything that we have learned from the loss of a child, our precious Sebastian, it is how important love and support of others is. If we can give back and support others in a time of need or provide a safe space for anyone that is looking, then this traumatic, emotional bumping journey we have been riding for the past 6 years will give us the opportunity of healing we never thought imaginable!

Ahh the risks, well life is a big fat risk!

I have a background in Practice management, customer service, meeting monthly expectations and turning $70k annual profits into $350k annual profits in just two years.

And this was just doing a job, not the job that I was passionate and was an extension of me job, just a 9 - 5 job that paid my bills.

( I've also in between "jobs" worked in hospitality since I was 15, many beautiful moons ago)

I have worked for others most of my life and the short stint I had at owning my own business, that was starting to be successful within a very short period of time, 8 months, I gave up due to Sebastian's illness.

I have a 20 year background in business management and if I can run other peoples business's successfully then look out world because I will nurture and love my very own only as a great mother can!

From the start I will have a sound business plan and have strategies in place to conquer everything and all challenges that come my way! And if I cant, I will seek out those who can!

So, what can you do? Help by contributing to such an awesome campaign! Simple, check out the perks to see whats available! Spread the word, make noise oh and I have to remind you to use Indiegogo share tools!!

Plus, please come and visit Sebastian's Place, you seriously wont be disappointed!!

Sebastian's Place: Vegan & Raw Food Cafe
A place to  Eat, Heal, Love and Nourish the Mind & Spirit

Much Love & Thank you!

Carrie, The Caring Cook & The Vegan Food Alchemist!

+ her sidekick Ptolemy, The Little Vegan Chef

+ Paul, her loving husband, her Muse and special Healing Man in his own Right ( plus I'm sure he will be happy to get the home kitchen back to cook up his special dishes)

+ Gabriel the Little Master of Love & Cheekiness

and  of course Sebastian, the most perfect and beautiful first born a mother could ask for. His time here was short but his presence was felt on an enormous level!
                                        Forever Loved & in My Thoughts Precious Boy!

His time here was short but his presence was felt on an enormous level!                                        Forever Loved & in My Thoughts Precious Boy!

story:
WHY?

SOMAR MEDIA, LLC has launched its first company phase in Batalla Management. This unique management company is setup with a drive to gain success for all its artist and music worldwide. We have the will to unify a community through music to keep LIVE MUSICIANS thriving and working. Indie Music has a hard time reaching the masses and many projects go unheard by the music world due to their inability to promote and market. Batalla Management is geared to help the indie artist break into the music community and get their music heard by many fans. The musicians sacrifice days and nights away from their family to put on great shows, record great music and give us the songs we listen to on a regular basis and most of them live close to the poverty line and in time decide to leave their dreams behind due to the lack of support from fans and venues. With its unique business structure Batalla Management is set up to gain more success for the musicians and also encourage them to develop their music on their terms with a wall of support that won't allow them to give up. We are a very different company and share the passion for music! Become a supporter and help us Unity A COMMUNITY Through MUSIC! 

Why Should I Fund You?

Batalla Management is setting up to represent various artists in some of the biggest genres of music. All the funds raised will go to the foundation of Batalla Management and will strengthen the already growing company. We will also add a production piece and showcase some of the artist on our management list.This showcase will shed light on bands and their music to help them gain fans in and around the State of Texas. We are looking to start this with our bands initially but working on making this a yearly tour that will allow other bands to participate.

By funding us, YOU give this project hope and a foundation that can evolve into a big event for the Indie Artist. We are developing perks that will give back to our donors and will include FREE MUSIC, an opportunity to meet and greet the artist and a VIP entrance to a show at a city of your choice. Other perks will be a merchandise packages and much more. Please help us accomplish our goal to help us make that great impact!

My Impact

Every dollar collected will go toward the promotion and marketing of each one of Batalla's Artist. It will help fund a small tour for the artist and help build the foundation of our future that will help many artist accomplish their dreams and launch the music they have prepared for the world. The initial tour will begin with our artists, but we plan to open the invitation to other indie artists to help them grow their fanbase.

This unique opportunity that Batalla will provide will help unite the Music world and give many struggling artists an opportunity to expose their talents to music fans in Texas but also to the world. Our initiative will help launch great music and contribute to making the music world a better place, redefining the music industries perception and changing the face of music promotion and music management. Our passion for doing the right thing is evident and comes through in all our conversations with our musicians. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest hurdle we face is charting the road for Indie bands through our promotion and marketing plan and also through our event planning division of Batalla Management. We have little company risk since this money will be placed in business ventures that have a ROI of close to 80% or higher. We strategically think of ways to invest every dollar to stretch its potential and that will help us grow as a company. We have an uphill battle supporting Indie Artist and negotiating proper contracts with major labels but its time to help the Indie artist maintain their musical integrity and feel appreciated and fulfilled going for their passion in MUSIC.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not capable of donating, a simple share with your friends via email, social media or just word of mouth advertising is a great way to help us spread the word! Since our campaign keeps all of its donations even just a dollar helps us as well! Everyone knows that individual that is looking for an opportunity to donate to a great cause and Unifying Communities through Music is a great way to help us raise awareness to the ongoing musician struggle to expose their music, so please share to help us get closer to our goal. We look forward to raising the money and help Unify the Music Community through their passion and commitment to their craft! 


Thank you for your support and we hope to see everyone in their hometowns!

story:
A world of Social Networking users will want change in the way t

Have you ever been frustrated with not being able to give feedback to brands regarding your experience, so have brands been frustrated in reaching you as audiences and getting your input into what matters to them the most. Social Media has failed to deliver this but here is a platform that is ready to bring about the change for both. This is the story of Kinnect2.

Having thought of the idea, I (Amina) have spent 2 years and all my savings into this project, as well as that of my dad since he is the easiest investor I could find. Your contribution is now that matters for this platform to become a reality. The platform is ready, designed and requires a little more work in terms of technology and then the marketing, so it would mean the world to me and to all the people out there if this comes out and brands and consumers can finally engage on social media.

And remember this is a journey that will change the experience for the 2+ billion social media users around the world.


Kinnect2: Platform a sneak-peak

How you can help?

We need US$ 1 Million to get this off the ground, launch it globally and get the right attention. We need the investment for technology, securities, the app and other little tweaks in the User Interface and Experience of the Kinnect2 Social Networking platform as well as for the very important Marketing. What we offer you in return is as follows:

Contributions of $100 - $999

Bronze supporting member of Kinnect2, your personal page will be created with a permanent bronze badge showing that you were an original supporter of Kinnect2.

Amina will send you a personalized thank you for your support.

Contribution between $100 - £$999.

Contributions of $1,000 - $4,999

Silver supporting member of Kinnect2, your personal page will be created with a permanent silver badge showing that you were an original supporter of Kinnect2.

You will be given an a Silver member certificate and be mentioned at our live Glasgow event.

Amina will send you a personalized thank you for your support.

Contribution between $1000 - £$4999

Contributions of $5,000 - $24,999

Silver supporting member of Kinnect2, your personal page will be created with a permanent silver badge showing that you were an original supporter of Kinnect2.

You will be given an a Silver member certificate, be invited to the Glasgow launch and be mentioned at the launch.

Amina will send you a personalized thank you for your support.

Contribution between $5000 - $24,999

Contributions of $25,000 - $49,999

Platinum supporting member of Kinnect2, your personal page will be created with a permanent platinum badge showing that you were an original supporter of Kinnect2.

You will be given an a Platinum member certificate, be invited to the Glasgow launch, travel and accommodation paid for as well as a chance to speak at the event.

Amina will send you a personalized thank you for your support.

Contribution between $25000 - $49,000

The Impact

The global demand for a brand-consumer-brand engagement platform is huge, with the gaps in the social networking space, it can easily be understood that brands have not received the attention they need and their needs have not been satisfied through the existing platforms.

Kinnect2 delivers a platform that brings brands to the consumers. Making it different!


Brands across the world are willing to pay for results, and seek market intelligence data that drives their success and makes their products a success. Even for the most successful the need is to keep audiences engaged.

Kinnect2 offers an inbuilt reward programme which allows for brands to employ it for their benefit.


Kinnect 2 realises social networking is the key. And therefore the development of the platform ensures social networking becomes part of the community that lives on Kinnect2.

Kinnect2 offers users the ability to use all the features that they have on any other social media platform.


How is Kinnect2 different

  1. Consumer Interaction – audio, video, photo, infographics, text
  2. Brand Interaction  - audio, video, photo, infographics, text, focus groups, market research, data mining, feedback, brand faceoff and many more
  3.  Various forms of social activity – sharing to other social platforms, liking, disliking, commenting, flagging, sharing on Twitter, Facebook, and Google+
  4.  A loyalty model incorporated into the system
  5. Ability for brands to launch campaigns, reward participation electronically, conduct virtual focus groups, engage with videos
  6. Ability for consumers to receive rewards electronically, post blogs/articles, links, queries, begin poll or start battle of brands
  7. The ability for brands to extrapolate data in real time from consumer posts.

Risks & Challenges

The challenges are expectations of getting things done on time, we have intentions to launch in July 2015, but delays in the technology end where things need to be outsourced and cannot be controlled may result in a delay. We also think that there is a potential of a lag in the launch which is a challenge but we are poised with an excellent marketing strategy as well as have plan b, where we have more experienced consultants that may help to fix any issues we have in the lagging period.

What else can you do for us?

Promote this campaign if you cannot contribute, your contribution on this matter would help us raise and realise this dream that shall change the way brands engage with consumers on social media.

story:
What is Impact?

Impact is a long term dream for us and has been over three years in the making. The idea is simple: a gothic & alternative clothing and gift shop in the heart of Medway, Kent.

We aim to bring a taste of Camden Town to Medway without the London price tags. 

With your help we can make this dream a reality and bring you all a truly amazing and unique shopping experience.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for £6,000, this money will go towards advertising, promotion, cementing our web presence and getting some extra special items in stock.

We are offering a series of great perks and bonuses for all those who donate from personal thank you notes and freebies to discounts and the chance to name and choose an outfit for our mannequins.

The Impact

This project will make the long term dream of ours come true and will also provide a type of business that is sorely missing from the Medway towns despite the thriving alternative community.

The amount donated will allow us to create a unique and enjoyable shopping experience for everyone with some truly special stock including unique items that are not found anywhere else.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share and get the word out there, the more you can get the word out there to everyone, the quicker we can meet our goal and you can get those rewards. :)

story:
We are Smoke and Sauce.

We first started Summerfest 4 years ago. Back then it was just a big birthday party for Casey.

     

We had a band, some food, and coolers to sit on. Each year since then it has grown, slowly morphing into what it is today. A benefit for the Humane Society for Southwest Washington, while providing great food, awesome music and a great time for everyone. 

For the past 3 years we’ve used our own money to fund Summerfest, unfortunately we cannot continue doing it all on our own. All funds raised on IndieGoGo will go towards funding Summerfest.  Any additional money would be put towards funding next year.

The money raised will be spent on: Food & Beverages, Musicians and Audio Equipment, Equipment Rentals and Consumables (Paper Plates, Utensils, Cups, etc.). 

At Summerfest we hope to raise at least $1,000 for the HSSW.

We are big time cat and dog lovers. Both of our dogs are rescues, one from a Humane Society and the other through a good friend. The HSSW has a wonderful new facility in east Vancouver, where they help over 8,000 dogs and cats a year!

Donate now and help make Summerfest a success!

story:
Over the last several years, my family has worked with many great folks to recover our health and we have shared these experiences with our neighbors. Through this journey came our desire to open Kickshaws Downtown Market. In doing so, we were able to bring more options to the area that were not previously available; things that help families like mine and yours heal. What we discovered in this last year at the Market was that transitioning to a whole foods life can be challenging. Having support can truly make all the difference in being successful and committed. Through our workshops we have met and helped so many great folks move forward to better health; which is why we are working to open Kickshaws Kitchen.


Kickshaws Kitchen will be expanding on food items already offered at Kickshaws downtown market such as quick and delicious breakfasts, lunches and baked

goods in a gluten-free kitchen, the only dedicated and certified gluten-free commercial kitchen in the area. During the morning hours, window service meals, which are made with local fresh produce, will be available for purchase. We will also always have dairy-free, vegan and vegetarian options available. In the afternoons and evenings workshops and classes will be open in a variety of subjects and time frames. With Kickshaws Kitchen we will not only be able to bridge the gaps to accessible, affordable and healthy foods year round, but help our neighbors learn how to transition to and live a whole foods life.

What We Need & What You Get

Any build out of a commercial space is costly which is why we have been carefully working on numbers to create this kitchen. Assuming we don’t have any major set-backs, we have gotten an estimate for the cost of the build out as a total of $35,200.

Here is the breakdown:

  • Electrical Service upgrade: $2,500.00

  • Electrical wiring, cooktop etc.: $950.00

  • HVAC: $3,450.00

  • Suppression hood and vent system: $8,000.00

  • Kitchen sink and plumbing: $1,800.00

  • Fresh flooring and paint: $1,500.00

  • Countertops, cabinets and storage: $3,900

  • Front door repair, ceiling and extras: $1,400

  • Commercial Oven: $3000

  • Stovetop: $2000

  • Commercial Fridge/freezer combo: $5,000

  • Workstation: $1700

So as you can see we have everything that is needed for the build out including the kitchen sink. We aren’t asking for the whole enchilada to be funded through this campaign though; we know there is a certain amount of time and money that Kickshaws simply must get covered. We are working closely with the City of Fredericksburg's department of Economic Development as well as Slow Food RVA to work towards making this Kitchen a reality. So here is what we are hoping to get covered in the Indiegogo campaign:

  • Electrical Service upgrade: $2,500.00

  • Electrical wiring/cook top/stove/4 convenience outlets/HVAC/Hood: $950.00

  • HVAC: $3,450.00

  • Suppression hood and vent system: $8,000.00

  • Kitchen sink and plumbing: $1,800.00

  • Fresh flooring and paint: $1,500.00

    TOTAL $18,200

If we can get the preliminary build out costs like the hood and fire suppression system out of the way, we will work towards making the rest happen. If our campaign is not completely funded, we are still going to be moving forward with the build it will just be a project we are going to have to slate for later in the year, possibly 2016. We would really love your support to help make Kickshaws Kitchen happen so we can all move forward to a healthier and happier community

Perks!

We have some great things that we have pulled together to help you get on your foodie way with that awesome support of Fraser's Wood Elements and Libertytown Art!

$15 Kitchen Gogo

You will receive a Kickshaws Kitchen Sticker as a thank you for supporting our project.

$30- The Kitchen Kit

You will receive a Kickshaws Kitchen Sticker PLUS a set of starter kitchen essentials including measuring cups and spoons to get you on your way! JUST ADDED- an awesome GREEN or Orange Kickshaws T-shirt! 

$50 Workshop Basic Essentials

You will receive a Kickshaws Kitchen Sticker, basic tools and one workshop of your choice. JUST ADDED- an awesome GREEN or Orange Kickshaws T-shirt! 

$100- The Kitchen Pack

You will receive a Kickshaws Kitchen Sticker, basic tools, TWO workshops and your choice of 2 locally roasted coffee (Ricks Roasters and Orange County Roasters) samples or a box of local tea from Loose Leaf Tea Company. JUST ADDED- an awesome GREEN or Orange Kickshaws T-shirt! 

$200- The Kraut Kit 

You will receive a 1 quart ceramic kraut crock, kraut weights made by Christina Bendo from Libertytown Arts, a kraut pounder by Fraser Wood Elements, sea salt all for your workshop Fermentation 101: Kombucha and Kraut. JUST ADDED- an awesome GREEN or Orange Kickshaws T-shirt! 

$500- Brew Master Kombucha Kit

You will receive a 1 gallon brewing vessel, a SCOBY (Symbiotic Colony of Bacteria and Yeast), pH strips, a thermometer, organic sugar, organic tea and BOTH Fermentation 101 and 201 (First Ferment and Second Ferment) JUST ADDED- an awesome GREEN or Orange Kickshaws T-shirt! 

$750- The Yogurt Starter Kit

You will receive a six jar yogurt maker, two yogurt starters (regular and greek) mesh strainer, thermometer, rennet and THREE workshops: Yogurt Basics, Greek Yogurt and Icelandic Style Yogurt. JUST ADDED- an awesome GREEN or Orange Kickshaws T-shirt! 

$1000- Unlimited!

You will receive UNLIMITED workshops at Kickshaws Kitchen PLUS a private cooking class in your home for a group (maximum of 10 people) JUST ADDED- an awesome GREEN or Orange Kickshaws T-shirt! 


The Impact

As a community, we can all benefit from Kickshaws Kitchen. It will provide the opportunity to become healthier together through education and quality foods. The new breakfast and lunch window service will cater to those on the go; whether heading to work, on lunch break, or simply enjoying your day strolling downtown. And this is food you won’t feel guilty about, but instead, fueled and energized for your days’ events.

The larger focus of Kickshaws Kitchen, about 50% of the actual kitchen use, will focus on our workshops. At Kickshaws we feel that good food is not enough if you don't know what to do with it. We will be able to offer a variety of class such as Fermentation 101, Making Your Own Milk: Nut Milks, Amazing Bone Broth, Growing Your Own Food and so much more. We are dedicated on offering education to the community to harness information and skills required to transition to a whole foods life.

At the end of the day we can only build our little city together. Kickshaws Downtown Market is already part of that very philosophy and we hope Kickshaws Kitchen can join in our dynamic community sooner than later as well! We are here to serve you, Fredericksburg, based on our mission and values; and will always be a business you can trust to continue doing so.


Risks & Challenges

Permits. Permits. Permits. As any business owner downtown knows, the process of getting every permit in line to meet health department regulations, zoning, building and fire are very arduous. We have a solid team of great folks working towards helping make this process a little easier.


Other Ways You Can Help


Share our campaign! We would be so honored if you would share the Kickshaws Kitchen campaign with your friends, family, and social media followers. Here are some ways to do so...

  • Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update

  • Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks

  • Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code.

Through our workshops we have met and helped so many great folks move forward
to better health; which is why we are working to open Kickshaws Kitchen.


Kickshaws Kitchen
will be expanding on food items already offered at Kickshaws downtown market such
as quick and delicious breakfasts, lunches and baked 

goods in a gluten-free kitchen, the only dedicated and certified gluten-free commercial kitchen in the area. During the morning hours, window service meals, which are made with local fresh produce, will be available for purchase. We will also always have dairy-free, vegan and vegetarian options available. In the afternoons and evenings workshops and classes will be open in a variety of subjects and time frames. With Kickshaws Kitchen we will not only be able to bridge the gaps to accessible, affordable and healthy foods year round, but help our neighbors learn how to transition to and live a whole foods life.

   What We Need & What You Get 
Any
build out of a commercial space is costly which is why we have been carefully
working on numbers to create this kitchen. Assuming we don’t have any major
set-backs, we have gotten an estimate for the cost of the build out as a total
of $35,200. 
Here
is the breakdown: 

Electrical
Service upgrade: $2,500.00
Electrical
wiring, cooktop etc.: $950.00
HVAC:
$3,450.00
Suppression
hood and vent system: $8,000.00
Kitchen
sink and plumbing: $1,800.00
Fresh
flooring and paint: $1,500.00
Countertops,
cabinets and storage: $3,900
Front
door repair, ceiling and extras: $1,400
Commercial
Oven: $3000
Stovetop:
$2000
Commercial
Fridge/freezer combo: $5,000
Workstation:
$1700

So
as you can see we have everything that is needed for the build out including
the kitchen sink. We aren’t asking for the whole enchilada to be funded through
this campaign though; we know there is a certain amount of time and money that
Kickshaws simply must get covered. We
are working closely with the City of Fredericksburg's department of Economic
Development as well as Slow Food RVA to work towards making this Kitchen a
reality. So here is what we are hoping to get covered in the Indiegogo campaign:


Electrical
Service upgrade: $2,500.00
Electrical
wiring/cook top/stove/4 convenience outlets/HVAC/Hood: $950.00
HVAC:
$3,450.00
Suppression
hood and vent system: $8,000.00
Kitchen
sink and plumbing: $1,800.00

Fresh
flooring and paint: $1,500.00
TOTAL $18,200


If
we can get the preliminary build out costs like the hood and fire suppression
system out of the way, we will work towards making the rest happen. If our
campaign is not completely funded, we are still going to be moving forward with
the build it will just be a project we are going to have to slate for later in
the year, possibly 2016. We would really love your support to help make Kickshaws
Kitchen happen so we can all move forward to a healthier and happier
communityPerks!We have some great things that we have pulled together to help you get on your foodie way with that awesome support of Fraser's Wood Elements and Libertytown Art!
$15 Kitchen Gogo
You will receive a Kickshaws Kitchen Sticker as a thank
you for supporting our project.
$30- The Kitchen Kit
You will receive a Kickshaws Kitchen Sticker PLUS a set
of starter kitchen essentials including measuring cups and spoons to get you on
your way! JUST ADDED- an awesome GREEN or Orange Kickshaws T-shirt! 
$50 Workshop Basic Essentials
You will receive a Kickshaws Kitchen Sticker, basic tools
and one workshop of your choice. JUST ADDED- an awesome GREEN or Orange Kickshaws T-shirt! 
$100- The Kitchen Pack
You will receive a Kickshaws Kitchen Sticker, basic
tools, TWO workshops and your choice of 2 locally roasted coffee (Ricks
Roasters and Orange County Roasters) samples or a box of local tea from Loose
Leaf Tea Company. JUST ADDED- an awesome GREEN or Orange Kickshaws T-shirt! 
$200- The Kraut Kit  
You will receive a 1 quart ceramic kraut crock, kraut
weights made by Christina Bendo from Libertytown Arts, a kraut pounder by
Fraser Wood Elements, sea salt all for your workshop Fermentation 101: Kombucha
and Kraut. JUST ADDED- an awesome GREEN or Orange Kickshaws T-shirt! 
$500- Brew Master Kombucha Kit
You will receive a 1 gallon brewing vessel, a SCOBY
(Symbiotic Colony of Bacteria and Yeast), pH strips, a thermometer, organic
sugar, organic tea and BOTH Fermentation 101 and 201 (First Ferment and Second
Ferment) JUST ADDED- an awesome GREEN or Orange Kickshaws T-shirt! 
$750- The Yogurt Starter Kit
You will receive a six jar yogurt maker, two yogurt
starters (regular and greek) mesh strainer, thermometer, rennet and THREE
workshops: Yogurt Basics, Greek Yogurt and Icelandic Style Yogurt. JUST ADDED- an awesome GREEN or Orange Kickshaws T-shirt! 
$1000- Unlimited! 
You will receive UNLIMITED workshops at Kickshaws Kitchen
PLUS a private cooking class in your home for a group (maximum of 10 people) JUST ADDED- an awesome GREEN or Orange Kickshaws T-shirt! 

    The Impact 
As a community, we can all benefit from Kickshaws
Kitchen. It will provide the opportunity to become healthier together
through education and quality foods. The new breakfast and lunch window service will cater to those on
the go; whether heading to work, on lunch break, or simply enjoying your day
strolling downtown. And this is food you won’t feel guilty about, but instead,
fueled and energized for your days’ events. 
The larger focus of Kickshaws Kitchen, about
50% of the actual kitchen use, will focus on our workshops. At Kickshaws we
feel that good food is not enough if you don't know what to do with it. We will
be able to offer a variety of class such as Fermentation 101, Making Your Own
Milk: Nut Milks, Amazing Bone Broth, Growing Your Own Food and so much more. We
are dedicated on offering education to the community to harness information and
skills required to transition to a whole foods life.
At the end of the day we can only build our little
city together. Kickshaws Downtown Market is already part of that very
philosophy and we hope Kickshaws Kitchen can join in our
dynamic community sooner than later as well! We are here to serve you,
Fredericksburg, based on our mission and values; and will always be a business
you can trust to continue doing so.

   Risks & Challenges  
Permits.
Permits. Permits. As any business owner downtown knows, the process of getting
every permit in line to meet health department regulations, zoning, building
and fire are very arduous. We have a solid team of great folks working towards
helping make this process a little easier. 

    Other Ways You Can Help 

Share our campaign! We would be so honored if you
would share the Kickshaws Kitchen campaign with your friends, family, and
social media followers. Here are some ways to do so...

Copy the campaign URL and paste it into
an email or social media update
Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or
Twitter icons to share through your social media networks 
Add a widget to your blog or personal
website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code.

story:
In Catholic parishes throughout this country, young men and women are leaving us. Some are choosing to leave, seeking more inclusive churches or no church at all, unable to remain because of the way we as church treat our gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender brothers and sisters.

Others are forced to exit, unwilling to sit in the pews of a church that denies their basic human dignity. They feel abandoned by the church in which they grew up, were baptized in and received other sacraments. They are called names by that church in its official documents—referred to as “intrinsically disordered,” “gravely depraved” or “contrary to nature.” In some cases they have been fired for who they are, in others they’ve been allowed to stay as long as they remain closeted.

And then there are those of us that have decided to stay, choosing to live authentic lives, honoring God’s creation and believing that the church we love will eventually love us back.

All LGBT Catholics, whether we’ve left or stayed, carry deep emotional and spiritual scars—scars left by church teaching, literal interpretations of Scripture, political battles and sacraments being denied to us and our loved ones. We also carry scars left by a laity that has either assisted in such spiritual violence or has sat idly by as our brothers and sisters have suffered and in many cases died.

We have failed them and us, and as the people of God we are better than that.

Church teaching is clear—gay and lesbian men and women must be accepted with respect, compassion and sensitivity. We have been told that the hand of the church has been outstretched to us and we have been asked to do the same.

It’s long past time that we do just that. If we don’t we face the real possibility of losing an entire generation of Catholics. A 2014 Pew Research study showed that 85% of young people ages 18-29 believe that society should be accepting of homosexuality. They won’t tolerate the silence, the discrimination and the ideological battles that have kept us from being true disciples of Jesus Christ.

Our world is deeply hurting. Families are struggling, our prisons are full and our libraries are empty. In a nation of immense resources so many of our children go hungry and too many of our veterans are homeless. Racial inequality and its long and deep roots continue to plague us and our neighborhoods. Immigrant families are torn apart due to antiquated policies that require reform.

The Roman Catholic Church, and we, the lay men and women that make up the Body of Christ, can and should provide a powerful witness in the public square. However, in order to do that, we need to come together and work toward reconciliation and renewal. 


The San Damiano Center seeks to bring about reconciliation in the Roman Catholic Church in the United States by:

1.  Working to end divisiveness and ideological rifts, seeking to find common ground to bring about the common good.

2.  Fostering an honest and respectful dialogue between gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender Catholics, their allies, families and church leaders. Raising up the stories of faithful lives authentically lived by LGBT Catholics, we will work to change hearts and minds, working toward acceptance, compassion and respect called for by church teaching.

3.  Being a public voice for change in the church and the world through earned media and digital outreach; conferences, workshops and retreats; and public speaking tours.

The San Damiano Center seeks to bring about renewal in the Roman Catholic Church in the United States by:

1.  Seeking to return our church to its rich history of seeking the common good, especially in advocating for the poor, bringing about racial justice and caring for God’s creation by organizing lay Catholics around these issues at the local and state levels.

2.  Assisting parishes and dioceses in navigating paths toward acceptance of LGBT Catholics in their communities, informed by church teaching that calls for respect, compassion and love.

3.  Conducting programming and developing publications that emphasize the need for spiritual growth and leadership development among lay Catholics.


Francis and the Church of San Damiano

About 800 years ago, in the hillside near Assisi, a young man prayed in the midst of the ruins of an old Italian church. There, the legend goes, St. Francis heard the voice of God tell him to “rebuild my church.” Francis, eager to please God, began the hard work of clearing away the rubble and started the process of literally rebuilding the Church of San Damiano and other churches nearby.

Eventually he realized that God meant for him to also rebuild God’s church in a more figurative way, providing a witness that continues to inspire Christians and other people of faith the world over.

It is in this spirit that we begin our work together, building a movement of lay Catholics who seek to rebuild the church from within by having the challenging conversations, doing the important work of bringing about real change in the world and providing a powerful witness to that world of what church can mean today.

Funding raised in this campaign will help build the foundation for the organization and our work in building a new movement of lay Catholics. Please consider joining us at this critical time for the church and its people. Thank you so much for your generosity and support.
