story:
On the night of March 16th, the community building at Reservoir Community Farm burned to the ground. 

We want to move forward, and rebuild.

Reservoir Community Farm is an urban farm in the heart of Bridgeport, Connecticut, one of America’s largest food deserts. Built entirely by volunteers, the farm has blossomed over the past two years into a community space for the neighborhood.  On the farm there are 40 community garden plots where families nurture their dinner from the seed to their plate.  The farm also has production plots and sells produce to the public school system, at a farm stand, and through a Community Supported Agriculture program.


With your help, we can create a bigger and better community building that will serve even more people in the Reservoir community.

This loss was felt throughout the Bridgeport community. The love for Reservoir Community Farm is evident from the amount of support the community has offered in the wake of the fire. 

The Reservoir Community has bonded together and is poised to rebuild.

The only thing that's missing is the funds.

             

Our farm has hosted hundreds of community gardeners and farm interns over the past 3 years. Dozens of families in the neighborhood utilize on-site garden space to grow their own food; others frequent our farm-stand regularly to purchase fresh fruits and vegetables.

The farm hosts educational workshops for schoolchildren across the city, teaching about farming, nutrition and sustainability in a welcoming, hands-on environment. Reservoir Community Farm is also a significant source of fresh produce for the Bridgeport Nutrition Center, which serves the free and reduced lunch program in Bridgeport’s Public Schools.


We are generously supported by a challenge grant, from a donor advised fund at the Fairfield County Community Foundation, which will match ever dollar we raise in the wake of the fire. This means for every dollar you donate, we will be raising two for Reservoir Community Farm! If we reach our goal of $25,000, we will have $50,000 not only to rebuild our community space, but also continue to host workshops and field days, advance our youth empowerment program through farm-based skill-building internships, and produce hundreds of pounds of fresh vegetables for Bridgeport Public School cafeterias every year. 


The Community Building, otherwise known as 

The Shed has hosted field trips for 24 schools in the city reaching hundreds of students. This building we lost was home to countless teaching supplies vital for the operation of these field trips. In addition to acting as the central meeting area for the farm and community members the building also housed our bathroom, washroom and produce refrigerator. We have been able to continue growing vegetables with the limited resources that escaped the flames but as we approach peak season we are struggling to maintain the educational support we pride ourselves in providing. To continue moving forward and upward we must raise funds to rebuild The Shed, and breathe new life into Reservoir Community Farm.



Looking Ahead

We've been working with architects and designers to create a solid plan for what the new and improved building will look like.



Every day, our farm faces challenges without The Shed. The entire city of Bridgeport feels it. People drive by every day to ask what happened, and what they can do to help. There are farmers that rely on us to provide a place where they can grow, and children that want to enjoy affordable, fresh food, everyday. 

We know that our farm makes a difference to so many people, but this unfortunate event has made it impossible for us to keep functioning properly. 

We are putting our faith in the community to help us repair and renew our farm. Every donation, small or large, significantly impacts our cause. And it all starts with YOU. 



Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that doesn't mean you can't help! Spread the word! Let people know about our farm, and make some noise! Share this campaign on Facebook, show our video at your school or work, post about us on your blog. Get creative, and spread the address to this page, ReservoirFarm.org





Special Thanks To KickVids

story:
Hello...

My name is Michael Brown-or just Mike among friends. I am an architect in a small town called Staunton in Virginia's Shenandoah Valley. I've been doing architecture for most of my life-it's the only job I have ever had. I've been doing it on my own here in Staunton since 1999 when my wife and I moved here from Atlanta.

I have had a great time doing what I love and I have helped a lot of people realize their dreams along the way. I have also been able to voluntarily donate my skills to help individuals, churches and synagogues, and my town. Helping out is something that is important to me, and, I think, is a feature of most small-town architects.

In the news you read about a lot of star architects and giant firms. You don't hear about the fact that most architects are sole proprietors, doing good in the ways I have just described.

So why am I here on Indiegogo? Well, we have all lived through the Great Recession, and for architects it started as early as December 2007. It finally seems to be coming to an end, thank goodness, and I have managed to survive it. But it has left me in a greatly weakened state even as the volume of work I have picks up again. By this I mean that I have old and broken-down equipment, obsolete software, and lots of debt. It makes it more difficult to do my job and to help others as I like to do.

There are a lot of examples of fundraising for new  ventures and projects. This is an example of a venture that is a proven success, after 16 years, and is also a proven survivor! So by doing what you can here, you can help to make sure that this venture can re-make itself for the next era, and keep it and me moving forward and by extension-help others move forward and realize their dreams as well.

Here are some places you can see more about Michael C. Brown / Architect:

http://www.mcbarch.com/

https://www.facebook.com/MichaelCBrownArchitect?ref=hl

http://organicvalleyarchitecture.blogspot.com/

Thank you for your time and your help!


More Details...

Needs:
  • New Computer: My existing computer is still using Windows XP!
  • New Plotter: My plotter is from the year 2000. I can only plot to it using the first computer I bought for the business in 1999-it still works for now and I only use it for plotting drawings.
  • Smart Phone: Right now I only have a basic cell phone and I could really make use of new technologies and apps in my work.
  • Software Upgrades: CADD and other software is expensive and I need to update mine.
  • Library: I need new codebooks and other resources.
  • Training! I need to update myself to use new software in order to keep up with trends in my industry.
  • Website: It really needs an upgrade.

You can see for yourself what some of these items look like in my video.

If I don't make it to the goal above, I'll simply prioritize what I can do from this list.


The Impact...

Now and in the past I have given voluntarily in numerous ways:
  • I sit on the Historic Preservation Commission for Staunton, VA. 
  • I have helped out Temple House of Israel synagogue, Ebenezer Baptist Church, and a number of others with projects they had to get done-projects involving accessibility for the handicapped, preschools, and other functions.
  • I have helped individuals and businesses with problems they had with the building code, accessibility, safety, structures, and more.
  • I act as the CFO of Friends of Kebyar, and organization that publishes architectural journals world-wide promoting organic architecture.

You can help me to keep doing these functions, so vital to a small town, and around the world, as well as helping me to continue to bring good architecture to the area.


Other Ways You Can Help...

I realize that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word about this campaign-use social media.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!


Thank you!

...from Mike

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

 
Thank you!
...from Mike

story:
Objective

Culture Matters is a social business committed to the cultural preservation and empowerment of craft based communities in the Southeast Asia. We are a spin off of the non-profit design for a research group funded by Nanyang Technological University. The team is headed by Dr Nanci Takeyama, from Nanyang Technological University in Singapore.

We take pride in ensuring our products are culturally respectful, sustainable and hence environmentally friendly, produced on fair-trade terms. To ensure premium at its best, our products are handmade, hand dyed, using natural pigments from nature.

                                    

Vest from Duality Collection

                                       

Shawl from Transcendence Collection


These photos are taken under studio lightings and may not represent the true colours of the products. Do consider too that our products are hand made and hand dyed and hence beautifully imperfect. Though be ensured that we take pride in ensuring that the quality of our products are controlled at its best.


Why Support Culture Matters

This initial kick start will be used to empower artisans through courses to understand the needs of international markets. Our goal is to support artisans to re-position the value of these traditional crafts, as premium products in the global market.


Your support would be used for the following:

Workshops for the artisans will include

  1. Sessions on quality control
  2. Sessions on skills such as, patterning, sewing, etc.

Production costs, which covers:

  1.  material cost, dye and silk
  2. artisans workmanship
  3. costs of 2 trips for 2 members for liaison


We will proceed with the 2 trips, if we meet 60% of the target we intend to raise. Should we not be able to do so, we will try our best to return the funds respectively. 


About the products and the artisans

Culture matters work closely with local artisans, and aspire to promote the crafts in Southeast Asia. Our products are limited editions of handmade, one-of-a-kind products, designed out of a four years research project.

The textile in Laos employs motifs and patterns that are still strongly connected to their own spirituality, daily rites and rituals. Our products were developed after the research on the symbol of Cosmic Serpent in their textiles and applications into contemporary products.

In re-discovering it's connections to the lives of the Laotians, Culture Matters hope to bring the richness, relevance and cultural context of the Cosmic Serpent to a new generation of local and foreign audiences.

                    

                              

                                            Shawl from Transcendence Collection

           

Clutch from Duality Collection


            


Vest from Duality Collection


Future Plans

This Campaign also serves as primary platform to provide an alternative option for our partners to see the global outreach opportunities. Each successful campaign we will initiate a second Campaign, for products that are more complex in making. After two successive indiegogo campaigns our aim is to create a holistic e-commerce platform.

story:
Camp Na'aleh

Camp Na'aleh is committed to educating youth on values of cultural Judaism, social justice, and community.  As we enter our eighteenth summer and a new campsite, this value-based education is as strong as ever.  We want to grow and ensure that our machaneh (camp) will continue to empower many generations to come.  In order to accomplish that goal, we are asking for donations of any amount.  We greatly appreciate the generosity from members of our community as well as their families, friends, and other donors.

story:
In a Nutshell

The Downtown Dance Collective has been a driving force in dance in Missoula for 7 years!  We have supported the creation of a new dance company, granted 13 Artist in Residence Series, donate time and space to many non-profits all the while hosting up to 30 classes a week for Adults and Children.  We offer Work Study programs so that everyone has a chance to dance and we make sure that every person that walks through our doors is welcome.  

We would like to call on you!  With this 7th Anniversary campaign, we are looking to specifically fund the following two projects.

  • The Missoula Summer Dance Intensive
  • The Artist in Residence Series

The Intensive offers a week of professional level contemporary dance training, making it the only dance training of its kind in the state. The AiR Series offers local dance makers and performers a rehearsal and performance space at the DDC, granting up and coming artists a place to take risks and create original work.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $7,000 with this campaign, which will allow the DDC to pay instructor travel and classes for the Missoula Summer Dance Intensive, and help us fund the Artist in Residence series for the 2015-2016. All donations are tax deductable, after your contribution you will recieve a reciept from Fractured Atlas, our non-profit sponsor.

  • $2,000 for transportation and fees for MSDI's guest artist Nicole Wolcott.
  • $3,000 additional faculty, facility, advertising, administrative and scholarships
  • Two grants of $1,000 for the 2015-2016 Artist in Residence year.

We are offering you: a big, fat THANK YOU, tickets to all of these events, and/or an informal reception to honor the community that allows events like the Intensive to happen.

    Growing and Giving

    The Missoula Summer Dance Intensive is in its second year, and as we try to expand we take more risks. This year that means bringing in more artists from farther away, and in order to do so we want to be able to pay these artists fairly for their incredible work. Our first year was a huge success, and we plan to grow from our experience by bringing in new faculty and students form around the Northwest.

    The Artist in Residence program was created in 2011, and the DDC has hosted many amazing professional dancers and performance in that time. Past artists include Joy French of Bare Bait Dance, Tricia Opstad, Collin Ranf, Ashley Griffith, Andy Meyers, Lizzi Hatfield, Kate Morris, Jess Mulette, Laurel Sears, to name a few. The DDC has felt honored to have this work taking place in this space, and would love to expand the program so that artists will receive rehearsal and performance space, marketing support, and a stipend for sets, costumes, light and sound.  This is a very unique program in our state and we hope to see it continue.

story:
Did you know that over 230,000 new cases of invasive breast cancer are diagnosed each year? 1 in 8 women will develop invasive breast cancer during her lifetime. The good news is that the survival rate for these women is much higher than it was even 5 years ago.

While there have been great advancements in breast cancer treatment the struggle for a survivor begins during treatment. Recovery can be difficult and women often lack resources to make it bearable.

Who are we?

Sisters Network of Central New Jersey is an organization dedicated to helping women stay encouraged during treatment and the recovery process so that they will live. Our services include but are not limited to: providing transportation to chemo treatments, wigs, prosthetics, food cards, financial assistance for prescription medication, and utility bills. In addition, we accompany women to doctors and/or hospital visits, provide free community workshops, encourage annual mammography screening through our mammogram project and we facilitate monthly support group meetings. We collaborate with Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital (RWJUH), St. Peter’s University Hospital, Cancer Support Community and Cancer Institute of NJ to teach survivors life skills and healthy living workshops.

Some of our proud partners and sponsors include:


This facility is one of the resources we make available to the women.

What is our project?

So let’s get right to the point. We need your help to contain our facility cost so that we can continue to provide and expand our survivor services. For example, we could collaborate with local hospitals and imaging centers to provide 3,190 mammograms, transportation to treatment for 400 women and prosthetics for 25 women.

How long will it take to complete our project?

Although we already help many women during their treatment, we expect that it will take 2 months from the day this project is funded to eliminate most of our facility costs.

How much backing do we need to complete our project?

To increase services to underserved women we are asking for a total of $497,465.

How will the money be used?

The money will be used to expand our survivor services to underserved women and contain facility cost.

What perks are we offering?

As an incentive we are offering several perks as a small gesture of gratitude for your support. See the perks structure sidebar.

$5 - USB Drive Key Chain

$10 - Stylus

$25 - Selfie Stick

$50 - Power Pack

$75 - Bluetooth Speaker

$100 - Laptop Bag

$500 - Samsung Tablet

$1000 - Surface Tablet/PC

Can we deliver the perks we promise in a timely fashion?

These rewards are provided by a reputable service provider which offers insurance for its delivery of the items.

What will we do if we get more than we asked for?

If we raise more than the target, 10% of the excess will be evenly distributed between Cure Breast Cancer Foundation, for research on the growth and spreading of breast cancer cells known as the Self-Seeding Theory and Steeplechase Cancer Center, RWJ, Somerset for research targeting African American women and access to mammograms. Additionally, funds would be used to establish a Sisters Network of Central New Jersey Inc. survivor’s endowment fund.

Why is this project worth the money?

This project is worth the money because it WILL save lives.

HELP US WIN THE FIGHT AGAINST BREAST CANCER!

story:
Chessed Ve'Emet is involved with Torah learning and outreach combined with acts of loving kindness. Amongst other things, we have a Torah lending library, store and various online services.

Our largest Mitzvah project is our Bayit Chadash (A New Home) -

Wedding Assistance Project for Jewish Orphans in Israel

In addition to practical assistance for the wedding where necessary, we provide orphan brides and grooms with a gift bundle of brand new items to begin their new home (their Bayit Chadash). 

Who it Serves:

Orphan brides and grooms marrying in Israel and setting up their new home in Israel.

The Need for the Project and for its Expansion:

Getting married and starting one's own home is expensive for any couple and that much harder when the bride or groom or both are orphaned from one or both parents. 

A few weeks ago, one of our volunteers noticed that a bridal gown store / rental service was closing and selling off their dresses very cheaply. She offered to sponsor a certain amount and together we went to look at the stock. Of the over 200 bridal gowns, 60 were found to be suitable for our brides. We have obtained these 60 bridal gowns but now need to obtain sturdy rails, a full length portable mirror, mannequin and other details in order to arrange these beautiful dresses. They are no help to anyone sitting in black bags. A number of the dresses are in need of cleaning, ironing and minor repairs. With this addition, we need to move our services to larger premises and this obviously will incur costs.

Our Bayit Chadash store is currently located in our strong room which is approximately 3m x 3m or a bit smaller. It can be seen in the video. As you can see there is no space for 2-3 sturdy clothes stands of 2m each. In the video you can see a few of the dresses on our one small clothes stand that is for our Simchah gowns.

Aside from the exciting addition of 60 bridal gowns we already need another set of shelves to display household items that come in.

The dry cleaning costs ₪80 per bridal gown or approximately $22. This is per gown. The total would be roughly $1300.

Each sturdy stand is approximately ₪350 plus ₪100 (per each item) for delivery or approximately $120 per sturdy stand.

We have not yet found a full length mirror we are happy with. Prices at this stage are about ₪300 plus delivery ₪100 giving a total in dollars of around $110.

We are still in the process of sourcing a suitable mannequin.

Moving cost is over ₪2000 (about $550). The exact price will vary depending on timing. Donors are welcome to contact us for more info.

Rental of new premises is approximately ₪5000 (about $1350) a month depending on size and location which depends in turn on donations that come in. If possible, we need funds to cover us for a few months while we find new premises, move and set up everything. This will be time during which we cannot earn as we will be busy with the practicalities of setting up the new premises.

 A further important note regarding premises, since Shoshanah is an occupational therapist by profession, care is given to the special needs or disabled bride to or the bride who has a disabled or special needs mother. For this reason, we need to move to a suitable venue that will be accessible to the disabled, both for those in wheelchairs and other mobility or visual deficits.

One Success Story

Chaim and Yehudit were preparing to marry. Chaim had lost his father while still a teenager and his mother had fallen on hard times. In addition to lacking the finances to make the wedding a success, his mother was living in another country. He lacked his father figure to help him prepare his wedding. Yehudit also had minimal contact or support from her family. It was Yehudit who took the initiative to contact Chessed Ve'Emet for assistance, as Chaim felt so embarrassed in his difficult situation.

After meeting us, it was clear the couple were in need of a variety of items and their wedding arrangements were incomplete. We were able to provide the couple with a selection of wonderful new items for their new home. The couple had expressed their sadness at not having suitable beds. After a brief discussion, we encouraged them in the direction of following in the laws of Jewish Family Purity and purchased two quality single beds for the couple to able to fulfill the laws in accordance with authentic Jewish law.

In addition, we took an active part in preparing and arranging a variety of important details of the wedding. This included: a professional make up artist who volunteered her service, a professional hair stylist who offered her service at no charge. We arranged a group of girls from one of the Jewish seminaries to take part in making the bride happy with their dancing, as she did not have enough guests at the wedding. For the groom we arranged a brand new quality suit as well as shoes, a driver brought him to the wedding. As a result of our intervention, the widowed mother made the decision to come, which was sponsored by a relative. We arranged the catering from a suitable and accepted Kosher caterer. We attended the wedding and took an active part by being a witness as required by Jewish law and taking care of the niece of 8 months old so that she did not disturb the wedding ceremony and arranging last minute details required at the wedding. Boys from a Yeshiva (place of Torah learning) were arranged to dance for the groom and to bring additional happiness to him too. It was an occasion that was filled with tremendous joy for everyone involved.

Support was offered to the mother for the week after the wedding that she was in Israel as there were times she was on her own.

Why We Need Funding Help to Keep it Operational.

We want to continue to be able to offer further assistance to couples as we have been doing up to now. We are in need of additional funds to continue running this part of the organization and to expand further. We would like to create a warm, friendly atmosphere and one that will enable us to offer more to more couples.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please visit our website and share the link.

  • Share the campaign and let your friends know how needed this service is.
  • Purchase an item from our Bayit Chadash Store
  • Book and pay for one of Chessed Ve'Emet's services. Services are found on our website.
  • If you have a modest bridal gown, bridal veil or Simchah gown, please donate it to our Bridal / Simchah gown service.
  • If you are a seamstress, please consider volunteering some of your time either to assist in repairs of the bridal gowns or for alterations when necessary.
  • If you offer a service related to Jewish weddings in Israel, please consider volunteering your service to assist our orphan Chatanim and Kallot or offering a reduced rate to those who can not afford full fees.
Website: www.lovingkindness.co
http://www.lovingkindness.co/wedding-project.html

story:
Wine tasting is a blast!  

 The problem is my memory.....after tasting 5 or 6 wines, I cannot recall which ones I really liked.  I need a tool to help me remember which wineries and wines I liked the best.

  • Which winery did I visit on which day?
  • What wines did I taste?
  • Which wines were the best of all I tasted?
  • How to I decide which wine club to join?

I am Steve Dollens,  your typical 50+ year old who enjoys visiting wineries, meeting the winemakers and touring the wineries.  As I listened to to my fellow wine tasters, many seem to share my problem.

I had several wines I liked, but which ones?


I decided the create my own tool.....and make it possible to create a community of wine tasters that can share our experiences.  I am creating:



The concept is simple, I would like to be able to do the following:

  1. Sign up fellow wine tasters in SipScore.
  2. Plan my wine tasting trips, and share the plans with my friends
  3. Have a mapped out route created
  4. Be able to schedule my stops, i.e.. limo pickup, wineries, hotel etc.
  5. When I visit the winery, see what will it look like as I approach it?
  6. Taste the wine, and be able to easily enter my score for each
  7. Rate the winery also, was it pleasant or rude. Will I visit again?
  8. Decide, or not, if I will join the wine club.
  9. Next time I go shopping, I can use my SipScore list to aid in my wine purchases.

Updates

June 24, 2015: The website development is progressing, here is a picture of the home page:


June 24, 2015: Here is a picture of the Trip planning page:

June 25, 2015: Here is a picture of the administration tool used to manage winery members. The wineries will advertise for a fee to secure prominent visibility:




Needed,  funding partners SipScore.... 

I simply cannot undertake to do this alone.  I have researched the web developers, and the cost is a few thousand $ just to get the website going.
I will use funds for the following:
  • Design the "engine" that will make the process work
  • Implement a website that will work with mobile devices
  • Create an iPhone app. that will enable on-the-go SipScore functionality
My confidence is pretty high that we can fund the website development. I am not real sure how much it costs to create an iPhone app.  However much the funding can cover, we will implement.  If we fall short, we will just use the tool as far as it has matured.  As time passes may the membership fees of SipScore will enable it's expansion to fulfill  the entire vision.


Probability of Success

I came out of Silicon Valley's high tech industry. I created and managed development and rollout of many products you might recognize. We can do this.
California has more than 600 wineries alone.  SipScore will include nearly all of these, then expand across the USA. 
Active promotion will be developed with travel agencies in Europe and Asia. The goal will be to become a featured tool for visitors to the USA.
Each winery will be approached with opportunity to be a "featured winery" in a given area. Funds from this advertising content will be used to expand promotion SipScore.
And for the future success of blossoming  wine connoisseurs, we must succeed !


SipScore in Action

Once the user has planned their SipTrip, they will be guided from point to point.

Here is a snapshot of what the user would see as they approach the next stop:



Other uses

Beyond scoring of wine tasting events, Sipscore can be extended to enable scoring of things like dining, campgrounds, beer tasting.  But, of now, we will start with Wine Tasting.



Other Ways You Can Help

Can't  contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help

  • Do your wine tasting friends a favor...tell them about our project
  • Are you a wine taster?  Tell your favorite wineries about SipScore.

Now go out there and be SAFE!
story_txt:
Wine tasting is a blast!  
 The problem is my memory.....after tasting 5 or 6 wines, I cannot recall which ones I really liked.  I need a tool to help me remember which wineries and wines I liked the best.


Which winery did I visit on which day?
What wines did I taste?
Which wines were the best of all I tasted?
How to I decide which wine club to join?



I am Steve Dollens,  your typical 50+ year old who enjoys visiting wineries, meeting the winemakers and touring the wineries.  As I listened to to my fellow wine tasters, many seem to share my problem.

I had several wines I liked, but which ones?

I decided the create my own tool.....and make it possible to create a community of wine tasters that can share our experiences.  I am creating:




The concept is simple, I would like to be able to do the following:


Sign up fellow wine tasters in SipScore.
Plan my wine tasting trips, and share the plans with my friends
Have a mapped out route created
Be able to schedule my stops, i.e.. limo pickup, wineries, hotel etc.
When I visit the winery, see what will it look like as I approach it?
Taste the wine, and be able to easily enter my score for each
Rate the winery also, was it pleasant or rude. Will I visit again?
Decide, or not, if I will join the wine club.
Next time I go shopping, I can use my SipScore list to aid in my wine purchases.

Each winery will be approached with opportunity to be a "featured winery" in a given area. Funds from this advertising content will be used to expand promotion SipScore.

story:
My wife Debra and I have created the first Scottish Style Distillery on the Isle of Whidbey in the Pacific Northwest. We are looking for your help to raise $30,000 to fund the spirit ingredients, additional materials, equipment and supplies required to help create our spirits. 

For your contribution we are offering gifts related to our brand ranging from the first batch of spirits in full production (we have been testing and creating profiles) to a selection of t-shirts, hats, candles, whiskey glasses and sipping stones as well as invitations to tasting events.  If we do not reach our full goal we will simply offer less product to start in the market and build the business from that point. This is the first phase in our journey and we hope you will be a part of it.

With your help we will be able to launch Cadée Distillery, offering a selection of Vodka, Gin and a selection of Whiskies. You can be part of this incredible journey and help us create a local business, supporting local people, and selling a handcrafted Whidbey Island product on a global level.

We have launched multiple businesses over the years (we are old), some very successful, some not so.  All were key business and life lessons for us to learn from and subsequently make better decisions.  We have full licensing and approval for the distillery, and we anticipate a launch date in September 2015. 

In the meantime we are actively operating the business in Clinton, Washington on Whidbey Island.  We have the tasting room ready to go and bottles waiting to be filled. We know some of you will not be able to contribute financially, but you can still help by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign.

Simply use the Indiegogo share tools, and that's all there is to it.

Sláinte!

Colin and Debra Campbell

An example of some products below.

story:
Tritone Guitars LLC is located in Southwest St. Louis city (in my home basement shop), and has been in business for three years now. Unlike many crowd funding campaigns, this is not a plea to save my business or fund a new product. 

The St. Louis area is an amazing musical city filled with great musicians and innovative gear builders alike! As a player, teacher, and repair person, I have managed to grow Tritone Guitars into a central hub that connects working  musicians of varius styles with both  entrepreneurs that specialize in music related endevors, as well as students and educators of music alike.

And with all the skill sets I have developed through my lutherie experience, performing as a multi instrumentalist and guitarist both in the studio and on stage, teaching, writing articles, product demos, etc there are only so many hours in the day to accomplish work and still function as a participating member of my home and family. 

Tritone Guitars has always had a very humble approch. I have built the shop by buying second hand tools and often finding free tools that people wanted to get rid of. Building benches and work fixtures from repurposed materials, and by marketing and promoting the business by social media. But its time to put some actual money back into this business! 

This Indiegogo Campaign is in place to help Tritone Guitars become more efficient and to provide a better shop environment by improving tooling and infrastructure. This campaign works like a pre paid service fund that gives you as a customer a better value! 

-There are structual needs like a broken step in the entrance way to water proofing and climate controlling the shop space.                                                                                              

-I would also like to redo the concrete floors, paint the walls and ceiling, and improve the lighting.                                                                                                                           

-New tools need to be purchased to speed up repairs, and replace broken or worn older tools.  

- Video equipment, lighting, and a newer computer needs to be purchased for promoting the shop, product demos, and educational resources.

-A surplus of parts, strings, and materials for pickup and guitar builds needs to be purchased.

story:
Vu que la plateforme Indiegogo est anglophone, la version française suivra plus bas (merci de votre compréhension).

CLIQUEZ ICI POUR LA VERSION FRANCAISE ! >>>


MYATTIK : THE FIRST SOCIAL NETWORK OF CLASSIFIED ADS

TAKE PART IN THE CREATION OF A NEW LEVER OF ACTION FOR A POSITIVE TRANSFORMATION IN OUR MODES OF CONSUMPTION


THE PREMISE

In an interconnected world offering opportunities for collaboration, we increasingly want to consume in an environmentally responsible manner. Through technological innovation, we are ready to find an alternative to our consumption patterns.

MyAttik provides this alternative, by offering you to participate in a collaborative and sustainable development economy.

We promote behavior that drives ownership of our environment footprint, since a different consumption pattern is now a necessity.


THE CONCEPT

MyAttik is first as a social network to devote itselft to member driven ads. This new innovative and intuitive platform integrates the strengths of a traditional classifieds site, by including the following features.

MyAttik offers the opportunity for viewership by the general public or restricted communities of all your objects meant for sale, rent, or exchange. You can chat with other membres directly on the site, though instant messaging; also, you can create public and private groups and events for a garage sale, flea market, or sidewalk sale.

=> Your platform is intuitive to facilitate sharing.


=> Your cart Messenger is a virtual shopping cart that includes all advertisements of interest you selected during a session, and it enables you to contact directly and much quickly the sellers from a single location.


=> Our quick sorting system allows you to find exchange opportunties and bargains much faster,one click away for all ad types (sale, rent, or exchange).

=> Your personal virtual attic includes a configurable management dashboard for your objects, which allows you to promote, delete or edit an ad.


=> Chat: Instant messaging among friends to facilitate communication.

=> An Attik coin allows you to promote an announcement by giving it more visibility in the upper part of the platform, which is labeled as Sunshine. Several coins can be earned by contributing to our launch campaign.


OBJECTIVE

MyAttik is determined to propose a serious alternative to the current economic models. The creators wish to encourage a culture where human qualities and values such as solidarity and recuperation are put forward.

CO-FOUNDER

MyAttik is co-founded with Aboubakar Tirera. He arrived to Montreal three years ago, with a focus on growing through enterpreneurship a project, which stimulates a collaborative economy and contributes to sustainable development.

The inspiration behind MyAttik came after living a year and a half in Montreal, several relocations within the city, and several introductions within the local community, which offered donations following his arrival to Quebec.

Through his discovery of flourishing neighborhood life, a goal was set to launch an accessible, intuitive, and innovative platform for citizens that wish to participate in the sharing economy.

This unique concept was born following his adventures in Montreal and from the effort of the motivated and ambitious team of MyAttik.

This project is nomited for the Startup Canada Awards of 2015 and for the Montreal Foundation Inc. Awards of 2015.

Contribute to the success of our project!


VALUES

The creator of MyAttik is a young Montreal contractor who believes in the force of the communities and the capacity of the citizens to organize themselves in favour of a collaborative economy.

The founders wish to demonstrate that each citizen can act on their own scale and without much budget, and to show that this is effective only thanks to networking. They believe that a positive transformation of our mode of consumption will come only from one collective process.


TIMELINE MY ATTIK



WHAT’S THE PURPOSE OF THE CROWDFUNDING?

Three levels, I’m counting on you!

4 000 $

The 4 000 $ threshold will make it possible for My Attik to launch the platform this coming fall. The collected sum will be used to cover the costs of starting, but also to finalize the design of the platform and the tests.

=> 2 000 $ to finalize the design of the platform and to make it as intuitive as possible.

=> 1 000 $ to improve the development of the platform and to make it the safest and the most powerful as possible.

=> 1 000 $ to deploy the means of communication necessary to the fall launch. This stage is one of upmost importance because MyAttik must bring together very many users in order to be really effective.

7 000 $

The 7 000 $ threshold will allow the creation of a portable application and to take part in the Salon carrière et développement professionnel (career and professional development day) that will take place in Montreal on October 7, 2015 and would give a great visibility to the project as well as bring in new talents.

=> 2 000 $ for the development of the MyAttik portable application.

=> 500 $ for the stand at the Salon in October.

=> 500 $ for the run of the Montreal universities.

11 000$ and +

If your participation is so generous that the level of 11.000 $ is exceeded, that will allow MyAttik to develop the second version (V2), more evolved and offering more options, in addition to the objectives previously mentioned. This sum will allow:

=> To reinforce our team of developers and advertisement moderators.

=> To lead field actions across Canada to let the platform be discovered by more people.

=> To have our own offices in Montreal.

Share this campaign with your neighbors, friends, families, and evanglists and active contributors within the sharing economy.

By using the Share tool on this page, post and promote our campaign within your own social network.

Spread the word within your surrounding area about our fundraising campaing - all donations are welcome and will be of great help!

Subscribe to our newsletter and beta test the platform priorto launch!

Follow MyAttik on Facebook !

Follow us on Twitter !

Follow us on our website !

Follow us on Instagram !

Whether you have further ideas on how to raise funds or whether you are driven to volunteer with us  and reach our goal together, we would like to hear from you at contact@myattik.com !

 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PARTICIPEZ À LA CRÉATION D'UN NOUVEAU LEVIER D'ACTION POUR UNE TRANSFORMATION POSITIVE DE NOS MODES DE CONSOMMATION


LE CONSTAT

Nous évoluons dans un monde interconnecté qui ne cesse de faire émerger des solutions d'entraide. Nous constatons aussi que, de plus en plus, de citoyens souhaitent consommer de manière écoresponsable et que nombreux sont ceux qui sont prêts à saisir des avancées technologiques pour trouver des alternatives à leur mode de consommation.

L'objectif de MyAttik est de proposer une alternative pour les citoyens qui souhaitent s'engager dans un processus qui encouragent l'économie collaborative et le développement durable.

Nous favorisons les comportements écoresponsables ; consommer autrement est devenu une nécessité aujourd'hui.



LE CONCEPT

MyAttik est le premier réseau social uniquement consacré aux petites annonces. Cette nouvelle plateforme innovante et intuitive intègre les atouts d'un site traditionnel de petites annonces en y ajoutant de nouvelles fonctionnalités.

MyAttik offrira à chaque utilisateur la possibilité de rendre visible au grand public ou à des communautés restreintes tous les objets qu'il souhaite vendre, louer, donner ou échanger. Les utilisateurs pourront directement discuter entre eux, sur le site, créer des groupes publics ou privés et des événements (vente de garage, brocante, ventes de trottoir).

=> Votre plateforme : une plateforme intuitive qui facilite le partage.


=> Votre panier Messenger : l'utilisateur peut ajouter toute annonce dans son "panier virtuel" lors de sa visite et contacter tous les annonceurs d'un coup, à partir du panier, sans perdre du temps.


=> Un système de tri rapide : l'option permet aux utilisateurs de trier en un clic toutes les annonces par type (vente, louer, donner et échanger) ; ce qui permet aux utilisateurs d'échanger plus rapidement et à moindre coût.

=> Votre grenier : mise à disposition d'un grenier virtuel paramétrable par l'utilisateur dans son tableau de bord et à la gestion des objets du grenier (promouvoir, supprimer et modifier l'annonce).


=>Tchat : messagerie instantanée entre amis pour faciliter la communication.

=> La pièce Attik : elle permet à l'utilisateur de promouvoir son annonce et de lui donner plus de visibilité dans la partie haute de la plateforme (sunshine). En participant à la campagne, gagnez plein de pièces Attik.



OBJECTIFS

MyAttik est déterminé à proposer une alternative sérieuse aux modèles économiques actuels. Les fondateurs souhaitent encourager une culture qui met de l’avant des qualités et des valeurs humaines telles que la solidarité et la récupération.

CO-FONDATEUR


Aboubakar Tirera est le co-fondateur de MyAttik. Arrivé à Montréal, il y a trois ans, avec, dans un coin de sa tête, la volonté de créer un projet d’entrepreneuriat favorisant l’économie collaborative et de participer au développement durable.

L'idée de créer MyAttik est venue après un an et demi de vie à Montréal, quelques déménagements et de nombreuses rencontres d'inconnus lui donnant des objets gratuitement, lors de son installation au Québec.

En découvrant cette riche vie de quartier, lancer une plateforme d'échange, innovante, facile et intuitive pour les citoyens qui souhaitent s'engager dans un processus qui encouragent l'économie du partage a germé de son esprit.

Ce nouveau concept, unique, est le fruit de ses aventures à Montréal et de toute son équipe motivée et ambitieuse.

Le projet MyAttik a été nominé au Startup Canada Awards 2015 et au concours de la Fondation Montréal Inc.

Participez à la réussite du projet ! 


VALEUR

Le créateur de MyAttik, un jeune entrepreneur montréalais qui croit en la force des communautés et en la capacité des citoyens à s'organiser en faveur d'une économie collaborative.

L'équipe de MyAttik souhaite démontrer que chaque citoyens peu agir à son échelle et sans grand budget, mais que cela n'est efficace que grâce à la mise en réseau. Elle croit qu'une transformation positive de nos modes de consommation ne peut venir que d'un processus collectif.


TIMELINE MY ATTIK



À QUOI SERVIRA LA COLLECTE ?


Trois paliers, je compte sur vous !

 

4 000$

Le seuil des 4 000$ permettra à My Attik de lancer la plateforme à l’automne. Cette somme récoltée servira à couvrir les coûts de démarrage, mais aussi à finaliser le design de la plateforme et les tests.

=> 2 000$ pour finaliser le design de la plateforme et la rendre la plus intuitive possible.

=> 1 000$ améliorer le développement  de la plateforme et la rendre le plus sécuritaire et la plus performante possible

=> 1 000$ pour déployer les moyens de communication nécessaires au lancement cet automne. Cette étape est une des plus importante, car pour être réellement efficace et alternatif, MyAttik doit réunir de très nombreux utilisateurs.


7 000$

Le seuil des 7 000$ permettra la création d'une application mobile et nous permettront de  participer au Salon Carrières et développement professionnel qui aura lieu à Montréal les 7 et 8 octobre 2015 afin de donner de la visibilité au projet et de recruter de nouveaux talents.

=> 2 000 $ pour le développement de l'application mobile My Attik

=> 500$ pour le kiosque au Salon Carrières et développement professionnel

=> 500$ pour la tournée des universités Montréalaise


11 000$ et +

Si votre participation est si généreuse et que la barre des 11 000$ est dépassée, cela permettra à MyAttik, en plus des objectifs cités précédemment, de développer la deuxième version (V2) plus évoluée et offrant davantage d'options. Cette somme permettra de :

=> Renforcer notre équipe de développeurs et de modérateurs des annonces

=> Mener des actions de terrain partout au Canada pour faire découvrir la plateforme d'échange

=> Avoir nos propres bureaux à Montréal



PERK // CONTREPARTIE

Uniquement 4 paires de lunettes disponibles, Pour voir toute la collection cliquez ici



01                                                                                 02

03                                                                                   04


Uniquement 5 ensembles de bracelets et boucles d'oreille disponible, "premier arrivé, premier servie" Pour voir toute la collection cliquez ici

01                                                                 02

03                                                                 04


05


Partagez cette page de campagne avec vos voisins, amis, familles, connaissances férues de l'économie du partage et avec tous ceux qui, selon vous, seront inspirés à contribuer.

Utilisez l’outil de partage sur cette page pour faire connaître notre campagne à votre propre communauté sur vos réseaux sociaux.

Parlez de nous à votre entourage et encouragez-les à donner ce qui leur conviendra, tous les dons aideront !

Inscrivez-vous à notre newsletter pour tester la plateforme avant le grand lancement ! 

Suivez MyAttik sur Facebook !

Suivez-nous sur Twitter !

Suivez-nous sur notre site Web !

Suivez-nous sur Instagram !

Vous avez d'autres idées pour lever des fonds ou nous aider en tant que bénévole pour atteindre l'objectif ? Écrivez-nous à : contact@myattik.com

his discovery of flourishing neighborhood life, a goal was set to launch an
accessible, intuitive, and innovative platform for citizens that wish to participate
in the sharing economy.
This
unique concept was born following his adventures in Montreal and from the effort
of the motivated and ambitious team of MyAttik.
This
project is nomited for the Startup Canada Awards of 2015 and for the Montreal
Foundation Inc. Awards of 2015.
Contribute
to the success of our project!
VALUES
The creator
of MyAttik is a young Montreal contractor who believes in the force of the
communities and the capacity of the citizens to organize themselves in favour
of a collaborative economy. 
The
founders wish to demonstrate that each citizen can act on their own scale and
without much budget, and to show that this is effective only thanks to networking.
They believe that a positive transformation of our mode of consumption will
come only from one collective process.TIMELINE MY ATTIK
WHAT’S THE
PURPOSE OF THE CROWDFUNDING?
Three
levels, I’m counting on you!
4 000 $
The 4 000
$ threshold will make it possible for My Attik to launch the platform this
coming fall. The collected sum will be used to cover the costs of starting, but
also to finalize the design of the platform and the tests.
=> 2 000 $ to finalize the design
of the platform and to make it as intuitive as possible.
=> 1 000 $ to improve the
development of the platform and to make it the safest and the most powerful as
possible.
=> 1 000 $ to deploy the means of
communication necessary to the fall launch. This stage is one of upmost importance
because MyAttik must bring together very many users in order to be really
effective.
7 000
$
The 7 000
$ threshold will allow the creation of a portable application and to take part
in the Salon carrière et développement
professionnel (career and professional development day) that will take
place in Montreal on October 7, 2015 and
would give a great visibility to the project as well as bring in new talents.
=> 2 000 $ for the development of the MyAttik
portable application.
=> 500 $ for the stand at the Salon in October.
=> 500 $ for the run of the Montreal
universities.
11 000$
and +
If your
participation is so generous that the level of 11.000 $ is exceeded, that will
allow MyAttik to develop the second
version (V2), more evolved and offering more options, in addition
to the objectives previously mentioned. This sum will allow:
=> To reinforce our team of developers and advertisement
moderators. 
=> To lead field actions across Canada to let the platform
be discovered by more people.
=> To have our own offices in Montreal.

Share
this campaign with your neighbors, friends, families, and evanglists and active
contributors within the sharing economy.
By
using the Share tool on this page, post and promote our
campaign within your own social network.
Spread
the word within your surrounding area about our fundraising campaing - all
donations are welcome and will be of great help!
Subscribe
to our newsletter and beta test the platform priorto launch!
Follow
MyAttik on Facebook !
Follow
us on Twitter !
Follow
us on our website !
Follow
us on Instagram !
Whether
you have further ideas on how to raise funds or whether you are driven to
volunteer with us  and reach our goal
together, we would like to hear from you at contact@myattik.com !

 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------PARTICIPEZ À LA CRÉATION D'UN NOUVEAU LEVIER D'ACTION POUR UNE
TRANSFORMATION POSITIVE DE NOS MODES DE CONSOMMATIONLE CONSTAT

Nous évoluons dans un monde
interconnecté qui ne cesse de faire émerger des solutions d'entraide. Nous
constatons aussi que, de plus en plus, de citoyens souhaitent consommer de
manière écoresponsable et que nombreux sont ceux qui sont prêts à saisir des avancées
technologiques pour trouver des alternatives à leur mode de consommation. 
L'objectif de MyAttik est de
proposer une alternative pour les citoyens qui souhaitent s'engager dans un
processus qui encouragent l'économie collaborative et le développement durable.

Nous favorisons les
comportements écoresponsables ; consommer autrement est devenu une nécessité
aujourd'hui. 
LE CONCEPT
MyAttik est le premier réseau
social uniquement consacré aux petites annonces. Cette nouvelle plateforme
innovante et intuitive intègre les atouts d'un site traditionnel de petites
annonces en y ajoutant de nouvelles fonctionnalités.
MyAttik offrira à chaque utilisateur la
possibilité de rendre visible au grand public ou à des communautés restreintes
tous les objets qu'il souhaite vendre, louer, donner ou échanger. Les
utilisateurs pourront directement discuter entre eux, sur le site, créer des
groupes publics ou privés et des événements (vente de garage, brocante, ventes
de trottoir). 
=> Votre plateforme : une
plateforme intuitive qui facilite le partage.=> Votre panier Messenger :
l'utilisateur peut ajouter toute annonce dans son "panier virtuel"
lors de sa visite et contacter tous les annonceurs d'un coup, à partir du
panier, sans perdre du temps. 

=> Un système de tri rapide : l'option
permet aux utilisateurs de trier en un clic toutes les annonces par type
(vente, louer, donner et échanger) ; ce qui permet aux utilisateurs d'échanger plus
rapidement et à moindre coût. 
=> Votre grenier : mise à
disposition d'un grenier virtuel paramétrable par l'utilisateur dans son
tableau de bord et à la gestion des objets du grenier (promouvoir, supprimer et
modifier l'annonce). 
=>Tchat : messagerie
instantanée entre amis pour faciliter la communication. 
=> La pièce Attik : elle permet
à l'utilisateur de promouvoir son annonce et de lui donner plus de visibilité
dans la partie haute de la plateforme (sunshine). En participant à la campagne,
gagnez plein de pièces Attik. 
OBJECTIFS
MyAttik est déterminé à
proposer une alternative sérieuse aux modèles économiques actuels. Les fondateurs souhaitent
encourager une culture qui met de l’avant des qualités et des valeurs humaines
telles que la solidarité et la récupération. 

CO-FONDATEUR
Aboubakar Tirera est le
co-fondateur de MyAttik. Arrivé à Montréal, il y a trois ans, avec, dans un
coin de sa tête, la volonté de créer un projet d’entrepreneuriat favorisant
l’économie collaborative et de participer au développement durable. 
L'idée de créer MyAttik est
venue après un an et demi de vie à Montréal, quelques déménagements et de
nombreuses rencontres d'inconnus lui donnant des objets gratuitement, lors de
son installation au Québec. 
En découvrant cette riche vie
de quartier, lancer une plateforme d'échange, innovante, facile et intuitive
pour les citoyens qui souhaitent s'engager dans un processus qui encouragent
l'économie du partage a germé de son esprit. 
Ce nouveau concept, unique,
est le fruit de ses aventures à Montréal et de toute son équipe motivée et
ambitieuse. 
Le projet MyAttik a été nominé au Startup Canada Awards 2015 et au concours de la Fondation Montréal Inc. 
Participez
à la réussite du projet ! VALEUR
Le créateur de
MyAttik, un jeune entrepreneur montréalais qui croit en la force des communautés et
en la capacité des citoyens à s'organiser en faveur d'une économie
collaborative. 
L'équipe de MyAttik
souhaite démontrer que chaque citoyens peu agir à son échelle et sans grand
budget, mais que cela n'est efficace que grâce à la mise en réseau. Elle croit qu'une
transformation positive de nos modes de consommation ne peut venir que d'un
processus collectif. TIMELINE MY ATTIK

À QUOI SERVIRA LA COLLECTE ?
Trois paliers, je compte sur vous !
 4 000$
Le seuil des 4 000$ permettra à My Attik de lancer
la plateforme à l’automne. Cette somme récoltée servira à couvrir les coûts de
démarrage, mais aussi à finaliser le design de la plateforme et les tests.
=> 2 000$ pour finaliser
le design de la plateforme et la rendre la plus intuitive possible.
=> 1 000$ améliorer
le développement  de la plateforme et la rendre
le plus sécuritaire et la plus performante possible
=> 1 000$ pour
déployer les moyens de communication nécessaires au lancement cet automne.
Cette étape est une des plus importante, car pour être réellement efficace et
alternatif, MyAttik doit réunir de très nombreux utilisateurs.
7 000$
Le seuil des 7 000$ permettra la création d'une
application mobile et nous permettront de 
participer au Salon Carrières et développement professionnel qui aura
lieu à Montréal les 7 et 8 octobre 2015 afin de donner de la visibilité au
projet et de recruter de nouveaux talents. 
=> 2 000 $ pour le
développement de l'application mobile My Attik=> 500$ pour le
kiosque au Salon Carrières et développement professionnel=> 500$ pour la
tournée des universités Montréalaise
11 000$ et +
Si votre participation est si généreuse et que la barre
des 11 000$ est dépassée, cela permettra à MyAttik, en plus des objectifs cités
précédemment, de développer la deuxième version (V2) plus
évoluée et offrant davantage d'options. Cette somme permettra de :=> Renforcer notre
équipe de développeurs et de modérateurs des annonces=> Mener des actions
de terrain partout au Canada pour faire découvrir la plateforme d'échange
=> Avoir nos propres
bureaux à MontréalPERK // CONTREPARTIEUniquement 4 paires de lunettes disponibles, Pour voir toute la collection cliquez ici01                                                                                 0203                                                                                   04Uniquement 5 ensembles de  bracelets et  boucles d'oreille disponible, "premier arrivé, premier servie" Pour voir toute la collection cliquez ici01                                                                 0203                                                                 0405Partagez cette page de
campagne avec vos voisins, amis, familles, connaissances férues de l'économie
du partage et avec tous ceux qui, selon vous, seront inspirés à contribuer. 
Utilisez l’outil de partage
sur cette page pour faire connaître notre campagne à votre propre communauté
sur vos réseaux sociaux. 
Parlez de nous à votre
entourage et encouragez-les à donner ce qui leur conviendra, tous les dons
aideront !
Inscrivez-vous à notre newsletter pour tester
la plateforme avant le grand lancement !  
Suivez MyAttik sur Facebook !

Suivez-nous sur Twitter ! 
Suivez-nous sur notre site Web !
Suivez-nous sur Instagram !
Vous avez d'autres idées pour lever des fonds
ou nous aider en tant que bénévole pour atteindre l'objectif ? Écrivez-nous à :
contact@myattik.com

story:
My name is Nancy Guinn and I am the owner of Dog Krazy in Downtown Fredericksburg, VA.  I opened Dog Krazy in August of 2006 with no idea of what it meant to own a business.  All I knew was that I loved my dogs, your dogs, every dog I passed on the street and even the dogs I hadn’t met yet.  I truly am Dog Krazy.  In the 9 years since I opened, I have learned so much about business, pets, nutrition, and I have fallen in love with thousands of dogs and their humans.  Dog Krazy is the "go to" for people who truly love their pets and want only the best for them.  I am now a certified pet nutritionist and several of my employees that share my passion for pets are completing the same course.  Your pet’s health is our first priority.  My other passion is animal rescue.  There are so many homeless dogs and cats that are waiting for their forever home.  While we are advocates for animal rescue, our current location is not set up to be able to host adoption events.  While we are able to raise funds to help animals in needs, we want to do more.

Nova and I on a bench near our store.  She's proof you can adopt pure bred dogs through rescue.


Our goal is to open a second location in a space where we are able to host events for the many rescues surrounding the Fredericksburg area.  Every day people come in and ask if we sell puppies.  The term pet store is not one we are happy about.  We want to be known as an ADOPT SHOP.  Our goal is to have a store where events are held every weekend to introduce everyone to the dogs in foster homes and shelters that are waiting for their forever families.  Daily, we want to have dogs in foster care spend the day with us so that people can come in and meet these wonderful dogs that don’t get the same exposure that puppies in pet shops receive. 

For years we have been saving to make this dream a reality.  Earlier this year we had finally saved enough money and we started exploring our options. That’s when I found that tiny little bump.  Seven years ago we rescued a 2 year old Bullmastiff that was brought to the vet to be euthanized.  She needed surgery and her former owners chose to put her to sleep instead of getting her the surgery she needed. Nova is our comic relief, our warm hug, our pumpkin head, and our heart.  That tiny pink bump turned out to be cancer and we knew that saving her life was more important than a second store.  After three months of surgeries, the ups and downs of what if and could be, masses on x-rays and now chemotherapy, she is free of any signs of cancer and we are ready to make this dream a reality. 

We spent thousands upon thousands saving Nova’s life.  Numerous friends suggested starting a fundraiser to help pay for all of her medical expenses.  We didn’t feel right asking for help because we had the money.  It was supposed to be used for a new store, but Nova trumped that.  Our dogs will always come first.  Instead of taking their help, we sent them links to others with donation sites for their dogs in need of surgery.  They needed help, we didn’t. 

But now, after much urging by those we have helped, we are asking for your help.  We want to make “The Adopt Shop” a reality.  We need a store that promotes adoption.  We need a place where people can come in and meet dogs in foster care on a daily basis.  Even though I am asking you to donate to my dream, you will not go empty handed.  We have thought long and hard about what “Perks” we could offer in exchange of you supporting our dream to help adopt dogs in need.  Even if you aren’t able to donate, sharing this campaign with family and friends would be just as helpful.  Thank you for your contribution in helping my dream come true and that of all the animals looking for their forever homes.

For those of you that have never been to Dog Krazy, here are some examples of what we do from our customers that we love…

In February of 2015 I noticed a Facebook post from the Spotsylvania Animal Shelter about a 13 yo dog named Lucy who had just been surrendered by her family.  They claimed she wasn't good with kids.  Having a 13 yo named Georgie, I couldn't imagine dumping him at the shelter.  I was worried about how scared the poor little girl would be.  So I posted on the Spotsylvania Animal Shelter's Facebook page that I was coming in to foster Lucy the next day.  As soon as Nancy, Owner of Dog Krazy, found out about this she instantly stepped in and donated food for Lucy.  This little old lady was only going to eat the best, care of Nancy!  Old Dominion Humane Society also stepped in and brought Lucy into their Foster program so I didn't have to worry about the shelter asking me to return Lucy.  Lucy was a sweet little girl.  Due to her age she was hard of hearing, her vision wasn't great and she was arthritic in her legs.  If she was cranky around kids it was because she wasn't being treated with the respect a woman of her age deserved.  She quickly stole the hearts of my husband and myself.  Lucy would follow me anywhere.  We would have adopted her if it wasn't for the fact that she and my alpha didn't get along.  Unfortunately they had a couple of run ins.  Until the perfect home came along, Lucy would have a home with us.  In April, I took Lucy for a senior check-up at my vet.  Other than a slight heart murmur, her blood work and vitals were good.  For a 13 yo Lucy was doing great!  3 short weeks later she did not eat her dinner.  It was a really hot day so I just chalked it up to the heat.  Next day wasn't any better.  She wasn't eating much and what she did drink or eat she was now throwing up.  We made the decision to take her to the vet and scheduled an appointment for the next day.  At the vet she had a temp of over 103, she was dehydrated, and her blood work came back all out of whack.  We reluctantly left her at the vet hoping that antibiotics and fluids would make her feel better.  Unfortunately, Lucy went downhill quickly once at the vet.  We decided to take her to an emergency vet so she could get 24 hour care.  Poor girl continued to deteriorate.  No one knew what was going on.  All the test were not giving us any answers.  Little Lucy's vet bills were adding up fast.  Every time we visited our poor girl she looked worse.

Without prompting, Nancy again stepped in to help!  She donated her profits for the day from Dog Krazy to go towards Lucy's care.  She also spoke with a fellow local store owner, Foode, and they donated funds for Lucy.  Unfortunately, despite all our best efforts, little Lucy didn't make it.  Through this sad time, Nancy's incredible generosity and love for my little Foster girl, and all animals in need, made the loss a little easier to overcome.  I can never thank Nancy enough for her all she has done for Lucy.  Nancy even donated cat food when we had a stray kitten come hang out around our house.  To have a place like Dog Krazy, where the owners are truly dog crazy, who truly care about your furry family members, and who would only sell what they trust to give to their own furry family members and who also want to give back to their community is a blessing.  – Kristy S.

Two months ago our 11 year old Yorkie got sick and that's when I decided to reach out to Nancy. Without knowing who I was, Nancy took the time to message me back and answered all my questions. Two weeks after we found out that he had CHF. Since then, Nancy has been helping us along the way.  We couldn't have done it without her help. We have learned so much about this condition and how to help our little baby thanks to her and we will be always grateful for that.  Vivi M.

Dog Krazy is amazing.  Years ago I walked into the original location not looking for anything and fell in love with the store and the owner.  Never had I met a woman so passionate about what she does and so passionate about her dogs.  Over the years I continued going to Dog Krazy. I always bought my dogs necklaces (collars) there, and bought their toys and they would get special treats from Mrs. Nancy each time we went.  Over the years Nancy befriended my Dachshund Booker.  Booker was a total jerk...to everyone but me and everyone but Mrs. Nancy.  Booker adored that woman.  Nancy knew Booker for the 6 years I had him before he passed away from cancer almost a year ago.  Booker even made a special trip to Dog Krazy to say goodbye to Mrs. Nancy.  And Nancy, as she would with anyone’s dog, spent over an hour on the floor with him, petting him and loving on him and giving him every bit of food he would take.  I ended up adopting another dog after Booker passed away and Nancy picked his food, his necklace came from Dog Krazy, his toys came from Dog Krazy and the staff members and Nancy remember his name even when they don't know mine.  Last year I had been laid off and couldn't afford much and it was to be my new dog Finn's first Christmas.  Dog Krazy sent a bag full of toys and treats and gifts for Finn.  Inside that bag was a card, the card was from Booker.  Booker said that he asked Mrs. Nancy to take care of his new brother at Christmas and make it easier on me.  A business owner doesn't need to do what Nancy does.  Nancy doesn't have to be involved in the community or with local rescues or with helping pup parents through their grief.  Most business owners are not friends with all of their clients.  Nancy is.  She knows all of them, loves most of them, but adores all of their dogs. And she will be the first one to offer up help for your dog.  I wouldn't have it any other way.  A business owner, friend, a shoulder to cry on, a Santa Claus, a professional and an amazing woman own that shop because Nancy is all of those things.  My life, and my dog’s lives wouldn't be the same without her. – Kelley M.

We adopted Baxter three years ago when he was about three years old. He came to us shaking his head all the time. We took him to the vet and they looked for mites and yeast and an ear infection. They found some yeast and gave us some medicine and said not to worry about it. Baxter kept having the problem although it got a little better when we put him on grain-free food. His ears were still chronically red and sensitive. Around this time we moved to Stafford, VA with the Navy. We stumbled upon Dog Krazy when we were walking around. Lucky for us Nancy was there and she talked to us about Baxter's condition. Nancy recommended we go potato-free, which we hadn't done yet and at least four vets hadn't recommended. It has changed his life. Baxter's ears have cleared up and he never shakes his head anymore. I've stopped having to use his ear cleaning medicine completely. We are beyond grateful and happy. My dogs' health means the world to me (they are my children). I would do anything to make them happy and feel great. I know that Nancy and Dog Krazy feel the same way and they have made a loyal and grateful customer out of me forever!!  Kristin S.

Ever since meeting Nancy about 5 years ago there has NEVER been a time where she hasn't helped our family. Every time we go into her store she makes my family and our dog feel like we are family. Nancy allows me to call/text her personal cell phone with any questions I have about my dog. Nancy and her store is the only pet store we ever shop at and ever will. She's honest, loyal, friendly, and just simply the best!! We love her and so does our dog Cody. We can simply say, "Cody wanna go see Nancy?" And his ears perk up and he runs to the door! Thank you for all you do for us, and the community!! – Elizabeth C

Nancy what can I say about this Woman, last year I was down and out and I thought I would never be where I was, I did not have job, I exhausted all I had, and I was facing being evicted, but worse for me was the fact that i could not feed my best friend Bandit, I walked in and asked her if there was somewhere I could go to get dog food for free for Bandit, she asked me if it was for me.  I replied with a yes. There was no hesitation, she said let me see what I could do.  It was not my proudest moment, but I had to take care of Bandit, and I knew she would understand, she came out with a bag full of food and treats that got me over the hump.  I found an angel is all I could think of.  I prayed that someone could help me and she did and on top of that she gave me a ton of information that would help me get past this time of hardship.  God makes angels and she truly is one, I would never purchase food from anyone but her, because loyalty is everything to me, she won my heart with kindness she cares about everyone and everything. Her pets are family just as mine is to me.  I am indebted for life for her saving me from the depression and place I was in.  Thank you, I believe in your cause and I will help when I get back on my feet. Secondly, this woman sent to our K9 soldiers here in UAE a care package that saved our four legged friends, the cooling vests, toys, and treats were so well received and our solider were so honored and grateful that you thought to send such a wonderful package, much applause to you and the things you do for all humans and K-9's.  – Nancy C.


One of the working dogs in Abu Dhabi opening his care package from Dog Krazy.


Why do I support Nancy?  My mom asked me why I don’t go to other pet supply stores and my answer was simple.  Last Christmas, when I was checking out at Dog Krazy, one of the employees handed me a treat bag with a dog cookie and a human cookie.  Nancy immediately grabbed the dog cookie and said, “no, Phoebe is allergic to rice.”  Nancy knows what my dog is allergic to.  Even my vet doesn’t remember what my dog is allergic to.  – Karen P.

We have found a spot that will suit our needs but it needs a lot of work!  We have a good portion of the costs to get this going but we need your help to make it unbelievable!  We are estimating the costs to be approximately $75000 to get this dream off the ground.  The space has walls but we are going to have to knock a few of them out and rebuild as the location was formerly a restaurant.  Here’s a small list of our needs…

  • Knock down walls

  • New flooring

  • Build new walls

  • Build suites for foster dogs to spend time in

  • Build walk in tub for older dogs and the dogs that have a lot more to love

  • Paint

  • New electrical

  • Shelving

  • Plumbing

  • Removing kitchen equipment from former restaurant including the hood which will require fixing the roof of the building.

  • Sound proofing so our neighbors aren’t bothered

  • New check out desk

  • Grooming tables

  • Bathtubs

  • Fixtures

  • Signage

  • Artwork which will only include canvases of dogs that are in need of homes.  This is what will decorate the entire store.

  • Licensing, permits, and all the other odds and ends.

In addition to running Dog Krazy, we also run a charity called The Fredericksburg Pet PanTree.  It is named after our German Shepherd, Triana AKA Tree.  Tree passed away in 2014 and we wanted to do something in her honor.  We recently became a 501C3 and we are here to help those that have fallen on hard times. The Fredericksburg SPCA blessed us by choosing us as her family and for 13 years she gave us so much love, protection and loyalty. Honoring her by helping those that have fallen on hard times is our goal. 

Opening a business is not for the faint of heart. Luckily, my heart is ready for round 2 and my doctor said my heart is fine!  Trust me, I had it checked!  Please help us make this dream a reality.  The dogs in foster care will thank you!  Who knows, we may introduce you to your next furry family member!
