was worried about how scared the poor little girl would be.  So I posted on the Spotsylvania Animal
Shelter's Facebook page that I was coming in to foster Lucy the next day.  As soon as Nancy, Owner of Dog Krazy, found
out about this she instantly stepped in and donated food for Lucy.  This little old lady was only going to eat
the best, care of Nancy!  Old Dominion
Humane Society also stepped in and brought Lucy into their Foster program so I
didn't have to worry about the shelter asking me to return Lucy.  Lucy was a sweet little girl.  Due to her age she was hard of hearing, her
vision wasn't great and she was arthritic in her legs.  If she was cranky around kids it was because
she wasn't being treated with the respect a woman of her age deserved.  She quickly stole the hearts of my husband
and myself.  Lucy would follow me
anywhere.  We would have adopted her if
it wasn't for the fact that she and my alpha didn't get along.  Unfortunately they had a couple of run
ins.  Until the perfect home came along,
Lucy would have a home with us.  In
April, I took Lucy for a senior check-up at my vet.  Other than a slight heart murmur, her blood
work and vitals were good.  For a 13 yo
Lucy was doing great!  3 short weeks later
she did not eat her dinner.  It was a
really hot day so I just chalked it up to the heat.  Next day wasn't any better.  She wasn't eating much and what she did drink
or eat she was now throwing up.  We made
the decision to take her to the vet and scheduled an appointment for the next
day.  At the vet she had a temp of over
103, she was dehydrated, and her blood work came back all out of whack.  We reluctantly left her at the vet hoping
that antibiotics and fluids would make her feel better.  Unfortunately, Lucy went downhill quickly
once at the vet.  We decided to take her
to an emergency vet so she could get 24 hour care.  Poor girl continued to deteriorate.  No one knew what was going on.  All the test were not giving us any
answers.  Little Lucy's vet bills were
adding up fast.  Every time we visited
our poor girl she looked worse.
Without prompting,
Nancy again stepped in to help!  She
donated her profits for the day from Dog Krazy to go towards Lucy's care.  She also spoke with a fellow local store
owner, Foode, and they donated funds for Lucy. 
Unfortunately, despite all our best efforts, little Lucy didn't make
it.  Through this sad time, Nancy's
incredible generosity and love for my little Foster girl, and all animals in
need, made the loss a little easier to overcome.  I can never thank Nancy enough for her all
she has done for Lucy.  Nancy even
donated cat food when we had a stray kitten come hang out around our
house.  To have a place like Dog Krazy, where
the owners are truly dog crazy, who truly care about your furry family members,
and who would only sell what they trust to give to their own furry family
members and who also want to give back to their community is a blessing.  – Kristy S.

Two months ago our 11
year old Yorkie got sick and that's when I decided to reach out to Nancy. Without
knowing who I was, Nancy took the time to message me back and answered all my
questions. Two weeks after we found out that he had CHF. Since then, Nancy has
been helping us along the way.  We
couldn't have done it without her help. We have learned so much about this
condition and how to help our little baby thanks to her and we will be always
grateful for that.  Vivi M.
Dog Krazy is
amazing.  Years ago I walked into the
original location not looking for anything and fell in love with the store and
the owner.  Never had I met a woman so
passionate about what she does and so passionate about her dogs.  Over the years I continued going to Dog
Krazy. I always bought my dogs necklaces (collars) there, and bought their toys
and they would get special treats from Mrs. Nancy each time we went.  Over the years Nancy befriended my Dachshund
Booker.  Booker was a total jerk...to everyone
but me and everyone but Mrs. Nancy. 
Booker adored that woman.  Nancy
knew Booker for the 6 years I had him before he passed away from cancer almost
a year ago.  Booker even made a special
trip to Dog Krazy to say goodbye to Mrs. Nancy. 
And Nancy, as she would with anyone’s dog, spent over an hour on the
floor with him, petting him and loving on him and giving him every bit of food
he would take.  I ended up adopting
another dog after Booker passed away and Nancy picked his food, his necklace
came from Dog Krazy, his toys came from Dog Krazy and the staff members and
Nancy remember his name even when they don't know mine.  Last year I had been laid off and couldn't
afford much and it was to be my new dog Finn's first Christmas.  Dog Krazy sent a bag full of toys and treats
and gifts for Finn.  Inside that bag was
a card, the card was from Booker.  Booker
said that he asked Mrs. Nancy to take care of his new brother at Christmas and
make it easier on me.  A business owner
doesn't need to do what Nancy does. 
Nancy doesn't have to be involved in the community or with local rescues
or with helping pup parents through their grief.  Most business owners are not friends with all
of their clients.  Nancy is.  She knows all of them, loves most of them,
but adores all of their dogs. And she will be the first one to offer up help
for your dog.  I wouldn't have it any
other way.  A business owner, friend, a
shoulder to cry on, a Santa Claus, a professional and an amazing woman own that
shop because Nancy is all of those things. 
My life, and my dog’s lives wouldn't be the same without her. – Kelley M.
We adopted Baxter
three years ago when he was about three years old. He came to us shaking his
head all the time. We took him to the vet and they looked for mites and yeast
and an ear infection. They found some yeast and gave us some medicine and said
not to worry about it. Baxter kept having the problem although it got a little
better when we put him on grain-free food. His ears were still chronically red
and sensitive. Around this time we moved to Stafford, VA with the Navy. We
stumbled upon Dog Krazy when we were walking around. Lucky for us Nancy was
there and she talked to us about Baxter's condition. Nancy recommended we go
potato-free, which we hadn't done yet and at least four vets hadn't
recommended. It has changed his life. Baxter's ears have cleared up and he
never shakes his head anymore. I've stopped having to use his ear cleaning
medicine completely. We are beyond grateful and happy. My dogs' health means
the world to me (they are my children). I would do anything to make them happy
and feel great. I know that Nancy and Dog Krazy feel the same way and they have
made a loyal and grateful customer out of me forever!!  Kristin S.
Ever since meeting
Nancy about 5 years ago there has NEVER been a time where she hasn't helped our
family. Every time we go into her store she makes my family and our dog feel
like we are family. Nancy allows me to call/text her personal cell phone with
any questions I have about my dog. Nancy and her store is the only pet store we
ever shop at and ever will. She's honest, loyal, friendly, and just simply the
best!! We love her and so does our dog Cody. We can simply say, "Cody
wanna go see Nancy?" And his ears perk up and he runs to the door! Thank
you for all you do for us, and the community!! – Elizabeth C
Nancy what can I say
about this Woman, last year I was down and out and I thought I would never be
where I was, I did not have job, I exhausted all I had, and I was facing being
evicted, but worse for me was the fact that i could not feed my best friend
Bandit, I walked in and asked her if there was somewhere I could go to get dog
food for free for Bandit, she asked me if it was for me.  I replied with a yes. There was no hesitation,
she said let me see what I could do.  It
was not my proudest moment, but I had to take care of Bandit, and I knew she
would understand, she came out with a bag full of food and treats that got me
over the hump.  I found an angel is all I
could think of.  I prayed that someone
could help me and she did and on top of that she gave me a ton of information
that would help me get past this time of hardship.  God makes angels and she truly is one, I
would never purchase food from anyone but her, because loyalty is everything to
me, she won my heart with kindness she cares about everyone and everything. Her pets are family just as mine is to
me.  I am indebted for life for her
saving me from the depression and place I was in.  Thank you, I believe in your cause and I will
help when I get back on my feet. Secondly, this woman sent to our K9 soldiers
here in UAE a care package that saved our four legged friends, the cooling vests,
toys, and treats were so well received and our solider were so honored and
grateful that you thought to send such a wonderful package, much applause to
you and the things you do for all humans and K-9's.  – Nancy C.



One of the working dogs in Abu Dhabi opening his care package from Dog Krazy.

Why do I support
Nancy?  My mom asked me why I don’t go to
other pet supply stores and my answer was simple.  Last Christmas, when I was checking out at
Dog Krazy, one of the employees handed me a treat bag with a dog cookie and a
human cookie.  Nancy immediately grabbed
the dog cookie and said, “no, Phoebe is allergic to rice.”  Nancy knows what my dog is allergic to.  Even my vet doesn’t remember what my dog is
allergic to.  – Karen P.
We have found a spot that will suit our needs but it needs a
lot of work!  We have a good portion of
the costs to get this going but we need your help to make it unbelievable!  We are estimating the costs to be
approximately $75000 to get this dream off the ground.  The space has walls but we are going to have
to knock a few of them out and rebuild as the location was formerly a
restaurant.  Here’s a small list of our
needs…

Knock down walls
New flooring
Build new walls
Build suites for foster dogs to spend time in
Build walk in tub for older dogs and the dogs
that have a lot more to love
Paint
New electrical
Shelving
Plumbing
Removing kitchen equipment from former
restaurant including the hood which will require fixing the roof of the building.
Sound proofing so our neighbors aren’t bothered
New check out desk
Grooming tables
Bathtubs
Fixtures
Signage
Artwork which will only include canvases of dogs
that are in need of homes.  This is what
will decorate the entire store.
Licensing, permits, and all the other odds and
ends.

In addition to running Dog Krazy, we also run a charity called
The Fredericksburg Pet PanTree.  It is
named after our German Shepherd, Triana AKA Tree.  Tree passed away in 2014 and we wanted to do
something in her honor.  We recently
became a 501C3 and we are here to help those that have fallen on hard times. The
Fredericksburg SPCA blessed us by choosing us as her family and for 13 years
she gave us so much love, protection and loyalty. Honoring her by helping those
that have fallen on hard times is our goal. 



Opening a business is not for the faint of heart. Luckily,
my heart is ready for round 2 and my doctor said my heart is fine!  Trust me, I had it checked!  Please help us make this dream a
reality.  The dogs in foster care will
thank you!  Who knows, we may introduce
you to your next furry family member!

story:
Hi, I'm Dave!

I'm a school teacher in Karvachar, a small town heavily destroyed by war. For me it's very important to make this place better for youth, to create place where they can spend their free time with benefits for themselves. And also - that will be the place where people can read and discuss their favorite books.


I'm planning to buy a 8x8 (64) sq. meters site for construction and start the work on the basement with my own. I need your help for the future construction which involves money on construction materials, payment of workers, furniture and books.

The main idea of this cafe is to make young people read more and also create a place for them to discuss books.

This place will combine cafe and bookstore. People will be able to buy books and stationery. There will be a book bank for people who can't afford new books. I plan to organize book discussions periodically and make bonuses for most active readers.
If not reach the goal I'll invest all money in the project and try to collect more money by fundraising.
This cafe will help local people to love their town more, it will be a place where people will contact with art and different cultures which will help them to understand different people and discover new things.
People and officials are very friendly here and it will be easy to get over obstacles.
And also that will be very nice to share this project to make more people know about it.

story:
Urbanvisible

  • Who Am I?

    My name is Matthew Goslar.  I was born in South Bend, Indiana, but spent most of my life in Phoenix, Arizona.  I'm 27 years old and a recent graduate of Arizona State University with a major in Sociology.  Seven years ago, I attempted to move to Seattle during the housing collapse and had a hard time finding work let alone a career. I have years of experience working with foster children through respite and habilitation, as well as a passion for working with kids.  Why was I being given sideways glances and turned away from jobs at schools when I knew I was perfect for the positions?  After applying and being turned down by numerous jobs (schools, fast food, retail, office, etc) a potential employer finally admitted that they turned me away because I had holes in my ears (even though I wasn't wearing plugs) and a small, innocuous tattoo on my wrist.  I searched the internet for suggestions for places that hire those with visible modifications and, aside from a few obvious answers, there were no resources available to help me. That is the moment the dream was born.
  • What is Urbanvisible?
    Urbanvisible is a company that advocates for and supports companies that hire individuals with visible modifications, but we need to create a website that can help do that nationwide.  Urbanvisible.com will be a review site similar to many others on the web that helps rate and review businesses based on their products, services, and customer service but is exclusive to those businesses that are open-minded and diverse.  
    - For a small monthly fee, businesses will be able to control their own profile with galleries, menus, contact information, applications, and unlike other review sites, they will have control over which reviews actually inform potential customers about their product.  
    - By supporting businesses that have fair hiring practices, we as a community can show that it IS important and that you don't need to fear losing business if you don't have the traditional "professional" appearance.  By ditching stereotypes and creating equality we actually shift importance to the products and services sold rather than the physical appearance of employees.

  • Why is this important?
    For Individuals:
    - It provides a place that you can look for work without fear of being judged because of who you are.
    - The power is put into your hands.  We had originally brainstormed starting as a non-profit, trying to change legislature so that companies were forced to hire regardless of modifications, but allowing businesses to make their own choice is very powerful.  We make the choice to get modifications and we have the ability to be positive examples of the community and show others that people are people regardless of physical appearance and tattoos or piercings.  

    For Businesses:
    - This is a completely new avenue to advertise your business.  You already get business for the products and services you provide, but Urbanvisible opens a completely new way for you to gain new customers while simultaneously promoting a great cause.
    - Functionality will be similar to existing review sites (ie. Yelp, Urbanspoon, Google Reviews), but with more control,  more options, and less hassle for  advertising payment. Be in control of which reviews actually help describe your business rather than being at the whim of customers that may have been looking to complain about something before they even came in.
    - Some people have asked "why should places like tattoo shops use this service if they obviously hire modified individuals?".  The answer to this is simple.  A majority of the site's users are interested in tattoo and piercing acceptance in the workplace.  This means that it is the perfect place to showcase the quality of your work as a tattoo artist, piercer, or hairstylist because urbanvisible users are probably already interested in those services. There will even be a separate section for artists, piercers, and stylists.

Goals and Perks

  • The goal is simple.  To complete urbanvisible.com it will take over 500 hours of work costing over $25,000 (not including server space, maintenance, or employee payment). We are passionate about this project and personally affected by discrimination. 
  • We're taking a bit of a risk by only offering two perks with this campaign.  You can donate however much you'd like, but the only perks cost $1 and $100.  
    -A $1 donation can be considered a vote.  Imagine how many businesses would sign up if they knew 25,000 people were interested in supporting diverse businesses even before the site is launched.
    - A $100 donation is for a business that wants to get in on the ground floor.  With a year subscription to urbanvisible, you can be at the forefront of equality and changing hiring practices nationwide.
    - The relationship between the perks is a symbiotic one.  The more people that donate $1 to signify their support, the more businesses will pledge $100 for a subscription, therefor giving more people reason to use the website and creating a diverse and equal community.
  • Our team has supporters that have already confirmed they will donate programming time if necessary.  If we do not reach our goal with this campaign alone, they will start building the backbone of the website and the money we do raise will go toward front-end design. The money will still go to the same place; making sure our dream (www.urbanvisible.com) becomes a reality.  

How This Relates To Everyone

  • This project is important to everyone.  Even if you have the job you want, it is important to help others in their career search.  Almost everyone has a friend, sibling, child, neighbor, or co-worker that has talent, work ethic, and charisma, but may be held down by their love for modifications.
  • We look up to entertainers such as musicians, actors, artists, and athletes that have tattoos.  Just because our talents may not lie in a creative field doesn't mean that we need to give up our love for creativity and body art.
  • I often come across people saying that having tattoos and piercings is "your choice".  It is my choice, but how is it different than anything else?  Since I was a child I always loved and admired well done tattoos and thoughtfully placed piercings.  I didn't have a specific role model with them, but always imagined how I would look once my body was adorned.  Every time I get a new piece of art on my body I come closer to my personal ideal image and am able to share beautiful art with people around me.  How is this different than someone losing weight, getting a new haircut, or changing their style? It isn't. All of these things serve to make ourselves feel good, attractive, and most of all, confident.  When I go into a job interview with my piercings out and tattoos covered I feel naked.  I feel like I'm playing someone else's role.  I'm a confident, intelligent, educated, and well-meaning person, but not being able to be myself during a job interview makes me feel like someone other than myself.
  • Tattoos, piercings, alternative hairstyles, and other modifications also help to bring people together.  It doesn't matter what race, ethnicity, sex, gender, religion, or belief system you have.  We can all bond over modifications. 
  • I personally am an avid and competitive Magic: the Gathering player.  Our community has shown strength in diversity by holding tournaments around the world with competitors of all different backgrounds and cultures.  Once you step into the room you are all there sharing an experience no matter who or what you represent.  While I'm playing in a tournament I am free to be me without worry of being judged because of my modifications.  There are plenty of other people with them and even more without, but it doesn't seem to matter.  The winner wins because they earned victory, not because of how they looked on their way there.  This is a personal call to the MTG community to rally behind an ideal that we share like we have many times before.

Interviews

  • Throughout the campaign we will be doing interviews with individuals from a variety of backgrounds to really exemplify the fact that we are all very different and unique, but also share a bond with modifications.  Check back regularly for updates.

                                                            Read Dennis' Interview Here!

             


                                
                                       Read the interview here!

Risks & Challenges

  • $25,000 is a lot of money, but a small price to pay for such a big idea.  
  • There is little-to-no risk for contributors.  $1 is a small amount and $100/yr is less than the vast majority of advertising/marketing routes.
  • One challenge is showing businesses that it is worth their while to openly hire individuals with visible modifications.  That is solved by us as people.  We are examples of a large community, so act in a way that lifts us all up.  Give $1 and cast your vote, show companies that it does matter.
  • Another challenge is getting enough businesses on the site to make urbanvisible.com useful.  That challenge is also solved by us as a community.  If you work somewhere that already hires modified individuals, then show the manager/owner this campaign.  Convince them that they can gain business by being open about their fair hiring practices and forward-thinking.  If enough people support the idea, some companies may even start hiring people with tattoos and piercings when they previously didn't because they realize there is room for growth by being open and equal.

Other Ways You Can Help!

  • We've made the perk for individuals $1 for a reason.  Urbanvisible's goal is to help people find jobs, so we wanted to avoid expensive perks and show businesses that being diverse matters.
  • Even if you can't give a single dollar, we understand.  Share the project with loved ones, friends, co-workers, business owners, and anyone you know that could get behind the idea or even those you think might be against it.
  • If you're active in the gaming community, help us fill whatever remaining money we're missing with Cards for a Cause! Even if you don't have money, we're taking donations of "buylistable" Magic: the Gathering cards (watch the video below for details).
  • If you're interested in helping w/ cards for a cause, send me an e-mail to mdgoslar@urbanvisible.com for shipping details, MTGO username, or any questions you might have.
  • Special thanks to:
    -Catherine Reason (video), Lance Robinson(sound), Dean Thomas (location), Cherisse Teeple, Jordan Henry, Suzy Lippmann, Natalie Newmeyer, Michael Blunden, Dennis Gable, Drea Orozco, Jon Del Toro, Daniel Ashworth, Kirk Gomez, RK Post, Feryn Suicide, Lauren Henderson, Mollie Stewart, Jordan Finn, and many others for the encouragement, help, conversations, and motivation to keep following my dreams and helping others do the same.

Throughout the campaign we will be doing interviews with individuals from a variety of backgrounds to really exemplify the fact that we are all very different and unique, but also share a bond with modifications.  Check back regularly for updates.                                                        Read Dennis' Interview Here!





             
                                                                        Read the interview here!


   Risks & Challenges  $25,000 is a lot of money, but a small price to pay for such a big idea.   There is little-to-no risk for contributors.  $1 is a small amount and $100/yr is less than the vast majority of advertising/marketing routes.
One challenge is showing businesses that it is worth their while to openly hire individuals with visible modifications.  That is solved by us as people.  We are examples of a large community, so act in a way that lifts us all up.  Give $1 and cast your vote, show companies that it does matter.
Another challenge is getting enough businesses on the site to make urbanvisible.com useful.  That challenge is also solved by us as a community.  If you work somewhere that already hires modified individuals, then show the manager/owner this campaign.  Convince them that they can gain business by being open about their fair hiring practices and forward-thinking.  If enough people support the idea, some companies may even start hiring people with tattoos and piercings when they previously didn't because they realize there is room for growth by being open and equal.    Other Ways You Can Help!  We've made the perk for individuals $1 for a reason.  Urbanvisible's goal is to help people find jobs, so we wanted to avoid expensive perks and show businesses that being diverse matters.
Even if you can't give a single dollar, we understand.  Share the project with loved ones, friends, co-workers, business owners, and anyone you know that could get behind the idea or even those you think might be against it. If you're active in the gaming community, help us fill whatever remaining money we're missing with Cards for a Cause! Even if you don't have money, we're taking donations of "buylistable" Magic: the Gathering cards (watch the video below for details).

If you're interested in helping w/ cards for a cause, send me an e-mail to mdgoslar@urbanvisible.com for shipping details, MTGO username, or any questions you might have.
Special thanks to:-Catherine Reason (video), Lance Robinson(sound), Dean Thomas (location), Cherisse Teeple, Jordan Henry, Suzy Lippmann, Natalie Newmeyer, Michael Blunden, Dennis Gable, Drea Orozco, Jon Del Toro, Daniel Ashworth, Kirk Gomez, RK Post, Feryn Suicide, Lauren Henderson, Mollie Stewart, Jordan Finn, and many others for the encouragement, help, conversations, and motivation to keep following my dreams and helping others do the same.

story:
Hybrid Air Conditioning

 

Hybrid Air Conditioning is the integration of advanced solar thermal technology and conventional HVAC equipment to achieve the same cooling effect, yet reducing energy usage.

story:
The Alder Room & Alder Food Security Society

The Alder Room and The Alder Food Security Society are the brainchildren of Ben Staley and Carley-Jane Stanton. We are two young people in Edmonton, Alberta with a passion for modern food and regionally-sourced ingredients and a vision for food security and food justice for all in our city.

Edmonton has a growing and vibrant food community, and we aim to introduce a new dining concept and an inclusive, transparent restaurant to our city. We believe it is our mandate to create a gathering place where diners can experience world-class cuisine and members of the community at large can connect and benefit from our local food system, regardless of their income or social status. With your support, we will bring The Alder Room, a modern fine-dining restaurant with an interactive and relaxed atmosphere and The Alder Food Security Society, a non-profit organization aiming to include every Edmontonian in our vibrant local food system to Edmonton.

The Alder Room

The Alder Room will be a small, 18-seat fine-dining restaurant in Edmonton, Alberta which will provide an interactive, educational experience for dining guests and members of the community. 

The Alder Room, led by Chef Ben Staley, will serve modern Canadian cuisine with a heavy emphasis on seasonality and regional ingredients, from vegetables to fruits, meats, and herbs. 

  • Our menu will be constantly rotating with the seasons, featuring fresh greens and blossoms in the springtime to cured meats and preserves in the winter. 
  • It is our goal to share our passion for our local food system with every guest and tell a story of our region and the season with every meal.
Guests in the full-service dining room will be offered three tasting menu options of six, nine, or twelve courses to be served directly by the chefs from a centrally-located kitchen. Guests will have the opportunity to ask the chefs questions about sourcing, preparation and inspiration throughout their entire meal, creating a lighthearted, communal atmosphere. All three menus will start with our "snack program", which features a selection of one-to-two bite “courses” to begin the experience and welcome our guests to The Alder Room. We will offer a dominantly Canadian wine list, along with innovative wine and alcohol pairings.

        

        

After their meal, our guests will enjoy our custom roasted coffee, custom crafted beers, high end spirits and a selection of well tailored cocktails ranging from classics to our our own creations in the 20-seat lounge. Our lounge will be a place to sit back, relax and enjoy a good drink with good company. For those who visit the lounge without the intention of joining us in the dining room, our snack menu will be available. The snack menu will comprise of the snack program offered with every tasting menu so guests can enjoy a taste of our modern Canadian cuisine and a fresh "take" on lounge food.

The design of dining room will be minimalist and without distraction so you may be fully engaged in the meal and your company. Showcasing an alder wood bar top, stone and reclaimed fur to welcome our guests, The Alder Room will be a place to meet, learn about local food and enjoy the fantastic produce our region has to offer.

The Alder Food Security Society

    

The Alder Food Security Society is the non-profit affiliate of the The Alder Room. We have the vision of an Edmonton where local food and our vibrant food community is available to everyone, regardless of income, age or class. 

The main goal of the Alder Food Security Society is to give low income families, seniors and marginalized groups access to the vibrant community associated with our local food system. Not only will creating opportunities for local producers and restaurants to reach out to these individuals reduce the instances of food insecurity in our city, but shopping at farmers' markets, visiting local restaurants and attending classes taught by local chefs is a wonderful experience that has fostered community connections for many Edmontonians. The cost of these experiences, however, is out of reach for the members of our city who could benefit from this wonderful community the most.

It is our goal to reduce this inequality in Edmonton through our programs and a four-tiered approach we believe will address the multifaceted and layered nature of food insecurity in our city. All programs implemented by The Alder Food Security Society will fall under one or more of the following core objectives:

  • Food Education For All: We aim to help all Edmontonians learn about the work being done in our food community, define food insecurity, determine the core areas for improvement, and learn about approaches from around the world to help our food system become more equitable and vibrant.
  • Addressing Immediate Food Insecurity: The Alder Food Security Society will assist food-insecure families directly during times of need with products from our local food system. We will also support the work of already-existing food charities to enhance their reach and raise funds for their invaluable programs.
  • Capacity Building for Long-Term Food Security: We believe all families should be able to afford and prepare healthy, local food at all times. By providing food education and connecting families to the food community, we believe these families will be able to make changes to reduce their food insecurity in their own lives, on their own terms.
  • Advocating for Systemic Change: We want to drive real legislative change in our city and province and help create an atmosphere where food insecurity is systemically addressed and the reliance on immediate food charity is deemed unacceptable by our government.

We are planning to introduce three community outreach programs to foster community connections, reward the good work being done by those working in poverty reduction, make farmers' market shopping more affordable and approachable for all Edmontonians, and give low-income youths the opportunity to learn from some of the best chefs in the city. The programs will include:

  • Monthly Food Chats, where the community at large will be invited to listen to farmers, chefs, researchers and other members of the community as they discuss their work and provide meaningful information about our food system.
  • Bi-Annual Community Dinners hosted by the Alder Room for hard-working volunteers and deserving individuals in the city in order to give them our thanks for their wonderful work and foster meaningful connections between the movers and shakers in our city.
  •  A Youth Job Shadow Program, where youths interested in local food and the culinary arts will have the opportunity to work with some of the best chefs in the city and gain valuable work experience, and 
  • A Farmers' Market Subsidy and Community Kitchen Initiative, where low-income individuals will be given subsidized "market bucks" to be used at farmers' markets in Edmonton and connected with others in their community via "Kitchen Collectives". These Kitchen Collectives will be toured through the farmers' market by one of our volunteers and will learn how to find high-quality produce at lower prices at market, use group purchases to reduce food costs, and start conversations with local producers. They will prepare a simple meal together in The Alder Room kitchen, learning cooking techniques from our chefs and other members of the group, and each take home a portion of the meal to their families. It is our goal to facilitate the continuation of Kitchen Collectives beyond market day and help families make connections within the community in order to reduce food costs and prep times in the long-term.

The Alder Room will be the primary source of funds for the Alder Food Security Society, though we plan to accept donations and grants from the community as well in order to "delink" the reach of the program with the revenues of the restaurant.

What We Need

Due to the nature of the heritage building where The Alder Room will be located, the total funds required to open The Alder Room, from construction of the kitchen and installing ventilation systems to stocking the kitchen and bar and developing our menu, is $500,000. Our initial fundraising goal of $100,000 will allow us to:

  • Begin consultation and construction of The Alder Room, including building the kitchen and lounge and installing that pricey ventilation system!
  • Pay staff to begin research and development for the opening menu, including spending time foraging and networking with local producers.
  • Gain leverage to approach investors and lending institutions to fulfull our remaining financial needs, and
  • Allow the Alder Food Security Society to launch its programs, focusing initially on community consultation and education to help Edmontonians define food insecurity and give us feedback to tailor our programs to suit their needs.
If we exceed our goal, these funds will be used to continue to pay staff for menu development, stock the kitchen with equipment and smallwares, and open our doors! Every dollar donated will bring us closer to opening our doors and launching our programs.

Our Mandate

We understand that funds donated from our community is a gift, and we value the opportunity you are giving us as young people to reach our goals and make a difference in our food system. It is our mandate to return this gift back to our community and support others in improving Edmonton's food system. As such,

  • 15% of the proceeds of this campaign will be dedicated to launching the Alder Food Security Society, and The Alder Room will commit to donating the value of the remaining campaign funds to the Alder Food Security Society within five years.
We want to make your contribution not only a gift to two young Edmontonians, but an investment in the long-term vibrancy, growth and inclusiveness of the Edmonton food system.

Your Perks

As a thank you to our community for your support, we are offering a variety of perks to express our gratitude and make your donation even more worthwhile. We've chosen to name our perks after native species in Alberta to reflect the fact that every supporter, from small to large, is an important part of our larger "ecosystem" that is Edmonton's food system.

It's our goal to create an Alder Community with our perks and include you, our supporters, in the story of the opening of The Alder Room. From including supporters' names on a giant art piece at our front door, to offering one-of-a-kind educational experiences to let you see firsthand the work that goes into service at The Alder Room, we want to make our perks reflect the values of The Alder Room and The Alder Food Security Society at every level of support.

Every perk is related to food education, the journey of opening the restaurant, or shopping for local food in some way. We hope you enjoy the journey with us!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand there are many Edmontonians who are passionate about local food and food justice but are not in the financial position to donate funds. You can still be part of our project and help us reach our goals!

  • Please share our Indiegogo campaign on your social networks including Twitter and Facebook to help us reach a wider audience to raise funds.
  • Donate your time to the Community Outreach programs offered by The Alder Food Security Society, please contact aldersociety@gmail.com. We would love you have you on our invaluable volunteer team!

We would like to thank Jeff Quirk, Debra Krause, Dennis Lenarduzzi Kevin Kossowan, Scott McKeen, Brayden Kozak, Kathryn Joel and local band Nature Of for helping us with our campaign video. And thank you to Edmonton for your support! We look forward to sharing our passion for regional food with our community.

story:
Why ThermalTag?

The Challenge: Each year, countless dogs die needlessly in overheated vehicles. The problem is escalating in this increasingly mobile society.

The Need: We frequently have to, or want to, bring our dogs in the car with us. They are great companions on road trips. However, there are many places we go that our pets are not allowed: stores, banks and the like. We are faced with the dilemma of needing to leave them behind when we step away from the vehicle. While cracking the windows may increase airflow, it does nothing to prevent heat or cold build up in the car.

The Solution: We invented ThermalTag, a system which applies clever technology to provide safety and security for dogs, while allowing owners and their dogs the freedom to go anywhere, anytime, together.

The Facts

Dog Physiology: Dogs have a higher body temperature than their owners, they do not do well in the heat.  Their bodies cannot expel heat they way ours do --they don't sweat!

Motor Vehicles: Our motor vehicles are small enclosed places.  They heat up rapidly.  On a relatively mild day (60-70°F), the temperature can get over 100°F in just 15 minutes.  Your pleasure vehicle becomes an oven.  At higher temperatures, 120°F and above can be reached.  Cracking the windows for ventilation does little to help.

The ThermalTag Answer

Simply put, we designed ThermalTag to save dogs' lives. ThermalTag does two things: 

  • Temperature monitoring system: Protect your dog from the deadly effects of heat and cold, particularly when left in a vehicle.  ThermalTag continuously monitors the temperature around your dog. As the temperature rises, ThermalTag sends you alerts, so you always know.

  • Each time you start ThermalTag, you drop a "pin" at the vehicle location. Through your smartphone's mapping system, you are guided back to your car, saving critical time in an emergency.

ThermalTag is a system which consists of two patent-pending parts: THE UNIT and THE APP. 

THE UNIT

A small, durable, water resistant container that works for dogs of virtually all breeds and sizes. It measures less than 2" X 2" and weighs 2 ounces. Using the attached stainless steel "O" ring, ThermalTag can be attached to any collar or harness design. Because of its compact size, it can be worn by almost any breed.

Each ThermalTag comes with a replaceable battery, which typically provides up to 6 months of service. (Your app will give you battery updates and remind you when it is time to replace it.)

ThermalTag is proudly Made in the USA, where production is made under strictly supervised conditions, with every unit inspected and certified to our demanding standards. 

THE APP (including a big technological breakthrough!)

  • Simple and intuitive, it's an easy-to-use app with distinctive icons that keeps you in two-way touch with your pet. 

  • You can customize the APP performance by specifying your vehicle and the breed of dog you have (YES both matter!)

  • The app supports iOS and Android smartphones

  • The Big Breakthrough: We go beyond BlueTooth! The app is Bluetooth (BLE) enabled, but through our patent-pending technology, we have enabled the unit to work far beyond BLE range. ThermalTag allows you freedom to venture beyond normal BLE range and enter buildings without losing connection. Rather than be limited to hundreds of feet with Bluetooth, ThermalTag works at any distance! 

The Funds

To this point, we have been entirely self-funded. Now, we need your enthusiastic support to go into full manufacturing mode. We’re reaching out to you, Indiegogo supporters, because you’ve shown a strong affinity for new ideas, innovative technology AND the world of pets.

Your Support Will . . .

Allow us to translate all our plans into production mode. We need funds for production tooling on all the plastic components.

Once complete, we will swing into the production and final assembly mode and being to fill our Indiegogo orders. 

The Impact

According to the American Pet Products Association (APPA): 

  • There are 78 million dogs residing in more than 46 million US households.

  • Nearly 6 in 10 people say they have driven with their dog in a vehicle at least once a month in the past year. ​

  • Every year, hundreds of dogs die in parked vehicles from heat exhaustion. A vehicle can quickly reach a temperature that puts a dog at risk of serious illness and death, even on a day that doesn't seem hot.

We humans are the stewards of our dogs' health and safety. Wherever we go, we want to protect them. ThermalTag allows us to stay connected to our dogs and ensures their precious lives are not at risk if they come along in the car.*

*Please check your local and state laws and regulations before bringing your pet in your vehicle.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support ThermalTag with an order today, please help us by spreading the word! Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest, and share ThermalTag news with your friends, family, coworkers and colleagues! Thanks!

We need funds for production tooling on all the plastic components.Once complete, we will swing into the production and final assembly mode and being to fill our Indiegogo orders. The ImpactAccording to the American Pet Products Association (APPA): 

There are 78 million dogs residing in more than 46 million US households.


Nearly 6 in 10 people say they have driven with their dog in a vehicle at least once a month in the past year. ​


Every year, hundreds of dogs die in parked vehicles from heat exhaustion. A vehicle can quickly reach a temperature that puts a dog at risk of serious illness and death, even on a day that doesn't seem hot.

We humans are the stewards of our dogs' health and safety. Wherever we go, we want to protect them. ThermalTag allows us to stay connected to our dogs and ensures their precious lives are not at risk if they come along in the car.**Please check your local and state laws and regulations before bringing your pet in your vehicle.  Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't support ThermalTag with an order today, please help us by spreading the word! Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest, and share ThermalTag news with your friends, family, coworkers and colleagues! Thanks!

story:
I have a love for making furniture, which driven by a love of Japanese craftsmanship resulted in my setting up a solo workshop in April 2014. This was done with the financial backing of another close individual for whom life has taken a difficult turn. As he was generously paying for the loan I took out to start the workshop I have been left with this extra money to find which is looking to be an impossible task; hence the large ask! 

I still have hope and determination that I can succeed and I am looking outside the walls of my workshop to find others who would like to see it happen too.

My own personal journey is just beginning; my journey to becoming a master of my craft. This is me in Japan at the beginning of my journey. I had left the Building Crafts College after my Fine Furniture course and had the chance to work in a Japanese workshop thanks to master craftsman Masaki Kondo. Looking out over the small town of Tanna, Shizuoka on my last day there I felt such calm and determination. I feel the same now. I will find a way through this no matter what, and I want to share this journey with other people who love what we crafts-persons do.

I have big ambitions for my workshop including starting an experience programme between the UK and Japan. Since the Kobe earthquake on which I did a school project, I have been touched by the sincerity of the Japanese people and the hardships they deal with in such a dignified way. This was no different in the most recent natural disaster and I want to find a way to contribute for the great experiences I was given by people in this great country.

With your help I can pay off the debt that threatens to close my business and concentrate on creating a create corner of craft across the North East of England and into Scotland. I'm excited for the future; of creating great wood craft and collaborating with other local artists in other crafts. To do this, I need your help!

Thank you so much for reading, and for watching my video. Please go on to view the rest of my campaign and I hope you feel you would like to contribute, or even claim a perk!

story:
Short Summary

The project "Casa da Ortigueira", born in the year 2012 for the realization of a forestry


activities for the production of wood chips, together with fruit and vegetable products

including blueberries, pears, apples, horticultural products in general etc., as well as

farm activity combined with that of a cultural association dedicated to the

dissemination of concepts of self-sustainability, ecology and human well-being.

The business will be based in the town of Ortigueira (La Coruna- Spain), in the Galicia region

on a total area of about 25000 sqm.

The activity is based on the production of electricity from renewable sources,

seasonal fruit and vegetable production with biological methodology, homebrewed

beer and divulging activities through courses and seminars held by us or by renting

part of the property to a third party.

The food and homebrewed beer will be sold both in the accommodation of the farm, both on-site in a small store, either via web.

The reference market with regard to the sale of electricity is that public-state and self use; concerning selling of agricultural products is local within 30-50 km from the property (company store), as tourism is  most of all international (renting rooms with breakfast all seasons except for january and february), pilgrims walking or cycling on the “Santiago route” and the WEB.


The Team

Roberto Torri is an italian geologist since 1996, working for geoenvironmental and geotechnical projects, he has lots of experience in groundwater research and geomorfology: Since 2005 he begans working geothermal energy projects and now he ahs a big experience in renewable energies (geothermal, photovoltaic, hydroelectric and biomas). He likes very much to work with vegetable garden.

Sandra Vazquez Perez is a spanish art restaurator since 1999, she is working since 2006, after many other important experiences at Centro Conservazione e Restauro La Venaria Reale (Italy) as responsible for modern and contemporary art conservation and restauration. She is the founder of a new application for museum art collection and temporary show management on mobile and fixed devices. She is the CREATIVE part of the team.


What We Need & What You Get

The total investment for the purchasing and improving of the entire project will be

approximately € 561.000 which will be fully committed in the first two years and with break-heaven-point in about 10-15 years.

Use of Funds:

Property purchaising: 450.000 € (we will have a mortgage for 60% of it)

Biomass plant: 66.000 €

Furnishing and equipments: 54.000 €

Starting and other expenses: 50.000 €

We need to raise € 200000 but if we won't raise that funds we mostly look for buying gasification plants and look for other european and regional funds for equipments.

If we will reach our goal we will offer al the perks you can see in this campaign.


The Impact

Our project is focused on energy savings and self production to reach a zero balance beetwen production and consuption to have a full green building and a confortable stay for our customers amd for us that want to obtain a more natural life style.

WE WILL KEEP FROM NATURE ONLY WHAT NATURE GIVES US AND WHAT WE NEED!!!!!

Risks & Challenges

We have built this projects on bad scenario with few work but ensuring zero cost for energy, we are sure that a right marketing plan, using social network web chances and being supported by consultant on it will be our risk minimisation: we will be at the top on it because it'l be our LIFE PROJECT!!!

1st year: expenses € 70500 -  income € 106920

2st year: expenses € 76900-  income € 133700

3st year: expenses € 76900 -  income € 137300

4st year: expenses € 80000-  income € 168100

5st year: expenses € 80500-  income € 180000

Expenses are considered mortgage and loans pyed every year.


Other Ways You Can Help

Anyone can help us on this project even with few money and with services, like marketing and any supply you mean to be usefull for us (agricultural equipments, furnishing, also top food from the world, etc.)

story:
Amazing technology...  

     Off-Grid Sustainable habitats... 
Breaking the cycle of poverty in the USA and abroad... 


WHAT DO WE DO?

We are Hope With Homes. We use passion and love combined with modern technology to uplift and sustain impoverished lives and devastated areas. 
Our portfolio of innovation creates a never-before-seen integration of cutting-edge technologies covering every aspect of a complete, sustainable, and resilient habitat. 
We provide manufacturing facilities for our technologies to create emergency homes, bathrooms, educational facilities, medical clinics, and horticulture houses in the United States, the developing world & in devastated areas, and then educate the local community to work in these new businesses, permanently uplifting their way of life and local economy.   
Our projects create sustainable jobs, provide safety for children, teach people new trades & skills, and kick-start economies in the communities we touch. 
Our vision is to do all of this on a global scale.

Click here to visit the Hope With Homes site

WHAT THIS MEANS FOR YOU:

     IMAGINE reducing your power bill by 80%...

                 IMAGINE what that money could do for your family... 

Our technology is not just for the poor, it is aimed to uplift ALL of our lives! 

While we are focused on getting these technologies to the people that need us, our technology partner is busy commercializing the technologies for the regular market! 

Not only will you have the satisfaction of knowing you made a difference in the world, but you will also get to experience the life changing technologies in your own home! 

Imagine owning an all-in-one Air Conditioner & Heater that cools and heats your entire home on less than 250 watts!!! 

What if instead of spending tens of thousands on a Photo Voltaic Solar Panel Array, you had a Solar-Thermal system that provided MORE energy than its PV equal, at a fraction of the cost? 

What if you could build an indoor Green House in your home and grow your own fruits, vegetables, and herbs on less energy than three 120-watt incandescent light bulbs? 

These are all of the technologies we are donating to the impoverished world, but they are intended to benefit everyone on the planet! 

CURRENTLY DEVELOPED TECHNOLOGIES:


OUR 1 BEDROOM TINY HOME PLAN:

SO WHY ARE WE DOING THIS FOR FREE? 

We live in an abundant world, yet we have set up a society that lives in scarcity... 

  • In the United States over 575,000 people are homeless.
  • Globally, 6 to 8 million people die annually from the consequences of disasters and water-related diseases.
  • According to the United Nations International Children’s Fund (UNICEF), 22,000 children around the world die EACH DAY due to poverty.
  • In South Africa alone, 9 children die each day from fire related incidents.
  • 1.1 billion people in developing countries have inadequate access to water, and 2.6 billion lack basic sanitation.
Man created these problems. It is up to man to solve them. It is as simple as that. 

We have the tools, experience, and technology to end these problems. But we need your help. 

Our campaign aims to kick off a global effort in solving these and many more of the catastrophic problems faced by people all over the world.


  COMPLETE TECHNOLOGIES OVERVIEW: 

At home we are already talking to potential investors and land owners to develop tiny home type developments for the homeless in Las Vegas!


Abroad we are currently focusing on the shack-dwelling impoverished communities of South Africa... where my story began. 



                               (A typical Township/Shanty Town in South Africa)


(In South Africa there are 50,000 shack fires per year)

(These fires consume everything in their wake and leave thousands homeless)

      (Early Childhood Center being manufactured at our South African facility)

          (Our first Early Childhood Development Center in Gugulethu, Cape Town)

Donating our technologies to these communities is not our only focus.

The products themselves serve as enablers for the creation of sustainable jobs in these communities.

We don’t just deploy products, we deploy full-forced manufacturing facilities within the communities that employ both skilled and unskilled labor and train the local people how to manufacture the technologies and build the structures.

The goal of our model is to kick-start the economy within these societies and show people that there is hope in the world by transferring new skills and teaching them how to keep their families fed and sheltered for life.


Our effort abroad in South Africa has already implemented bathroom facilities impacting over 500 residents in a shack-dwelling community and 2 Early Childhood Development Centers keeping over 300 children safe, fed, and educated.

Your donations will not only kick-start our USA projects, but also keep the effort going in South Africa, and ultimately impact the entire world as we deploy our projects into impoverished and devastated areas all over the globe.


WHAT WE NEED:

Hope With Homes is seeking to raise $1,000,000 to kick off our projects.

With patents, prototypes, and manufacturing already in place, now we need help to build the infrastructure of our company and the delivery of our projects beginning with South Africa.

Donations will help fund:

Immediate deployment of projects $300K in USA / $300K in SA:

  • Tiny Home Village for the homeless 
  • Bathrooms
  • Early Childhood Development Centers (ECDC)
  • Community Water Towers
  • Medical Clinics
  • Adult Educational Facilities
Operations and Research & Development 40%:
  • Further development of technology and prototypes.
  • Hiring of staff from Marketing & Events, to Engineering 
  • After this crowdfunding campaign, our goal is to have 100% of all on-line donations go directly to deployment of projects while donations from special events sustain our operations.

Even if we don’t hit our goal, your donations will go to great use! What is important is that we kick off projects here in America and continue the projects in South Africa until we get the funds we need for R&D and Operations. With an already established infrastructure out there, your donations will keep bathrooms, ECDC’s, and Clinics being built and delivered as we raise more funds.

THE IMPACT:

The impact of your donations will create jobs for our citizens, bring a higher standard of living for the homeless, and bring shelter to the poor around the world. 

A father to a new baby, I cannot imagine my daughter enduring the living conditions that I witnessed in South Africa (and that exist all over the world). Knowing that I have the ability to help other parents keep their children from this extreme suffering is enough fuel for me to ignite hope in their lives.

RISKS & CHALLENGES:

Internally, the biggest and virtually only challenge we face currently is lack of capital. Raising funds for non-profit organizations is both tedious and difficult. With so many other great organizations out there, we hope you can see how we stand out in not only our life-changing technologies, but the jobs and education we will create throughout the world.

Domestically we face extremely expensive certification processes for all of our technologies that create difficult hurdles for us that do not exist in other countries. 

Abroad we face cultural challenges in that not every society is the same, nor do they accept help as easily as we would think.

For example, in South Africa, we cannot just go into a shack-dwelling community and erect a bathroom block. We have to first consult with the elders of the community (who hold all of the respect and decision making in the community) and gain their acceptance of our help. Then they tell us where and when we can deploy our buildings. Without this permission, our buildings would be destroyed as soon as we erected them and our teams would be thrown out of the communities.

Our team consists of business professionals, engineers, and heads of foundations that already have experience within the communities we aim to uplift. With travel to over 140 countries around the world, members of our team have the vast experience and knowledge of the differences in these cultures that are key to the success of our project.

MY BACKGROUND

My name is Raul Klein and I am the founder of Hope With Homes. An entrepreneur for the past decade, I specialize in sustainable energy and cutting-edge green technology. Three years ago I moved to South Africa with a vision of bringing my patented building system to the people. When I got there it opened my eyes to the reality of what it means to be a shack-dweller in a community of impoverished people. It created a new life-mission for me to transcend these people to a standard of living that most of us take for granted. 

Over the past year I have put together a team of fellow entrepreneurs, inventors, and members of other Non-Profit Foundations sharing the same vision, to create the ultimate package of patented, cutting-edge, affordable technologies that enable us to create completely sustainable and resilient structures. 

(My wife and I after completing the first phase of the bathrooms in Kimberley)

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially to our mission.

Your help in spreading the word about our work and this campaign is equally important to us! Please share this on your Face Book, Twitter, and any other social media outlet you may be a member of as well as your most influential contacts!

Indiegogo offers some great share tools to help you help us spread the word! Please use them!

If you are looking to take a more hands-on approach, please feel free to contact us as we are always looking for volunteers to help with our behind the scenes efforts.

story:
Overview

  • Sister duo April and Joy have a sincere passion for helping others as well as caring for and educating youth. Together we have been in the education field for over 20 years and look forward to sharing our expertise with the families of Collier and Lee counties. 
  • Launching First Step has been years in the making. Through partnerships with various community organizations we have developed a thorough business plan that accounts for every aspect of successful child care operation.
  • By offering 24 hour child care, we will fill a void in the lives of parents who are in need of safe, quality child care outside of the traditional hours of 9-5. Our center will offer an academically focused program that parents can depend on to provide trustworthy child care services when they need it most.
  • Contributors to our campaign will help us bring quality, 24 hour child care to the families of Southwest Florida.


About Us

  • We have always had the sincere desire to change the lives of children through education. Children are our passion.
  • We are both Florida certified educators with degrees in education,
  • We have over 20 years experience in the field of education. These experiences include formal education and training; experience within small and large child care facilities; as well as K-12 public education. 
  • As mothers ourselves, we truly understand what parents are seeking in their search for trustworthy and convenient child care. We will exceed parental expectations by treating each and every child as if they were our own.


How Will Your Contributions Help?

Our campaign goal is $50,000 which will be used for pre-opening expenses to include:
  • Leasing and preparing a building for our school 
  • Purchasing academic curriculum materials 
  • Purchasing and installing security software in order to maximize safety
  • Purchasing classroom supplies (Furniture, Toys, Manipulatives, Diapering Supplies, etc.)
  • Recruiting, training, and retaining high quality staff


Tokens of Appreciation

All funds received will be used to continue to work towards the opening and continued success of our cutting edge child care facility. For your contribution we offer the following tokens of appreciation:

  • Signature First Step materials
  • Invitations to our grand opening
  • Discounted child care services
  • Prepaid child care services
  • Promotion of your business through our referral program
  • The gratitude of the families of Southwest Florida. 


What Will First Step Bring to Collier County?

  • Our project will impact the community by providing a safe haven for children.  Our 24 hour child care option will allow parents to enroll their children in a facility that offers safe, quality child care when they need it most. 
  • As certified educators, we are very knowledgeable about the requirements for students entering the K-12 school setting. Our curriculum will fully prepare our students for the academic world beyond preschool. 
  • The U.S. Census forecasts that the population of Collier county will continue to grow at a rate almost double that of the state percentage. These projections include a growth in the number of families with children under the age of 18. These growing populations translate into an increased need for child care. First Step will be there to serve these families through our superior child care offerings. 

Other Ways You Can Help

While monetary contributions are great, we understand that you may not be in a position to do so at the present time. You can still help!

  • Share! Share! Share!
  • Share our campaign with your family, friends, and colleagues. 
  • Share our campaign on your social media sites as well as personal websites.
Help us in our quest to help families in our community!

story:
There are many restaurants and businesses who do not offer delivery service to their customers. There are 2 types of them:

1- Some of them are franchises like KFC, Nando’s and McDonald’s. Some of them are top restaurants that don’t bother with delivery themselves but their customers demand the product.

2- The restaurants cannot afford to pay the delivery man and manage him for just less than ten deliveries per day. It is not cost effective, lots of hassle and bustle to take the order and address, they may lose the sale in the restaurant.

These two type of business love to have more sales, in the other hand there are lots of people love their products but they can’t get in to the restaurant  for whatever reason, maybe busy, tire, have child, or their times values is more than the few pound.

Here order2genie can help all these people to get almost whatever they want from any of their shop and restaurant.

We will reach our break even in 6 month after our set up.

In month 6 we will have 300 orders per day.

Average income from each order is £11.30 we will earn £3,390 per day.

Just eat has 100,000 order per day. In the worse scenario at the end of year two we will reach 1000 order per day.

We are working for more than 1.5 years. Amazingly I seen that  from 5 potential customers who ordered food online by other platform, one of them become our customer after I pitch them, some become loyal  customer and ordering twice a day. 

We already spent more than £30,000, including bike and car.

We need £100,000 to accomplish our plan and expand our business.

O2G needs capital for:

A- Marketing campaign;

B- Develop the website; 

C- Create a customized app;

D-Social media marketing

E- SMS printer for restaurant

F- Office and maintenance 

G- Professional wages.

For more information you can visit our official website http://order2genie.com/

If you have any question, or you are interesting to invest please let us know by contacting to:

support@order2genie.com

Thank you for your contribution

Rouzbeh Sebtrasoul

story:
The Story

In January 2014 I was working in a call center and I was planning to be an entrepreneur by doing something that I really love to do.My passion is about working with computers and technology. Later in February 2014, I quit my job and started working on my own business. 

I need to take action now!  This is important to me!

I didn't have much capital and I wanted to make my dream happen.

That was March 2014. At that time I did not have enough money to get a good personal computer or laptop.

I borrowed about $26 from my mother and had some money of my own and I went to an old monitor shop.  I was trying to find a monitor that I can buy and work on. Later I managed to buy a used CRT monitor $24.I went to another used computer shop to find a cheap PC casing which I bought for $6.57 and built a computer with some other parts that I had.  

From the same old computer accessories shop I bought a used keyboard worth $1.32 and also a mouse worth $1.32.

                           

Then I was happy :), I had a PC! But then I didn’t have enough money to buy a table and a chair to put the Computer on.  I used to put my computer on one side of my bed and I used to sleep on the other side. I was still happy! 

I needed an internet connection but had no money for that.  We ended up sharing a broadband internet connection with 6 people in order to cut costs.

Then I needed an internet cable…  I was trying to manage everything as cheap as possible. I went to a recycling shop.

While I was walking beside the unused items seller, Idiscovered a man pulling out the copper from the internet cable to sell the copper. My face turned into a smile, and I bought it for $0.39 and then I bought some scotch tape.

I fixed it right up!  I bought one meter of cable with connectors, and cut it into two parts and rebuilt the cable! Finally I get connected to the internet! That was a happy moment for me. 

I started offering my service online and was making a little money. 

In August 2014, I got a job in a power plant on an island. Before going there I bought a used laptop with the money I was able to save while working my business.

I lived on the island and I worked during my free time using my laptop. 

After a couple of days of working my business, I realized the laptop overheats and automatically shuts down, so to keep my laptop running, I bought a laptop cooler.That solved the problem!

I was enjoying my business more than I was enjoying my job but after about a month, my computer wouldn’t turn on anymore.  I decided to open up the computer to see if I could find the problem.  I even made my own tools that some of the screws needed.

So I repaired my laptop and was soon back to work!

In October 2014, I’d had enough of my job and new I had to do something that I was passionate about.  So I quit my job and started working my business full time!

I came back to the place where I was before. 

Recently in January, my laptop broke down again. So I went to service man and they got it back in service!

Now

I have a plan to start a virtual assistant business, please support.

This is part of my story. Thank you for your valuable time!  Please support and share with your friends.

The money raised here will go to buying new computers, some furniture, working space rent, and the bills like the internet.

Thank you for your help.

story:
Portable Sun - Bringing clean energy solutions to the world

We have combined advanced technologies with lightweight components and a full array of useful appliances to meet basic power and lighting needs when primary power goes down, whether you're in Kansas or Kenya.

                  Earth Button Perk

                                                                        

How Clean?

We build our systems to comply with the Restrictions of Hazardous Substances directives and have also eliminated the hazardous materials associated with Lead Acid and Lithium Ion batteries by using better technology.






                                      

                                   Just Set, Connect and Use                               

                                        

                                       No Mounting Required

The sturdy built-in stand sets up in seconds - virtually anywhere.

                                         One Cord Connection

Only one cord to connect - the controller automatically senses the panel and begins charging - Nothing else to do

                                          Anywhere - Anytime

Whether it's a power outage at home, a weekend at the cabin or out with your RV you can count on our portable power system to charge phones, tablets, laptops, batteries or power a TV and other small appliances.

    

                                           Middle of the Storm

Skip the panel and stay safe inside. No generator to fuel or start...Your power is ready and waiting for you to plug in and use.

                                              


                                               


                                  Glass Free - Shatter Resistant

We designed our unique solar panels without the glass that's common to almost every other panel so you won't have to worry about the hazards of  damaged, broken glass. Remarkably lightweight and waterproof.

                                                   


                 Solar Panels Belong Outside - Controllers Inside 

The electronics, battery and open electrical outlets in your controller don't belong outside exposed to moisture, temperature extremes and dust.  It creates the potential for electrical short circuits, corrosion and premature aging.

That's why we designed our light weight controller to be so portable and easy to use.  Place it in any sheltered location - Right where you need your power and use the extra long cord to place the panel outside - Right where it belongs.

                    Under Rated Panels / Under Rated Storage?

 If you can't fully recharge your system in 1 day your system is out of balance.  After all, lighting demands mean the night is usually when you need most of your power.

Conversely, if you can't store or use most of your solar panels daily output then your system is not balanced.

                                                          

 We design and match our components to work as an integrated unit, insuring balanced performance, lasting power and the most value for a system.




                                        

                                        The Portable Sun Solar Panel

Our innovative design features lightweight glass-free construction with our unique 5 layer composite, high performance cells and self supporting frame.

No flimsy plastic or fabric used here... The rugged anodized aluminum frame and stand provides the type of proper support necessary for a premium system designed for a lifetime of use.

Easily sets up in seconds virtually anywhere and at a little over 8 lbs. it's the  lightest of it's type.


                                      Our Controller / Power Center

We incorporated  our solar controller,  storage battery and inverter functions into one compact, integrated unit for simple, uncomplicated  use - Ready to supply AC and DC power from the safety of your home at the flip of a switch.

Ergonomic design... The angled control panel provides a clear view and easy access because we placed the power outlets below - keeping cords out of your way.

Using a strong, all aluminum case and one of the most advanced batteries available,  the entire unit weighs less than 12 lbs - The lightest in its class





             








  











We've completed design, prototyping and beta testing phases, our suppliers are on board and we are ready to begin production but  we need you...


Your contributions to the campaign will allow us to purchase materials in the quantity needed to start full production.

Our long term goal is to reach production levels that will reduce the price and bring these systems within the grasp of more families across the planet that have no access to electricity. You DO matter!





We have sought to minimize potential risks by developing our system and establishing great working relationships with our suppliers before  starting the campaign. At this stage we are confident we can solve any unforeseen challenges if they arise.  We have just completed a successful beta testing of the system and final tasks include adjusting the graphics, borders, creating the user manual and designing the packaging.




Does the solar panel have to be pointed exactly South?

No, an approximate Southerly direction (Southeast to Southwest) is sufficient.

Is the Solar Panel weather proof?

Yes, the panel is waterproof and unaffected by temperature. In fact, in cold temperatures the panel will outperform our rating.

Will it produce power on a hazy day?

Yes, we use some of the best solar cells commercially available which perform well across multiple wavelengths with low temperature coefficients.

How long does it take to recharge the Power Center?

The system will fully recharge from the lowest state with 7 - 8 hours of sunlight.

How long will the Power Center hold a charge?

After 1 year it will retain an  80% charge but we suggest you 'top off'  2 or 3 times a year with the wall charger or the solar panel to maintain a near full charge for emergency use.

Can it be used without the Solar Panel connected?

Yes, the Power Center can be used independently to run devices.

How many devices can be run at the same time?

It is possible to run up to 10 devices at once. There are 2 AC outlets, 2 USB (5vdc) outlets and 6 - 12vdc outlets.

Can this system be used to jump start a car battery?

No, we designed the battery to provide optimal performance during long periods of steady use - unlike the short bursts of high current required for starting a vehicle.

Will this system power a refrigerator?

Not household size refrigerators. The power load of appliances like refrigerators, toasters and hair dryers is beyond the capabilities of portable systems. Despite the claims of some manufacturers only a large permanently mounted solar system with extensive battery storage and an inverter of at least 1,000 watts would be required for these power loads.

Can a TV be run on this system?

Yes, most can be run. However battery time can be greatly extended by using smaller flat screen LED TV’s that are generally available - like the 19” HD TV we offer as a perk. It only draws 30 watts and is a great accessory for watching news reports during power outages and weather emergencies.

Can I buy an additional 12 volt lamp to use with the system?

Yes, select the perk to add a lamp.

Where is this system made?

Our components are sourced from the Philippines, Thailand and China. We did make an exhaustive effort to find companies in the U.S. who could build the components to our specifications but they either were not interested, not capable or priced beyond the consumer level. Our current suppliers are experienced, capable and responsive - we’re glad to partner with them to bring you a premium product.

What is the warranty ?

We warranty the Solar Panel and  Power Center for 10 years.

What if I have questions or need help?

We will be glad to work with you and answer any of your questions - Just send us a message on our contact page.



Interested in becoming an international distributor?

Contact us, we'd like to hear from you.



Help get the word out and let others know about us. We encourage you to use the  share tools on Indiegogo to start.


     A Veteran Owned Company
