story:
Our Story

Two years ago, a simple yet not so common nowadays idea stuck in our minds: To create an online Barter marketplace! A community where anyone can trade goods and services in a simple, secure and user friendly space.

Myself (Yiannis Deliyiannis), George Karamanoglou and Michalis Pitsikalis, quit our day jobs and jumped into the abyss of the startup world!

On January 2013  tradenow was launched in Greece! A beta version with many ooops.. page not found! The whole project was at risk, technically speaking - because in terms of traction we signed on 5K members in our first 3 months! 

We regrouped, brought into the team a Senior developer (Dimitris) and redeveloped - redesigned the platform! We didn't give up our dream: To become the world's online Barter marketplace.

Today, almost 8 months in full operation, our barter community: 20K members and 400 companies have created a marketplace with goods, services and real-estate worth over €150ΜΜ.  

With over 1,000 completed transactions valued at €500Κ,  this  barter community has helped thousands of individuals save money and hundreds of companies  to build their network and utilize their excess capacity.


Discover the world of barter trading


Value to our community


Value to our barter partners



What we need & why

We need your support to take tradenow one step further towards our vision: To become the World's online Barter marketplace.

Specifically, we will use the funds to roll-out the platform in Europe & US and to develop a mobile application for our community. 

Our mobile app mock-up video:



What perks we offer to our supporters!

Since we are in the barter industry, what we offer for your support is a series of tradenow perks and a solidarity promise: 10% of all the extra achievement of funds raised will be donated to our partner NGO's.


Monuments of Athens

A set of 3 lanterns displaying the Caryatids and set of 6 coasters displaying the Parthenon and the Caryatids in pop colors.  A perk offered by one of our barter partners Idisti - Greece with a twist


Good luck charm from Greece

A notebook, a mousepad, a set of 6 coasters and a magnetic bookmark - all with a good luck charm from Greece!  A perk offered by one of our barter partners Idisti - Greece with a twist


Tradenow Pins


Handbag


Hooded Sweatshirt



Risks & Challenges

We are a startup, therefore the risks are big!!!  But, we have what it takes to make this venture successful:
GREAT TEAM, HARD WORK, PASSION and VISION!
Our only challenge is to make it happen...

Other Ways You Can Help

Contribution to our campaign can be expressed with just putting the word around: Help #tradenow - The world's online barter marketplace go #onestepfurther 

Support our vision, share our campaign , join the world's online Barter marketplace, like our Fan Page and... Enjoy trading!!!


Thanks for your support!
story_txt:
Our Story Two years ago, a simple yet not so common nowadays idea stuck in our minds: To create an online Barter marketplace! A community where anyone can trade goods and services in a simple, secure and user friendly space.
Myself (Yiannis Deliyiannis), George Karamanoglou and Michalis Pitsikalis, quit our day jobs and jumped into the abyss of the startup world!


On January 2013  tradenow was launched in Greece! A beta version with many ooops.. page not found! The whole project was at risk, technically speaking - because in terms of traction we signed on 5K members in our first 3 months! 
We regrouped, brought into the team a Senior developer (Dimitris) and redeveloped - redesigned the platform! We didn't give up our dream: To become the world's online Barter marketplace.
Today, almost 8 months in full operation, our barter community: 20K members and 400 companies have created a marketplace with goods, services and real-estate worth over €150ΜΜ.  
With over 1,000 completed transactions valued at €500Κ,  this  barter community has helped thousands of individuals save money and hundreds of companies  to build their network and utilize their excess capacity.

Discover the world of barter trading




Value to our community




Value to our barter partners





What we need & why
We need your support to take tradenow one step further towards our vision: To become the World's online Barter marketplace.
Specifically, we will use the funds to roll-out the platform in Europe & US and to develop a mobile application for our community. 
Our mobile app mock-up video:

Since we are in the barter industry, what we offer for your support is a series of tradenow perks and a solidarity promise: 10% of all the extra achievement of funds raised will be donated to our partner NGO's.

A notebook, a mousepad, a set of 6 coasters and a magnetic bookmark - all with a good luck charm from Greece!  A perk offered by one of our barter partners Idisti - Greece with a twist

Handbag

GREAT TEAM, HARD WORK, PASSION and VISION!Our only challenge is to make it happen...  Other Ways You Can Help Contribution to our campaign can be expressed with just putting the word around: Help #tradenow - The world's online barter marketplace go #onestepfurther

story:
Why is a newspaper important to rural communities?

Rural communities face unique challenges that mainstream news agencies do not address.

Our communities are geographically wide spread, as well as politically, economically and culturally diverse. Keeping abreast of local happenings and concerns is impossible without a common source of information.

The mission statement of The South Clark County Gazette is:

To unite our rural communities by sharing information through fair and unbiased reporting of relevant events, issues and opportunities.


A local paper Improves Quality of Life in many ways

Creates Community: It strengthens the sense of community by building a bridge of communication between neighbors. It's a vital source of reliable information, and is very much the lifeblood of small communities.

The editors of The South Clark County Gazette see the diversity of our communities as a strength and are steadfastly committed to fair and unbiased reporting. We want to inspire unity where possible and respectful acceptance of others, where opinions may be divided.

Boosts the Economy: Our communities have numerous small businesses, as well as an emerging Cottage Industry. The paper is the perfect medium to get the word out, bringing customers and services or products together. Potentially creating even more opportunities for local jobs and economic growth.

The South Clark County Gazette will strongly support and promote all local enterprises, by highlighting and publicizing their products and services.

Supports the Children and Young Adults: Student activities, events and achievements are proudly celebrated and reported upon, in a local paper.

The SCCG has partnered with our local public schools as well as the homeschool groups. We are also a standing committee with Keystone Enrichment Foundation. A local non-profit, whose purpose is to benefit the community through various events and educational opportunities. Education and the success of our young people is a vital concern. We want to improve our communities and create a better future for everyone, but especially our children.

Our communities have never had a self-sustaining newspaper!

The Editors of The South Clark County Gazette are strong women who have deep ties to these communities and a long history of community service.  Our life paths have varied widely, creating a complimentary array of strengths, talents and skills. Our long term goal is to establish a self-supporting newspaper that will out last us!

The money raised in this campaign will cover our start up costs and what we will need to produce and print a bi-weekly newspaper for one year.  We are strictly volunteers, any and all money raised will only be used for operating costs.

We are completely committed to this project and are diligently working to get this newspaper going. Will you please help us? We have put together some fabulous “Thank you” gifts we'd for you to have! Please take a look and join our team today!

You are invited to watch our video! It informative and has many pictures of our beautiful communities. Hope you enjoy and are inspired to help us reach our goals.

story:
Milenio TV Interview | 26/05/2016 | El Café de los Sentidos


Versión en Español


1) Our Story:

In 2013 after researching projects that promoted the labor market inclusion of people with disabilities we found out about El Café de las Sonrisas (The Smiles Coffee Shop), a civil organization in Nicaragua that promotes the social and labor inclusion of people with hearing impairments.

Since then we started putting up the project of a Coffee Shop chain that besides supporting people with disabilities could also support other vulnerable sectors (such as elderly people, homeless people and indigenous communities) by making partnerships with civil organizations, government bodies and social enterprises.

In August 2013, we took part in a national contest at La Semana del Emprendedor  (Entrepreneur Week) that is organized by the INADEM (Mexican National Institute of Entrepreneurs). We were awarded the first prize in our category, receiving  $95,000 MXN (~ $5,500 USD) to incubate and structure El Café de los Sentidos (The Senses Coffee Shop) with professional counseling from Feher & Feher a  Mexican, highly recognized business incubator, accelerator and consultancy.



2) What do we Offer:

Specialty Coffee:

Currently the price of coffee is determined by the stock markets in New York and London. As a consequence the volatility of the prices creates a high level of uncertainty for the coffee farmers .The “coyotes” and all sorts of intermediates hog the coffee beans and prevent the farmers to benefit from a higher price for their harvest. Furthermore, they sometimes are forced to sell their coffee at a loss.  

Specialty coffee represents only 5% to 10% of the worldwide production, due to its high quality it allows farmers to directly receive an income that can be 2 to 10 times higher than the one they  get in the mainstream coffee market.

We can thus guarantee:

1)  A significantly higher income for coffee farmers

2)  A premium quality coffee for our clients.

Local Products:

We believe that the best way to achieve a higher social impact is by collaborating with civil organizations as well as  local companies that are already creating benefits for our society.

In our Coffee Shops you will  find:


3) Partnerships and MUCAM

According to the CONAPRED (Mexican National Council to Prevent Discrimination) in Mexico many people with disabilities, elderly people, indigenous communities, young people as well as women are considered to be vulnerable groups and frequently face employment discrimination.

This is the reason why we have established partnerships with civil organizations and social enterprises that have the endeavor to foster the development and the labor inclusion of these sectors. These partnerships include organizations such as

1) Domus Institute that supports people facing Autism Spectrum Disorders.

2) CEDAC Foundation that supports people with Down Syndrome. 

3) CINIA a company that collaborates with more than 300 people with disabilities and offers products and services of the highest quality.


MUCAM (COEXME group | Civil Organization)

Together with Luz María Ozuna, Director of the most important coffee event in Latin America (Cumbre Latinoamericana del Café- Latin-American Coffee Summit) and 5 other companies we established MUCAM, a non-profit organization that promotes the export of produce manufactured by Mexican women and  female artisans.

With MUCAM, we have established strategic partnerships with institutions, organizations and government bodies with which we have supported different projects in Mexico as well as achieving a strong presence at international events ( in Colombia, Italy, US and soon in the EU).

We have, at present, supported +30 companies with about $120,000 USD.


4) How will the money be used?

Unlike conventional companies, 60% of our profit will be permanently reinvested in social initiatives and social projects. 

With your support, we will be able to obtain 60% of the initial investment we need to open our first coffee shop.

The appeal shall be distributed as follows:


5) Why is your support so important?


El Café de los Sentidos was born 3 years ago with the aim of reinvesting  in society.

With your support we will be able to open our first coffee shop and permanently reinvest 60% of its profit in projects and social initiatives!  All of these projects will be put forward and voted by you and a group of experts through local and national calls for proposals. Therefore, our main “partner” will be Society and that is you!

The remaining 40% of our profit will be reinvested in new coffee shops working under the same scheme.

Some of our goals in the medium and long term are:

1-  To reinvest 20% to 90% of the profit of each Coffee Shop in social initiatives and projects to have a major positive impact in our society.

2-  To enable our collaborators to develop their own personal social projects with part of our reinvestment.

3-  To allow our model to be replicated into other sectors and traditional businesses in Mexico and worldwide (bakeries, restaurants, tea houses etc).

With your support and by spreading the word we will secure the remaining 60% that we need in order to open our very first  El Café de los Sentidos Coffee Shop! 


Versión en Español



1) Nuestra Historia

En 2013, después de investigar distintos proyectos alrededor del mundo que promueven la inclusión laboral de personas con discapacidad, descubrimos El Café de las Sonrisas, organización civil en Nicaragua que impulsa la inclusión socio-laboral de personas con discapacidad auditiva.  

A partir de entonces, empezamos a estructurar un proyecto de cadena de cafeterías que, además de apoyar a personas con discapacidad, pueda incluir a otros sectores vulnerables (adultos mayores, personas en situación de calle, comunidades indígenas, etc.) por medio de alianzas intersectoriales con organizaciones civiles, organismos gubernamentales y empresas sociales. 

En agosto de ese año, participamos en un concurso a nivel nacional en La Semana del Emprendedor organizado por el Instituto Nacional del Emprendedor (INADEM) con el cual obtuvimos el 1er lugar en nuestra categoría y un apoyo de $95,000 pesos (~ $5,500 USD) para incubar y estructurar El Café de los Sentidos con asesoría profesional de Feher & Feher, una de las incubadoras, aceleradoras y consultorías más reconocidas en México. 

2) ¿Qué ofreceremos en nuestras cafeterías?

Café de Especialidad:

En la actualidad, los precios del café están determinados por las Bolsas de Valores de Nueva York y de Londres. Como consecuencia, la volatilidad de los precios genera mucha incertidumbre para los cafeticultores que pueden llegar a vender su café a un precio por debajo de los costos de producción. Aunado a esto, los "coyotes" e intermediarios acaparan el café e impiden generalmente que los productores reciban un mayor precio por sus cosechas. 

El Café de Especialidad que representa del 5% al 10% de la producción mundial del café debido a su calidad, permite que los cafeticultores reciban directamente un ingreso que puede ser de 2 a 10 veces mayor al que recibirían en el mercado tradicional de café. 

De este modo garantizamos:

1) Un ingreso significativamente mayor para los productores de café.

2) Una excelente calidad del café que ofrecemos.


Productos Locales:

Creemos que el mejor camino para lograr un mayor impacto social es colaborando con organizaciones civiles y empresas locales que ya están generando un beneficio para la sociedad.

En nuestras cafeterías podrán encontrar:

3) Alianzas y MUCAM

De acuerdo con el Consejo Nacional para Prevenir la Discriminación (CONAPRED), en México las personas con discapacidad, los adultos mayores, las comunidades indígenas, los jóvenes y las mujeres, son considerados grupos en situación de vulnerabilidad y enfrentan frecuentemente discriminación laboral.

Es por esto que implementamos alianzas con organizaciones civiles y empresas sociales que se dedican a impulsar el desarrollo y la inclusión laboral de estos sectores como:

1) Instituto Domus | Que apoya a personas con Trastorno del Espectro Autista (TEA).

2) Fundación CEDAC | Que brinda educación e incluye laboralmente a personas con Síndrome de Down

3) CINIA | Empresa social que ofrece productos y servicios de la mejor calidad en la que colaboran más de 300 personas con discapacidad.


MUCAM (Grupo COEXME, A.C.):
Junto a Luz María Osuna, Directora del evento de café más importante en Latinoamérica (Cumbre Latinoamericana del Café) y 5 empresas constituimos MUCAM, organización sin fines de lucro que promueve la exportación de productos elaborados por mujeres y artesanas mexicanas. 

Con MUCAM hemos realizado alianzas estratégicas con instituciones, organizaciones internacionales y organismos gubernamentales con los cuales hemos apoyado distintos proyectos en México, logrando también presencia en eventos internacionales (en Colombia, Italia, Estados Unidos y próximamente en Europa). 

Actualmente MUCAM ha apoyado a más de 30 empresas con un total aproximado de más de $120,000 USD.





4) ¿En qué utilizaremos el dinero?

Con su apoyo, obtendremos el 60% de los recursos que nos hace falta para la apertura de nuestra primera cafetería. 

A diferencia de una empresa tradicional en la que el socio recibiría el 60% de las utilidades, el 60% de las utilidades de esta cafetería será reinvertido permanentemente en proyectos e iniciativas con impacto social.

El recurso será repartido de la siguiente manera:


5) ¿Por qué es importante tu apoyo?

El Café de los Sentidos nació hace 3 años con el propósito de reinvertir en la sociedad. 

Normalmente, en una cafetería "tradicional" las utilidades se dividen únicamente entre los socios/accionistas. Al obtener el 60% de la inversión inicial de nuestra primera cafetería a través del crowdfunding, nuestro principal inversionista eres tú.

Con su apoyo, podremos abrir la primera cafetería de El Café de los Sentidos y reinvertir permanentemente el 60% de sus utilidades en proyectos e iniciativas sociales. 

Todos los proyectos serán propuestos y elegidos por ustedes. Con el apoyo de organizaciones aliadas y un jurado compuesto de expertos en distintos sectores, se seleccionarán los proyectos que puedan lograr un mayor impacto positivo para la sociedad.

El 40% restante de las utilidades será reinvertido en nuevas cafeterías que funcionen bajo el mismo esquema.  

Algunos de nuestros objetivos a mediano y largo plazo son que:

1) El 20%-90% de las utilidades de las nuevas cafeterías pueda ser reinvertido en proyectos e iniciativas sociales que generen un mayor impacto social.

2) Que todos los colaboradores de El Café de los Sentidos cuenten con las posibilidades de desarrollar sus proyectos personales con parte de nuestras reinversiones. 

3) Que el modelo de reinversión social empresarial pueda replicarse en otros mercados y negocios tradicionales en México y el Mundo (panaderías, restaurantes, casas de té, etc.) y que la sociedad se convierta en el principal "socio" y beneficiario de estas empresas.

¡Con su ayuda y difusión conseguiremos el 60% que nos falta para inaugurar la primera cafetería de El Café de los Sentidos! :D


6) Recompensas

5) ¿Por qué es importante tu apoyo?


El Café de los Sentidos nació hace 3 años con el propósito de reinvertir en la sociedad. 
Normalmente, en una cafetería "tradicional" las utilidades se dividen únicamente entre los socios/accionistas. Al obtener el 60% de la inversión inicial de nuestra primera cafetería a través del crowdfunding, nuestro principal inversionista eres tú.
Con su apoyo, podremos abrir la primera cafetería de El Café de los Sentidos y reinvertir permanentemente el 60% de sus utilidades en proyectos e iniciativas sociales. 
Todos los proyectos serán propuestos y elegidos por ustedes. Con el apoyo de organizaciones aliadas y un jurado compuesto de expertos en distintos sectores, se seleccionarán los proyectos que puedan lograr un mayor impacto positivo para la sociedad.
El 40% restante de las utilidades será reinvertido en nuevas cafeterías que funcionen bajo el mismo esquema.  
Algunos de nuestros objetivos a mediano y largo plazo son que:
1) El 20%-90% de las utilidades de las nuevas cafeterías pueda ser reinvertido en proyectos e iniciativas sociales que generen un mayor impacto social.
2) Que todos los colaboradores de El Café de los Sentidos cuenten con las posibilidades de desarrollar sus proyectos personales con parte de nuestras reinversiones. 
3) Que el modelo de reinversión social empresarial pueda replicarse en otros mercados y negocios tradicionales en México y el Mundo (panaderías, restaurantes, casas de té, etc.) y que la sociedad se convierta en el principal "socio" y beneficiario de estas empresas.
¡Con su ayuda y difusión conseguiremos el 60% que nos falta para inaugurar la primera cafetería de El Café de los Sentidos! :D

6) Recompensas

story:
For the last two years Shasta Rock Club has been working to create a ‘basecamp’ for people to dream, belong and grow into their destiny through the vehicle of rock climbing. We are excited to share the future of Shasta Rock Club and our Expansion Project: Onward & Upward. 

Shasta Rock Club is an urban destination in Redding, California aimed at building community through inspiring, educating, and challenging people through a unique rock climbing experience.


Our long-term vision is to build a world-class rock climbing facility and become a leading adventure resource for Northern California. We believe that a community of encouraging, welcoming, and hope-filled people can impact lives and take people out of fear into freedom.






Expansion Phase 1:

Our plan is to relocate into a new building. This incredible opportunity will allow us to expand our climbing space through renovations, increase our programs, serve more customers, and add overall value to what we offer as a business.

Finances will be put toward building a new climbing gym at a new location by more than doubling the bouldering terrain, purchasing higher quality climbing holds & gear, and creating additional community, fitness, and retail space. We are also considering a 24-7 membership option. 


Expansion Phase 2:

After we outgrow this space, we will target our focus toward the construction of a new building that will house a world-class rock climbing facility. The renderings above depict the design and features of Phase 2. Facility highlights of Phase 2 include: Top out bouldering, top-rope climbing, lead climbing, fitness area, lounge / refreshment area, kids climbing area, private party area, retail and more. 


Financial Breakdown:  We have a flexible funding campaign. The following breakdown outlines how we will spend funds depending on the amount raised. 


Expansion Phase 1:

$10,000 - Purchase new holds

$20,000 - Purchase new holds and fitness equipment

$50,000 - Constructing bouldering walls, new holds & fitness

$75,000 - Remodel building, construct new bouldering walls, new holds & Fitness

$100,000 - New Bouldering & Fitness Gym!!

Expansion Phase 2:

$150,000 - Construct Bouldering and Fitness areas in new facility

$200,000 - Construct Bouldering, Fitness and initial Top-Rope area

$250,000 - Construct more expansive Bouldering, Fitness, & full Top-Rope area

$300,000 - Construct new facility to the full extent based on the renderings above & contingent on bank loan

$500,000 - Construct new facility to the full extent based on the renderings above



Our Perspective:

Our Shasta Rock Club team believes that true success comes through "showing up". Showing up to us means doing the very best we can with what we have. Like any goal worth attaining, we know that consistently saying "yes" to the everyday, seemingly small steps is a key part of the process that leads to accomplishing the greater "yes" we have given. We are all in on this journey. We are thrilled about the expansion opportunity, knowing it will allow us to reach our bigger dreams in a sustainable, impactful way. Thank you for getting involved and for your support. Onward and upward we go!

story:
Welcome to the Happy Panda USA Corp. campaign

 
To ensure a descent start right of the bat, we need a 50.000 pcs sample batch of BIO plastic, 100% BIO degradable, Happy Panda Cold Cups worth 5000 usd in order to show to prospects and organizations. Up to 20,000 usd is needed for marketing, sales, travel, office, equipment and running costs for the first 6 months upon delivery of the sample batch. 
Please, become an active supporter of Happy Panda and contribute to our cause by either a small donation or a larger gift by obtaining one of the perks on our campaign. Become a part of the solution.


But let us introduce ourselves first:

The Happy Panda team: 

Founder #1: Eduardus WJ Groenewegen, Dutch

Founder#2: Christopher James McKenna, American

Melissa Kaye Yeager, Vice President

Gerry Martin, Vice President

Nicholas Hinsch, webmaster

--

Eduardus WJ Groenewegen, President                                                                                 >> Dutch Military communication & intelligence specialist 1983 - 1986 – Debt recovery specialist 1987 - present www.secumon.com & www.sa-f.eu – Dance- and Music Festival producer 1990 - 1993  – Production assistant 1994 - 2015 for (among others): www.pinkpop.nl  www.parkpop.nl 

 www.carnivaledenhaag.nl  www.profac.nl 

Melissa Kaye Yeager, Vice President operations & treasurer (registered agent Happy Panda USA Corp.)                                                               

 >> Administration, Sourcing, and General Management for IT company –Associate's degree, Business, Management, Marketing, and Related Support Services 2009 – 2011 (Studied Business Management with a focus on Organizational Innovation) – Bachelor's Degree, Business Management, organizational innovation, 3.29 GPA 2011 – 2014 (Studied Organizational Innovation)

Gerry Martin, Vice President sales & marketing                                                                    >> The Martin Group, 2013 – Present, Restaurant, Bar & Carnival Consulting Group – Real Estate Agent, Lakefront Real Estate, September 2011 – 2013, Hamilton Lake, IN – Human Resource Consultant, Kendall & Davis, Inc., October 2011 – 2012, Midwest – Owner restaurant / Bar, Pier 32, July 2003 – November 2008, Hamilton Lake, IN – Sales Representative for Sports Den, 1995 – 1997, Fort Wayne, Indiana Area, A road Salesman where I serviced around 75 schools along with 10 University's.

Left to right: Gerry Martin, Melissa Yeager, Chistopher J McKenna at the           Happy Panda shareholder signing ceremony with our law partners, Fort Wayne, IN,: www.beckmanlawson.com

--

Nicholas Hinsch, webmaster & admin.                                                                   >> Co-Founder | CEO & Managing Member of "eVAL", May 2011 – Present, Columbus, Ohio Area, "eVAL" is an Information Security firm that provides solutions to businesses in need of: eCommerce and Web Application Penetration Testing, Source Code Auditing (vulnerabilities / crypto implementation / access control and authorization ), Server Vulnerability Assessments, Network Security Auditing (Intrusion detection & Hardening), Server Deployment/Maintenance, Secure Networking Implementation (air-gapping / VLANs / IPS)

--

The Problem...

The World is DROWNING in an Ocean of Plastic!  Dramatic and Unimaginable yes, but true, and the truth, is far scarier then you will ever be told! 


In the 1970’s the World learned to recycle plastics.  By doing so, one of our main sources of fuel for our power plants was no longer viable and as a result, more & more fossil fuels were needed to burn in our power plants! 

 In 2016 World Leaders came together in Davos Switzerland to talk about Climate issues.  The Ellen MacArthur Foundation produced a Chilling report dealing with the “Plastic Soup” in the ocean.  The report stated that, “by 2050, There will be more plastic in the Oceans than Fish”.  A Nightmare for the World, but there are Lifelines for our ravaged Oceans, with Initiatives like “The Clean Sea Project” (www.cleansea-project.eu) and “The Ocean Clean-Up” (www.theoceancleanup.com/problem), which work tireless to educate & resolve this issue.

Happy Panda believes that BIO plastics are the Future!  Bio plastics like PLA biodegrade within 10-24 months in the environment saving our Oceans countless acres of Plastic soup!  BioPlastics are 100% recyclable & reusable!

-See more at: http://www.inspirationgreen.com

- And sign our petition at: 
https://secure.avaaz.org/nl/petition/Ban_Kimoon_Please_help_the_change_from_petroleum_plastics_to_BIO_plastics/


Our story...

While visiting the United States in 2013 our founder Eduardus Groenewegen was introduced to Chris McKenna a U.S. Navy veteran who, with the help of his wife Sarah, wanted to make a difference.  They were producing & selling Biodegradable drink cups made from Bamboo resin.  Intrigued, Eduardus became friends with the McKenna’s and took a case of their Bamboo cups back to his native Holland. 


After introducing the Bamboo cups to his friends & colleagues, Eduardus was dismayed by the public’s lack of knowledge on biodegradable disposables. 

With the help of the Dutch government, Eduardus opened an Eco Awareness café called Happy Panda in Amsterdam.  His unique storefront was part University & part Marketplace where he sold recycled products & Bio degradable merchandise from all over the world.  They would offer introductions to environmental problems along with possible solutions.  

Eduardus Groenewegen at his test store in amsterdam.

Happy Panda started a revolution where concerts, festivals and bars are now using & promoting Biodegradable disposables. 

Eduardus came back to the United States in 2014 and with the support of the McKenna’s, set out to make Happy Panda a Global phenomenon, by becoming the Worlds “Eco Awareness Pioneers!” 

Chris wants his legacy to be one his children (including new born boy, Spencer) and grand children can enjoy (as does Ed) after he left this earth.

With the understanding that any real true Change, first begins with education.  Happy Panda has begun gathering information on not only Bio Degradable plastics such as PLA or POLY (Polylactic acid or Polylactide).  - Which is thermoplastic aliphatic polyester derived from renewable resources, such as Corn Starch (North America), Tapioca Roots, Chips or Starch (Asia) and Sugarcane (World).  - But, also on initiatives like The Clean Sea Project & The Ocean Clean-up Project.  Happy Panda is introducing Eco Friendly plastics to people & companies whom were never educated or introduced to them.  Who have begun their own path to a greener tomorrow! 


3rd from left: Eduardus Groenewegen with 2nd from right: Gerry Martin at Ripley County, Indiana, environmental meeting.

Ed discussed his findings with Melissa and Gerry and Karl Lapan (of the Northeast Indiana Innovation Center, formed in December 1999 as a private-public partnership between the City of Ft. Wayne, IPFW, the County of Allen, the Greater Fort Wayne Chamber of Commerce, and local community stakeholders). These discussions lead to the conclusion that the backbone of Happy Panda USA Corp. should be the single use bio-plastic disposables indeed. The designers where put to work and the first type cold drink cup to be made from PLA plastic was born. 

This is where this campaign comes in:

In order to work towards our ultimate goal of making a difference in the plastic industry regarding replacing petrol based plastics with renewable, recyclable bio degradable plastics we need YOUR help!

YOUR contribution to our project will kick-start production and sales. We already have found a contract manufacturing partner in ROCKLEIGH INDUSTRIES in order to produce our own brand, make and model cold drink cups and more.

Here is What We Need & What You Get

To ensure a descent start right of the bat, we need a 50.000 pcs sample batch worth 5000 usd. Up to 20,000 usd is needed for marketing, sales, travel, office, equipment and running costs for the first 6 months upon delivery of the sample batch. 
Become part of the ECO awareness team that is Happy Panda USA Corp. by becoming a contributor and receive an unforgettable one of a kind incentive. 


Ranging from limited edition cold drink cups to personalized cold drink cups and awesome T-shirts.



Happy Panda USA Corp. is no stranger to working on tight budgets. Eduardus (like Christopher) has used his little private funds to get us where we are today. In case we may not reach our funding goal we will be able to order a sample batch of 1000 pcs for as little as 1100 usd per model (startup and mold costs) and work from there.

Why did we form Happy Panda, the ECO awareness pioneers?

-- A new report on dealing with the plastic soup was presented at the World Economic Forum, where world leaders came together from 20 to 23 January 2016, in Davos. New Plastics Economy was produced by the Ellen MacArthur Foundation in collaboration with an impressive number of companies and institutes.                The report highlights the gravity of plastic pollution – “in 2050 there will be more plastic than fish in the sea” – and notes that it is primarily plastic packaging that is the culprit.

The report’s premise is simple. Plastic has multiple advantages such as improved food safety and lower transport costs and is therefore indispensable. Of all the plastic packaging, 95% is lost to the economy after use. This represents a loss of 80 to 120 billion dollars. As much of that plastic ends up in the environment and has caused and continues to contribute to the plastic soup, this generates even more costs. The New Plastics Economy must stimulate change by viewing more plastics as a basic resource and keeping it in the economic system. The disposable economy needs to rapidly turn into the circular economy.

The proposed solution is not to dramatically reduce plastics, but to take a three pronged approach. One, processing facilities for plastic waste in the countries which contribute significantly to the plastic soup – primarily in Asia – need to be improved. Two, and of greater importance, the researchers propose to make plastic waste more economically attractive. And finally, three, the material itself needs to be improved. Plastics need to be developed which, once in the marine environment, cause less damage.

One fundamental problem of the proposed solution is that a higher economic value for plastic waste is unrealistic. Almost all plastic is made of fossil fuels and the current price of 30 dollars a barrel is a historic low. The continuously low oil price pushes the production costs of plastic down. The result is a spike in the production of plastic with even more uses found. The value of plastic waste will thus not increase, but actually decrease. Each product, for example, could be packaged three times in plastic without significant additional costs. Recycling companies around the world are going bankrupt.

Eduardus and team visiting most modern 14 million euro industrial composting plant in Europe, located in The Netherlands and mixing BIO plastic plant containers from green house fruit farmers with regular plantbased green waste. 

What is most needed is to strongly restrict the unbridled production of single use plastic. By creating scarcity, you can increase the value of plastic waste. Unfortunately, the companies consulted for this report are unwilling to discuss production limitation. This is the simple reason that this option is not mentioned in the report at all. --                                                             
                                                           (source: http://www.plasticsoupfoundation.org/en)  

We could not say it better ourselves, but we did come to this conclusion years before this report came to light and thus Happy Panda was born.

The combined knowledge, expertise, qualities, drive and sense of responsibility regarding our planet's environment towards our (and YOUR) children makes the Happy Panda ECO awareness team a WINNING team!     

                                          

The challenges we face....

We realize that it would be utterly naive to think we will change the way the world's plastics industry and inhabitants operate, think and live without some challenges and/or risks. But we ARE committed to spread ECO awareness and replace regular plastics for BIO plastics on a COMMERCIAL scale!

The Happy Panda team will use its very broad skill set to ensure victory in the short, medium and long term. We wil gather intelligence on products, markets, competition and demographics, analyse that intelligence, form a plan of attack and surprise the world with our products and vision, one city, one county, one state, one country and one continent at a time.

--

Happy Panda USA Corp's long-term vision (5 - 10 yrs) includes a traveling interactive ECO awareness café (for music festivals, dance events and other large scale gatherings) build from steel shipping containers as a platform for fun while learning about our environment and what people can do themselves, also, a chain of commercial "ECO awareness" retail stores selling everything 'Bio' degradable, recyclable, recycled, up-cycled and "honest" branded.


But let's start with a SINGLE cup .....  We can't do it without YOUR help.


Other Ways You Can Help Happy Panda and become a true 'ECO awareness pioneer':

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask friends to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it. 

YOUR Happy Panda ECO awareness team.

Two, and of greater importance, the researchers propose to make plastic waste more economically attractive. And finally, three, the material itself needs to be improved. Plastics need to be developed which, once in the marine environment, cause less damage.


One fundamental problem of the proposed solution is that a higher economic value for plastic waste is unrealistic. Almost all plastic is made of fossil fuels and the current price of 30 dollars a barrel is a historic low. The continuously low oil price pushes the production costs of plastic down. The result is a spike in the production of plastic with even more uses found. The value of plastic waste will thus not increase, but actually decrease. Each product, for example, could be packaged three times in plastic without significant additional costs. Recycling companies around the world are going bankrupt.


Eduardus and team visiting most modern 14 million euro industrial composting plant in Europe, located in The Netherlands and mixing BIO plastic plant containers from green house fruit farmers with regular plantbased green waste. 

What is most needed is to strongly restrict the unbridled production of single use plastic. By creating scarcity, you can increase the value of plastic waste. Unfortunately, the companies consulted for this report are unwilling to discuss production limitation. This is the simple reason that this option is not mentioned in the report at all. --                                                             

                                                           (source: http://www.plasticsoupfoundation.org/en)  We could not say it better ourselves, but we did come to this conclusion years before this report came to light and thus Happy Panda was born.
The combined knowledge, expertise, qualities, drive and sense of responsibility regarding our planet's environment towards our (and YOUR) children makes the Happy Panda ECO awareness team a WINNING team!     

                                          
The challenges we face....
We realize that it would be utterly naive to think we will change the way the world's plastics industry and inhabitants operate, think and live without some challenges and/or risks. But we ARE committed to spread ECO awareness and replace regular plastics for BIO plastics on a COMMERCIAL scale!



The Happy Panda team will use its very broad skill set to ensure victory in the short, medium and long term. We wil gather intelligence on products, markets, competition and demographics, analyse that intelligence, form a plan of attack and surprise the world with our products and vision, one city, one county, one state, one country and one continent at a time.
--
Happy Panda USA Corp's long-term vision (5 - 10 yrs) includes a traveling interactive ECO awareness café (for music festivals, dance events and other large scale gatherings) build from steel shipping containers as a platform for fun while learning about our environment and what people can do themselves, also, a chain of commercial "ECO awareness" retail stores selling everything 'Bio' degradable, recyclable, recycled, up-cycled and "honest" branded.





But let's start with a SINGLE cup .....  We can't do it without YOUR help.



Other Ways You Can Help Happy Panda and become a true 'ECO awareness pioneer':
 Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Ask friends to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it. YOUR Happy Panda ECO awareness team.

story:
Our Story

Chrishella Roché is a Milwaukee native, raised in the Sherman Park community. Always having a passion for youth involvement, she decided to study education and received my degree in Elementary Education from Alabama State University. She brought the skills she learned back to Milwaukee and taught K-4th grade students. While in the classroom, she noticed that students (even at a young age) were trying to manage anxiety, depression, and societal pressures to be the "perfect scholar". This saddened her and she wanted to take a break from teaching because she felt like there was something more she could do. She took some time to live and continue teaching but this time abroad and she noticed children all over were dealing with some of the same issues but managing them differently. She observed different coping techniques that were encouraged, practiced, and utilized them in her personal life and with her students. Some of the most common techniques she noticed was painting, poetry, meditation, and music. 

During her time abroad (August of 2016) community frustrations boiled over in her hometown resulting in civil unrest in Milwaukee's Sherman Park Neighborhood. Multiple businesses were burned down. The riots in Milwaukee had become breaking news! She saw her community hurting and crying out for help. Afterwards she noticed that their was a community that needed healing and a safe space to release thoughts, feelings, and emotions but there was no outlet within reach. That's when Vibez Creative Arts Space was created.

She decided to come back home (Milwaukee) and instead of going back into the traditional classroom, she created my own "Classroom". "At Vibez, I want youth and adults to learn different techniques to express themselves so that we don't have to experience another Sherman Park (or Milwaukee) uprising.Over the years, I recognized in myself that poetry, painting , and music allowed me to focus, express myself, as well as heal. Vibez creative arts space was created to give the community that same safe space, the same outlet that I had used to find peace." - Chrishella Roché

What We Need & What You Get

Over the next 40 days we are raising $5,000 in funds to help us complete our space inside of the Sherman Phoenix Building. This will allow us to complete the essential build-out of the designated 1,200 Sq Ft inside of one of the building that was burned during the riots (Now known as the Sherman Phoenix building). Not only will we complete the build-out but we will purchase equipment to create a comfortable atmosphere. 

Here is what we need:

  • Drink station equipment
  • Tables
  • Chairs
  • Sound equipment

Here is what you (the community) get:

  • A community arts space
  • Instructor lead art experiences
  • Comfortable and safe atmosphere
  • Office and studio space to create in a private setting

The Impact

This campaign is special because not only will It will help a female entrepreneur renovate her business space and purchase more equipment but funding this project will bring a creative space to the inner city; a place the community can go to relax and explore art. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Like us on Facebook and Follow us on Instagram : @VibezCreativeArtsSpace www.facebook.com/VibezCreativeArtsSpace www.Instagram.com/VibezCreativeArtsSpace
  • Join our E-mail list to stay up to date with Vibez Progress; www.VibezCreativeArtsSpace.com
  • Help us "make some noise!!" share our campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and by E-mail.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What

Thanks to Carolyn Weber, who six years ago conceived the idea, Cream City Hostel will be the first in Milwaukee’s history.

Hostels are tourist accommodations with shared and individual rooms where guests have access to twin, full, or bunk beds and share bathrooms. There are common areas for socializing and a kitchen area for guests to prepare their own meals.

Hostels foster awareness among  guests and bring a diverse set of experiences under one roof. As we become more divided --  in a world that is more digitally connected -- hostels are a connection that can bridge these divides and truly create cultural understanding.

Cream City Hostel aims to be a destination for global, adventurous and budget  travelers in the Riverwest/Harambee neighborhood in Milwaukee. Cream City Hostel will provide a safe place for travelers to stay, provide an authentic experience of Milwaukee and fosters diverse social experiences among guests and the community

Why

This brings us why we are doing an Indiegogo.
We are on track to open May 2019 but need an extra push for more funds to bridge the gap between now and our busy summer months.

With RiverBee LLC, we have fund-raised $1,000,000 dollars in community loans towards purchasing the building, the building build-out and start-up costs for the everyday operations of the hostel and that budget is tight.

Long-term this will help to create a space for community music and art where we can host movie nights, food trucks and all ages shows. Maker markets, garden space and open that backyard to the neighborhood.

Your contribution will help make Cream City Hostel a community-driven project. Plus you get the perks of helping support the first hostel in Milwaukee!

We have some pretty awesome perks from t-shirts and hoodies to  great experiences unique to our first year like staying at the hostel during Riverwest 24 and early events at the space where you hang out with the owners for a tour, dinner, or a pajama party (Family friendly or Adult only!)

Who

Cream City Hostel is the tenant of the building at 500 E. Center Street in Riverwest- on the intersection of Holton and Center Streets. Riverbee LLC represents community investors brought together by Juli Kaufman of Fix Development who are purchasing the building and the initial furnishings for the hostel.

Carolyn Weber is the founder of Cream City Hostel and longtime resident of Riverwest. The journey started six years ago with a dream and is now becoming a reality. She has a passion for business, community, hosteling, traveling and making connections. Past experiences include being involved with the Riverwest Food Coop, cycling advocacy in Milwaukee and many other volunteer positions over the years in Riverwest. Carolyn is currently owner of Coast In Bikes and soon Cream City Bikes in Milwaukee. After studying Library & Information Science Carolyn found her passion found her passion for business innovation, event planning and community engagement in Milwaukee.

Wendy Mesich a Riverwest neighborhood resident, is strongly invested in her community and Milwaukee- with 18 years of experience in volunteer recruitment, coordination and mobilization, community outreach and engagement, and organizational management. She also has a background in finance and administration. Throughout her work, she has created communication strategies to increase member bases, engagement, and support through social media and email campaigns. She has experience engaging with diverse groups by developing relationships and community networks that will aid Cream City Hostel in connecting the business and guests to the community and to nurture authentic experiences.

Juli Kaufman & Fix Development uses a place-based, market-driven Main Street redevelopment model that disrupts local commercial real estate and financing systems to enable catalytic buildings that support small local businesses that create entrepreneurial jobs. Fix Development has successfully implemented this model in more than $25 million in real estate developments across Milwaukee. The Fix Development approach uses three differentiated elements key to its real estate model: Co-Development Mentorship, Community-Identified Economic Development Needs and Community Ownership. The Fix Development model enables neighbors to build: Wealth by owning an asset; power and control by dictating an inclusive redevelopment process and terms of tenancy that maximize local jobs for and businesses owned by local people; and self-determination for the types of commercial activity desirable within their own community. All of these elements will be maximized with the redevelopment of 500 E. Center Street.

Where

Cream City Hostel will be located in the Riverwest neighborhood on the north side of MIlwaukee, about four miles north of the heart of downtown Milwaukee,

This diverse, offbeat neighborhood has a DIY sensibility that runs deep. You’ll find a little bit of everything here- from funky music venues to intimate restaurants and brewpubs to tiki bars. Riverwest is an eclectic neighborhood with strong communal spirit, home to a community-run bar, local video store, a community radio station, and a thriving co-op. There’s no time that the spirit of Riverwest is stronger than during  Riverwest 24, an annual 24-hour bike race that’s part street race and part all-night block party.

The building at Center & Holton is a old bank that was built in 1927 for the Holton Street State Bank. It was designed by St. Paul, Minnesota-based A. Moorman and Co. architects. The last tenant was Milwaukee Public Schools. The building has the “magic sauce” that is needed for a hostel in Milwaukee because the neighborhood has local restaurants, breweries, bars, dance club and accessible transportation for guests. The neighborhood's locals support and love hostels and the building is the right size for common room areas and rooms with an AWESOME large backyard for neighborhood connections and for guests to use.

Please share this Indiegogo and stay tuned for updates on our progress.

Follow Along with our Journey Here

Facebook

Instagram

Youtube

Website & Blog

Yelp

Get in Touch

creamcityhostel@gmail.com

Articles

Cream City Hostel proposed for old Holton St. State Bank / Centro del Nino. Feburary 22, 2018. OnMilwaukee. https://onmilwaukee.com/visitors/articles/cream-city-hostel.html

City's first hostel breaks ground (and bread) this weekend. November 14, 2018. OnMilwaukee. https://onmilwaukee.com/visitors/articles/cream-city-hostel-breaks-ground.html

Travelers hostel proposed for historic building in Milwaukee's Riverwest neighborhood. Feburary 13, 2018. Journal Sentrial. https://www.jsonline.com/story/money/real-estate/commercial/2018/02/13/travelers-hostel-proposed-historic-building-milwaukees-riverwest-neighborhood/333062002/

City’s first hostel-style hotel planned for Riverwest
Juli Kaufmann planning Cream City Hostel. Feburary 13, 2018. BizTimes Milwaukee. https://www.biztimes.com/2018/industries/hospitality-tourism/citys-first-hostel-style-hotel-planned-for-riverwest/

Milwaukee will soon have a new, affordable way to attract visitors. Febuary 28, 2018. CBS News. https://www.cbs58.com/news/milwaukee-will-soon-have-a-new-affordable-way-to-attract-visitors

story:
We are Seren, Steve, Magnolia, Vinka & Adeline Sinisi. We are passionate about our work and way of life. We raise incredible grass-fed beef and organically fed pork and chicken. Our extensive home gardens, bee hives & beginning orchard round out the homestead and feed our family year-round. We love our community, and want to extend a glimpse into the farm life to those looking to stay in a unique space with a small footprint.

Just outside Freeport, and only 30 minutes from Portland, the 8' x 24' tiny house will accommodate 4 people. With two big beds, a fully equipped kitchen, hot shower and composting toilet, this small space makes a calming retreat away from the city- for a night or for a week. Drink your morning coffee while looking out at the cattle & chickens grazing in the fields. Seren and the smalls will give you a farm tour to see the piggies and answer any questions you may have about our farm or practices.

What We Need & What You Get

We are running an Indiegogo campaign to help finance the development of a Tiny House on Wheels Agritourism venture. We are asking for $20,000 (realistic?) and hoping (fingers crossed) to raise $40,000 to help offset the projected building and site preparation costs.

Tiny Homes of Maine is building our tiny for us. We've got the trailer ordered and we'll be posting updates with photos of the building process. The tiny house build is budgeted for $45,000. Excavating a gravel pad for the tiny house to sit on and bringing electricity to the site is estimated at $2-3 thousand. The landscaping and tiny home decor will be done with love and care by Seren, her mom (Nancy) and a team of willing friends.

Your farm stay will be in a 8'x24' tiny house with a fully equipped kitchen & bath, a sofa that transforms to a comfortable bed, and a spacious loft with a skylight for stargazing.

  • Pre-booking stays will help us establish the #OCRtinyhouse profile on social media and Airbnb.
  • A regular night’s stay at the tiny house will cost $150; we are reducing that to $125 per night for contributors to our Indiegogo campaign. 
  • There's no limit to the number of nights you can pre-buy.
  • Also, remember to combine your night's stay with dinner with the farm family or chores with the farmer.
  • Other fun perks include Old Crow Ranch t-shirts & swag, homemade Moo-Oink Lip Balm, or if you're feeling frisky: a night of cornhole, beverages & grilling out with Steveo.

What an #OCRtinyhouse Farm Stay Looks Like 

Click here for a link to an album of photos from Old Crow Ranch

When you arrive for your stay, we'll greet you and give you a farm tour (if you'd like one). Settle into the tiny house with lots of windows, and make yourself at home: have a cup of tea, take a walk through the fields or woods. Farmer Steve feeds all the animals every morning and every evening and we always have some project or another in the works. Seren and the girls go collect eggs and feed the laying hens every morning. Please be mindful: we are a working farm. We'll have some guidelines for your safety and the safety of our farm and animals.

The Impact

This project is near and dear to our hearts. Old Crow Ranch, a Forever Farm, was purchased in 2008 with help from the “Land for Maine’s Future” program and the Royal River Conservation Trust. Sixty-five of the seventy acres were put into an agricultural easement that preserves the farmland in perpetuity. The other five acres, a quarter mile back off the road, where our farmhouse is and where the #OCRtinyhouse will reside, is known as the homestead lot. We have built our home, farm infrastructure and business from the ground up, and this tiny house rental represents the next chapter of our story. 

Community is knit into the fabric of our farm, and what better way to expand our community than to invite folks to stay with us? We already host a number of events every year- a community potluck pig roast (#potluckpigoast), the Martin Black horse clinic, the Mangalitsa Nose to Tail hog butchery weekend workshop (2016 & 2017), and our "family dinners". The farm-stay rental will become another way our community and the greater world community can experience the life we’ve created at Old Crow Ranch.

Risks & Challenges

In a world where online presence is key, we live a very homesteady life. We've been working hard to bulk up our digital presence so that more people will learn about us and want to come stay with us. But we're nervous "If we build it, will they come?" 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to financially support our project (we understand, there's SOOOO much we wish we could throw money at!) it would be a huge help if you'd be willing to:

  • Make some noise about the #OCRtinyhouse
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Please share on ALL the social media that you frequent. Share early & share often.
  • Encourage friends and family to stay with us after we have launched

We here at Old Crow Ranch thank you from the bottom of our hearts!
