story:
Petunia es un nombre lleno de esperanza, de añoranza y de amor. Era el nombre del cachorro que mi hermana nunca llegó a tener; el de la tradición de hornear en familia, entre una nieta y su abuela; también es un símbolo de inclusión, de una sociedad en la que todos tienen lugar.    

Petunia is a name full of hope, longing and love. It was the name of the puppy my sister never had; that of a family baking tradition, between a grand daughter and her grandma; it is also a symbol of inclusiveness, of a society open to each and every one.

Mi pasión por hornear, por brindar productos frescos y de calidad, se une con la determinación de ofrecer oportunidades de trabajo dignas, no excluyentes, a hombres y mujeres trans. Juntos tenemos la oportunidad de demoler barreras, endulzando vidas y celebraciones. 

My passion for baking and the will to provide quality and fresh products it’s paired with the drive to offer dignified job opportunities, without discrimination, to Trans men and women. Together we have the chance to bring down walls, sweeting lives and celebrations.

El cambio puede venir de pequeñas acciones y gestos, y este proyecto está destinado a combinar la alegría de hornear con la necesidad de promover oportunidades. Con Sebastián, mi socio, hemos decidido lanzar este proyecto, esta empresa, este sueño. Nos emociona invitarte a ser parte de PETUNIA.   

Change can come from small actions and gestures, and this project is destined to combine the joy of baking with the need to promote opportunity. Alongside with Sebastian, my business partner, we have decided to launch this idea, this project, and this dream. We are excited to invite you to be a part of PETUNIA. 

We are both a social enterprise and a political statement.

Somos una empresa social y una afirmación política.

Estamos decididos a combatir la violencia y la discriminación dirigida a la población LGBTI, particularmente hacia las personas trans. Múltiples estudios e investigaciones señalan las grandes dificultades que tiene esta población para ser aceptada, las poquísimas oportunidades que tiene para encontrar un trabajo del que se sientan orgullosos, para mejorar sus condiciones económicas y para ser parte activa de la sociedad. Petunia es nuestra contribución para que esta situación cambie.   

We are determined to stand up against the violence and discrimination directed to LGBTI population, particularly toward Trans people. Several studies and investigations point at the overwhelming obstacles that this segment of the population faces in order to be accepted, the scarce dignified job opportunities, and their difficult economic and social conditions. Petunia is our contribution and effort to change this state of things. 

¡NECESITAMOS TU AYUDA! / WE NEED YOUR HELP!

Nuestro objetivo es recaudar $20.000 dólares para darle forma al proyecto y abrir nuestro primer taller de pastelería. Este será un espacio de inclusión, de diversidad y de encuentro donde cualquiera pueda pasar un rato ameno con una torta, un brownie y un buen café. Ofreceremos inicialmente trabajo y capacitación a tres personas trans, quienes trabajarán en la cocina y en atención al público. Si logramos recaudar $25.000 podremos adquirir nuestros propios hornos y ofrecer una experiencia más enriquecedora a nuestros clientes. 

Our goal is to raise $20.000 so our project comes to fruition, opening our first bakery shop. This will be a space for inclusion and diversity, where one and all can spend a pleasant time with a piece of cake, a brownie and a good coffee. We will initially train and hire three trans employees, whom will work in the kitchen and in customer service. However, if we can raise $25.000 we will be able to have our own ovens and offer an even more gratifying experience to our customers.

Tortas, cupcakes, galletas / Cakes, cupcakes, cookies

En nuestro menú tenemos tortas, galletas, brownies, cupcakes y cheesecakes. Hemos participado con éxito en varios matrimonios donde la torta de Petunia ha competido con la novia por las miradas. Algunas empresas interesadas en nuestro proyecto se han acercado para probar nuestros dulces productos.

We already have an established menu that includes cakes, cookies, brownies, cupcakes and cheesecakes. We have been part of marriage celebrations where the Petunia cake has almost out-shined the bride. Some companies that have shown interest in our project have already tasted our sweet products. We have some original items warming up in the oven! They will be revealed after our opening.

¿Por qué es importante? / Why it matters

Desde luego, por nuestro amor por la pastelería artesanal y la comida de calidad, por darle sabor a las tardes de lluvia y a las mañanas soleadas. Pero no solo por esto. Creemos con sinceridad que todos estamos en la capacidad (y en la obligación) de contribuir al mejoramiento de nuestro país, enfrentando la violencia,  la discriminación y el sufrimiento que muchos colombianos viven a diario. Este proyecto ayudará a fortalecer a la comunidad LGBTI y a promover el diálogo con otros grupos de nuestra sociedad. Proyectamos desarrollar nuestra idea a escala nacional y a asociarnos con otras empresas, grandes y pequeñas, con el fin de transformar preconceptos y ampliar el panorama de las estructuras sociales.

First of all, because we love artisanal baking and quality food; because all rainy afternoons and sunny Sunday mornings deserve a sweet bite. But this is not all. We sincerely believe that each one of us has the capacity (and obligation as well) to contribute to the betterment of our country, confronting the violence, the discrimination and the suffering that many Colombians suffer daily. This initiative will give strength to the LGBTI community and will promote dialogue with the other groups of our society. We aspire to develop this on a national scale and to partner with other companies, larger and smaller, looking to make a change in the way certain social structures are perceived. 

Metas e impacto / Goals and impact 

En el primer año nuestra meta es construir un equipo con al menos 3 trabajadores transgénero, a quienes ofreceremos un salario justo, entrenamiento y oportunidades para crecer más allá de Petunia. Luego de este periodo crucial y a través de alianzas e intercambio de experiencias, fomentaremos la implementación de políticas de trabajo incluyente para la población LGBTI, como parte de la responsabilidad social corporativa, de la igualdad de oportunidades y de la equidad de género. Los primeros 6 meses de trabajo estarán también enfocados en alcanzar la meta de rentabilidad. Tras 12 meses aspiramos que nuestros primeros empleados tengan excelentes ofertas laborales en compañías de primer nivel; así podremos renovar nuestra plantilla y continuar ofreciendo plazas de trabajo, entrenamiento, experiencia y sustento a nuevas personas. También habremos terminado de equipar nuestra propia cocina profesional y prepararemos el lanzamiento de otro punto de venta.

During our first year we aim at building up a team with at least 3 transgender employees, which will receive a fair wage, skill training and further employment possibilities beyond Petunia. After this crucial period and through strategic alliances and experience sharing with like-minded businesses, we will champion the implementation of inclusive work policies for the LGTBI population, as part of corporate social responsibility and gender equality. 

The first six months of work will be also focused on reaching profitability. After the first year, we hope to see top job offers flowing in for our first employees, paving the path for new Petunia staff. By that time our kitchen will be fully equipped, and our team will be ready to launch a second brick and mortar location.

Who are we? / ¿Quiénes somos?

ANDREA Y SEBASTIAN -¿Quiénes somos?

Nos conocimos en la Universidad en Bogotá, aunque ambos somos de otras ciudades. Somos profesionales en Gobierno y Relaciones Internacionales y después de 5 años de graduados seguimos comprometidos con nuestra amistad y con un grupo de valores que definen quienes somos: equidad, honestidad, solidaridad, respeto por la diversidad y esfuerzo en el trabajo. Guiados por este horizonte, elaboramos productos creativos y de excelente calidad, compramos a proveedores locales, entrenamos y empleamos a personas vulnerables. Hacemos nuestro mayor esfuerzo para construir una mejor comunidad.

We met at the Univiersity in Bogota – Colombia, although we are both from other parts of the country. We got our bachelors in Government and International Affairs, and 5 years after graduation we are still committed to our friendship and to a group of values which define who we are: equality, honesty, solidarity, respect of diversity, and the value of work. Guided by this north, we offer creative products of the best quality; we buy locally sourced fresh produce, we train and give jobs to those less advantaged. We are giving our best to build a better community. Help us ignite the flame and the world won’t stop us!

 

Andrea Suárez: Tengo 27 años y crecí en Pamplona, Norte de Santander. Me mudé a Bogotá para ir a la universidad y he trabajado en diferentes áreas desde que me gradué: en la Organización de Estados Americanos en República Dominicana, con la Estrategia Nacional para la atención Integral a la Primera Infancia –De Cero a Siempre-, proyectos con poblaciones vulnerables en el sur de Bogotá, un proyecto de reciclaje inclusivo con el gobierno nacional y algunas consultorías con el Centro Nacional de Memoria Histórica y el Banco Mundial. Actualmente soy estudiante de la Maestría en Estudios de género en la Universidad Nacional de Colombia. En mi tiempo libre soy voluntaria para jugar y leer con niñas y niños pequeños que viven en hogares, dedico tiempo a mi amado esposo y me gusta ver cualquier cosa que haya en Netflix. La astrología, los estudios de género y por supuesto hornear son mis más grandes pasiones.

I’m 27 years old and grew up in Pamplona, Norte de Santander. I moved to Bogotá for college and have worked in a few different fields since graduation: Organization of American States in Dominican Republic, National Strategy for Early Childhood, community-based projects for the reduction of violence and discrimination of marginalized populations in the south of Bogota, a project for inclusive recycling at the national level and a few consultancies with the World Bank and The National Center for Historical Memory. I am currently a master’s candidate in Gender studies at the National University in Bogota. In my free time I volunteer to play with and read stories to small children in foster care, spend time with my amazing husband and watch pretty much anything on Netflix. Astrology, gender studies and of course baking are my biggest passions.

  

Sebastián Uribe: Aunque nunca he horneado un ponqué, traigo conmigo mucha experiencia e ideas de negocio. Estoy a cargo de traer este proyecto a la vida, construyendo un plan de negocios sostenible para nuestra pequeña empresa. Vengo de Medellín, Colombia, y tengo 27 años. Conocí a Andrea cuando comenzamos a estudiar juntos en la Universidad Externado de Colombia, hace más de 10 años. Justo después de mi graduación me mudé a París, donde estudié y trabajé un poco en política. Luego hice un posgrado en Bordeaux, donde recibí un título de maestría en Asuntos Políticos. Ahora trabajo en la industria del turismo y vivo en México pero viajo frecuentemente a Esados Unidos. Además, hago parte del Comité Internacional para recaudar fondos para los Hogares Bambi, una organización sin ánimo de lucro que provee apoyo a cientos de niños en Colombia. Vivo con mi novio hace 5 años y juntos estamos criando dos niños maravillosos. Mis pasiones son viajar, la política y la literatura.

Although I have never baked a cake, I bring with me a lot of business experience and ideas. I have been charged with bringing this project to life, putting together a sustainable business plan for our small company.  I come from Medellin, Colombia and I am 27 years old. I met Andrea when we began the same studies at Universidad Externado de Colombia more than 10 years ago. Right after college I moved to Paris where I studied and did some work in politics. I then went into graduate school in Bordeaux where I received a master’s degree in International Affairs. I currently work in the travel industry and live in Mexico but travel often to the US.  Additionally, I sit on the board of the international fundraising committee of Bambi Homes, a non-profit organization that supports hundreds of children in Colombia. I live with my boyfriend of 5 years and together we are raising two wonderful boys.  My passions are traveling, politics and literature.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Special thanks / Agradecimientos especiales

We want to thank the people around us who have made this possible: our amazing partners in life Kevin and Juan Felipe, Juan Carlos Gutiérrez who is the brilliant mind behind our logo and new image and Javier Hidalgo who has walked us through the process of this campaign and is now our friend. Special thanks to María Fernanda Gutiérrez, who we are excited to announce is the first person to join our team.

Queremos agradecer a las personas a nuestro alrededor que han hecho esto posible: nuestros increíbles compañeros de vida Kevin y JuanFe, a Juan Carlos Gutiérrez quien es la mente brillante detrás de nuestro logo y nueva imagen, y Javier Hidalgo quien nos ha acompañado en el proceso de crear esta campaña y se ha convertido en nuestro amigo. Un agradecimiento especial a María Fernanda Gutiérrez, a quien con mucha emoción anunciamos como la primera integrante de nuestro equipo.
story_txt:
Petunia es un nombre lleno de esperanza, de añoranza y de amor. Era el nombre del cachorro que mi hermana nunca llegó a tener; el de la tradición de hornear en familia, entre una nieta y su abuela; también es un símbolo de inclusión, de una sociedad en la que todos tienen lugar.    
Petunia is a name full of hope, longing and love. It was the name of the puppy my sister never had; that of a family baking tradition, between a grand daughter and her grandma; it is also a symbol of inclusiveness, of a society open to each and every one.
Mi pasión por hornear, por brindar productos frescos y de calidad, se une con la determinación de ofrecer oportunidades de trabajo dignas, no excluyentes, a hombres y mujeres trans. Juntos tenemos la oportunidad de demoler barreras, endulzando vidas y celebraciones. 
My passion for baking and the will to provide quality and fresh products it’s paired with the drive to offer dignified job opportunities, without discrimination, to Trans men and women. Together we have the chance to bring down walls, sweeting lives and celebrations.
El cambio puede venir de pequeñas acciones y gestos, y este proyecto está destinado a combinar la alegría de hornear con la necesidad de promover oportunidades. Con Sebastián, mi socio, hemos decidido lanzar este proyecto, esta empresa, este sueño. Nos emociona invitarte a ser parte de PETUNIA.   
Change can come from small actions and gestures, and this project is destined to combine the joy of baking with the need to promote opportunity. Alongside with Sebastian, my business partner, we have decided to launch this idea, this project, and this dream. We are excited to invite you to be a part of PETUNIA. 
We are both a social enterprise and a political statement.
Somos una empresa social y una afirmación política.

Estamos decididos a combatir la violencia y la discriminación dirigida a la población LGBTI, particularmente hacia las personas trans. Múltiples estudios e investigaciones señalan las grandes dificultades que tiene esta población para ser aceptada, las poquísimas oportunidades que tiene para encontrar un trabajo del que se sientan orgullosos, para mejorar sus condiciones económicas y para ser parte activa de la sociedad. Petunia es nuestra contribución para que esta situación cambie.   
We are determined to stand up against the violence and discrimination directed to LGBTI population, particularly toward Trans people. Several studies and investigations point at the overwhelming obstacles that this segment of the population faces in order to be accepted, the scarce dignified job opportunities, and their difficult economic and social conditions. Petunia is our contribution and effort to change this state of things. 
¡NECESITAMOS TU AYUDA! / WE NEED YOUR HELP!
Nuestro objetivo es recaudar $20.000 dólares para darle forma al proyecto y abrir nuestro primer taller de pastelería. Este será un espacio de inclusión, de diversidad y de encuentro donde cualquiera pueda pasar un rato ameno con una torta, un brownie y un buen café. Ofreceremos inicialmente trabajo y capacitación a tres personas trans, quienes trabajarán en la cocina y en atención al público. Si logramos recaudar $25.000 podremos adquirir nuestros propios hornos y ofrecer una experiencia más enriquecedora a nuestros clientes. 
Our goal is to raise $20.000 so our project comes to fruition, opening our first bakery shop. This will be a space for inclusion and diversity, where one and all can spend a pleasant time with a piece of cake, a brownie and a good coffee. We will initially train and hire three trans employees, whom will work in the kitchen and in customer service. However, if we can raise $25.000 we will be able to have our own ovens and offer an even more gratifying experience to our customers.

Tortas, cupcakes, galletas / Cakes, cupcakes, cookies
En nuestro menú tenemos tortas, galletas, brownies, cupcakes y cheesecakes. Hemos participado con éxito en varios matrimonios donde la torta de Petunia ha competido con la novia por las miradas. Algunas empresas interesadas en nuestro proyecto se han acercado para probar nuestros dulces productos.
We already have an established menu that includes cakes, cookies, brownies, cupcakes and cheesecakes. We have been part of marriage celebrations where the Petunia cake has almost out-shined the bride. Some companies that have shown interest in our project have already tasted our sweet products. We have some original items warming up in the oven! They will be revealed after our opening.
¿Por qué es importante? / Why it matters
Desde luego, por nuestro amor por la pastelería artesanal y la comida de calidad, por darle sabor a las tardes de lluvia y a las mañanas soleadas. Pero no solo por esto. Creemos con sinceridad que todos estamos en la capacidad (y en la obligación) de contribuir al mejoramiento de nuestro país, enfrentando la violencia,  la discriminación y el sufrimiento que muchos colombianos viven a diario. Este proyecto ayudará a fortalecer a la comunidad LGBTI y a promover el diálogo con otros grupos de nuestra sociedad. Proyectamos desarrollar nuestra idea a escala nacional y a asociarnos con otras empresas, grandes y pequeñas, con el fin de transformar preconceptos y ampliar el panorama de las estructuras sociales.
First of all, because we love artisanal baking and quality food; because all rainy afternoons and sunny Sunday mornings deserve a sweet bite. But this is not all. We sincerely believe that each one of us has the capacity (and obligation as well) to contribute to the betterment of our country, confronting the violence, the discrimination and the suffering that many Colombians suffer daily. This initiative will give strength to the LGBTI community and will promote dialogue with the other groups of our society. We aspire to develop this on a national scale and to partner with other companies, larger and smaller, looking to make a change in the way certain social structures are perceived. 
Metas e impacto / Goals and impact 
En el primer año nuestra meta es construir un equipo con al menos 3 trabajadores transgénero, a quienes ofreceremos un salario justo, entrenamiento y oportunidades para crecer más allá de Petunia. Luego de este periodo crucial y a través de alianzas e intercambio de experiencias, fomentaremos la implementación de políticas de trabajo incluyente para la población LGBTI, como parte de la responsabilidad social corporativa, de la igualdad de oportunidades y de la equidad de género. Los primeros 6 meses de trabajo estarán también enfocados en alcanzar la meta de rentabilidad. Tras 12 meses aspiramos que nuestros primeros empleados tengan excelentes ofertas laborales en compañías de primer nivel; así podremos renovar nuestra plantilla y continuar ofreciendo plazas de trabajo, entrenamiento, experiencia y sustento a nuevas personas. También habremos terminado de equipar nuestra propia cocina profesional y prepararemos el lanzamiento de otro punto de venta.
During our first year we aim at building up a team with at least 3 transgender employees, which will receive a fair wage, skill training and further employment possibilities beyond Petunia. After this crucial period and through strategic alliances and experience sharing with like-minded businesses, we will champion the implementation of inclusive work policies for the LGTBI population, as part of corporate social responsibility and gender equality. 
The first six months of work will be also focused on reaching profitability. After the first year, we hope to see top job offers flowing in for our first employees, paving the path for new Petunia staff. By that time our kitchen will be fully equipped, and our team will be ready to launch a second brick and mortar location.

Who are we? / ¿Quiénes somos?
ANDREA Y SEBASTIAN -¿Quiénes somos?
Nos conocimos en la Universidad en Bogotá, aunque ambos somos de otras ciudades. Somos profesionales en Gobierno y Relaciones Internacionales y después de 5 años de graduados seguimos comprometidos con nuestra amistad y con un grupo de valores que definen quienes somos: equidad, honestidad, solidaridad, respeto por la diversidad y esfuerzo en el trabajo. Guiados por este horizonte, elaboramos productos creativos y de excelente calidad, compramos a proveedores locales, entrenamos y empleamos a personas vulnerables. Hacemos nuestro mayor esfuerzo para construir una mejor comunidad.
We met at the Univiersity in Bogota – Colombia, although we are both from other parts of the country. We got our bachelors in Government and International Affairs, and 5 years after graduation we are still committed to our friendship and to a group of values which define who we are: equality, honesty, solidarity, respect of diversity, and the value of work. Guided by this north, we offer creative products of the best quality; we buy locally sourced fresh produce, we train and give jobs to those less advantaged. We are giving our best to build a better community. Help us ignite the flame and the world won’t stop us!
 

Andrea Suárez: Tengo 27 años y crecí en Pamplona, Norte de Santander. Me mudé a Bogotá para ir a la universidad y he trabajado en diferentes áreas desde que me gradué: en la Organización de Estados Americanos en República Dominicana, con la Estrategia Nacional para la atención Integral a la Primera Infancia –De Cero a Siempre-, proyectos con poblaciones vulnerables en el sur de Bogotá, un proyecto de reciclaje inclusivo con el gobierno nacional y algunas consultorías con el Centro Nacional de Memoria Histórica y el Banco Mundial. Actualmente soy estudiante de la Maestría en Estudios de género en la Universidad Nacional de Colombia. En mi tiempo libre soy voluntaria para jugar y leer con niñas y niños pequeños que viven en hogares, dedico tiempo a mi amado esposo y me gusta ver cualquier cosa que haya en Netflix. story:
Help us open HeartBeet Organic Superfoods Cafe in West Seattle

My name is Monika Kinsman and I'm the founder of HeartBeet Organic Superfoods Cafe located in the Roosevelt neighborhood of Seattle.  We've been open since 2008, and have served hundreds of thousands of customers our delicious smoothies, fresh juices, delectable grain bowls, salads, and specialty pies. We use only the freshest organic, gluten-free and dairy-free ingredients and we don't use ovens or microwaves because our food is ALIVE!  Customers always tell us how they leave our cafe feeling healthier and more vibrant. 

Our mission is to get America hooked on superfoods and it's been my dream to open more locations.  The opportunity has come to open a second location in the awesome community of West Seattle!  We have secured a lease at one of the new developments on Fauntleroy, but we need your help raising money for finishing the buildout, kitchen equipment, and working capital.

Why open in West Seattle?

We love West Seattle!   My wife and I are raising our family here, who attend Louisa Boren STEM K-8.  We could not be happier with the supportive community and beautiful ammenties of West Seattle.  With Alki Beach, yummy restaurants, quirky bars, gorgeous parks, amazing views of Puget Sound, and the community of families and friends... what's not to love about West Seattle?

We have a unique opportunity with a VERY supportive local landlord (a good neighbor) who really wants us to occupy this location which will be next to a yoga/barre studio and a wellness clinic.  Having HeartBeet Cafe there just makes sense!  There are not many quick serve healthy options in West Seattle, so we strongly believe this location will do well.  We tried to obtain funding through the Small Business Administration (SBA) and several banks, without success.   Most banks don't typically lend money for startup restaurants, and we don't have enough cash on hand to take advantage of this opportunity on our own.  We have about 20 days left to raise the money to make this location work.  If we don't raise the money soon, unfortunately, this location won't happen.

How YOU Can Help!

Whether you've been a long time fan of HeartBeet Cafe or you're a West Seattle resident who wants to see something like this in your community, YOU can help!  We need to raise $180,000 to help us purchase kitchen equipment, help finish the build out portion of the cafe, and working capital to open in January of 2018.  Whether it's $10, $1,000, or anywhere in between, we could use your help in raising the money needed to reach our goal and spreading the word about our mission.

All the Value is Returned to you!

Although Indiegogo is framed as a donation-style campaign, you actually get the full value (and in some cases, a greater value) than what you put in.  You pre-purchasing a $100 gift card now, for example, helps us gather the cash we need to open, and at the same time, you get to spend that $100 in return at a later date.

 

Risks & Challenges

This campaign has an audacious, lofty goal.  There is a big risk that we won't secure all of the funding that we need, and if we aren't close to our goal, we won't be able to open.  However, if you're considering contributing to this campaign, don't wait!  We want to see early success in the campaign and know that progress will encourage others to follow-suit and contribute.  And like it said in the previous paragraph, all the money you put in comes back to you in rewards that you can use at our Roosevelt location, so you really won't be out if we don't make it.

If we do not meet our goal, we will use the funding that we raised during this campaign to reduce our debt load and hopefully make ourselves more "bankable" in the future -- meaning, any amount of debt reduction that we can do, will help our case with banks and credit unions moving forward, so we can go back to them down the road and reapply for funding at a later time.

Thank You

Thank you for taking the time to learn more about our campaign and hope you will share this with your family and friends.  Thank you to the loyal HeartBeet Cafe customers who have helped our Roosevelt location thrive.   And thank you to the community of West Seattle for supporting our family and our vision and for just being super awesome!  Please help to share our campaign far and wide.

Thank you in advance for making our dream a reality by giving West Seattle Real Food That Loves You Back!

story:
Serving our Community

Over twenty five years ago, we began “making ripples” in our community. We began as a small martial arts school, and over time grew both in members and impact. We supported charities and community events, developed enrichment programs for the local schools, raised over $25,000 for local and national charities, and donated our time and materials to thousands of classrooms.

As time went by, we realized that we could make so much more of an impact if we were no longer limited to teaching only martial arts. Through the years, we had been researching and developing a learning system that would allow any teacher to teach ANYTHING. We tested it through the martial arts, then applied to to everything from breakdancing, to painting, to science experiments. And it worked! And so, Questers’ Way was born.

We opened our beautiful, 16,000 square foot facility just over two years ago. Since that time, guests of all ages have learned new skills like ballet and creative writing. They’ve made new friends through our Game On! programs. We have on-site game masters facilitating everything from Dungeons and Dragons expeditions to table top game design classes. We teach music lessons, martial arts (of course), and so much more.

We've taught the value of healthy eating through our cafe. We offer everything from macro-nutrient balanced meals to delicious fruit smoothies. Both kids and adults had felt the impact of choosing to eat simple, tasty, real food.

We’ve hosted over 400 no-mess no-stress birthday parties for friends and families. We've had thousands of kids play in our indoor park. New friendships have been made, and long time friends have found a safe gathering place for their children while they relax and catch up over a cup of coffee.

This place is awesome, and we are working on securing partnerships to help us begin building more centers throughout the country. We have many developers - especially for mall properties - who are very excited to see our concept brought to their communities.

The Challenges

Our center is located in an area of Connecticut known as the “the last green valley”. Over 77% of this 700,000 acre area is forest and farmland. We decided it was important to open our first center in our hometown, however the lack of population and low economics of this area located in a struggling state have made it difficult to make the bend financially.

Many delays in the building of the center along with several unexpected obstacles along the way have left us needing to raise additional operating capital as we enter the slower summer season. We have had so much support and enthusiasm from so many people, and we just need a little boost to get us over this last hump. People are driving from over an hour away to visit our center…it is truly a special place!

Our goal is to serve the community and this center is very close to being financially sustainable. The purpose of our campaign is to help us raise some “over the hump” funds by showcasing some of the things that make our center so unique. We are so incredibly thankful for all of the wonderful experiences we’ve shared with so many over these first two years.

Our Goal

200 local kids experiencing an awesome summer of fun and learning. That’s our goal with this campaign. There are so many families in our community who could benefit from what we do and are unable to afford it. For every $300 we raise, a child will receive over 30 hours of amazing classes, projects, friends and fun. We’ll even be able to provide healthy snacks and meals for them.

We set our goal high because we know how many kids could benefit from our center’s awesomeness. However, whatever we raise will immediately turn into programs for as many kids as possible.

Let's Make It Fun!

We have some awesome perks for you! Every contribution will get you a shout-out from our silly, quirky, highly creative team (who all LOVE what they do…and it will show when they thank you for your generosity). Higher level contributions will result in an absolutely amazing experience for you and a group of your friends and family. We will absolutely spoil you and your group with an experience of your choice. From a D & D adventure to a Candlelight Cafe experience, we’ll give you a day you won’t forget.

The Impact: A Love of Learning

There is nothing that can change a life for the better like a love of learning. What becomes possible when a child falls in love with their ability to learn new things? What becomes possible when they believe that they can grow as a person through their own efforts and interests? That’s what Questers’ Way is all about.

We’re here, and we’re ready to make a difference. This is only the first of many centers to come. We are actively working with developers to begin building more center as soon as the end of this year. Your contribution will not only help our local families, it will serve to demonstrate the support we have from people like you to see us bring Questers’ Way to the world.

We already have so many stories. From the two moms who talked for hours screen-free while their kids played in the park, to the thousands of students who have been bused to the center for the enrichment programs that we provide free of charge, we’ve already made quite an impact. Check out our Facebook page and scroll through the timeline. We dare you to find a face that isn’t smiling!

Other Ways to Help:

There are lots of ways you can support the center and its mission even if you can't contribute to this campaign:

  • Share this campaign on social media
  • Like us on Facebook (facebook.com/questersway)
  • Come enjoy a meal in Crossroads Cafe
  • Try a class
  • Tell everyone you know about this hidden gem of Northeastern CT :)
story_txt:
Serving our Community
Over twenty five years ago, we began “making ripples” in our community. We began as a small martial arts school, and over time grew both in members and impact. We supported charities and community events, developed enrichment programs for the local schools, raised over $25,000 for local and national charities, and donated our time and materials to thousands of classrooms.
As time went by, we realized that we could make so much more of an impact if we were no longer limited to teaching only martial arts. Through the years, we had been researching and developing a learning system that would allow any teacher to teach ANYTHING. We tested it through the martial arts, then applied to to everything from breakdancing, to painting, to science experiments. And it worked! And so, Questers’ Way was born.

We opened our beautiful, 16,000 square foot facility just over two years ago. Since that time, guests of all ages have learned new skills like ballet and creative writing. They’ve made new friends through our Game On! programs. We have on-site game masters facilitating everything from Dungeons and Dragons expeditions to table top game design classes. We teach music lessons, martial arts (of course), and so much more.

We've taught the value of healthy eating through our cafe. We offer everything from macro-nutrient balanced meals to delicious fruit smoothies. Both kids and adults had felt the impact of choosing to eat simple, tasty, real food.
We’ve hosted over 400 no-mess no-stress birthday parties for friends and families. We've had thousands of kids play in our indoor park. New friendships have been made, and long time friends have found a safe gathering place for their children while they relax and catch up over a cup of coffee.

This place is awesome, and we are working on securing partnerships to help us begin building more centers throughout the country. We have many developers - especially for mall properties - who are very excited to see our concept brought to their communities.

The Challenges
Our center is located in an area of Connecticut known as the “the last green valley”. Over 77% of this 700,000 acre area is forest and farmland. We decided it was important to open our first center in our hometown, however the lack of population and low economics of this area located in a struggling state have made it difficult to make the bend financially.
Many delays in the building of the center along with several unexpected obstacles along the way have left us needing to raise additional operating capital as we enter the slower summer season. We have had so much support and enthusiasm from so many people, and we just need a little boost to get us over this last hump. People are driving from over an hour away to visit our center…it is truly a special place!
Our goal is to serve the community and this center is very close to being financially sustainable. The purpose of our campaign is to help us raise some “over the hump” funds by showcasing some of the things that make our center so unique. We are so incredibly thankful for all of the wonderful experiences we’ve shared with so many over these first two years.

Our Goal
200 local kids experiencing an awesome summer of fun and learning. That’s our goal with this campaign. There are so many families in our community who could benefit from what we do and are unable to afford it. For every $300 we raise, a child will receive over 30 hours of amazing classes, projects, friends and fun. We’ll even be able to provide healthy snacks and meals for them.
We set our goal high because we know how many kids could benefit from our center’s awesomeness. However, whatever we raise will immediately turn into programs for as many kids as possible.


Let's Make It Fun!
We have some awesome perks for you! Every contribution will get you a shout-out from our silly, quirky, highly creative team (who all LOVE what they do…and it will show when they thank you for your generosity). Higher level contributions will result in an absolutely amazing experience for you and a group of your friends and family. We will absolutely spoil you and your group with an experience of your choice. From a D & D adventure to a Candlelight Cafe experience, we’ll give you a day you won’t forget.


The Impact: A Love of Learning
There is nothing that can change a life for the better like a love of learning. What becomes possible when a child falls in love with their ability to learn new things? What becomes possible when they believe that they can grow as a person through their own efforts and interests? That’s what Questers’ Way is all about.
We’re here, and we’re ready to make a difference. This is only the first of many centers to come. We are actively working with developers to begin building more center as soon as the end of this year. Your contribution will not only help our local families, it will serve to demonstrate the support we have from people like you to see us bring Questers’ Way to the world.
We already have so many stories. From the two moms who talked for hours screen-free while their kids played in the park, to the thousands of students who have been bused to the center for the enrichment programs that we provide free of charge, we’ve already made quite an impact. Check out our Facebook page and scroll through the timeline. We dare you to find a face that isn’t smiling!

Other Ways to Help:
There are lots of ways you can support the center and its mission even if you can't contribute to this campaign:

Share this campaign on social media

Like us on Facebook (facebook.com/questersway)
Come enjoy a meal in Crossroads Cafe
Try a class
Tell everyone you know about this hidden gem of Northeastern CT :)

story:
Volumes Bookcafe opened in March 2016 with the goal of providing the Wicker Park neighborhood with a bookstore & cafe that would provide endless literary and community events. We've done that! We need your help to keep things going.

WHO WE ARE

Volumes was built by two sisters, Kimberly & Rebecca. We are both former Chicago teachers who are fiercely dedicated to promoting literacy in our community.

We started this business on a bootstrap budget & built most of it with our bare hands. However, those unexpected costs from opening the store are now holding us back from allowing us to be the best bookstore we can be.

Supporting an independent bookstore helps your community in a number of ways:

  • The money spent in an indie neighborhood bookstore stays in the neighborhood.
  • Each year we support schools & a variety of foundations and charitable organizations. Helping us allows us to help others.
  • Supporting an independent bookstore means more literary & arts events in your neighborhood. We offer close to 300 FREE events each year.
  • Independent bookstores support local authors & artists! Close to half of all of our author events are either for a local author or involve a local author/writer/poet/dreamer. We love our locals.

Our authors love us too! For this campaign we are incredibly thankful to have received help from: Rebecca Makkai, Jac Jemc, Kathleen Rooney, Martin Seay, Giano Cromley, Alex Higley, Zoe Zolbrod, Charles Finch, Michael Moreci, Kim Brooks, Mary Robinette Kowal, Kevin Coval, Lori Rader-Day, Megan Stielstra, Rachel Ruiz, Kelly O'Connor McNees, Paulette Livers, Ben Tanzer, Kristin Iskandrian, Abby Geni, Eve Ewing, Christine Sneed, Aviya Kushner, Maryse Meijer, Alex Higley, Lindsay Hunter, Gint Aras, Metropolis Coffee, Coffee House Press, Graywolf Press and SO MANY MORE! 

What We Need & What You Get

In order for us to continue to bring the unique programming to the community and keep our bookstore running another year, we need help. We need at least $60k to pay off some debt so that we can keep going. A bookstore is a nickel by nickel/razor thin-margin business. We can't survive if all of our money is not being invested in the business. We need to move forward. We need your help to make that happen. We are fortunate to have an amazing team of supporters helping with this campaign to make your contribution doubly worth it.

We need your contributions to help pay off the excessive debt we took on to tackle the unexpected add-ons the city required when we opened. It has been very difficult to run a successful bookstore with a functioning cash flow when we have a great deal of $ paying off space improvements. This also helps to pay back our amazing landlord, who has helped in the first two years of our opening. Our debt is hurting our ability to function. We really need help moving forward if we're going to stay open.

We are very lucky that we have a fantastic team of authors, community members, vendors and publishers that are supporting our campaign with perk donations. You can get anything from an enamel pin and a handwritten thank you, to a book club package where the author visits your book club! Get your name in a book! Get a writing consultation. Get some Volumes Swag!

Also, we are launching our first anthology - and it's going to be BOOKSTORE EROTICA (In bold because we think this is pretty awesome). We'll have brand new contributions from the likes of Charles Finch, Rebecca Makkai, Maryse Meijer, C. Russ Price, Kathleen Rooney and MANY MANY MORE (Seriously, though - the list is growing every day)!

EVERYONE who donates/shares is invited to our birthday party on March 24th! It's a Perks Party! We will have your perks available for pick-up (if you so desire) as well as stories, music & treats!

If we don't reach the final goal, the funds will still go towards paying this debt and will be enormously helpful.

If we get more than the final goal, the money will be invested in inventory and community events for years to come.

 

The Impact

Independent bookstores epitomize the community value of independent small businesses.

Helping us will help to:

  • Continue to provide a safe space for writers & readers.
  • We provide twice weekly story times for children, author school visits, school book fairs, & book donations for the schools in our neighborhood and in the surrounding communities.
  • We provide close to 300 events each year. 99% of these events are FREE and open to the public. We would love to expand our reach to offer even more!

Risks & Challenges

We realize that this doesn't solve every problem - running a small business is no easy thing. We've learned a lot in the last two years, and we now have the data to plan efficiently as the years progress. The good news is, we are growing bit by bit.

  • We have a new accountant and finance team that are helping us to pinch every penny so that we can run the most efficient bookstore we can.
  • We’re applying for grants to help aid in the number of programs we offer to the community at large.
  • We plan on hosting a once-a-year super amazing spectacular ticketed fundraising show to help offset our event hosting costs.
  • We want to open the store to more full-store rentals for private events.

We will be starting a CSB program (Community Supported Bookstore - much like a farming CSA) where customers can basically start a tab with the store - and receive an extra 5% off their purchases. In other words, pay something like $200 up front - we’ll keep that $200 in our system for you to use. This helps bookstores during the slow months!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Share our campaign! If ten people contribute from your share, we will give you a $10 gift card to Volumes. This must be done using the indiegogo share tools - so we can track it!

Continue shopping with us! We are so grateful to our customers, and seeing your faces in our store is always a treat. We get to fall in love with book loving people every day. We hope to do that until the end of time.

story:
WHO DOESN'T LOVE SHOPPING!  

AND IF YOU LOVE SHOPPING - YOU LOVE A DEAL!  

WELL, HERE IT IS - THE COUPON-A-TRON WILL BE IN SHOPPING MALLS AND GIVE COUPONS FOR THE STORES YOU ARE GOING TO ANYWAY!

Who am I?

My name is Don Haese and I’m the founder and president of Mall Media, Inc. and the inventor and developer of the Coupon-A-Tron system for increasing the store traffic and sales of major mall retailers.

The Company’s self-service, automated Coupon-A-Tron kiosk systems will be located inside the main entrances to major malls, the choke points where shopper foot traffic is most concentrated.  They will continuously deliver fresh, rotating coupons, special offers and video ad messages to the shoppers in the mall only from the merchants in that mall.


How it works

Shoppers pull coupons as they enter the mall and are also counted as impressions for the advertiser whose video ad is playing on the screen as they are present in the viewing cone of the screen.  Their presence in the mall defines them as being in a buying frame of mind and makes them more likely to act on a store’s offer.

The big advantage to advertisers.

We deliver coupons and video impressions to shoppers when they are only a couple hundred feet from the door of the retailers whose ad they’ve seen and are almost certainly in a shopping frame of mind.  These are big advantages for mall advertisers.

I have put into this project around $80,000 and 3,000 hours over 2 ½ years, to get us to the point where we have a working prototype ready to install and plan to open our first location around February 1, 2015.

Why am I here?

We are here raising funds because it’s our belief that once Retail Marketing Managers see how the COUPON-A-TRON units can increase sales, they are going to demand them in all of the malls that their stores are located. We will need funds in reserve to purchase additional units to meet the demand. 

I have to confess that when I first heard of cause-based crowd funding, I was skeptical at best as to what it was that we could come up with that would be a meaningful enough of a reward to motivate people to join us.  It took a while, but my team and I have come up with a plan that we think will motivate you to donate.

THE MALL MEDIA CHARITY INITIATIVE

No matter if you donate $1.00 or $10,000 - we will distribute coupons for you for your friends and neighbors to donate to charitable organizations.

For the highest denomination contribution of $10,000, I’ll give 50,000 coupon distributions (retail value $30,000) and 500,000 video impressions (retail value $12,500) to your choice of one of the 4 national charities we currently support…IN YOUR NAME. 

Other rewards for other denominations are as follows:


How can we do this?

It is the nature of our business model to have excess, unsold coupon or video ad slots every month.

Our business model is based on 25% of our coupon capacity being sold and only 60% of our total video capacity being sold, leaving large excesses of unused coupons that are wasted like empty hotel rooms or airline seats when they’re not sold.  We concluded that the best thing for us to do with them was to give them to charity to help raise funds.

Here’s an example of the coupon; the video ad will have the same information and image.

Currently, we have the following charities in this program:

Susan G. Komen Breast Cancer Research

Muscular Dystrophy Association

St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital

Autism Speaks

Other charities can apply for inclusion in this initiative by calling Don Haese at 954-336-3772.

By the time the machines are installed, there will be a link at www.mallmediainc.com which will be the contributor’s personalized pledge page from where the charity donor gets forwarded directly to the donation page of the charity.  The donation pledges will be made directly at the charity organization's website.

Rose Lawless of West Palm Beach, FL

sincerely thanks you for your contribution today to:

St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital

As soon as you select a pledge amount, we will forward you to the contribution page where you can easily make your donation directly.

_____  $10

_____  $20

_____  $50

_____  $100

_____  More

_____  Monthly pledge


A New and Unique Marketing Tool For Mall Merchants

The Coupon-A-Tron unit allows mall merchants to distribute their coupon offers to their most qualified market segment in a fast, efficient and economical way.

EASY - Coupons are submitted by the merchant through a simple online interface to the system with a user-driven and user-friendly software where advertisers can enter their existing in-store coupons which can be inserted into software coupon slots, or they can choose from coupon templates offered in the software.

EFFICIENT - Merchants have flexibility to remotely control amount, terms or expiration dates, run daily or hourly specials or blowouts, immediately cancel coupons on sold-out merchandise, instantly sweeten the offer if the coupon is not performing and quickly turn overstocks or closeouts into cash.  The merchant receives fast marketing feedback to quickly compare offers or campaigns.

ECONOMICAL - Merchants pay only for ads that are seen by their best prospects. Most ad media charge rates are based on the number of people who could see your ad, not by the number who have been proven to actually see it. 

With Coupon-A-Tron, 100% of coupon ads are delivered “in hand” every time, guaranteeing that merchant advertisers get what they pay for.

WHY ADVERTISERS SHOULD PRE-BUY COUPON SLOTS?

We also want to introduce our systems to marketing managers of major mall retailers, so we are extending the charity program to include an attractive program for retailers.  Here is our offer:

If an advertiser purchases two ad units (5,000 coupons each) at $3,000 each unit for a total of $6,000 any time before we open our first system in a mall, we will donate 15,000 coupon distributions (retail value $9,000) and 150,000 video impressions (retail value $3,750) to the selected charity of their choice.

Marketing managers will want to ensure that their store is represented in the COUPON-A-TRON - there are only 8 slots available per machine.

For answers to questions or more information, please contact:

Don Haese  Tel:  954-336-3772.  Email:  don.haese@gmail.com

TESTIMONIALS

“Cool concept"  Heather Lang
Senior VP Associate Media Grp Director, Eicoff Agency, Chicago

"The ease of use for those that aren’t as gifted with scanning QR codes or researching coupons on their smart phones is a great feature." 

Kimberly Swain,  Account Manager BFW advertising + interactive

“In the retail shopping environment, there are endless strategies, insights and opinions about effectiveness, behavior and so on—and most are up for debate.  But two facts seem to hold true across the board: people want to save money and they want it to be easy.  Coupon-a-Tron delivers on both benefits.  It’s not complicated.  Walk up, take a sheet of coupons, save money. It’s hard to think of any logical reason why a consumer would not use this device.”

Paul C. Amelchenko, Associate Creative Director, Sapient Nitro

Former Faculty Member, University of Miami – School of Communication

Management Team

To execute its Plan and deliver profits to its shareholders, the Company has formed a nucleolus of professional and competent people who are outstanding in their respective areas of expertise and are enthusiastic to be part of the team assembled to develop the concept into a profitable business.

Don Haese, President & Chief Business Development Officer

Ralph Clements, Vice-President & Chief Technology Officer

Xin Wei (Diana Clements), Vice-President and Chief IT Officer

Barbara Pope, Vice-President & Media Consultant

Duran Schmidt, Manager of Kiosk Maintenance

Sandra Slemp,  Secretary of the Corporation

OF COUNSEL, Robert C. Curfiss

Rose Lawless, Marketing Specialist

Job creation

We estimate the following jobs will be created in the first 5 years of the Company's operations as described in its Business Plan:

                                                 Y1  Y2  Y3  Y4  Y5

  No. jobs (employees)           4    8   16   32  64

Innovation/Technology

The Company has created a unique, patent-pending, in-mall kiosk advertisement delivery system using many US-manufactured OEM components.  A U.S. patent application, #62041636, was filed on August 25, 2014.  The design allows us to deliver guaranteed, measurable ad impressions, something few other media can offer, and those aren't located in the mall where the shoppers are, a huge advertising advantage.

Our system delivers printed coupons; guaranteed, counted screen impressions; and a combination of the two for a 1-2 punch that will allow mall merchant advertisers have never had before.  Measurable impressions is a tool retail marketing managers have never had before. They also get broad flexibility and new in-mall metrics previously unavailable to them to increase their efficiency and lower cost.

Advertiser benefits

Coupons are guaranteed to be "eyeballs-on-ads" or "ads-in-hand" and impressions are guaranteed to have occurred making for efficient use of an advertiser's marketing dollars.  The Company's systems will allow advertisers to more clearly see their actual cost, compelling other in-mall media to abandon ambiguous pricing and vague traffic estimates.  This should lead to more in-mall media competition leading to lower prices for advertisers.

Consumer benefits

The system creates a broader, timelier, more convenient and simple way distributing money-saving coupons, ad messages and impressions allowing consumers to be exposed to much more savings opportunities. Our units will deliver over 5,000,000 money-saving coupon offers to shoppers in malls in our first year for an estimated $1,500,000 in consumer savings and in our 2nd year over $5,000,000 in consumer savings.

Public service

A number of coupon slots (there are 8 on a coupon sheet) will be set aside for public service announcements, security announcements, amber alerts, etc.  Similarly, a number of video ad time slots will also be set aside for public announcements, security announcements, amber alerts. 

Coupon-A-Tron Campaigns Increase Sales, Save Time, Money And Are More Efficient.

Increase sales by:

·  Drawing more mall traffic into your store

·  Beating the competition to first-buyers of new launch products

·  Identifying most effective offers, discounts and products in short time frame

·  Building  urgency into your "sale" campaigns

·  Making ads in other media pull stronger with incentive of valuable Coupon-A-Tron coupon book or special offer available only at Coupon-A-Tron in mall

·  Creating unique coupons and special offers focused narrowly on drawing the shopper the last 300 feet from the Coupon-A-Tron unit into the store.

Save time and money by:

·  Achieving higher redemption rates through rapid offer-testing

·  Quickly identifying non-selling offers

·  Testing small in real time before committing big dollars to other media in  major campaigns

·  Liquidating unwanted inventory in days, not weeks

Get more efficiency by:

·  Achieving higher redemption rates through rapid offer-testing

·  Offering a more convenient, streamlined, in-mall method for shoppers to receive your coupons

·  Delivering them while shopper is already in the mall

·  Obtaining 100% delivery of ad messages purchased

·  Improving inventory control

Operations

The Company’s first kiosk will be located either in the Galleria Mall in Fort Lauderdale, Florida or the Town Center Mall in Boca Raton, Florida or The Mall at Wellington in Wellington, Florida and the target opening date range is February 1, 2015 to April 1, 2015.

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION, PLEASE VISIT

http://www.mallmediainc.com

FOR PRESS RELEASE KIT, PLEASE VISIT
http://www.mallmediainc.com/press-release-kit.html

Thank you very much!

frame of mind.  These are big advantages

I have put into this project around $80,000 and 3,000 hours over 2 ½ years, to get us to
the point where we have a working prototype ready to install and plan to open
our first location around February 1, 2015.
Why am I here?
We are here raising funds because
it’s our belief that once Retail Marketing Managers see how the COUPON-A-TRON
units can increase sales, they are going to demand them in all of the malls
that their stores are located. We will need funds in reserve to purchase
additional units to meet the demand. 
I have to confess that when I first
heard of cause-based crowd funding, I was skeptical at best as to what it was
that we could come up with that would be a meaningful enough of a reward to motivate
people to join us.  It took a while, but
my team and I have come up with a plan that we think will motivate you to
donate.THE MALL MEDIA CHARITY INITIATIVE
No matter if you donate $1.00 or $10,000 - we will distribute coupons for you for your friends and neighbors to donate to charitable organizations.For the highest denomination
contribution of $10,000, I’ll give 50,000 coupon distributions (retail value
$30,000) and 500,000 video impressions (retail value $12,500) to your choice of
one of the 4 national charities we currently support…IN YOUR NAME.  
Other rewards for other
denominations are as follows:

How can we do this?
It is the nature of our business model
to have excess, unsold coupon or video ad slots every month.
Our business model is based on 25%
of our coupon capacity being sold and only 60% of our total video capacity
being sold, leaving large excesses of unused coupons that are wasted like empty
hotel rooms or airline seats when they’re not sold.  We concluded that the best thing for us to do
with them was to give them to charity to help raise funds.
Here’s an example of the coupon; the
video ad will have the same information and image.Currently,
we have the following charities in this program:
Susan G. Komen Breast Cancer Research
Muscular Dystrophy Association 
St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital
Autism Speaks
Other
charities can apply for inclusion in this initiative by calling Don Haese at
954-336-3772.By the time the machines are installed, there will be a link at www.mallmediainc.com which will be the contributor’s personalized pledge page from where
the charity donor gets forwarded directly to the donation page of the charity.  The donation pledges will be made directly at the charity organization's website.Rose
Lawless of West Palm Beach, FL
sincerely
thanks you for your contribution today to:
St.
Jude Children’s Research Hospital
As soon as you select a pledge amount, we will forward you to
the contribution page where you can easily make your donation directly.
_____  $10
_____  $20
_____  $50
_____  $100
_____  More
_____  Monthly pledge



A New and Unique Marketing Tool For Mall Merchants
The Coupon-A-Tron unit allows mall
merchants to distribute their coupon offers to their most qualified market
segment in a fast, efficient and economical way.
EASY - Coupons are submitted by the
merchant through a simple online interface to the system with a user-driven and
user-friendly software where advertisers can enter their existing in-store
coupons which can be inserted into software coupon slots, or they can choose from
coupon templates offered in the software.
EFFICIENT - Merchants have
flexibility to remotely control amount, terms or expiration dates, run daily or
hourly specials or blowouts, immediately cancel coupons on sold-out
merchandise, instantly sweeten the offer if the coupon is not performing and
quickly turn overstocks or closeouts into cash.  The merchant receives
fast marketing feedback to quickly compare offers or campaigns.
ECONOMICAL - Merchants pay only for
ads that are seen by their best prospects. Most ad media charge rates are based on the number of people who could see your ad, not by the
number who have been proven to actually see it. 
With Coupon-A-Tron, 100% of coupon ads
are delivered “in hand” every time, guaranteeing that merchant advertisers get
what they pay for.

WHY ADVERTISERS SHOULD PRE-BUY
COUPON SLOTS?
We also want to introduce our
systems to marketing managers of major mall retailers, so we are extending the
charity program to include an attractive program for retailers.  Here is our offer:
If an advertiser purchases two ad
units (5,000 coupons each) at $3,000 each unit for a total of $6,000 any time
before we open our first system in a mall, we will donate 15,000 coupon
distributions (retail value $9,000) and 150,000 video impressions (retail value
$3,750) to the selected charity of their choice.Marketing managers will want to ensure that their store is represented in the COUPON-A-TRON - there are only 8 slots available per machine.
For answers to questions or more
information, please contact:
Don Haese  Tel:  954-336-3772.  Email:  don.haese@gmail.comTESTIMONIALS
“Cool
concept"  Heather Lang
Senior VP Associate Media Grp Director, Eicoff Agency, Chicago

"The ease of use for those that
aren’t as gifted with scanning QR codes or researching coupons on their smart
phones is a great feature." 
Kimberly Swain,  Account Manager BFW
advertising + interactive
“In
the retail shopping environment, there are endless strategies, insights and
opinions about effectiveness, behavior and so on—and most are up for
debate.  But two facts seem to hold true across the board: people want to
save money and they want it to be easy.  Coupon-a-Tron delivers on both
benefits.  It’s not complicated.  Walk up, take a sheet of coupons,
save money. It’s hard to think of any logical reason why a consumer would not
use this device.”
Paul
C. Amelchenko, Associate Creative Director, Sapient Nitro
Former
Faculty Member, University of Miami – School of CommunicationManagement Team
To execute its Plan and deliver
profits to its shareholders, the Company has formed a nucleolus of professional
and competent people who are outstanding in their respective areas of expertise
and are enthusiastic to be part of the team assembled to develop the concept
into a profitable business.
Don Haese, President & Chief
Business Development Officer
Ralph Clements, Vice-President &
Chief Technology Officer
Xin Wei (Diana Clements),
Vice-President and Chief IT Officer
Barbara Pope, Vice-President &
Media Consultant
Duran Schmidt, Manager of Kiosk
Maintenance
Sandra Slemp,  Secretary of the
Corporation
OF COUNSEL, Robert C. Curfiss
Rose Lawless, Marketing SpecialistJob creation
We estimate the following jobs will
be created in the first 5 years of the Company's operations as described in its
Business Plan:
 
                     
                     
   Y1  Y2  Y3  Y4  Y5
 
No. jobs (employees)           4    8 
 16   32  64
Innovation/Technology
The Company has created a unique,
patent-pending, in-mall kiosk advertisement delivery system using many
US-manufactured OEM components.  A U.S. patent application, #62041636, was
filed on August 25, 2014.  The design allows us to deliver guaranteed,
measurable ad impressions, something few other media can offer, and those
aren't located in the mall where the shoppers are, a huge advertising
advantage.
Our system delivers printed coupons;
guaranteed, counted screen impressions; and a combination of the two for a 1-2
punch that will allow mall merchant advertisers have never had before. 
Measurable impressions is a tool retail marketing managers have never had
before. They also get broad flexibility and new in-mall metrics previously
unavailable to them to increase their efficiency and lower cost.
Advertiser benefits
Coupons are guaranteed to be
"eyeballs-on-ads" or "ads-in-hand" and impressions are
guaranteed to have occurred making for efficient use of an advertiser's
marketing dollars.  The Company's systems will allow advertisers to more
clearly see their actual cost, compelling other in-mall media to abandon
ambiguous pricing and vague traffic estimates.  This should lead to more
in-mall media competition leading to lower prices for advertisers.
Consumer benefits
The system creates a broader,
timelier, more convenient and simple way distributing money-saving coupons, ad
messages and impressions allowing consumers to be exposed to much more savings
opportunities. Our units will deliver over 5,000,000 money-saving coupon offers
to shoppers in malls in our first year for an estimated $1,500,000 in consumer
savings and in our 2nd year over $5,000,000 in consumer savings.
Public service
A number of coupon slots
(there are 8 on a coupon sheet) will be set aside for public service
announcements, security announcements, amber alerts, etc.  Similarly, a
number of video ad time slots will also be set aside for public
announcements, security announcements, amber alerts. 
Coupon-A-Tron Campaigns Increase
Sales, Save Time, Money And Are More Efficient.
Increase sales by:
·  Drawing more mall traffic
into your store
·  Beating the competition to
first-buyers of new launch products
·  Identifying most effective
offers, discounts and products in short time frame
·  Building  urgency into
your "sale" campaigns
·  Making ads in other media
pull stronger with incentive of valuable Coupon-A-Tron coupon book or special
offer available only at Coupon-A-Tron in mall
·  Creating unique coupons and
special offers focused narrowly on drawing the shopper the last 300 feet from
the Coupon-A-Tron unit into the store.
Save time and money by:
·  Achieving higher redemption
rates through rapid offer-testing
·  Quickly identifying
non-selling offers
·  Testing small in real time
before committing big dollars to other media in  major campaigns
·  Liquidating unwanted
inventory in days, not weeks
Get more efficiency by:
·  Achieving higher redemption
rates through rapid offer-testing
·  Offering a more convenient,
streamlined, in-mall method for shoppers to receive your coupons
·  Delivering them while
shopper is already in the mall
·  Obtaining 100% delivery of
ad messages purchased 
·  Improving inventory control
Operations
The Company’s first kiosk will be
located either in the Galleria Mall in Fort Lauderdale, Florida or the Town
Center Mall in Boca Raton, Florida or The Mall at Wellington in Wellington, Florida
and the target opening date range is February 1, 2015 to April 1, 2015.
FOR FURTHER INFORMATION, PLEASE
VISIT
http://www.mallmediainc.com

FOR PRESS RELEASE KIT, PLEASE VISIT
http://www.mallmediainc.com/press-release-kit.html

Thank you very much!

story:
The Problem

The recession has a negative impact on existing drug-related problems, worsening physical health, increasing self-destructive behavior and heightening the marginalization of drug users and their risk of relapse. They need to be offered vocational training in order to help their rehabilitation process, liaise with other vulnerable groups to enhance social awareness and create jobs for themselves, through economically viable social enterprises.


The Solution

KETHEA STROFI webradio offers an excellent chance for social integration and vocational training for almost 30 ex drug addicts per year. The webradio hosts shows with famous radio producers, musicians and artists, writers, broadcasts live from prison settings, joins forces and gives voice to many socially vulnerable groups throughout Greece. It is a unique communication, creativity and rehabilitation platform, hosted in a therapeutic program for drug addicts. Along with its therapeutic and educational mission, it can mobilize support for marginalised groups, evolve into an employment solution for ex drug addicts and enhance KETHEA's fundraising efforts as a "socially responsible sound studio" (for CD recordings, music band rehearsals).


Impact

KETHEA STROFI webradio started broadcasting on December 20th 2010. During these years, almost 150 people joined the webradio team, and on a week basis attend radio lessons for 6 hours (on sound, voice characteristics, recording, radio programming) and produce a weekly webradio program. Almost 1/3 of the group members pass the know how to their peers and help as volunteers in the management of the radio station. During 2013, 50 well known musicians, singers, actors and artists were invited to the radio show EPI TOPOU STROFI which is created by KETHEA STROFI webradio team and hosted weekly by ERA (the Greek public radio station). This resulted in 30 one-hour radio shows that disseminated prevention messages about drug addiction, through well known "embassadors", and provided the perfect proof that ex drug addicts can fully and actively reintegrate in society. ll Impact Potential

In order for the webradio to be the main communication channel among valnurable social groups and a best practice example of vocational training, it should "travel" throughout Greece, in remote villages and islands, in prison settings, even in hospitals. The creation of a "mobile radio studio" could serve this goal.

Another fundamental strategy for the future, is the self funding of the project. The creation of a hitech sound studio, run by ex drug addicts experts in recording techniques, and given to music bands under a symbolic price, will safeguard the sustainability of the project.

The webradio and sound studio could be used for the following:
 • creation of audio advertising (spot) for television and radio and recording (narration, dubbing , radio productions, speakage) for payment.
 • recording demos complexes and rent the space for group rehearsals

• recording and production of music albums.

• creating a mobile studio in order to record outdoors. The portable studio could be also used as an entertaining and educational space in prison settings, where KETHEA STROFI offers services to inmate drug addicts


What We Need

The funding accomplished will cover everyday and operational costs of the radio station. Furthermore, new equipment is needs to be bought in for the sound studio to be functional and attract musicians to record there.

story:
Special Waves Special Children

Our names are Noah Koumas, Jacob Rosenberg, and Bobby Briggs. We are Juniors in high school at Sage Hill School in Newport Beach. We are all passionate surfers who want to make an impact in our community using our passion of surfing. We hope to host a surf event for special needs children where we can teach them how to surf. This event will provide a great opportunity for special needs children to get outside and active in a judgment-free environment. We need money for surfing equipment and experienced surf instructors to make this impact possible. As well as donating money for our event, it would be great for you to spread the word about our campaign.

As well as donating money for our event, it would be great for you to spread the word about our campaign.

story:
After 20+ years Working in kitchen around the US I amassed a large amount recipes and ideas.  This company will be my way to get these wonderful flavors of all the cuisines I have worked with to the public.  Starting with a batch of 6 hot sauces and moving on to BBQ and others as can be worked in.
Everyone asks how I will compete with all the other hot sauces out there.  Well, the answer is: Flavor, not heat (true there will be heat) will be the focus of the first batch of sauces available.
Sauce                                                                Heat level. aka Scoville units
  • Ancho (dried poblano)                                 1,000-2,500
  • Jalapeno                                                           2,500-10,000
  • Chipotle                                                            2,500-10,000
  • Serrano                                                             15,000-25,000
  • Chili de Arbol                                                   15,000-30,000
  • Habanero                                                          150,000-325,000

Future hot sauces will include Ghost peppers, Trinidad scorpion, Carolina Reaper and Thai Chili sauce.


Shipping will be in mid to late February depending on response and the state of Florida and what roadblocks they hand me.

The funds will be used to pay rent at a commerical kitchen, buy the peppers, salt and vinegar needed for the sauces and the last few pieces of equipment left to get.

story:
Why BarNote? 

I am a HUGE fan of work hard, play hard. I work my tail off to help hundreds of thousands of people find jobs. Yes, I am a head hunter. There is truly no better feeling that seeing someone land their dream job... 

After work, it is sometimes nice to grab a cocktail. Being over 21, I have spent some time in many bars. The problem is I always have this feeling that I am being over-charged, especially if the happy hour turns into a long night. I also hate having to go to the bar the next day to grab my credit card that I forgot... :-/

I am asking for folks like yourself to help build a tool that will completely eliminate the distrust between the venue and the customer - simply put. 

The Goods! Help us help you! 

We are looking for folks who can help us END THE DISTRUST between venues all over the planet and the customer. The money we are looking for will go directly into development, with constant features being added per our beta group. I have established a squeeze page [www.barnoteapp.com] that has generated hundreds of folks that want to get involved and crack the disconnecting feeling we all have after leaving the bar... 

While we are a start-up, I also understand how valuable your money is and that it can be going in many other places. Saying that, you immediately will have access to the exclusive club once this has been fully developed. 

The Impact for Venues and Customers!

For you bartenders, mixologists, waitresses, and dive bar owners... read here! How nice would it be for your staff to NEVER have to hunt down those socialites that asked for their tab 30 minutes ago, but just decided ordered another round of whiskey shots? Ugh... How nice would it be for your staff to be able to close the tab when he/she wants? How nice would it be to actually start to develop customer trends on your favorite customers? How nice would it be to have your staff actually focus on the customer, instead of standing by the POS system swiping too many credit cards? BarNote is your answer.

For you customers... get ready to smile. How nice would it be to NEVER have to give your credit card out? How nice would it be to NEVER leave your credit card at those fine establishments you go to? How nice would it be to 'ping' the waitress when you are ready for more drinks? Finally, how nice would it be to just be able to walk out of the bar when you are ready vs. waiting for the waitress to come back only to dispute there are too many drinks on your tab... BarNote is your answer. 

Other ways to contribute. 

If you cannot help with a contribution, please go to www.barnoteapp.com and input your contact information. I will be consistent with valuable updates on development, but also ask the audience questions on what they would like to see in the product.

story:
The A Cohen Company has been supplying the watchmaking and jewelry industry for 103 years.  Over the last few years we have hit a bit of a rough spot.  I want to make the company healthy again and I need your help.


This company has always provided the tools and supplies necessary for small businesses in the area and wants to again.  The inventory and customer base has taken a hit with all the internet suppliers as competition and I want to gear up to challenge them again.  With your help I can restock from and repay the vendors I need to and get the store back on a solid footing.  A little help from a group of interested parties could make all the difference.  It's tough to be a little guy but I'm willing to put in the time and effort.


I hope that those of you who see and read this will open up your hearts and take a bit out of your wallets as well to help.


Thank you for your support.


Allen D Jacobs,  A Cohen Co Inc
