story:
Our Campaign

We have decided to do this campaign to help us with adding new drains & concrete to our brewery. We will also use funds to increase our wood cellar capacity. This will help us produce more wild & sour beer. We will release these beers as part of our Loess Hills Farmhouse Series. They will be packaged in both kegs & specialty released 750ml bottles. The more we increase our cellar capacity, the more beer we can get into your hands!

Any amount raised past our goal will be used to purchase more oak barrels & stainless steel kegs.


Short Summary

Marto Brewing Company will be an innovative artisan brewery. We will produce craft beer with the highest quality ingredients from all over the world. With these ingredients we will incorporate local ingredients, such as raw honey, fruit, and grains. We are also very excited to implement the use of whiskey and wine barrels to condition some specialty beers. We will combine these ingredients with traditional and unconventional brewing methods to produce world class beer. We have a projected opening during the second half of 2015. We are just as excited to hire willing and hard working local employees as we are implementing local ingredients into our product. Having employees who know our customers and area will be a benefit to our business.

About Marto
Marto Brewing Company was formed when a hobby turned into a pursuit to perfect the craft. With over 5 years of brewing experience, Owner and Brewer, Erik Martin has a proven track record of producing high quality beers. After a few years of brewing Erik began to enter brewing competitions and many awards were earned. Some of the most recent awards are Best of show at the 2014 Nebraska State Fair, Best of Show at the 2014 Omaha River City Roundup, and many 1st places in categories such as Imperial Stout and IPA. Erik also won the 2014 Omaha Beer Week Homebrew Showcase, which is organized by the Nebraska Brewing Company. That beer was re-brewed with Nebraska Brewing Company at their brewpub and served at a ticketed beer and food pairing event.
Brewery & Taproom
Our brewery and taproom will be located on Historic 4th Street in downtown Sioux City, Iowa. The beer will be brewed on a 7 barrel brewing system. The tap room will have ten taps to serve our customers from. The taproom will be a warming environment with the bar and decor built from old barn poles and wood. The barn wood was sourced from family farms, located right here in the Onawa area and the Loess Hills.

Our Beer
We will produce a core, seasonal, and a premium lineup of beers. Our core lineup will consist of traditional styles such as an American Pale Ale, IPA, Robust Porter, & Imperial Stout. Our seasonal styles will very from season to season and will incorporate seasonal fruits, grains, and hops to name a few. Our premium lineup is known as the Loess Hills Farmhouse Series.

The Loess Hills Farmhouse Series will be brewed with traditional, rustic old world, and innovative processes depending on the end result the brewer is intending. These beers will be fermented and conditioned in both stainless steel and wood. In this series we will ferment the beer with many different yeasts and bacteria at different stages of the fermentation. Something that will make our beer unique to any other beer out there, is the use of local yeast & bacteria. We will capture these cultures in the Loess Hills. We have already isolated a "wild" strain of brettanomyces yeast that has the characteristics that we are looking for. In our trial batches, this strain paired excellent with our other saison yeast strains. This series will be excellent to enjoy on the day we release them or they can be aged for years like a fine wine.



Sales & Distrobution
Along with purchasing our beer by the glass at the tap room, beer lovers will be able to take a "growler" home with them. Growlers typically come in 32oz & 64oz packages and are refillable at the tap room. We will also self distribute kegs of beer to select accounts in Siouxland, Des Moines,& Iowa City at the beginning phase of the business. We will also bottle the Loess Hills Farmhouse Series beers in 750 milliliter champagne style bottles. These bottles will be self distributed to Siouxland, Des Moines, Council Bluffs, Iowa City, and more locations throughout the Midwest. As our production capacity increases we will begin to move to new markets around the country.
We have already started the ground work of partnering with retail, bars, restaurants, & distributors. New relationships have opened up after we shared our beer with these establishments. Excited beer enthusiasts have also contacted some of these establishments urging them to sell our beer when production begins. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $10,000 to help us with some of our startup costs. Details are listed at the top. 
  • The merchandise perks will arrive within 2 months of the campaign end date. The beer, tasting, brewing, etc will be honored once we have our license and production has started. 


The Impact

Not only do we want to produce great craft beer, we want to revitalize our town and area businesses. Craft beer lovers will travel to our brewery. This will have an impact on many businesses such as gas stations, hotels, & restaurants to name a few. 
We will use many agriculture ingredients so the growers, wholesalers, & distributors near and far will benefit. Many less noticeable jobs will benefit such as retail employees, yeast & product analysis laboratories, glass manufactures & steel producers.


How You Can Help

  • Become a supporter! Choose one of our great awards on the right hand side of the page
  • Share our campaign on all of your social media accounts. 
  • Tell your friends face to face!
story_txt:
Our Campaign
We have decided to do this campaign to help us with adding new drains & concrete to our brewery. We will also use funds to increase our wood cellar capacity. This will help us produce more wild & sour beer. We will release these beers as part of our Loess Hills Farmhouse Series. They will be packaged in both kegs & specialty released 750ml bottles. The more we increase our cellar capacity, the more beer we can get into your hands!
Any amount raised past our goal will be used to purchase more oak barrels & stainless steel kegs.




Short Summary
Marto Brewing Company will be an innovative artisan brewery. We will produce craft beer with the highest quality ingredients from all over the world. With these ingredients we will incorporate local ingredients, such as raw honey, fruit, and grains. We are also very excited to implement the use of whiskey and wine barrels to condition some specialty beers. We will combine these ingredients with traditional and unconventional brewing methods to produce world class beer. We have a projected opening during the second half of 2015. We are just as excited to hire willing and hard working local employees as we are implementing local ingredients into our product. Having employees who know our customers and area will be a benefit to our business.About MartoMarto Brewing Company was formed when a hobby turned into a pursuit to perfect the craft. With over 5 years of brewing experience, Owner and Brewer, Erik Martin has a proven track record of producing high quality beers. After a few years of brewing Erik began to enter brewing competitions and many awards were earned. Some of the most recent awards are Best of show at the 2014 Nebraska State Fair, Best of Show at the 2014 Omaha River City Roundup, and many 1st places in categories such as Imperial Stout and IPA. Erik also won the 2014 Omaha Beer Week Homebrew Showcase, which is organized by the Nebraska Brewing Company. That beer was re-brewed with Nebraska Brewing Company at their brewpub and served at a ticketed beer and food pairing event.

Brewery & Taproom
Our brewery and taproom will be located on Historic 4th Street in downtown Sioux City, Iowa. The beer will be brewed on a 7 barrel brewing system. The tap room will have ten taps to serve our customers from. The taproom will be a warming environment with the bar and decor built from old barn poles and wood. The barn wood was sourced from family farms, located right here in the Onawa area and the Loess Hills.Our BeerWe will produce a core, seasonal, and a premium lineup of beers. Our core lineup will consist of traditional styles such as an American Pale Ale, IPA, Robust Porter, & Imperial Stout. Our seasonal styles will very from season to season and will incorporate seasonal fruits, grains, and hops to name a few. Our premium lineup is known as the Loess Hills Farmhouse Series.The Loess Hills Farmhouse Series will be brewed with traditional, rustic old world, and innovative processes depending on the end result the brewer is intending. These beers will be fermented and conditioned in both stainless steel and wood. In this series we will ferment the beer with many different yeasts and bacteria at different stages of the fermentation. Something that will make our beer unique to any other beer out there, is the use of local yeast & bacteria. We will capture these cultures in the Loess Hills. We have already isolated a "wild" strain of brettanomyces yeast that has the characteristics that we are looking for. In our trial batches, this strain paired excellent with our other saison yeast strains. This series will be excellent to enjoy on the day we release them or they can be aged for years like a fine wine.



Sales & DistrobutionAlong with purchasing our beer by the glass at the tap room, beer lovers will be able to take a "growler" home with them. Growlers typically come in 32oz & 64oz packages and are refillable at the tap room. We will also self distribute kegs of beer to select accounts in Siouxland, Des Moines,& Iowa City at the beginning phase of the business. We will also bottle the Loess Hills Farmhouse Series beers in 750 milliliter champagne style bottles. These bottles will be self distributed to Siouxland, Des Moines, Council Bluffs, Iowa City, and more locations throughout the Midwest. As our production capacity increases we will begin to move to new markets around the country.

We have already started the ground work of partnering with retail, bars, restaurants, & distributors. New relationships have opened up after we shared our beer with these establishments. Excited beer enthusiasts have also contacted some of these establishments urging them to sell our beer when production begins. 



   What We Need & What You Get  We need to raise $10,000 to help us with some of our startup costs. Details are listed at the top.  The merchandise perks will arrive within 2 months of the campaign end date. The beer, tasting, brewing, etc will be honored once we have our license and production has started.     
The Impact
Not only do we want to produce great craft beer, we want to revitalize our town and area businesses. Craft beer lovers will travel to our brewery. This will have an impact on many businesses such as gas stations, hotels, & restaurants to name a few. 
We will use many agriculture ingredients so the growers, wholesalers, & distributors near and far will benefit. Many less noticeable jobs will benefit such as retail employees, yeast & product analysis laboratories, glass manufactures & steel producers.
  How You Can Help  Become a supporter! Choose one of our great awards on the right hand side of the page Share our campaign on all of your social media accounts. 
Tell your friends face to face!

story:
Short Summary

Jack Rockwell Coffee – Is unveiling its unique one of a kind single cup brewing innovations. The age of bean to cup coffee is finally here. The retail coffee experience is about to witness a seismic shift in commercial coffee brewing from the traditional filtered, drip pot brewer, pod system or pour over. Our team has been focused and committed on radically redefining the coffee experience and our pressure brewing coffee machine known as the FarQuest® delivers that.  We are poised to redefine how the world drinks enjoys coffee.  A perfect cup of fresh brewed coffee at the touch of a single button in under 30 seconds.

Jack Rockwell has groundbreaking technology that offers a new patented method of brewing and enjoying gourmet coffee.  We begin with whole beans which are ground in seconds and then pressured brewed, bean to cup in 30 seconds, thanks to our patented FarQuest® brewing chamber. The FarQuest® has proven innovative technology can be pure and natural and taste delicious.


We have worked ardeusly over the years and have been awarded 2 patents so far.  We specialize in making of a newly patented commercial grade, single cup coffee brewing system known as “The Farquest”.  The Farquest produces a French press style cup of coffee from whole bean to cup in thirty seconds.

                                                    


Using our patented process along with a patented brew chamber, the Farquest is unique, innovative and makes quality gourmet coffee all at the touch of a single button.


The only one of its kind. Our patented process is pressure brewing.  The Farquest produces a fresh superior cup of coffee which is very similar to a French Press style of brewing as opposed to the industries old, drip pot method. The Farquest is environmentally friendly, since we don’t use filters or pods, our machine doesn’t pollute our ecosystem.

The Farquest unique system will become the standard in coffee brewing.  The days of drip-pot, pod systems and large stale vats of coffee will be a thing of the past.  No pods or K-cups or paper filter is ever needed since we use a steel micro filter that doesn’t require replacing.  Every commercial coffee establishment will want our system of brewing since it allows for a fresh cup of delicious coffee every time you press the button.  No more pouring out large amounts of coffee because it has sat around for more than 20 minutes losing time and money! With The Farquest there is no waste at all since every cup is made individually and bean to cup fresh, at a touch of a button, in under a minute! You cannot get any fresher than that, short of going to get coffee at the coffee farm.  It tastes great! And we are currently developing a FarQuest for the home.  Your help in this campaign will help us take us there.

Market Analysis

Market Growth

According to industry statistics;
www.coffee-statistics.com/coffee_statistics_ebook.html:

·  Americans consume 400 million cups of coffee per day, or equivalent to 146 Billion cups of coffee per year; making the United States the LEADING CONSUMER of coffee in the world.

·  Coffee represents 75% of all the caffeine consumed in the United States.

Industry Analysis

The link below leads to a chart and is from a recent study conducted by Rabobank. According a recent study by Rabobank, emerging markets will reach 50% of the global coffee consumption by the year 2020.  It also identifies a global shift from multi-serve to single-serve coffee.  Product innovation is driving market shares in gains and gross profit.

Rabobank’s analysis shows the rapid growth of coffee houses. The bar chart below in the photo gallery, illustrates the incredible annual growth of the coffee consumer market.  View complete RaboBank Report here: http://tinyurl.com/pdqzdj4       View short PowerPoint here: http://tinyurl.com/o2crwmv


What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking Two Hundred Fifty Thousand dollars in funding to complete the final version of our machine.  We will produce a run of about 15 machines and bring out to industry market makers and commercial coffee house establishments to try and enter into a licensing agreement which will bring expeditious gourmet coffee to the entire world.  Engineering and production cost are the primary cost factors.  With you help, we can take the coffee world in a step in the right direction in terms of flavor, speed, and cost effectiveness and all with positive impact on the environment.

The innovative unique patented Farquest, makes every cup of coffee fresh, no exceptions.  No other machine on the market can go bean to cup fresh in seconds. The days of old, stale bitter coffee are over.  Declare your independence from the old establishment and demand what you are paying for.  By investing in the Farquest you will be on the cutting edge of a coffee revolution and a part of history. End the drip!

The funding raised will be used to complete the production of the Farquest. Engineering, design, software, parts and components will get us started on the road to a fantastic coffee brewer of which the coffee world can benefit.  Other funding will go to marketing and the distribution of the machines.  We plan to meet with every major coffee retail house in the world to get the word and product out.  And our Teams commitment to uphold the highest standards in all attributes of our organization, will get us there.

The Impact

For the past one-hundred years coffee has been made with a paper filter.  Drip pot makers have been in use since the 1950’s.  Your contribution will change that and bring the world a coffee maker for the new millennium.  Fast, efficient, Eco-friendly, perfect and fresh every time, without exception.  The Farquest is environmentally friendly because it uses no filters that end up in the landfill.  The grounds are recyclable and ideal for compost, thus no waste.  The Farquest machine will only heat water on demand resulting in reduced energy consumption.  Help us change the coffee world one fresh cup at a time.  Be the first to see it all in your lifetime.  The Farquest is the future of coffee and the future is here!

The world is gravitating to the single cup mentality.  K-cups and pods are dominating the coffee drinking world because we all want a fresher, better tasting cup of coffee.  We want it fresh and fast because anything else is a waste of time.  Pods and K-cups have already made an enormous impact on how we all drink coffee.  We love the positive impact we can provide for the industry as well as the phenomenal flavor the FarQuest produces.  The demand for fresh gourmet coffee is here.  The Farquest will take fresh coffee to a whole new level.  A  greater standard for the growing billions of coffee drinkers around the globe.  The world deserves a perfect cup of coffee, the world deserves The Farquest!

Risks & Challenges

We have worked for many years developing Jack Rockwell's FarQuest however there will be improvements on our innovation that we hope to expand upon.  We realize that Jack Rockwell's Farquest is an unrecognized brand name.   Due to the fact we are a new entrant into the coffee arena it will take time to establish an elite reputation.  However, we believe word of mouth will invariably be our best form of advertisement once people start to enjoy Jack Rockwell coffee.  While Jack Rockwell has a new innovative product, most of the start-up funds have been dedicated to the development of the process as well as legal, accounting and project management fees for machine design as we awaited our issued patents.

Jack Rockwell has a strong innovative new process which delivers the freshest cup of coffee in the world.  We love the taste of fresh coffee and we want to share our technology with the world.  With funding we will get the word out through the countless media outlets available today.  Our dynamic product will resonate through the coffee industry.  Everyone in the world wants fresh gourmet coffee at a reasonable price and our machine will make that happen! The Farquest puts the future of coffee squarely in the hands of those who want more.  By pledging to support this innovation you are doing so with the understanding that this is a new product that you are making possible - allowing cutting edge technology to be realized plus you really want the best tasting cup of coffee out there.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you Love coffee, Post-it, send it, email it, share it! A tweet can go rival in minutes and spread a message around the World faster than TV or other traditional media.  Social media is king with more companies taking to Facebook, Twitter, Google, Pinterest and Instagram so getting the word out has never been easier.  Send us your email address and we will send you videos of the Farquest in action.  Post it on the web, send it to your family and friends help us get the word out that the new evolution in coffee is finally here.  Or better yet, find a way to invest with us and become part of Coffee History in the making! The old way of making coffee are about to get swept into the dust bin of history.  The new standard has arrived and The FarQuest is here!

Lose the drip!

story:
Mouthwatering Flavourful Traditional Ceylon Cuisine using Local produce & Exotic spices - Taste to perfection.

According to our research, we will be the First Sri Lankan Food Truck Business in Canada. How awesome if you could be part of our dream and support us to reach our goal.

Our rewards are simply awesome.

We only need to meet $3500 goal since we received portion of funds from a personal supporter and we sold our mini food cart to invest in the food trailer.

Why food? Why Sri Lankan cuisine? I love food, flavours, miracle spices and local farmer produce. I was born and raised in Sri Lanka, eating delicious Sri Lankan meals  every day. My mom was a stay at home mom and was a very good cook. I love traditional Sri Lankan food. I search for flavours in my childhood memories then I cook with my heart, taste to perfection. 

Sri Lankan cuisine is flavourful, delicious, healthy and will satisfy every taste buds. Thanks to influence of foreign invaders like Portuguese, Dutch, and British and also neighboring countries, Sri Lankan cuisine is one of the most complex cuisines in the world with variety of dishes.

We started our business in Comox Valley Farmers Market serving hot food using the mini food cart and expanded the product line to frozen curries and curry blends. Also we import unique  spices including true cinnamon from Sri Lanka to create extraordinary taste, support Sri Lankan Farmers and offer healthy, quality spices for Canadians.


Our goal and your rewards

Our goal is to reach $3500 in 30 days. Total fund goes towards buying the food trailer.
Our rewards to you
- Prepay for your meal to reach us our goal. We will add your name to the prepaid list and please come to any of our hot food events or Comox Valley Farmers Market.
- Sri Lankan Feast - Beuatiful big dinner table feast at the Blue Moon Winery  in Comox Valley, BC
- Check out our products - True Cinnamon, Curry Blend and more
Please be part of our dream. You can make a difference.

The Impact

We want to be a part of the local movement, support lovely farmers, find good quality produce and spices to cook great meals for our customers. 

Our products are Gluten Free, Dairy Free, Homemade, handmade, smaller batches with love and care, No artificial flavours, colors, preservatives.

 

Risks & Challenges

Currently we are using shared kitchen facility and cannot operate mini cart for hot food. We just sold it to invest in the food trailer with this project. We are not expecting an easier path and we know entrepreneurship is hard. We believe in our business, brand and our products. We walk with great passion and love for what we do.
Not having our own kitchen facility is limiting our production and we will work hard to find a leasing commercial kitchen. 
Customers love our food and with your help we can operate food trailer this summer and work towards our own kitchen. 
We will guarantee high quality on our products using more local produce. We are hoping to distribute our products - True Cinnamon, Curry Blends and Pickles throughout Canada in near future.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are lucky to live in a beautiful Comox Valley and Our community and customers are simply awesome. We have come this far with your support.
Please spread the word. Share with your friends and family. 
Don't forget to come and visit us at Comox Valley Farmers Market or at any of our hot food events.

story:
Gossty es una idea, una empresa y una ilusión de un grupo de amigos trabajando por hacernos la vida más fácil...  Es una app que conecta a personas y lugares.


Dinos qué quieres cenar y dónde, los lugares de la zona te mandarán su mejor oferta, invita a tus amigos y entre todos decidid cuál será el mejor plan!!

Imagina: Madrid centro, Sábado 23:00h, antojo de Arroz con Bogavante y  un gin-tonic, ¿vas a perder tiempo buscando donde conseguirlo? Nooo, con Gossty te lo sirven en bandeja.

Un ejemplo:

Rocío está dando un paseo por el Retiro con unos amigos, y al pasar por una terraza se le ocurre que podrían tomar un gin-tonic antes de ir a cenar.


Propone el plan a sus amigos, pero no acaban de decidir a dónde pueden ir ya que no conocen ningún lugar que esté abierto a la hora que les interesa y cerca de donde van a ir a cenar.


Abre Gossty e introduce la información a través de un sencillo formulario, simplemente selecciona a sus amigos e indica sus preferencia: Un grupo de 5 personas que quieren tomar un gin-tonic a las 20:00h por la zona de Alonso Martínez, en un lugar que sea acogedor y poco ruidoso.


Sus amigos en casa reciben un gossty en el momento en el que Rocio da de alta el plan. Desde entonces tendrán voz y voto para decidir qué van a hacer.


En los siguientes minutos recibe en su móvil diferentes propuestas de aquellos locales que pueden enviar una oferta personalizada que satisfaga la idea de Rocio.

Iván, que trabaja en el un local de Alonso Martínez, no deja pasar la ocasión. En un instante puede, ver los gustos que los cinco amigos muestran voluntariamente en Gossty y hacerles una propuesta a medida.

Desde casa sus amigos pueden ver las diferentes opciones y votar la que más les guste. Sus opiniones se reflejan en tiempo real en la aplicación y se va formado un ranking entre los establecimientos candidatos.

Pueden tomarse el tiempo que quieran, pero si hay una opción que les convence, simplemente la escogen con un botón y el resto de las alternativas son descartadas. En ese momento se establece una conexión entre el local y Rocio.

¡Y todos contentos! Si Rocío quiere puede configurar Gossty para recibir propuestas periódicas, o no recibirlas nunca, o solo cuando haya una oferta especial de su bebida favorita. En resumen, ella manda sobre la manera en la que están conectados.



Gossty está en la fase de lanzamiento... y necesitamos un último empujón para terminar el desarrollo y comenzar con las actuaciones finales y el marketing.

Creemos en Gossty y sabemos que vas a disfrutar con ella, te va a cambiar la forma de hacer PLANes y de obtener exactamente lo que habías PLANeado.

Tenemos un proyecto y necesitamos recursos para darle forma. ¡Con vuestra ayuda la app estará completa y formaréis parte de nuestra primera celebración! 

Nuestros pasos a seguir:

  • Terminaremos la arquitectura, y el diseño de la  aplicación.
  • Completaremos todas las secciones y funcionalidades.
  • Realizaremos la prueba piloto.
  • Haremos actividades de marketing y campañas comerciales para dar a conocer la aplicación, sus ventajas y alimentarla de usuarios y lugares.

Todo lo anterior lo conseguiremos haciendo crecer nuestro equipo con profesionales que nos ayuden en distintas áreas y que son necesarios para terminar esta fase. 

¿Cómo vamos a invertir el dinero? 

Tenemos planteado un calendario que nos lleva al lanzamiento del servicio en junio de 2015, y para ello invertiremos en:

  • Programadores y profesionales de la informática: 8.000 euros
  • Infraestructuras, servidores y maquetas: 2.500 euros
  • Marketing : 3.000 euros
  • Asesoría legal: 1.500 euros

En total, 15.000 euros sin los que no podremos terminar nuestro proyecto a tiempo. No obstante, si sobrepasamos esa cifra, todo lo que recaudemos se destinará íntegramente al desarrollo de la plataforma.

Pero no nos limitaremos simplemente a daros las gracias, a continuación os queremos mostrar lo que os ofrecemos a cambio de vuestra ayuda.


Un momento, ¿qué es eso de premium, conexiones y campañas? ¿Early User?, ¿eso no es un té?

En Gossty configuras tu cuenta para mostrar voluntariamente tus gustos y que así los establecimientos puedan ofrecerte productos a medida. Por ejemplo, te encanta la tortilla de bacalao, pues si haces una reserva para comer en un restaurante, podrán prepararte una tapita para ofrecértela mientras decides qué pedir. Tu la disfrutas y ellos te fidelizan, ¡todos ganan!

En algunos casos, un local puede planificar un evento y darle cierta exclusividad, por eso creamos la red Premium, para que dispongan de un circuito alternativo y así poder convocar a los usuarios con cuenta Premium.

¿Y las conexiones y campañas?, Ahí está nuestro modelo de negocio. Cuando alguien busca un servicio, un establecimiento se lo ofrece y su oferta es seleccionada, se establece una conexión. Ese es el servicio que cobramos, poner en contacto la oferta y la demanda.

Pero podemos hacerlo al revés, Por ejemplo, un proveedor se ha equivocado y en vez de 2 kg de pollo te ha traído 20kg!!. Pues manos a la obra, mientras en la cocina preparan el rebozado, tu creas una campaña en Gossty para celebrar la Noche del pollo frito, nosotros seleccionamos a un grupo de usuario  que adoren ese plato y les mandamos un mensaje. Si no aceptan la invitación no te cobramos, y si lo hacen tampoco, que ya has pagado por la campaña (y menos de lo que crees).

Finalmente, early user es el usuario más exclusivo de todos, y que solo se podrá crear si ha participado en esta campaña de crowfunding. Tenemos muchos sorpresas esperando para vosotros...

Para aquellos que tengan curiosidad por nuestro modelo de negocio, estaremos encantados de recibiros en nuestras oficinas y explicaros cómo pensamos hacerlo, pero os dejamos a continuación un pequeño esquema de los segmentos de mercado a los que pretendemos llegar.


Consumidores: Cualquier persona que quiera realizar un plan bajo una serie de condiciones o premisas. Además existe un control del establecimiento donde van a llevarse a cabo, los servicios que se van a recibir y la información de los productos involucrados, tanto características como información comercial de sus proveedores y marcas.

Establecimientos: Bares, Restaurantes, Discotecas, cualquier establecimiento susceptible de ofrecer productos y servicios. En base a las preferencias de los consumidores podrán actualizar sus estrategias comerciales e identificar a su público objetivo, todo esto con la capacidad de establecer un criterio de selección de marcas y de consumo. 

Marcas: Fabricantes y proveedores de bienes de consumo. Este segmento tiene la capacidad de obtener mapas de penetración de mercado, pudiendo determinar qué zonas y establecimientos alcanzan a determinados sectores de la población, pudiendo establecer una relación directa con el consumidor para acercarle su producto.

Nuestro objetivo es establecer la conexión entre los tres segmentos, cuidando siempre la privacidad, el control y la rentabilidad. Eso es Gossty.




La ventaja de la tecnología es la facilidad con la que podemos intercambiar información y colaborar unos con otros. Pero tú puedes ayudarnos un poco más difundiendo nuestro proyecto y aportando la cantidad que consideres oportuna. ¡Seguro que en el futuro habrá una forma de agradecértelo aún más!

Un abrazo, 

El equipo de Gossty.


P.D. Vamos a empezar los agradecimiento citando a Rocio, Laura, Chus, Aitor, Jorge, Ivan, Nacho y Ricardo sin los que no podríamos haber lanzado esta campaña. 
Gracias!!
story_txt:
Gossty es una idea, una empresa y una ilusión de un grupo de amigos trabajando por hacernos la vida más fácil...  Es una app que conecta a personas y lugares.Dinos qué quieres cenar y dónde, los lugares de la zona te mandarán su mejor oferta, invita a tus amigos y entre todos decidid cuál será
el mejor plan!!Imagina: Madrid centro, Sábado 23:00h, antojo de Arroz con Bogavante y  un gin-tonic, ¿vas a perder tiempo buscando donde conseguirlo? Nooo, con Gossty te lo sirven en bandeja.Un ejemplo:Rocío está dando un paseo por el Retiro con unos amigos, y al pasar por una terraza se le ocurre que podrían tomar un gin-tonic antes de ir a cenar.Propone el plan a sus amigos, pero no acaban de decidir a dónde pueden ir ya que no conocen ningún lugar que esté abierto a la hora que les interesa y cerca de donde van a ir a cenar.Abre Gossty e introduce la información a través de un sencillo formulario, simplemente selecciona a sus amigos e indica sus preferencia: Un grupo de 5 personas que quieren tomar un gin-tonic a las 20:00h por la zona de Alonso Martínez, en un lugar que sea acogedor y poco ruidoso.Sus amigos en casa reciben un gossty en el momento en el que Rocio da de alta el plan. Desde entonces tendrán voz y voto para decidir qué van a hacer.En los siguientes minutos recibe en su móvil diferentes propuestas de aquellos locales que pueden enviar una oferta personalizada que satisfaga la idea de Rocio.

Iván, que trabaja en el un local de Alonso Martínez, no deja pasar la ocasión. En un instante puede, ver los gustos que los cinco amigos muestran voluntariamente en Gossty y hacerles una propuesta a medida.

story:
Short Summary

Greetings, I am Shishir Rao  resident in Dubai, one of the most cosmopolitan city in the world. I have a degree in MIS from Southern New Hampshire University and also studied Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from Michigan State. 

  Our dream is to put forth an events company Icon Intelligence and Marketing that deals with business conferences in diverse fields such as telecoms, finance, IT, broadcasting, accounting as well as exhibitions, not to mention exhibition related services such as stands, lighting, promoters.

Indeed we both have considerable experience in the aforementioned.

It is not easy to compete with IQPC, IIRs of the world and while we don't wish to brag, we believe we can offer a superior product at lower cost through our unique talents.

   We were having difficulty raising the seed money for this enterprise through  conventional methods. We had also already set up a beta site which we was running since last fall . We have considerable interest from various organizations both government and private for whom we executed some modest projects in the past. However in order for this to come to fruition we need to come with more capital than we currently have at our disposal which is actually rather modest-relatively speaking.

With your generous support, you can help us revolutionize how business information and networking can be overhauled and help the small business owner ,free lancer as well as the large behemoths(we are above all -fair) given a good deal for the monies they dispense and not be subjected to the exorbitant amounts they are currently been gouged right now by the majors.

How would we do that, well we believe in relationships first and foremost and not the cowboy ant farm boiler room take the money and run culture that unfortunately exists in this field. In short, we believe in more pull than push.

While we are based in Dubai, we envision our reach all across select cities in MENA, India,North America  and Europe within the next 10 years.

What We Need & What You Get

Most of what we hope you contribute would go towards

  • Renting an office space over a two year lease

  • Trade license fees and company bank account(min balance maintenance required from bank)

  • Hiring sales and admin staff for 1 year

  • Marketing mix-email marketing and databases, brochures, PR, ads, etc

  • Office supplies such as laptops, printers, fax machines

  • Telephone and internet monthly dues

  Paying subcontractors when we have a project in hand as we have to offer the client 60 day credit facilities

  We envision to bring over well known personalities in the business and media world to our events. Our patrons if they are willing to avail,will receive passes to the aforementioned events as well as access to upto date business strategies and market know how in the concerned sector!

If we fail to reach our goal, we will still go forward on a leaner, less ambitious mission statement. But we are ever grateful for still bestowing what you could spare for even that opportunity.

The Impact

As the saying goes where the lion treads there is food for all. You will help us become that kind of lion. Instead of  being the type of organization that sucks the life of the industry and soul force and creativity out of its employees(this is an industry notorious for high staff turnover) , you will be instrumental in helping us create less frazzled and equitable company which still manages to deliver quality product

We have been successful in producing(on a smaller scale) what we have proposed above. We have ran exhibitions for Panasonic, UAE government. Conferences on hedge funds,Retail Banking, construction, Telecom, Broadcasting and many more.

Of these were our portfolios while working (semi independently) for other companies

Risks & Challenges

We don’t really envision a strong profit for the first year. After all as mentioned we prefer to build relationships with our clients rather than the take the money and run approach as practiced by some in the industry.

The first year would be tight and difficult but that is part of the mission and we cant stray from it.

But we are in it for the long haul and we are confident when we deliver a professional product in time with no hassle , we will have earned their trust and loyalty and will stick around for the long haul

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any non monetary support as well. Please be sure to spread the word about our company in any way you can. Not the least- use the indiegogo share tools to get the job done.

story: Somos un grupo de corredores jujeños que buscamos darle sentido a los kilómetros que re-corremos mas allá de los objetivos de índole deportivo.  Nuestra motivación es juntar dinero para una cocina solar de la Escuela nro. 198, Ciudad de la Plata, la misma se encuentra en El Chorcan a 47 km de Humahuaca. La escuela cuenta con un comedor ya que se brindan las cuatro comidas en el lugar. Es de jornada completa y funciona como albergue escolar ya que algunos niños se quedan a dormir. Realmente es una tarea muy ardua la recolección de leña, incluso puede durar días. dole deportivo. a que se brindan las cuatro comidas en el lugar. Es de jornada completa y funciona como albergue escolar ya que algunos niños se quedan a dormir.

story:
Uwe Rath, seit 25 Jahren in der Dominikanischen Republik, hat sein Unternehmen Uwescuba auf individuelles, technisches und Hoehlen - Tauchen ausgelegt. Um das Tauch -Angebot in der Zukunft attraktiver zu gestalten und um sich komplett von der Masse der anderen Tauchschulen abzuheben sollen sehr spezielle Tages und Mehrtages - Touren angeboten werden, die es so in Ihrer Art von keiner anderen Tauchschule in der Dom.Rep. gibt.  Hier ein paar Beispiele:

Tagestour fuer Wrack - Liebhaber mit 4 Wracks in zwei Tauchgaengen

Mehrtages - Touren fuer Hoehlentaucher rund um die Insel

Tages und Mehrtages - Touren fuer unberuehrte Riff - Liebhaber

Tagestour und Mehrtages - Tour fuer Grossfisch - Liebhaber 

Das Bedarf natuerlich einer komplett anderen Logistik im Transport und bei der Ausruestung. Die Tauchgaeste muessen zu den entsprechenden Orten ueber Land transportiert und betreut werden. Je nach Tour muss die Ausruestung / Tanks komplett fuer mehrere Tage mitgenommen werden.

Um das auf die Beine zu stellen ist eine Investment - Summe von ca. USD 35.000 notwendig.

Die Investitionen werden sein:

Transporter mit Trailer fuer Personen und Ausruestung, transportabler Kompressor, spezielle Tankventile ( Rechts / Links ) fuer Sidemount - Konfiguration, Tanks, Tauchausruestung, Ausbau des Trailers als kleine fahrende Tauchschule. Genehmigungen und Versicherungen.

Wir moechten natuerlich nicht das Ihr Geld gebt und nicht davon habt. Wir werden je nach Einzahlungs - Summen entsprechende Gutscheine vergeben, die bei uns eingeloest werden koennen. Denn wenn wir so etwas machen, dann solltet Ihr, egal ob Taucher oder Nicht - Taucher einen Nutzen davon haben.

Da die meissten von Euch ja ueber die sozialen Netzwerke mit uns verbunden sind, werden wir Euch staendig ueber den Fortschritt der Kampagne informieren. Bei nicht erreichen der erforderlichen Summe werden wir versuchen mit dem eingegangenen Geld, das Projekt zumindest zu starten bis die Restsumme finanziert werden kann.

Wir sind sehr zuversichtlich das unsere Kampagne funktionieren wird, denn alle Gaeste die wir befragen, haben den Wunsch sich individueller in Ihrem Urlaub zu bewegen und Dinge zu erleben die nicht von einer breiten Masse angeboten werden.

Uwe Rath mit seiner 25 jaehrigen Erfahrung in der Dom.Rep. ist einer der wenigen der diese Touren mit Sinn und Verstand anbieten kann. Das laesst sich in den sozialen Netzwerken nachlesen.

Die Investitionen werden sein:
Transporter mit Trailer fuer Personen und Ausruestung, transportabler Kompressor, spezielle Tankventile ( Rechts / Links ) fuer Sidemount - Konfiguration, Tanks, Tauchausruestung, Ausbau des Trailers als kleine fahrende Tauchschule. Genehmigungen und Versicherungen.
Wir moechten natuerlich nicht das Ihr Geld gebt und nicht davon habt. Wir werden je nach Einzahlungs - Summen entsprechende Gutscheine vergeben, die bei uns eingeloest werden koennen. Denn wenn wir so etwas machen, dann solltet Ihr, egal ob Taucher oder Nicht - Taucher einen Nutzen davon haben.
Da die meissten von Euch ja ueber die sozialen Netzwerke mit uns verbunden sind, werden wir Euch staendig ueber den Fortschritt der Kampagne informieren. Bei nicht erreichen der erforderlichen Summe werden wir versuchen mit dem eingegangenen Geld, das Projekt zumindest zu starten bis die Restsumme finanziert werden kann.
Wir sind sehr zuversichtlich das unsere Kampagne funktionieren wird, denn alle Gaeste die wir befragen, haben den Wunsch sich individueller in Ihrem Urlaub zu bewegen und Dinge zu erleben die nicht von einer breiten Masse angeboten werden.
Uwe Rath mit seiner 25 jaehrigen Erfahrung in der Dom.Rep. ist einer der wenigen der diese Touren mit Sinn und Verstand anbieten kann. Das laesst sich in den sozialen Netzwerken nachlesen.

story:
The first annual Roseville Zombie Walk is coming to Vernon Street on October 27th, and we want you to be a part of the fun and excitment! The Downtown Roseville Merchants Association is a non-profit group who loves giving back to the community it serves. The Zombie Walk is an extension of Family Fun Night which occurs annually on the Thursday before Halloween. Our goal is to make the Zombie walk a FREE recurring event as well. 

The Zombie Walk invites everyone, young and old, to dress up as the undead and lurk through the streets of Downtown Roseville. Zombie walks are a quickly growing phenomenon with events being held all around the world and we are excited to bring this FREE event to local Zombie lovers.

The event is scheduled to take place on Friday, October 27th beginning  at  4:30 pm in the Vernon Street  Town Square.  The walk itself will begin at 6:00 pm, with registration, food trucks, make-up application and Monster Midway carnival games taking place before then, The walk will begin and end in the Vernon Street Square and cover approximately 8 blocks.  Afterwards we will be issuing tickets to our top contributors for a private viewing of George Romero's 1968 classic "NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD."

We are excited to bring the Zombie Walk experience to Roseville. However, becuase it is it's initial run, and we are  a non-profit organization, we need your help to make sure it is a successful FREE event. The money will go towards the infrastrucure needed to keep everyone safe (crowd control), entertainment, games, insurance, permits  and advertising to help market the event to all interested participants and spectators. 

By contrbuting to this event, you not only get some really cool perks, but you get to help kickoff an exciting new tradition that we hope will become an annual event for many years!

All perks will be available for pick up at the Zombie Walk on October 27th, or you can arrange for pick up t a different time if needed.

story:
Design on a Mission

Join us in welcoming home adopted & foster children! I have always had a passion for adoption, and recently interior design. I never knew how these two things aligned until now. I am launching Bloom Family Designs with the mission to create beautifully designed rooms for adopted & foster children, at no cost to the families. 

My heart is that this will help serve adoptive and foster families in a tangible way so they can have more means and time to focus on welcoming home their soon to be child.

What We Need

In order to continue creating spaces for adoptive/foster families, I need partners to come alongside us financially. I am looking to raise our initial launch expenses in order to create 10-12 rooms for adoptive/foster families and to help with the training to gain our non-profit status.

  • Our Goal is to raise $15,000 in 21 Days
  • July 5th-July 26th at 11:59pm PDT

The Impact

Each contribution is not just about creating a beautiful space for these children. It is about tangibly serving these bold parents who have said "Yes!" to adoption/foster care. As well as, making an impact on each child that walks through those doors by helping to foster an environment that proclaims, "You are wanted, worthy, safe, beautiful, and loved. You are home!

Ways You Can Help

I ask you to consider donating to our mission today. Whether it be $5 or $500, no amount is too small. Each partner brings us one step closer to making Bloom Family Designs a reality. You can be a part of this incredible mission and help welcome each child home!

I understand that some people who want to help, may not be able to give at this time. If this is the case, one of the biggest ways that you contribute to our mission is to help spread the word! 

  • Share with your friends, family, co-workers, and church family
  • Share on social media using the tools above
  • Make some noise!

I appreciate each of you more than you know. Thank you in advance for your support!

Melissa Whitlock
Founder of Bloom Family Designs

story:
Plan Your Next Vacation - Preserve Our Destination 

Dear Friends,

As the headlines grow darker by the day, here in Costa Rica, where we depend on tourism for our livelihood, we know as well as anyone that only by restricting our exposure to one another can we hasten the end of the pandemic. Just as you are doing, we are staying at home, and our schools and businesses are closed.

But by denying us – all of us – the opportunity to travel, this crisis also helps reinforce its singular importance: the way travel opens your mind, challenges you, inspires you, changes your perspective, even changes your life. (Or at least introduces you to the exhilaration of ziplining over the forest canopy or seeing turtle hatchlings on the beach.)

And while we know this crisis will pass, until it does Pension Santa Elena and Pension Playa Samara are accepting ALL cancellations without fees and assisting our visitors with their questions and concerns, making it easier for our guests to focus on the important things: family, work and home. 

As we wait for life as we knew it to resume, you can help preserve our destination and plan your next vacation now. We know you can’t travel this season so we are offering Travel Packages that you can lock in at Special Rates: with no blackout dates, they are transferable and good for travel anytime in 2020, 2021 and 2022.  Your commitment today helps not only our Pension Family through this financially challenging time but also supports local tour companies, employees and our communities.

story:
Short Summary

Exclusive holiday stockings that reflect your personality (or your friends/families as they also make fantastic gifts) is just the beginning for stock it to you. 

We've got big goals for a small business. Including lowering the carbon footprint and reducing waste.

2021 goals include launching limited lines from up and coming artists and adding aprons to the inventory.

Want to know what we've got planned for 2022 and beyond? Contact us!

What We Need & What You Get

Break down:

  • Our goal is $50,000 for start up expenses. This will cover not only business expensese and the materials for your support perks, but also the space to create, manufacture, and ship our inventory.
  • As your level of support increases so do your perks i.e. more stockings!
  • If our entire goal is not met the funds raised will be used for the materials & manufacturing of perk items. Any remaining monies will be used for business expenses i.e. webhosting, licensing, taxes, etc.

The Impact

By choosing to support this campaign:

  • You're contributing to the success of a female owned small business.
  • You're reducing waste by investing in a high quality durable item.
  • You will feel joy each year you reflect your personality when hanging your stocking.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk Stock It To You faces is low support numbers. Without enough support space for manufacturing will require out of pocket cost which means long days at work & nights manufacturing (or vice versa).

  • We're willing to put in the long hours, day and night, to get Stock It To You up & running.
  • We are constantly reviewing and rewriting our plan to track what is working and where we need to make adjustments.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
1. About the Campaign

One of my fondest childhood memories is going to the bookstore with my parents and getting lost in the stacks. We lived in a rural area, so it was a rare treat when we went to the nearest town with a bookstore to visit (about an hour away from my home)- a bookstore that has since closed, to my sadness.  Those visits are part of what inspired my love of books, and my desire to someday manage a bookstore. 

The online wing of the Red Hen Bookshop has been up and running on a small scale for four years now, and it is time for the next stage. The goal of this campaign is to fund the purchase of a mini camper to convert into a small Bookmobile, to enable the Red Hen to take books to the rural areas of the state that could not support a brick and mortar store full time.

Every bit helps to bring the bookstore experience to the rural areas of Missouri.

The Ask (and the Perks)

The cost of the mini camper is $4000. That is the asking amount for this campaign. If more is raised, wonderful- that will be put toward the cosmetic work, fixtures, and inventory for the bookmobile. 

The Perks:

  1. All contributions get a shout out on the website.
  2. $5 gets a Red Hen Stuffie
  3. $15 gets a hand printed tote bag
  4. $25 gets a hand printed scarf
  5. $35 gets a Classic color scheme mug
  6. $50 gets a mug and scarf or tote- dealer's choice
  7. $75 gets a swag pack of everything
  8. $100 gets books for six months
  9. $150 gets books for a year

The Impact

More books reaching more people, and in a way that enables them to support small business. Encouraging a love of reading is a key goal of the Red Hen Bookshop, and lifelong reading has so many benefits to the reader and their community. 

What Can Go Wrong?

Worst case scenario is the campaign fails. No money, no bookmobile. The idea gets shelved for a few more years. What else? The $4000 is not met. In that event, whatever is raised goes into the bookmobile "pot" until enough money from sales can be added to it to cover the costs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Love the idea, wish you could support it, but the pandemic/life/everything is keeping you from being able to support in a monetary way? No worries! No guilt allowed- we've all been there at some point. Other things you can do:

  1. Share the campaign using the handy sharing buttons- sharing is something anyone can do!
  2. Tell your book loving friends about the campaign, and encourage others to contribute and/or share.
  3. When you are able, if the campaign isn't here but you still want to support the Red Hen, visit the website, share the website, place an order or drop subtle hints that you want something from the Red Hen Bookshop for a gift- profits from the sale of Swag will be dropped in the Bookmobile "pot" alongside any contributions made.

story:
Why We're Raising Funds

Dear Friends,

COVID-19 is a global crisis that has turned many lives upside down. Several businesses like ours are trying to stay afloat. We started Matera just last year with the majority of our sales coming from events which we are no longer able to attend due to the current circumstances. When the shelter-in-place order was mandated in March, we worked on strengthening our online presence, but still faced a huge challenge as a new, small business. Despite this, we are grateful and believe we can get through this all together while helping others in need along the way as well.

We understand that other businesses such as ours and other individuals in communities are struggling due to COVID-19 and we'd like to help. This campaign is launched so that we can still share the benefits of yerba mate while supporting others. 10% of funds will go toward supporting local hospitals in California and vulnerable communities in Argentina. Please, help us, help others.

Matera’s vision is to create social impact while fostering a global yerba mate community. The mission is to share the healthy and energizing benefits of Argentinian loose leaf yerba mate with more people. It was founded by us, Vir from Argentina, and Lina from the US. More than ever, we feel very connected to help vulnerable communities in the US and Argentina.

In California, Jiaren Cafe is one of our partners and a nonprofit neighborhood cafe in Santa Clara. We are supporting them by helping to provide free mate and drinks to local hospitals. Drinks are going to Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara), Santa Clara Valley Center, O'Connor Hospital, El Camino Health, Palo Alto Medical Foundation (Palo Alto) and other health care locations. 


In Córdoba, Argentina, families in El Milagro neighborhood are facing difficult circumstances. Not able to work, families are supporting each other with limited groceries and sanitary elements. It costs $500 Argentinian pesos (less than $8) to provide essential groceries for a family for a week and $250 Argentinian pesos (less than $4) to have a sanitary kit.


Matera & the Benefits of Yerba Mate

Yerba mate is rich in antioxidants (more than green tea) that boosts energy and focus naturally and supports the immune system and high caffeine (like coffee) but without the jitters or crash.  One serving of Matera yerba mate is all you need for sustainable energy throughout the day and other health benefits.
 

 

Matera yerba mate is sourced from small-scale producers in Argentina so with your order you are supporting them and their artisan craftsmanship. Yerba mate leaves require an aging process — which can take anywhere from one month to three years. The longer it is aged, the better the quality and softer the taste. Matera yerba mate has been aged for over a year and has an earthy taste and no additives.


What You Get & How You’re Helping

10% of all funds we raise will go directly to the cause of your preference. Please, let us know which cause you would like to support or if you would like it donated to both! If no selection is made we will contribute to both.

Choose from the following 4 options: Support with a donation, Just Yerba Mate 1kg bag, Starter Kit with individual packets, or Starter Kit with 1 kg bag.


How To Enjoy

The Matherma includes a detachable infuser for the yerba mate. Uncap the infuser to pour the yerba mate in, put the cap back on the infuser, put the infuser back in Matherma, and pour cold or hot (not boiling) water over the infuser. Similar to steeping tea, the warmer the water, the stronger the taste. You can take out the infuser or leave it in before you drink.


Risks & Challenges

We are ready for delivery, but with the state we are in due to COVID-19, things can be uncertain. If there is a delay we will be in touch.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that donating may not be possible for all due to the financial implications of this global crisis. If you can, please consider sharing this campaign with others. Find us on Facebook or Instagram: @drinkmatera or reach out to us at hello@drinkmatera.com

Our thoughts go out to everyone who has been impacted by this global crisis and we’re wishing you all safety and health. Thank you for your kindness and support as we work through this together.

story:
The Story of QuikFix:

The owners of QuikFix Tech Repair, Aaron Offenberger (myself) and Ken Gibb, have been friends for over 20 years and are now small business owners!

We have been in the electronics repair industry for a combined 12 years and have personally repaired over 20,000 devices (much of that being right here in Toledo)! We have built an incredible reputation in the Toledo area, being known at the Honest and Friendly tech repair guys (A reputation we are VERY proud of). 

In June of this year, the company we were working for informed us they were going to move out of the state, leaving us both suddenly unemployed. We decided there is no time like the present, and decided to open our own repair shop. And thus, QuikFix Tech Repair was born! 

We want to raise the bar on what to expect from a tech repair shop. Some of the ways we are going to do that are by:
-Providing multiple brands of parts - resulting in prices that meet any budget
-Providing unmatched PERSONABLE customer service - customers are more than numbers
-Offering multiple repair services:

  • In-Store - these repairs are done in house and take around an hour
  • Mail-In - mail your device to us from anywhere for repair
  • Mobile Repair Unit - we come to your home or office and repair your device
     

The Journey:

On July 1st, we signed the lease for what would become our storefront and started planning immediately, as we wanted to open as soon as possible and get back to work!

The following images are our mock-ups for the product displays and exterior:

The building was built in 1950 and was used as an automotive repair shop (notice the outlines of the old car ports on the right side of the exterior). It has been many things over the years, but was most recently a convenience store, which moved to a different location in 2014. The building has remained vacant, until now!

So, as you can see, we definitely had a lot of work ahead of us!

Fast forward to today, August 23rd. We opened our doors on August 5th and are making more and more progress toward our vision in the mock-ups! As I'm sure you know, a lot goes into opening a business...namely money! That's where you can help!

We have broken down our major projects into phases:
*Bold means the project has been completed*

Interior Remodel

  • Clean
  • HVAC
  • Build Lobby Wall
  • Repair Slat Wall
  • Paint
  • Alarm System/Security System/Locks
  • Repair Display Counters
  • Convert lighting to LED
  • Inventory
  • Computer/POS system/Internet/Phone
  • Furnish
  • Custom Signage/Adverts


Pylon/Readerboard signs

  • Pylon sign permit
  • Convert Pylon to LED
  • Install Pylon QuikFix Signs
  • Readerboard backing
  • Readerboard letters
  • Convert Readerboard to LED

 

Exterior Remodel

  • 'Car Port' Rebuild (Leaks)
  • Rent Dumpster/Schedule Pickup
  • Paint QuikFix Stripes
  • Custom Signage/Adverts
  • Pull and Cap Roof Lighting
  • Update Parking Lot Lighting

Check out where we are so far:

 

We have accomplished A LOT in just under two months; however, there is much more to do!

 

How Your Donation Will Be Used:

Your contributions help us recover from the major upfront costs of opening a business, complete our remodel goals (listed above), as well as help us with operational costs such as payroll (we haven't been paying ourselves these last two months!), perishables, etc.

You can contribute as little as $2!

 

What You Get For Your Donations:

You can choose to contribute without a perk, or you can check out the awesome perks we have set up at various contribution amounts!
story_txt:
The Story of QuikFix:
The owners of QuikFix Tech Repair, Aaron Offenberger (myself) and Ken Gibb, have been friends for over 20 years and are now small business owners!
We have been in the electronics repair industry for a combined 12 years and have personally repaired over 20,000 devices (much of that being right here in Toledo)! We have built an incredible reputation in the Toledo area, being known at the Honest and Friendly tech repair guys (A reputation we are VERY proud of). 
In June of this year, the company we were working for informed us they were going to move out of the state, leaving us both suddenly unemployed. We decided there is no time like the present, and decided to open our own repair shop. And thus, QuikFix Tech Repair was born! 
We want to raise the bar on what to expect from a tech repair shop. Some of the ways we are going to do that are by:-Providing multiple brands of parts - resulting in prices that meet any budget-Providing unmatched PERSONABLE customer service - customers are more than numbers-Offering multiple repair services:


In-Store - these repairs are done in house and take around an hour

Mail-In - mail your device to us from anywhere for repair

Mobile Repair Unit - we come to your home or office and repair your device 

The Journey:
On July 1st, we signed the lease for what would become our storefront and started planning immediately, as we wanted to open as soon as possible and get back to work!
The following images are our mock-ups for the product displays and exterior:


The building was built in 1950 and was used as an automotive repair shop (notice the outlines of the old car ports on the right side of the exterior). It has been many things over the years, but was most recently a convenience store, which moved to a different location in 2014. The building has remained vacant, until now!
So, as you can see, we definitely had a lot of work ahead of us!
Fast forward to today, August 23rd. We opened our doors on August 5th and are making more and more progress toward our vision in the mock-ups! As I'm sure you know, a lot goes into opening a business...namely money! That's where you can help!
We have broken down our major projects into phases:*Bold means the project has been completed*
Interior Remodel

Clean
HVAC
Build Lobby Wall
Repair Slat Wall
Paint
Alarm System/Security System/Locks
Repair Display Counters
Convert lighting to LED
Inventory
Computer/POS system/Internet/Phone
Furnish
Custom Signage/Adverts

Pylon/Readerboard signs

Pylon sign permit
Convert Pylon to LED
Install Pylon QuikFix Signs
Readerboard backing
Readerboard letters
Convert Readerboard to LED

 
Exterior Remodel

'Car Port' Rebuild (Leaks)
Rent Dumpster/Schedule Pickup
Paint QuikFix Stripes
Custom Signage/Adverts
Pull and Cap Roof Lighting
Update Parking Lot Lighting

Check out where we are so far:





 
We have accomplished A LOT in just under two months; however, there is much more to do!

 
How Your Donation Will Be Used:
Your contributions help us recover from the major upfront costs of opening a business, complete our remodel goals (listed above), as well as help us with operational costs such as payroll (we haven't been paying ourselves these last two months!), perishables, etc.
You can contribute as little as $2!
 
What You Get For Your Donations:
You can choose to contribute without a perk, or you can check out the awesome perks we have set up at various contribution amounts!

story:
Independent bookstores are vital to our communities. Skylight Books has been seriously affected by the COVID-19 shutdown. We are asking for community support to help us cover expenses, as well as get books to those in need.

One thing we're struggling with as an independent bookstore is a sudden and staggering loss of sales due to the temporary closure of our store. Our total sales have dropped by more than half, and since we're paying our primary book distributor to fill all our orders on our behalf, we're getting a much lower margin, too. This has always been a low-margin business, and we appreciate each and every website order, but it's not enough.

So we turn to our beloved community to keep us afloat during these tough times. We are currently working on reopening to provide curbside and direct shipping from the store, which will help, but for the safety of the staff and customers the timeline does not allow us to open until May 20th. Even then we don't expect our sales to increase substantially for some time.

This campaign has two main goals. First, we've included an option to donate directly to Skylight Books; 100% of those donations will stay with us to pay our rent, vendor invoices, utilities, and other bills while we're shut down. We've set up special rewards packages of Skylight swag to thank you for those donations.

Second, we've provided options to donate books, purchased through Skylight, to children and adults who have lost access to books entirely, with schools, libraries, and bookstores all closed. Over the years, we have had the good fortune to work with some pretty amazing people: teachers, librarians, and nonprofit organizations who buy books from us and give them to readers who otherwise wouldn't have new books of their own. With the COVID-19 crisis, a lot of the infrastructure for this has been closed, as have the classrooms and libraries where readers can borrow books for free.

To fill this gap, we've reached out to two organizations, and now to you, to help us get books in the hands of these readers during the shutdown. Your donations will pay to buy books from Skylight to give to these organizations, who will in turn distribute them to low-income readers. These sales will help keep us afloat, and you'll be putting books in the hands of readers in need.

Street Fleet is an exciting new outreach effort out of the Engagement and Learning Division of the Los Angeles Public Library consisting of three mobile van units that currently provide books to the emergency COVID-19 shelters. These books are not catalogued and being checked-out, they are donations that are being distributed. This is an opportunity for you and Skylight together to provide new books to donate to this program that will be put directly in the hands of unhoused Los Angeles residents living in temporary COVID-19 shelters.

Punk Rock Marthas is a local organization we work with often, who have done an amazing job getting books into the hands of young readers since the shutdown. In fact, they've distributed over 1,100 books via the "grab and go" school lunch program and the food pantry at St. Francis Center.

On behalf of our staff and our partners, thank you for considering a donation. Books mean the world to us, and with your help, we can spread the joy of reading even during this shutdown.

story:
Who We Are

My name is Earnest. For the past three years we have been working with an organization called Dreaming Out Loud learning to run a farmers market, called Aya Community Markets, since we were 11 years old. Now I'm 14 years old and we started growing our own healthy food as young urban farmers and creating our own jobs that are more fun than working at a fast food place. And we learn a lot more too. We need your help to expand our urban farm space so that we can support more youth like ourselves with jobs. 

Now that you've met Earnest, I am Chris Bradshaw, Founder and Executive Director of Dreaming Out Loud. We are building something special and need your help to create jobs through building an equitable food system! We need the infrastructure and people power to expand our community supported agriculture (CSA) program, grow more produce at our farm, and make healthy value-added products.

We started Aya Community Markets because in our work in after school programs for children and youth, we noticed unhealthy after-school snacks and no healthy food choices in the community. In 2014, we directly reached more than 10,000 people, distributed more than 100,000 pounds of produce, and had more than 1,500 people experience healthy cooking demonstrations at Aya Community Markets (Aya). 

We have farmers markets in two locations in our City: In Southwest DC (Ward 6) and Northeast DC (Ward 7) and each site is growing. We serve communities that do not have equal access to fresh, local produce by building relationships with community and farmers in the region. Through matching incentives, called "Aya Bonus Bucks", we help folks spending SNAP, WIC, EBT, and Senior Farmers Market Nutrition Program benefits afford more healthy, fresh produce. 

What We Need & What You Get

This Indiegogo campaign will help us to continue serving our community at our two established farmers markets; invite and support new farmers; and expand our urban farm to support youth like Earnest. 

For our markets we need to get:

  • Meet our infrastructure requirements.
  • New tents and tables.
  • Materials to continue community outreach (fliers, seasonality charts, and food for community meetings).
For our urban farm we need:
  • Grow-bags that allow us to expand garden space for growing healthy food with  youth farmer-entrepreneurs. 
  • Topsoil and compost. 
  • Insulated zip-up bags for our community supported agriculture program.
  • Construction materials for a greenhouse.
  • Electricity. 
  • One deep freezer.
  • Seeds and seedlings.
  • Crop planning from small farm designers.
  • Miscellaneous tools. 

Perks!!!

  • Tickets to Broccoli City Festival in Washington, DC on April 25th. This Earth Day celebration and festival that features music, fitness, food, and healthy living. PERK MUST BE REDEEMED ON APRIL 25th, 2015.
  • A special edition t-shirt from District of Clothing.
  • A bounty of produce from our garden and our farmers market. 
  • A picnic in the garden prepared by the special guest chef in our urban garden. 
  • Our "Greenhouse Sponsor" can name the greenhouse and have their name/logo placed on the sponsors banner at our urban farm. 
  • Our "Energy sponsor" will have their name/logo on a sponsors banner at our urban farm.

The Impact

"Aya" is an Adinkra symbol (from Ghana) that literally means "the fern" and is a symbol of endurance and perseverance. We are working to build enduring community health, vitality, and jobs. Our communities have a rising health consciousness, but face gaps in reaching healthy options. We help to bridge the gap and build solutions. Many of the people in the communities we serve face multiple layers of health challenges including diabetes, hypertension, high-blood pressure, and HIV/AIDS. 

We have a broad base of support from community-based organizations, universities, faith-based groups, governmental and private-sector entities. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute there are other ways you can help:

  • Get the word out and let folks know about our campaign. Tweet about it at least twice a day. Share it on Facebook! Share it on the the Gram! Email it to folks who believe in food and jobs with justice!
  • Get in touch with us regarding volunteer opportunities at info@dreamingoutloud.org! We always need help passing out fliers, making calls, and helping at the farm. Come on through...we would love to have you!

story:
Campaña Busco Héroes [ texto en Español ] 
Pintemos una vieja locomotora de vapor

El objeto de esta campaña es hacer posible el repintado de una locomotora de vapor abandonada hace décadas.

Siempre es difícil movilizar el suficiente número de personas y conseguir la ayuda necesarias para alcanzar metas económicas. Estas son las cosas que hacen posible el poder cumplir con tus objetivos.

La difusión de la campaña es vital, por eso te pido que te sumes compartiéndola en tus redes sociales, sólo eso, comparte mi esfuerzo, anima a tus amigos y conocidos, ¡vamos a pintar un tren abandonado! 

Si cada persona que lee este texto difunde la campaña, amigo mio, el tren ya estaría casi pintado. http://igg.me/at/buscoheroes

Puedes hacer que suceda sólo por compartirlo, envíame a sufrir un enorme pintado solo, pelearé cada palmo del proyecto, os mostraré donde he gastado cada céntimo y sobre todo compartiré esta aventura con vosotros :)



Wanted heroes Campaign [ text in English ] 
Let's paint an old steam locomotive

The object of this campaign is to make possible the repainting of a old steam locomotive decades ago.

Always it’s difficult mobilize enough people and get help needed to achieve economic goals. These are the things that make possible get your goals. 

The diffusion of the campaign is vital, so I ask you to join and share in your social networks. You only have to share my effort. Encourage your friends and familiar ¡Come on to paint an abandoned locomotive!

If every person read this text share the campaign, my friend, the train would almost painted. http://igg.me/at/buscoheroes

You can make it happen if you share it, send me to suffer a huge paint alone. I’ll fight all time and I’ll show you where I spent every penny. Obviously, I’ll share with you this adventure.



¿Por qué he elegido este proyecto?
Este año he decidido realizar cinco esfuerzos/labores para sensibilizar sobre patrimonio abandonado, pintar este tren es mi tercera acción.

En la primera recuperé 116 planos industriales, digitalizándolos, procedentes de una antigua fábrica de cerámica y loza abandonada. La fábrica está en su fase final de decadencia con las estructuras muy vandalizadas. Esto me llevó más de dos meses de trabajo.

Mi segunda acción está encaminada a indexar hitos kilométricos del antiguo plan peña de 1940. Continúo trabajando en este proyecto, el cual me llevará unos cuantos meses más.

Para mi tercera acción decidí dar un pintado a este tren. Cuando lo ví me enamoré de él, pero en este caso mi mala situación económica me impide acometer el proyecto con mis propios medios. Por ello, he decidido realizar esta campaña de mecenazgo. Esperando vuestra comprensión y ayuda en dicha tarea.



Why I chose this project?
This year I decided to make five labor for sensitize about deglected/abandoned heritage; paint this train is my third action.

In the first, I recovered 116 industrial plans, digitalizing them, from an old factory of abandoned/deglected ceramic and pottery. The factory is in its final stay of decay with very vandalized structures.

My second action it will be dedicated to index kilometers markers of the old “Plan Peña” of 1940. I continue working in this project which will take me few more months. 

For my third action I decided to paint this train. When I saw it, I fell in love, but in this case my poor economic situation inhibits me do this proyect with my own means. Therefore, I decided do this patronage campaign. Expecting your understanding and support in this task.



Básicamente necesito el dinero justo para la pintura más adecuada a su situación y alguna herramienta. Un total de 600 euros, 100 euros para transporte, ir y volver hasta el tren, localizado a 500 km de mi casa, 50 euros para comer durante 10 días de trabajo, y dormiré allí mismo.

Igualmente incluyo 152 euros para hacer frente a las comisiones de la plataforma INDIEGOGO, paypal, transferencias y tasas estatales por donaciones, así como 200 euros para los detalles por colaborar, una serie de fotos del trabajo realizado, según la aportación, de antes, durante o de todo el viaje.

Necesidades estimadas:

  • 152 € Impuestos y comisiones.
  • 600€ Pintura y herramientas.
  • 100€ Gastos de transporte.
  • 50€ Comida 10 días.
  • 0€ Dormir en la calle 10 días.
  • 200€ Agradecimiento fotográfico.

    Total: [ 1.102€ ] 


Sin más, muy atentamente
Manuel Calavera (J. Álvaro Iglesias Iglesias)
Vendedor de viajes del alma
DOD (Departamento de la Muerte)

PD: Dispones de una mini-web con información detallada.
http://indiegogo.manuelcalavera.org



Basically, I need the money right for the adecuate paint for his situation and some tool. 100 euros for transport until the train (round trip), located 500 km from my house, 50 euros to eat for 10 days of work and I'll sleep right there.

It also includes 152 euros to tackle commissions of platfor/program INDIEGOGO, paypal, transfers and state fees for donations, and 200 euros for details to collaborate, a serie of photos of work done, dependind on the contribution, previous, during or in all trip.

Estimated needs: 

  • 152 € Taxes & Fees.
  • 600€ Paint and tools.
  • 100€ Transport cost.
  • 50€ Food cost for (10 days)
  • 0€ Accommodation costs (10 nights in the street)
  • 200€ Photographic thanks.

    Total: [ 1.102€ ] 

At that, very carefully
Manuel Calavera (J. Alvaro Iglesias Iglesias)
Seller of souls' travel
DOD (Department of Death)

PD: You have a mini-web with detailed information.
http://indiegogo.manuelcalavera.org


---[ Mis Redes Sociales | My Social Networks ]--------

Web  http://www.manuelcalavera.org
Instagram  http://instagram.com/manuel.calavera
Facebook  http://www.facebook.com/diariodemimuerte
Blog  http://manuelc2005.blogspot.com.es
Twitter  http://twitter.com/_manuelcalavera

---[ Canales de Youtube | Youtube Channels ]----
Canal-1 Abandonos : http://www.youtube.com/user/manuelc2005
Canal-2 Personal : http://www.youtube.com/user/manuelcdeadlog

200€ Photographic thanks.Total: [ 1.102€ ]

story:
Many of you the world over may know Mama Star. Perhaps you've dined in any of the restaurants here on Caye Caulker where she was chef. Or maybe she braided your hair. Or gave you a deep tissue massage. Many may know her more recently as the BBQ chef at Wish Willies. Perhaps you've enjoyed some of the take-out she prepares daily at home. Perhaps she catered your wedding. Perhaps you just received the blunt end of her infectious charm.

Mama Star is the mother of four fine young men, adopted Ma to many others and Granny to countless more. This has come with no small self sacrifice of course what with the hardships of single parenting in a developing country. Still, very few in need of food are ever turned away at Mama's kitchen. 

Star has successfully managed two restaurants for other folks. She has somewhat of a cult following among return tourists here and the all important group leaders. She has long dreamed of opening a place of her own. Start up capital is the rub.

But it need not take much. If successful the money provided by this campaign will cover most of the expense that opening an open air diner here entails. First and last on the lease, kitchen equipment, tenting and such are the big ticket items. The set up labor has been volunteered by those who love her. The operational labor will provide much needed employment for several others.

Please contribute in any way you can. If you live in or intend to visit Belize please note the perks. A small contribution is well worth that first meal!
