story:
Help support the first Women's Resource Centre in the village!

On 3rd August 2015, WIL Uganda celebrated its first year of delivering educational empowerment programmes to women and girls in the rural village of Busembatia, Uganda.

Just one year ago, we started WIL Uganda; with two volunteers, one class room and 20 women and girls. Over the next 12 months we have created and delivered 5 in school programmes and 2 community programmes, partnered with a journalism project in New York, had two girls published internationally, been featured in the huffington post, successfully fundraised an incredible £927.59 for our first crafts project, opened our WIL Uganda office and took on 3 more fantastic volunteers!

As a result, we are proud to say that we have successfully brought knowledge, skills and empowerment to over 200    women and girls in Busembatia, Uganda.

To celebrate our very special first anniversary, we would like to share with you our exiting plans for WIL Uganda’s second year and our vision for the future...

The WIL Uganda Women's Resource Centre!

After working in rural Busembatia for over a year now, we appreciate how scarce educational resources are and have seen the difficulties women and girls have accessing such resources.

There are over 7,000 women and girls  in Busembatia village. We would like to create the first  Women's Resource Centre in Busembatia village.  The Women's Resource Centre will be the only centre of its kind, not only in the village, but in the entire district. 

Our vision for the next 12 months is to raise enough funds to create a welcoming space that could house all of our community projects and act as an engaging resource hub for women and girls in the area.

The Women's Resource Centre would incorporate the following:

  • Busembatia’s first community library
  • The first computer lab in the village, where invaluable IT skills can be taught
  • A tailoring room, for our women to learn an income generating skill
  • A crafts area, which will act as the hub of our local crafts project
  • A new community meeting space
  • Our WIL Uganda office
  • A garden where we can teach agriculture and animal rearing, which will act as a source of sustainable income for the centre

We would love for you to be involved from the start!

We currently have one small office in Busembatia (pictured below) and run the programme with one laptop and very few resources.

Over the past 12 months, with just one laptop and one small office, we have seen the visible difference our programme has made .....

"I feel that WIL Uganda has changed me. I can now read some small words, recognise numbers and write.  I feel like I have been to school and reached a higher level." Mutesi Janeti, participant on the adult literacy programme.

Imagine how much more we could achieve over the next year with your help!

How can you help?

In order to secure funding for the Centre, we’re applying to a number of foundations.

In order to apply to these foundations, we need your support!

The initial stage of the application needs to show we have support for our project – this is where you come in!

By donating to our campaign, it will allow us to buy the initial resources for our Women’s Resource Centre and show the foundations that we have the much needed backing for our latest project!

What your donation could buy:

£10 could help us to buy a book shelf for the community library

£25 could help us to buy toys and stationary for 50 children attending the centre to play with

£50 could help us to buy a sewing machine for the tailoring room or materials for the crafts project

£100 could help us to buy 125 books for the community library which up to 7,000 women and girls could access

£150 could help us to buy a laptop or two desktop computers to bring IT skills to women and girls in the village

Other ways you can help …

  1. Donate unwanted items

Books, stationary, clothes, old cameras, laptops, tablets – send them to us!

We are collecting books, stationary, clothes and electrical items this August in London. If you would like to donate any of these items for us to take back to Uganda for the Women's Resource Cetre please get in touch by emailing: cianne@wiluganda.co.uk

2. Organise a fundraising event

As we are such a small organisation, fundraising events with friends, family and colleagues really make the world of difference to the services we’re able to offer on the ground in Uganda.

We would be thrilled if you would like to organise a fundraising event for us! We will be sharing a link soon to our fundraising resources!

There are so many different ways you and your friends could get involved, some examples include:

  • Pub quiz
  • Bake sale
  • Collection at work
  • Sponsored activities e.g sky dive, walk, song-a-thon …
  • Dress down days at work
  • House parties
  • Old clothes sale
  • Local music gigs/ comedy nights
  • Film screenings

Whatever your idea, we’ll be on hand to help every step of the way!

 If you are interested in fundraising for our Women’s Resource Centre please email: funraising@wiluganda.co.uk.

    3. Share our campaign with your family and friends!

We only have just two months to raise funds on the indegogo site. Its really important that together we share the campaign as much as possible to reach  as many people as possible and increase our chance of smashing our target.

SO get sharing our campaign through all your social media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram !!

However you choose to get involved, your incredible efforts will help us provide invaluable services to over 7,000 women and girls who would otherwise never have the chance to access such opportunities.

Thank you for taking the time to read our campaign, together we can make the Women's Resource Centre a reality! #makeithappen

Lots of Love,

Cianne, (Founder & Director), the WIL Uganda team and the women and girls of Busembatia xxx

story:
We at Americans for Heroes are looking to help in the aftermath of a soldier suicide. Our generation is facing a major struggle; better yet, it can be defined as an epidemic. We are stricken by a plague of self-destruction that is curable with love and support. The epidemic I am referring to is Soldier Suicide. On average, we lose 22 soldiers and veterans a day. That is 22 families left struggling with heartbreak. We understand the struggle because most of us have been there to help families of friends cope with such a sudden loss. We are asking for your help. Help to bring these loving families of our lost brethren hope. #americansforheroes

1.  Project Background

My name is Cris Hudson and I am a veteran. I am the CEO/Founder of Americans for Heroes and I have stood side by side with some of these heroes. I have shared a foxhole with them, met their families, and even in some cases had to render honors at their funeral. It is never easy to see a friend, brother, or sister in arms, or trusted soul fall in combat. It is never easy to look at their spouse, or child, as they are told their loved one died in combat. It is even worse to think they aren’t going home to their family, but you are.

These are thoughts all veterans have to endure. “If I could go back, I would die right beside them,” is what goes through a veteran’s mind. I was very lucky when I returned that I had such a loving, and understanding family and group of friends in my life. They never let me feel alone, nor did they ever shut me out when I needed to talk. They would sit down and give me their undivided attention like this was the most important story of their lives. Not every soldier has that. They come home to a cold, empty life. These soldiers had to do things to survive that no one can fathom, and they are dealing with this alone. In the end, some cannot take the thoughts and feel that death is their only reprieve. When that happens, they leave behind loved ones with unanswered questions. They have an overwhelming hole in their heart, in their lives, and in their souls.

2.  Project Scope

We at Americans for Heroes are looking to help in this aftermath. We understand the struggle because most of us have been there to help families of friends cope with such a sudden loss. We are asking for your help. Help to bring these loving families of our lost brethren hope. Find healing. To find closure. As most know when the word suicide is involved in the loss of a soldier, the family left behind has nowhere to go. Their house falls apart. They are overwhelmed with distress, financial struggles, and feel they are completely alone.

3.  What We Need

This company is a Grass Roots project. In order to raise funds to create a business plan to present to sponsors, grant providers, and other organizations using a crowdfunding campaign to pay for the development of such presentation. The funds collected from the crowdfunding will be used to open office in Las Vegas, NV, and pay staff to run the company.

We need $200,000 or more to run Americans for Heroes. These funds will cover the following expenses.

·  Office Space - Building with 3 offices and room for expansion

·  Office Equipment and supplies - Computers, desks, paper, software, telephone, etc. for day to day operations

·  A central locations for employees and volunteers to work from - The start staff of Americans for Heroes will be:

a.  Office Staff - In order to process all office services

b.  Grant Writers - To research and write grants for families

c.  Website and Social Media personnel - To spread the word, promote, and bring in more resources

d.  Qualifying personnel - To determine what help each family needs

e.  Fundraisers - Create fundraising events for specific aspects of help

f.  Networking personnel - Work with other organizations across the country to support each other in helping the families of the fallen soldiers

g.  Sales - Sales staff to bring money through sales of promotional space on website, literature, etc.

4.  High-level Requirements

The project itself is a grass-roots effort at this point. In order to bring the project to fruition, we need to build a business plan and a marketing plan to better implement the entire scope of the project, be able to present it to the necessary organizations that will provide sponsorships, grants, scholarships, and other resources to help the lives of the families chosen.

The Business Plan must include the following:

·  Project goals

·  Mission, vision, core values

·  Location and contact information

·  Description of company

·  Management and staff

·  Marketing plan

·  Website content

·  Financial projections

·  Full transparency of all activities as a company so the public can see the real action so that they feel the funds are being used and appropriated f to fulfil the Mission

5.  Affected Parties

The families that are highlighted through the show will be given hope and the tools for them to move forward in their lives. When a soldier comes home from a war, he or she comes back traumatized and may not be able to cope with their new reality of being at home, safe and with family.

When a soldier falls, his or her family is left in a crisis, they no longer receive benefits, they are left with many questions, new issues, and a loss of self, home, and control. Feel that they are left in a financial ruin and overwhelmed.

6.  Benefits to Affected Parties

As “Family of the Fallen Soldier,” we will provide the resources and skills to give them the independence they need to work and live a fulfilling life.

The following items will be provided by various corporations, companies, funds raised, for-profit and non-profits organizations:

·  Housing - Providing housing that is affordable to them and will not place them in a financial burden

·  Transportation - Repair current vehicle, provide new or used vehicle, or other types of transportation

·  Groceries - If the family is in immediate need, groceries and toiletries will be provided one time as an emergency ration

·  Education and Vocational Training - Seek out grants, scholarships, and other resources for an education for a career

·  Other resources as needs develop

7.  Milestones

The project itself will be rolled out in stages. Each stage will be handled by specific individuals that can provide their expertise. Some stages can overlap to move along the project.

1.  Crowd sourcing funds of $200,000

2.  Office setup

3.  Business plan

4.  Marketing plan

5.  Hiring of personnel

6.  Fundraising (grants, loans, crowdsourcing, etc.)

7.  To affiliate with other organizations

8.  Help the families

8.  Business Plan

A company with this magnitude cannot succeed without a solid business plan in place. The three months of funds that is requested is to ensure full time employment and dedication to make the business plan and pay for the necessary legalities. As the business plan development, input from all key personnel will be essential for its marketability, distribution, and promotion.

Once the business plan is completed, we will need to distribute to grant providers, sponsors, and other organizations that will help Americans for Heroes.

9.  THE IMPACT

Qualified families that are in dire need get the help they need to move forward in their daily lives. We help them by seeking sponsors, organizations, and other resources that can help each family pick up from that point and move forward. The funds collected will be used to provide housing, education, transportation, therapy, and other resources for the betterment.

10.  RISKS AND CHALLENGES

It does come with challenges of gathering money, and risks of not raising enough funds.

The SWOT analysis provides us with an opportunity to examine the internal strengths and weaknesses that Americans for Heroes must address. It also allows us to examine the opportunities as well as potential threats.

Strength - Americans for Heroes, has a valuable inventory of strengths that will help it succeed.

·  Our strengths are our key staff to achieve the following:

·  The clear vision of the families that need help

·  Strong relationships with sponsors and grant providers that offer money, resources, and contacts for success.

Weaknesses - Strengths are valuable, but it is also important to realize the weaknesses. These weaknesses include:

·  Access to additional operating capital.

·  Cash flow is unpredictable.

·  Donors are reluctant, "It goes to the founders and not the needy."

Opportunities - Americans for Heroes' strengths will help it capitalize on emerging opportunities. These opportunities include, but are not limited to, a growing population of daily Internet users, and the growing social bonds fostered by the new Internet communities. Social bonds fostered by the growing internet use. The Internet is bringing people from across the world together unlike any other communication medium. Americans for Heroes will capitalize on this social trend by providing a place for donors to be kept updated.

·  Interactive Website

·  Facebook

·  Twitter

·  Blogs

·  LinkedIn 

Threats - Threats that Americans for Heroes, should be aware of include:

·  Governmental influences

·  Reluctance of sponsorships

·  Qualifying families for grants

11.  Risk

The Risk is funding and running a company of this type costly. Therefore, there is no guarantee it will be successful the first year. Even with Risks and Challenges as with any company, it’s the determination, the donations, and the drive of the staff and volunteers that will make Americans for Heroes a success.

12.  OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Some people cannot contribute monetarily; they are other ways to help.

·  Be an Ambassador for your company or organization

·  Get the word out

·  Raise funds on our behalf

·  Create campaigns

·  Post us on your social media

·  Be a guest blogger

·  Visit us on the web

promotion. 
Once the business plan is completed, we will need to
distribute to grant providers, sponsors, and other organizations that will help
Americans for Heroes.
9. 
THE IMPACT
Qualified families that are in dire need get the help they
need to move forward in their daily lives. We help them by seeking sponsors,
organizations, and other resources that can help each family pick up from that
point and move forward. The funds collected will be used to provide housing,
education, transportation, therapy, and other resources for the betterment.
10. 
RISKS AND CHALLENGES
It does come with challenges of gathering money, and risks
of not raising enough funds.
The SWOT analysis provides us
with an opportunity to examine the internal strengths and weaknesses that Americans
for Heroes must address. It also allows us to examine the opportunities as
well as potential threats.
Strength - Americans
for Heroes, has a valuable inventory of strengths that will help it succeed. 
· 
Our strengths are our key staff to achieve the
following:
· 
The clear vision of the families that need
help 
· 
Strong relationships with sponsors and grant providers
that offer money, resources, and contacts for success. 
Weaknesses
- Strengths are valuable, but it is also important to realize the weaknesses.
These weaknesses include: 
· 
Access to additional operating capital. 
· 
Cash flow is unpredictable. 
· 
Donors are reluctant, "It goes to the
founders and not the needy."
Opportunities
- Americans for Heroes' strengths will help it capitalize on emerging
opportunities. These opportunities include, but are not limited to, a growing
population of daily Internet users, and the growing social bonds fostered by
the new Internet communities. Social bonds fostered by the growing internet
use. The Internet is bringing people from across the world together unlike any
other communication medium. Americans for Heroes will capitalize on this social
trend by providing a place for donors to be kept updated.
· 
Interactive Website
· 
Facebook
· 
Twitter
· 
Blogs
· 
LinkedIn 
Threats - Threats
that Americans for Heroes, should be aware of include:
· 
Governmental influences
· 
Reluctance of sponsorships
· 
Qualifying families for grants
11. 
Risk
The Risk is funding and running a company of this type
costly. Therefore, there is no guarantee it will be successful the first year.
Even with Risks and Challenges as with any company, it’s the determination, the
donations, and the drive of the staff and volunteers that will make Americans
for Heroes a success.
12. 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Some people cannot contribute monetarily; they are other
ways to help.
· 
Be an Ambassador for your company or
organization
· 
Get the word out
· 
Raise funds on our behalf
· 
Create campaigns
· 
Post us on your social media
· 
Be a guest blogger
· 
Visit us on the web

story:
Matilda's Farmyard has been enriching the lives of children and adults around the Illawarra for the past 15 years. We are a small, family run business ...meet the team... including George my husband...

                                         

myself Venetia ...

                                             

and Matilda our 16 year old daughter ...

                                         

who has grown up loving & caring for all of our animals.

Over the past 15 years we have been caring and looking after farm animals. We take pride in having healthy & happy animals that have a good quality of life. Our farmyard is very well known in the local area and we are always happy to try and assist animals in need. We take our animals around to local schools, shopping malls, and birthday parties to engage and teach children and adults alike about animals and how to properly care for them.

                


                      

We live in an electronic generation and it's very common to hear about children spending hours upon hours shut in their room watching TV or playing computer games. We aim to get children outside and into the fresh air, even if it's just for an hour or so to learn compassion, responsibility and to gain hands on knowledge and experience of caring for animals.

        

  Why do we need your help ? Its easy .... our mobile farmyard supports the day to day running of the business ie vet, feed, insurance, licensing, fencing bills.... but we need more space . People frequently call us asking us to care for an animal ... there can be many reasons ... ie mother won't feed the baby, mother passed away in the birthing process, baby has been found distressed and away from other animals, animal has become too large or was a mistake buy for someone ... the list goes on and on. 
Our original converted stables:
              


                   

The animals that we raise are well socialized and once they no longer depend on us for their milk and early care this helps us to find homes for them in pairs on hobby farms or return them to their original farm once they can just graze and have hard feed. However after 15 years we are bursting at the seams and in desperate need of a new barn in order to further care and nurture the many animals we look after. 
Recent arrivals.... 2 Of our newest rescues to turn up ...
Below are just a couple of animals that have arrived recently ...

                     

Little piggy turned up on the 10th August 2015 ... look how little he is compared to his brothers & sisters ... and he's heading the wrong way. The farmer knew he would never latch on & he would get weaker as his brothers & sisters got stronger.

                                       

For the first week he was spoilt and got to sleep by the fire inside !!! He needed feeds little & often even through the night every 2 hours...too much formula and he could have got the runs.
Just look at him now 18 days later ....

                           


Little "Roscoe" the South African Boer goat turned up last week. Luckily a friend of ours spotted him on a lost & found fb site. He had been found covered with ticks & lice in the bush at the back of someones house. They needed someone to care for him .... luckily a vet nurse picked him up ... treated him for the lice ... removed the ticks & nurtured him through the night. She dropped him to us in the morning and happily he is accepting his 4 feeds of goat formula a day & is mixing with the rest of our similar aged goats & lambs. Good result all round !

                                   


Our main goal for this project is to raise as near to $25000 as we possibly can. This will enable us to :
Buy a barn .....                                     $7000
Erect the barn .....                              $2000
Concrete slab ....                                $6000
Update our second hand float .... $7000
                                                             ....................
                                                                $22000
Any extra funds will be used to sign-write float & fit out the barn !
What can we give you in return for helping us..
Our Perks ...
To raise the funds we have come up with some wonderful perks !!!! They are listed but I also  had to share a few photos of them !!!!
Matildas Farmyard Badges ..... great for kids to show their support. Bright and colourful with pictures of our animals. 

                           


Matilda's Farmyard T shirts - Buy one of our beautiful t-shirts that include pictures of our very own animals. But be quick ... Stocks are limited.

       

                                              

Ultimate Nadia - Meet our beautiful "Nadia" she has been every little girls favorite for 15 years ! (Don't worry she only goes pink for special occasions & its totally natural colour ). She loves new friends & will love doing exclusive visits !! Imagine her delivering a birthday card or a bunch of flowers to someone special ... 

                 

Nadia is loved by young and old ... 

    

even though she is cheeky sometimes ....

                   

                                                                                                      Photo : Martin Ollman
Ultimate Lucille -"Lucy" Llama came to us when she was just 3 weeks old ... she had a problem with her balance & couldn't feed so mum rejected her..... she has grown into a real star .... and she is just a must for selfies !!!!

                                

She would even sneak inside looking for her bottle if you left the back door open when she was young ...

                                       

                                    Shes even been on TV ! ... with Colin Buchanan

                               

                          and posed with Fast Ed from Better Homes and Gardens !

                                              


                        Ultimate American Idol - meet "Idol" he is one of our newest members and comes all the way from Texas in America. He loves to meet people & is already winning peoples hearts ...

                          

Pictured as a baby with mum here ... he is 6 now but still only measures 29.25" ! He came 4th in the Nationals in America so probably one of the smallest spotted micro donkeys in Australia !

                                      

  Even Piggy & Idol have met the  Better Homes Team !!

             


                                  " Midweek visit from mini pets" ... 
Here is another great perk we are offering - this is very exciting we have 2 large tubs that we place sawdust and a selection of bunnies,guineas,chicks and ducklings. Its just the right height for little ones to observe, pat and feed the animals PLUS they love to have their photo taken holding the little nest baskets !! Fully supervised and ideal for small groups.

                                         

     

             

               


Signage on our float & mobile pen .. this perk is aimed at local companies. We attract a lot of people wherever we go... our horse float is very eye catching ...

                      

our new float will be slightly larger & less rusty !!! 

                              

Hows that for a queue ... it happens every day for 17 days ... plenty of exposure there !!! We even have to have designated pram parking !!!

                      


The next perk I am afraid is just for people who can get to the farm .... we are offering....
  Behind the scenes visit ... A private visit for a family of 2 adults and up to 3 children to see the farm .... the mobile farm is out and about most weekends so visits tend to be midweek or during holidays. You will get to spend 2 hours on the farm .... see the stables where the animals sleep,check out any chicks or ducklings in the brooder,feed the bunnies and guineas their treats, visit the animals in the paddocks, bottle feed some of our many babies, give Nadia & Idol a brush, deliver some hay to the larger retired animals. Give the piggies a scratch !! Feed the chickens and ducks and finally - Unlimited cuddles and photographs can be taken !!
Every perk you buy will take us one step nearer to getting our barn ... however we know not everyone is in a position to order a perk but still may want to help our cause ... You can !!! Tell your friends ... share our facebook page .... share the links to our campaign .... tell your local preschool - every little bit will help and every little bit of help we will be grateful for. 
Thankyou from the team at Matilda's Farmyard !!!

story:
* FOR FREE TICKETS CLICK THE LINK  http://christmascantata.us/2015-gcc-los-angeles-ticket-request-form/ *


In September of last year,the IYF, International Youth Fellowship, presented the Gracias Christmas Cantata at the Shrine Auditorium here in Los Angeles. We again this year would like to invite you and your friends and family to this wonderful performance. 

Gracias Christmas Cantata is performed by award-winning Gracias Choir & Orchestra, an international renowned music group whose sole mission is to showcase the life-changing power of music and performing arts. This mission has taken Gracias Choir all around the world every year. They perform in front of presidents, mayors, congressmen, educational leaders, and devoted audiences who know, appreciate, and adore Gracias music.

* FOR FREE TICKETS CLICK THE LINK  http://christmascantata.us/2015-gcc-los-angeles-ticket-request-form/ *


Gracias Choir has made a steadfast commitment to offering performances for free to the general public in order to give everyone, regardless of background, culture, or economic status, the opportunity to understand how music changes the heart, and changes one's own outlook on life.

That's exactly why we need your help in making the Gracias Christmas Cantata Tour a reality for 2015. We plan to increase the number of stops, the duration of the tour, and the scale of our production. Wherever YOU are in the United States, you'll have the chance to attend and walk away with unforgettable memories, both from the performance and that cherished bygone era of your childhood at Christmas time.

* FOR FREE TICKETS CLICK THE LINK  http://christmascantata.us/2015-gcc-los-angeles-ticket-request-form/ *



* FOR FREE TICKETS CLICK THE LINK  http://christmascantata.us/2015-gcc-los-angeles-ticket-request-form/ *



Volunteers that made the amazing night happen.

Last year 2014 we had a full house at the Shrine Auditorium


Act I


Act II


Act III

story:
After watching presenter and campaigner Sophie Morgan’s recent BBC documentary on disability in Ghana - Loulou Bontemps, owner and designer for la pitchoune decided to take a new direction in growing her up and coming luxury brand.

Through this campaign we will build a concept that will expand our brand and allow us to donate 20% of our profits to independent charities around the world – philanthropy through children’s fashion.

The £6,000 from this campaign will be donated to The Orthopaedic Centre www.otcghana.info run by Sister Elizabeth Newman and the Physically Challenged Action Foundation www.pcaf.com.gh run by Mr Barima. Funds will help Mr Barima & Sister Newman look after those they already support and open their doors to more children in need around Ghana.

But this is only the beginning; we want to raise funds via the sales of our dresses to support children in as many places as we can reach.

We aim to raise further funding to build the fashion campaign #createandgive and The Phoenix Rising Charitable Trust for us to begin reaching out to other children in danger and disabled at home and around the world.

la pitchoune is a luxury childrenswear label selling dresses for girls. After their first year selling online they have developed an audience around the globe and received great press in Vogue Bambini, British Vogue, CWB, The Guardian and more. 

‘we are at the cusp of expanding to retailers in the United States and the UK, I want to seize this opportunity and give back to where my inspiration in fashion came from, my childhood.’ Loulou bontemps

Here is a touching example of the purpose behind our goals…

 

This is Blessing, a 3 year old girl ‘disposed of due to the spiritual sickness that was believed to have caused her disability. For many others there is almost no access to equipment, education, transport, healthcare or work. As a result, many live in abject poverty. The stigma attached to disabled people and their families has shocking consequences, including confinement and torture. There are also unconfirmed reports that sacrifices of disabled children take place, conducted by so-called ‘fetish priests’, written by presenter and campaigner Sophie Morgan.

With the profits made throughout the growth of our collection and brand, we would help many more just like Blessing at the OTC and support Mr Barima in building his centre to give disabled children, young adults and adults suffering from a form of disability a better chance at life.

The remaining funds from this project will go to the design process of this collection and a new super team in fashion, business, campaigning, public relations, and social media. In order to realistically reach our goal in sales, expanding and spreading awareness, we need a strong team to build those foundations – we want to create a brand with substance that will out last us.

The inspiration for this Autumn Winter Collection is Ghana. Inspired and touched by Sophie’s documentary, Loulou wanted to help these children. After researching the country further she discovered how beautiful its colours, prints, and textures truly are. 

‘Ghana is full of tribal colours and culture, vibrant prints and textures that challenge me to create something out of the ordinary and appealing to our customers. A collection that expresses our inspiration and respect for a beautiful culture, while supporting their children in need.’ Loulou Bontemps

When we reach our entire goal! the money raised will go to launching this new philanthropic direction and the development of the collection. This will include 8 of our bestselling styles, each with 3 choices of fabrics, providing buyers a collection of 24 items to choose from. We need to design this collection in order to appeal to our market and capture the interest of luxury buyers.

The funds we raise after the £6000 contributions will contribute to build and launch…

-  The design process creating a collection that appeals to the masses in luxury childrenswear; including sample fabrics and the making of the sample collection.

- Trade Shows in order to reach out to buyers that shop for our target audience (Bubble Trade Show, Pitti Bimbo & Playtime New York).

- Public relations to create understanding between the public, product, and idea.

- Social Media to inspire and inform our audience.

- Campaigning reaching as many people as we can, while managing the funds to be as productive as they can.

- Business consultancy to help build strong foundations for the growth of la pitchoune.

- Look books, displays, advertising and more.

- To open The Phoenix Rising Trust, in order to manage and direct the funds for those in need.

The money put in The Phoenix Rising Trust will be distributed to children in danger, disabled and generally left behind all around the world.

The success of building this project will allow us to create with no boundaries!

THE CHALLENGES

This opportunity will help our growth tremendously. We aim to form a partnership with many department stores whom will sell our collections in order to reach a volume of people to spread awareness of our philanthropy through childrenswear. The luxury market is a specialised field, we want to take special care in forming loyal relationships with our buyers. Our team aims to conquer this market.

la pitchoune is a Made in Britain label. 

We have manufacturers ready to take our orders. We create our own designs, using fabrics imported from around the world and then printed here in England.

  

ABOUT US

Let us introduce our team...

la pitchoune is owned by designer and stylist Loulou Bontemps www.lapitchoune.com 

I wanted to give what we are doing creatively substance, a purpose behind its progress and ethos.’ Loulou has had a love for fashion and textiles since she was a child. ‘Childhood is such a crucial time in anyone’s life it shapes us as adults – which can be good or bad, depending on our experiences. By giving to children who are having a tough time, we hope to play a small part in making their futures brighter.’  www.louloubontemps.com

Presenter and campaigner Sophie Morgan www.sophiemorgan.com

Sophie is an award-winning campaigner, celebrated not only for her educational work within road safety (Drive iQ, U.N Decade of Action) but also her journalism raising awareness of the access and attitudinal barriers facing people with disabilities.

She reports regularly for Channel 4 News, Sky News & the BBC (BBC News, The One Show) and with her first critically-acclaimed documentary winning several awards and her next due to air later in the year, Sophie is quickly establishing herself as an exciting new TV Presenter. Most recently she travelled to Ghana to present the documentary, 'The World's Worst place to be Disabled?' for BBC Three, which aired in July https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TFAdUtKimIQ

Our team will also include experts in Public Relations, Social Media, and entrepreneurship.

The Phoenix Rising Trust will be created for this project. A charitable trust with the purpose to help children around the world in danger, disabled or whom have simply been left behind. Trustees are Loulou Bontemps and Sophie Morgan.

NON SIBI SED TOTO – Not for oneself, but for all.

The £6000 we do receive will be sent directly to the OTC, Mr Barima's centre for disabled children.

If you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help! Please share our campaign via your social channels. You may have some expertise or advice in order to help us achieve our goals and reach as many people in business and in need around the world. 

Thank you for sharing, contributing and taking the time and patience to read about our project! We appreciate all your support!

No amount too big or too small!

THANK YOU
story_txt:
After watching presenter and campaigner Sophie Morgan’s recent BBC documentary on disability in Ghana - Loulou Bontemps, owner and designer for la pitchoune decided to take a new direction in growing her up and coming luxury brand.Through this campaign we will build a concept that will expand our brand and allow us to donate 20% of our profits to independent charities around the world – philanthropy through children’s fashion.The £6,000 from this campaign will be donated to The Orthopaedic Centre www.otcghana.info run by Sister Elizabeth Newman and the Physically Challenged Action Foundation www.pcaf.com.gh run by Mr Barima. Funds will help Mr Barima & Sister Newman look after those they already support and open their doors to more children in need around Ghana.But this is only the beginning; we want to raise funds via the sales of our dresses to support children in as many places as we can reach.We aim to raise further funding to build the fashion campaign #createandgive and The Phoenix Rising Charitable Trust for us to begin reaching out to other children in danger and disabled at home and around the world.la pitchoune is a luxury childrenswear label selling dresses for girls. After their first year selling online they have developed an audience around the globe and received great press in Vogue Bambini, British Vogue, CWB, The Guardian and more. 


‘we are at the cusp of expanding to retailers in the United States and the UK, I want to seize this opportunity and give back to where my inspiration in fashion came from, my childhood.’ Loulou bontemps

Here is a touching example of the purpose behind our goals…
 

This is Blessing, a 3 year old girl ‘disposed of due to the spiritual sickness that was believed to have caused her disability. For many others there is almost no access to equipment, education, transport, healthcare or work. As a result, many live in abject poverty. The stigma attached to disabled people and their families has shocking consequences, including confinement and torture. There are also unconfirmed reports that sacrifices of disabled children take place, conducted by so-called ‘fetish priests’, written by presenter and campaigner Sophie Morgan.
With the profits made throughout the growth of our collection and brand, we would help many more just like Blessing at the OTC and support Mr Barima in building his centre to give disabled children, young adults and adults suffering from a form of disability a better chance at life.

The remaining funds from this project will go to the design process of this collection and a new super team in fashion, business, campaigning, public relations, and social media. In order to realistically reach our goal in sales, expanding and spreading awareness, we need a strong team to build those foundations – we want to create a brand with substance that will out last us.
The
inspiration for this Autumn Winter Collection is Ghana. Inspired and touched by
Sophie’s documentary, Loulou wanted to help these children. After
researching the country further she discovered how beautiful its colours,
prints, and textures truly are. 
‘Ghana is full of tribal colours and culture, vibrant prints and textures that challenge me to create something out of the ordinary and appealing to our customers. A collection that expresses our inspiration and respect for a beautiful culture, while supporting their children in need.’ Loulou Bontemps

When we reach our entire goal! the money raised will go to launching this new philanthropic direction and the development of the collection. This will include 8 of our bestselling styles, each with 3 choices of fabrics, providing buyers a collection of 24 items to choose from. We need to design this collection in order to appeal to our market and capture the interest of luxury buyers.
The funds we raise after the £6000 contributions will contribute to build and launch…
-  The design process creating a collection that appeals to the masses in luxury childrenswear; including sample fabrics and the making of the sample collection.
- Trade Shows in order to reach out to buyers that shop for our target audience (Bubble Trade Show, Pitti Bimbo & Playtime New York).
- Public relations to create understanding between the public, product, and idea.
- Social Media to inspire and inform our audience.
- Campaigning reaching as many people as we can, while managing the funds to be as productive as they can.
- Business consultancy to help build strong foundations for the growth of la pitchoune.
- Look books, displays, advertising and more.
- To open The Phoenix Rising Trust, in order to manage and direct the funds for those in need.
The money put in The Phoenix Rising Trust will be distributed to children in danger, disabled and generally left behind all around the world.
The success of building this project will allow us to create with no boundaries!
THE CHALLENGES
This opportunity will help our growth tremendously. We aim to form a partnership with many department stores whom will sell our collections in order to reach a volume of people to spread awareness of our philanthropy through childrenswear. The luxury market is a specialised field, we want to take special care in forming loyal relationships with our buyers. Our team aims to conquer this market.
la pitchoune is a Made in Britain label. 
We have manufacturers ready to take our orders. We create our own designs, using fabrics imported from around the world and then printed here in England.



  
ABOUT US
Let us introduce our team...
la pitchoune is owned by designer and stylist Loulou Bontemps www.lapitchoune.com 
I wanted to give what we are doing creatively substance, a purpose behind its progress and ethos.’ Loulou has had a love for fashion and textiles since she was a child. ‘Childhood is such a crucial time in anyone’s life it shapes us as adults – which can be good or bad, depending on our experiences. By giving to children who are having a tough time, we hope to play a small part in making their futures brighter.’  www.louloubontemps.com




Presenter and campaigner Sophie Morgan www.sophiemorgan.com
Sophie is an award-winning campaigner, celebrated not only for her educational work within road safety (Drive iQ, U.N Decade of Action) but also her journalism raising awareness of the access and attitudinal barriers facing people with disabilities.
She reports regularly for Channel 4 News, Sky News & the BBC (BBC News, The One Show) and with her first critically-acclaimed documentary winning several awards and her next due to air later in the year, Sophie is quickly establishing herself as an exciting new TV Presenter. Most recently she travelled to Ghana to present the documentary, 'The World's Worst place to be Disabled?' for BBC Three, which aired in July https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TFAdUtKimIQ

Our team will also include experts in Public Relations, Social Media, and entrepreneurship.
The Phoenix Rising Trust will be created for this project. A charitable trust with the purpose to help children around the world in danger, disabled or whom have simply been left behind. Trustees are Loulou Bontemps and Sophie Morgan.



NON SIBI SED
TOTO – Not for oneself, but for all.


The £6000 we do receive will be sent directly to the OTC, Mr Barima's centre for disabled children.
If you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help! Please share our campaign via your social channels. You may have some expertise or advice in order to help us achieve our goals and reach as many people in business and in need around the world. 
Thank you for sharing, contributing and taking the time and patience to read about our project! We appreciate all your support!
No amount too big or too small!
THANK YOU

story:
Raising Children, Racing Arizona

Lara Parpan—a freelance editor/writer  and avid triathlete from the Philippines and a longtime supporter of the Virlanie Foundation, a child care institution in Manila—attempts to finish her first Ironman, a race involving a 3.8k swim, a 180k bike, and a 42k run, to raise much-needed funds for the abandoned children in Virlanie’s care. She writes on what drives her to do this:

++++

I came to know of the Virlanie Foundation back in 1994, as a correspondent for the French news agency Agence France-Presse in Manila. My boss asked me to write about a French social worker  named Dominique Lemay who came to the Philippines and was so moved by the plight of Manila’s street children that he never left. I was humbled meeting Dominique. As an idealistic journalist in my mid-20s, I couldn't wait to leave the country. But here was this foreigner who decided to stay and help abandoned children. 

I left Manila for eight years. When I returned in 2005, I found a job in publishing, as an editor for the Philippine edition of a French women’s magazine called Marie Claire. The local celebrity we were featuring on our cover, KC Concepcion, had just finished studies in Paris and was starting her career in showbusiness. She expressed a desire to take up a worthy cause, and because of the French connection, Virlanie and Dominique came to mind. Once again, my path crossed with the foundation. From 2007 to 2012, I spent four hours a week at Virlanie’s Magellan Learning Center as a volunteer, tutoring some 3rd and 4th grade kids in math. In 2014, I was invited to be on the Board of Directors. 

Fitness and enjoying the outdoors have been my lifestyle for years now, though you can say I’m a late bloomer. I’ve been a gym rat since I was 25, a wakeboarder and waterskier since 28, took up running at 32, and turned into a a triathlete at 42. It’s triathlon—a sport that involves swimming, cycling, then running—that's now my first love when it comes to the active lifestyle. The feeling of accomplishing not one, but three sports just doesn’t contribute to my overall sense of and well-being, but an indescribable feeling of achievement. Sports does build character. Depending on the distance I swim, bike, and run, the training I do can be gruelling not just physically, but mentally too. 

In five years since I started the sport, I have finished 35 triathlons consisting of 8 half-Ironmans (a half-Ironman which is also known as the Ironman 70.3 is a 1.9k swim-90k bike-21k run), 6 long-distance triathlons, 15 Olympic-distance races (1.5k swim-40k bike-10k run), and 6 sprint (short-distance) triathlons. These five years have not been injury-free. A bad landing while training on my mountain bike in August 2012 for an off-road triathlon, resulted in a torn anterior cruciate ligament in my left knee which required surgery in October 2012. I was sidelined from racing for seven months as I went through intense physical rehabilitation to get full use of my knee again. I resumed triathlon in June 2013, and haven’t stopped. Nor do I intend to, unless fate has other plans for me. 

On November 15, 2015, I am embarking on the biggest challenge of my triathlon life: my first full Ironman in Tempe, Arizona. In the Ironman, the triathlete swims 3.8 kms, cycles for 180 kms, and runs a marathon of 42 kms after. It’s an event that takes the seasoned professional triathletes eight hours to finish. Triathletes like myself, known as age-groupers (amateurs with day jobs who are more than weekend warriors and are passionate about the sport) finish the Ironman event anywhere between 10 to 17 hours. I hope to finish the Ironman in 16 hours. While the thought of taking on this distance is daunting, I have never felt better physically, emotionally, and mentally as I do now.

As I write this, the Ironman is barely three months away. I have been training since the start of the year and am averaging 15 to 18 hours of training each week. What keeps me going is not just the fulfilment of a personal goal and the support of family, but the children Virlanie cares for, particularly the 20  infants and toddlers who are in great need of care at this early stage in their lives. I was moved  by the story of Paul, who entered the Foundation as a newborn infant. Please click on the video of baby Paul, to find out more about his story and how Virlanie cares for him.

I hope to raise P300,000 (US$6,000.00) for the Virlanie Foundation’s Babies and Toddlers’ Home. I will be most grateful if you can support me in this journey, by donating any amount you feel in your hearts to give to the kids. Think of this:           PhP 2,000 (USD 44) is enough to feed one baby for a month. One hundred percent of the funds raised through your help will go straight to them. 

Virlanie stands on a solid, trusted, 23-year history of being a reliable partner of the country’s objectives in alleviating the plight of street children. I hope you can help me help them continue their invaluable work by donating to the Babies and Toddlers’ Home. These children, your pledges and donations, will add more significant meaning to racing and finishing Ironman Arizona to the best of my ability.

Bank Transfer

Virlanie's Bank Account Details:

Name: Virlanie Foundation, Inc.
Bank Name: Banco de Oro - Vito Cruz Branch
US Dollar Account No.: 104580108577
Peso Account No.: 004580002426
Euro Account No.: 304580112833

*For bank deposits, please email a copy of the deposit slip to info@virlanie.org indicating that your donation goes to the #IronmanForVirlanie campaign.

Send a check

Payable to Virlanie Foundation, Inc.

4055 Yague Street, Barangay Singkamas, Makati City, Philippines 1204

*Kindly indicate that the donation is for the#IronmanForVirlanie campaign.

For more information, you may send an email to info@virlanie.org or call (+63-2-895-3460).

More ways to help:

- Like our page on Facebook: www.facebook.com/virlaniefoundation

Share our #Race4Virlanie #IronmanForVirlanie campaign posts on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook.

- Become a sponsor: Sponsor a child-Sponsor a program

- Give in-kind donations

story:
Our Story

Nearly a decade ago, in the Scottish Highlands, a dream was born.  The allure of the misty moors was irresistible.  Each distillery's tour guide educated us with his hearty brogue as we passed ruddy stills and learned about the near-mystical uniqueness of highland water. 

The quest was set!!!

Harnessing the power of water, we have found the perfect location!  Here, we are able to honor the rich history of distilling, millworks, and our region. 

Please join us as we breathe new life into this riverside mill!

This video shows some of what we have accomplished so far:


Article in the Bennington Banner!

http://www.benningtonbanner.com/localnews/ci_29067326/spirits-old-bennington-coming-vermont-tissue-mill

What We Need & What Your Dollars Enable

You may be expecting that we are requesting funds to purchase equipment...nope! 

We've got that covered. 

Converting a space which has been shuttered since the 1980’s is quite an undertaking!  Plumbing, electrical, septic, doors, windows…Need we say more?  In addition to the infrastructure build-out, we have also invested in the myriad of equipment and installation necessary to operate a distillery.  This includes floor drains, forklift, sinks, tanks, mash tun, still, and the list goes on…

We have the bare bones, but we want to make a big difference for our community.   

We are reaching out for your partnership in making this site a true asset to the community.  What will your support enable?

 Building Facade Renovation – $5,000 – This will take more than a coat of paint!

 Windows and Doors – $5,000 – Did you see the heron in the video?  Maybe you will spot her when you visit…if we have windows, that is…

 Beautification – $5,000 – Beyond the basic renovation of the façade, we’d like to make the building a truly beautiful place to drive by or stop in. 

 STRETCH GOAL – TASTING ROOM – $10-$15,000 – We would like to invite everyone over to our place!  With a tasting room, we can invite leaf-peepers, skiers, campers, and locals alike to stop by.  We look forward to this opportunity to promote the other artisans and businesses in the area, and even carry their products in a retail space. 

What You Get - Exclusive Perks!!!

The perks keep building right from the start!  

Shout-outs...Glasses...Bottle Vouchers...Notoriety...Parties...Royal Stature

Perks:  

New PERK!!!  Special Addition for Long-Distance Callers

$100 - Abundant Swag

For those friends who may not be able to make it over for a visit, but want to have us represented in their bar before any of their friends... We will bring everything to your doorstep! This will include an assortment of our engraved and printed items, including rocks glass, shot glasses, flask, and more! (If we could ship liquor, we would, but sans liquor, this package will still be loads of fun!)

$5 - Shout-out on Facebook

We'll let all of your friends know what they are getting from you for their birthday!!!

$25 - Cheers!

We will send you a limited edition rocks glass, available only to our early supporters. When we open our doors, you are welcome to stop by and join us in a toast!

$50 - Early Adopter

Perks above, PLUS:  Voucher for a special release bottle.  750mL – Redeemable at Distillery

$100 - Proud Supporter

Perks above, PLUS: YOUR NAME ON OUR WALL!!! If you will be visiting the distillery, you are welcome to decorate your space to your liking. If not, we will take care of this for you!

$250 - On 'The List'

Perks above, PLUS: 2 Invitations to an Exclusive Speakeasy Event for Backers!!! This event will be complete with code-word and expert cocktail mixology!

$500 - Royal Taster

Perks above, PLUS: Invitations to tasting sessions at the Distillery as recipes are developed. (Actual crowning dependent on performance!)


The Extra Mile

For those who would like to be recognized as our partners, we are offering a set of high-profile perks, starting at the $1,000 level.  These include enduring notoriety on our engraved plaque, which will be hung proudly for years to come.  These levels will also include special gifts we are procuring, like this set!  

            

Please join us!

The Impact

We hope to serve our community in a multitude of ways.  Your support will expand beyond our walls, and enable us to boost our local farms, artisans, and small businesses.  

As a family, we are active in the community, and we look forward to growing this aspect of our lives.  

As a business, we are:

 Working with farms to identify and establish our supply chain for ingredients which can be sourced locally.  

 Building relationships with local small businesses to ensure that our investments are circulating through the community.  

 Brainstorming ideas around how we can drive business from our own customer base to support our local artisans, including engagement of local artisans for specialty packaging and premium items.  

Bottom line...We are seeking opportunities to serve the greater community, and support from you will add splendid fuel to that fire!  

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge to launching new products is getting traction in the market.  This is where we need your support as we start to launch products.  Keep in touch and let us know what you like and things we can improve on.   

Tell your favorite bar to look us up.  Will add distribution as we get requests.  

For the building side we just have a few more piles of permits to get through to expand a tasting room and make a great destination.  After what we have already accomplished this not too daunting.   

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us to get the word out!!!

 Share this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers...anyone you think may be interested in supporting this work.  

 Like us on Facebook and share our page.

 When we launch products, make sure your shop keepers and bartenders know our products are in demand.  

 Take us to the party!  Our products will make great gifts, and party offerings.

 Working with farms to identify and establish our supply chain for ingredients which can be sourced locally.  
 Building relationships with local small businesses to ensure that our investments are circulating through the community.  
 Brainstorming ideas around how we can drive business from our own customer base to support our local artisans, including engagement of local artisans for specialty packaging and premium items.  
Bottom line...We are seeking opportunities to serve the greater community, and support from you will add splendid fuel to that fire!  
    Risks & Challenges The biggest challenge to launching new products is getting traction in the market.  This is where we need your support as we start to launch products.  Keep in touch and let us know what you like and things we can improve on.   
Tell your favorite bar to look us up.  Will add distribution as we get requests.  
For the building side we just have a few more piles of permits to get through to expand a tasting room and make a great destination.  After what we have already accomplished this not too daunting.   
    Other Ways You Can Help Please help us to get the word out!!!
 Share this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers...anyone you think may be interested in supporting this work.  
 Like us on Facebook and share our page.
 When we launch products, make sure your shop keepers and bartenders know our products are in demand.  
 Take us to the party!  Our products will make great gifts, and party offerings.

story:
About me…

My name is Hendrik Wierenga, I am 19 years old and my friends call me Henk. I live in Botswana and is currently a student at Northwest University, in South-Africa. I work during holidays to fund my studies. I love to help people in whichever way I can, be it my fellow student or elderly people of our community. Love animals and like to be in nature. My friends describe as being trustworthy, hardworking, reliable, unconditional, kind and honest.

Simba and me

About my quest…

I would really like to buy a 2nd hand motorcar (car), which will help me to be independent from the cumbersome & unreliable public transport system. The public transport in Botswana is not that good, and it is extremely difficult to travel around if one do not have your own vehicle. It will also make it possible for me to go home, from South Africa to Botswana, during holidays. I used all my savings, and the money I urn during part time work, to pay for my studies at the University and hence find it hard to save-up to buy my own mode of transport.

About the car…

The car which I seek funding for is a Honda, CRV. It is a year 1998 model and has 76,000 km on the clock. It is owned by a UN employee who will return to Europe, at the end of his contract, in November 2015. The seller offer the vehicle to me at a reduced price, as a gesture of his support to the quest.

My dream.

About my studies…

I am studying at the North West University in South-Africa. I am a first year student and my course of study is “B-Com Business Management and Entrepreneurial (Bachelor's Degree)”. It is a 3 year course.

My friends and I at university.

My objectives in live...

My life goal is to one day own my own tourism company, with hotels and lodges. I would like to be a kind and fair employer, who cares for nature and its resources. I would also like to start an entity which would enable students, like me, to have access to affordable funding, to obtain a vehicle/mode of transport.

Me, as a scholar…

When I was in school; I assisted in the library during breaks and helping my fellow scholars to locate literature, which they needed for their studies. I feel reading is one of the cornerstones for youth development. I also worked in the school’s cafeteria, and implemented systems to improve sales, quality of food, and the promotion of a heathy diet.  

As a team player I took part in sports such as: Volleyball and Softball. I believe that team sports are an important activity, to be a balanced student.

Unloading fertilizer at my school to make a garden.

My interests and more…

My free time is spend with my family and friends, as it is important, for me, to spend time with people you love and care for. I also love swimming and being outside in nature.

My family.

I have 1 pig, her name is “New Year”, and she is a pot-bellied pig. She is the most adorable thing which you will ever meet. I also have 2 dogs called Jessy and Josei, a peacock with brilliant tail feathers, 2 ducks, 1 pigeon and a couple of chickens. 

My pig New Year.

I also have 4 cats, its sounds like allot but all of them has a unique story behind them. To mention one such story: Shadow, my youngest female cat, was rescued at the bus station, when she was but a kitten. She was cold and starving, and I took her home and she has stayed in our hearts ever since. I have so much more to tell, which will have to wait for later.

Avani, my cat in action.

In conclusion…

I would really appreciate your support in making my dream come true.

With warm regards,

Henk Wierenga 

* A special thank you to the owners of Mokolodi Backpackers for sponsoring the T-shirts and the accommodation. Thank you for helping me achieve my dream. See www.backpackers.co.bw

story:
Mission Statement

Due to the harsh austerity measures placed upon the people of Greece and the subsequent Capital Controls, the Greek citizens are struggling to cope while businesses which deal with international transactions have come to a stand-still. It is the aim of the PFG (Peoples Fund for Greece) program to help these businesses keep afloat and prosper despite the adverse conditions. At the same time PFG aims to improve the Greek GDP by providing quality food & drink products and tourism services to people abroad.


What is this about?

Political instability, unfair taxation system, economical chaos, financial dead end and constant pounding with negativity from the media have driven more than 10,000 people in Greece to suicide just in the recent years and the figure is constantly rising while masses of others immigrate to foreign lands! We are witnessing a severe change in civilization where numbers, politics and banks matter more than human life, rights and dignity. Capital controls  and no prospects for the foreseeable future have brought Greece to a standstill with most businesses on the edge of extinction.

PFG is a program designed to support producers and suppliers of quality food & drink Greek products with main focus the export as well as develop and support tourism services. PFG aims to help keep businesses running and employ people, while at the same time do it in a way to positively influence the Greek GDP in order for the country to afford its financial commitments and reach sooner the path of recovery.

We shall use any amount we raise to its full potential but we propose an initial target of £850,000 to provide enough momentum for an immediate positive impact.

PFG will be based in the UK and the fund will be used to create an infrastructure to assist the Greek beneficiaries in development, expansion, marketing, distribution and retail in various foreign markets in order to create self-sustained profits. Part of the fund will also be used for the purchase and delivery of your perks to local retail points.


How is this special?

The special advantage of PFG lies on the fact that it is a 2-way long term investment promise and continuous relationship between contributors and suppliers. Most importantly its ultimate goal is to generate profits from the supply of quality goods and services which will be directly invested back into the program to further expand its benefits in as many businesses and aspects of the Greek economy as possible.


Why should you invest and contribute?

History has proven that all great and long lasting collaborations are those which offer real mutual benefits to all parties involved. Not only will you be helping real people in need, you will also enjoy a lifelong relationship with the people you helped while they provide you with their products/services at membership preferential prices. So please make sure you claim your PFG Life Membership from the perks.


Challenges

We anticipate contributors from around the world, so organising the distribution  network and retail points will be a huge challenge by itself. However, we shall do our best to fulfil our promise as soon as possible and will keep you up to date with our progress. It is worth noticing that the more people we have to serve in each area, the easier and more cost effective it will be, so please share our campaign with your local groups.

In order to guarantee a quality service on competitive prices we have limited the delivery of some of your perks to a specific set of countries. If your country is not listed, please register your interest and contribute by selecting one of the perks which are available Worldwide. If we get enough interest for a non-listed country we shall look into it.

  • Contributors in the UK should expect their perks in good time well before Christmas while deliveries to other European countries and other continents may take longer. More information about delivery dates in due course.
  • Where a local collection point cannot be organised, a postal surcharge may be requested before the delivery of the goods.


FAQ

We anticipate there will be a lot of questions as you read through our campaign which is why we have set up a website and accounts on popular social media sites. We value your feedback and suggestions so please get involved.

Following are a few of the most popular questions we have already been asked.

- Can I buy more than one perks?

Yes, you can and please do! :)

- Can I buy a perk as present for a friend?

Yes, you can! Most of the perks are designed to be great gift ideas.

- I got an idea for a perk I don't see listed. Would you consider it?

Yes, we shall! If you have an idea for a perk we have not thought about please do get in touch and let us know about it.

- I like a perk but it is not available in my country. How do I get it?

Due to transport restrictions for heavy items containing liquids and glass, some of the perks are not available at the start of the campaign outside of the UK. If you would like that particular perk, just get in touch and we shall investigate the possibility of posting to your country.

- Where is the PFG product list?

There is no set product list yet. However, you should expect to see popular Greek food & drink products like olive oil, ouzo, olives, oregano, honey etc. to name a few. As more products are added on the list they will get published on our website and social media accounts.

If there is a particular product you would like to see in a store near you let us know and we shall do our best to find a good producer and trial it out in your area.

- Will I be able to buy PFG food & drink products after the end of the campaign?

Yes. We aim to setup a continuous supply of great products near all areas with PFG contributors with the collaboration of local deli and other food stores. Isolated contributors in remote areas may still be able to purchase PFG products through an online delivery service.

- Is the price for the Olive Tours and Holidays perks inclusive of my air fares?

As we really do not know where everyone will be travelling from, it is unrealistic to have a price inclusive of air fares. Hence, the price for the tourist perks does not include your air tickets and you should make your own travelling arrangements. Nevertheless, PFG shall provide all the necessary guidance to help you get to your destination easy and affordable.

- Does the perk price include delivery?

The price on the Postcard and Voucher perks are inclusive of the delivery.

In order to keep expenses to a minimum, delivery of the product perks like Golden PFG will be attempted to be delivered for collection to a local store which will stock PFG products. For cases where this will not be possible, you may be required to pay a small postal fee to have the goods delivered at your registered address.

- Why do you need my address for the PFG Life Membership?

All the perks which include the PFG Life Membership require your address. This is necessary in order for us to start working on finding suitable local retail points in your area which are willing to stock PFG products.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Donations are very welcome.
  • Please share this campaign NOW with your family, friends, neighbours and work colleagues.
  • Follow us on our social media accounts to be kept updated when we post other ways to help as the project goes live and develops and new needs arise.
Every contribution and help we receive is highly appreciated!

THANK YOU for your support, feedback and shares.

story:
Short Summary

http://abcnews.go.com/Travel/avoid-bag-fees-mobile-ad/story?id=34309668

http://www.springwise.com/adverts-luggage-pay-customer-baggage-fees/

http://www.today.com/money/how-avoid-airline-ba...

http://www.fox4news.com/trending/25913712-story

I HATED PAYING FOR BAGGAGE FEES! SO I DID SOMETHING ABOUT IT! 

When ever I go the airport, I see so many folks at the front of the ticketing line going into their luggage and trying to swap items from one piece of luggage to the next. Sometimes not being very successful and they end up paying the dreaded penalties for being over weight. 

SO I CAME UP WITH A WAY TO HELP EVERY TRAVELER IN THE WORLD! I HOPE YOU LIKE IT TO! 

ORION TRAVEL TECHNOLOGIES announces the 1st Mobile luggage billboard that can travel the world in one day!

ORION Luggage is the first luggage technology company that gives back to it's customers by offering them free round-trip baggage fees while traveling on Commercial Airlines. We will pay your round-trip Baggage fees by becoming the world's first Patent Pending traveling billboard trolley with a front and back advertising.  Cool images are Molded into the plastic that is permanent along with a personalized touch for every traveler. ORION allows customers to personalize their own luggage with a  super graphic that they can choose from.  Everyone gets to pick their choice from a number of on-going promotional campaigns that are being conducted throughout the year.

What We Need & What You Get

Use of Funds

Orion Travel Tech, Inc.  is looking for $30,000 to build out an Online Travel Portal (A Facebook for travelers) to coincide with our Orion Travel Billboard. Why you ask? Because over 53% of the US population does not take their paid vacation per year! The Number one reason is that they have no one to go with! They cannot coordinated their vacation dates with family or friends so they don't take them.  They just don't want to go by themselves and they have no way at the moment to find or meet travelers with their same interests. Our new travel site pairs them up with people from around the world with their same tastes and within their own bucket lists.  Orion Travel Tech is introducing a "Friends for Life" Travel Campaign that will pair folks from around the world.  There will be no more excuses not to use your paid vacations!  Don't Just "Think different", "BE DIFFERENT"! is Orion's Motto!

The Orion Travel Portal will tie in with our Mobile phone app projects that will allow our customers to be in touch with friends, trends, travel and weather alerts in real time from their mobile devices. 

Our goal is to raise $30, 000 to complete the Orion Travel Tech Portal project and our mobile phone tie-in projects that will allow our customers the ability to do everything from their mobile devices. Our mobile programs will be available in Android and in Apple IOS.  This project is now in progress and will be completed by November 25, 2015.

The Impact

Our Campaign will spread like wildfire and let the world know that there is another way of not having to deal with baggage fees and not having the excuse of not taking your paid vacation.  With our sponsorship driven mobile billboard,  Orion Travel Technologies will pay your baggage fees and give you a brand new 2 piece set of luggage just to prove our way of thinking! WOW!  Everyone is Happy! The airlines, the travelers, the sponsors, and the advertisers!

The greatest gift is that the folks who have been using excuses for years and not taking their paid vacations now have a way to go enjoy the world. Now no more excuses! It's waiting for you, so give it a try! You won't regret it! So come back with great stories to tell and be totally revitalized. 

ASK A QUESTION?

Our first mobile luggage billboard campaign is set to roll out in February 2016 with an announcement to the press. We anticipate 4-10 programs in 2016 and 25-50 in 2017.

We also anticipate many questions and most will be answered within a 24 hour period.

We will also implement another video half way through our INDIEGOGO Campaign. We will be sending out press announcements to let you know whats happening in the course of our INDIEGOGO campaign. 

Our Travel Technology Programs will launch starting in November 2015 and be available worldwide in January 2016.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please become an Orion Super Trooper and get the word out and join our cause to get folks like you and I to travel without fear and to have an upper hand when traveling.  Orion Travel Technologies, Inc. is here to make travel fun again and to help bring the world a better traveling experience.  Feel free to go to our web site and find out more and sign up for our "we pay your luggage fees" program!

  • Please do not hesitate to use the INDIEGOGO share tools!

story:
I learned of the existence of Yarmouk’s legendary piano when I visited the Yarmouk refugee camp last year for the 1st time.

The refugees of Yarmouk, whose population once exceeded 250.000 habitants, dwindled throughout the Syrian civil war to 12.000. Yarmouk’s people have been under siege since 3 years, it’s residents are deprived of food, water, electricity and medical supplies. The suffering they have endured in the camp is reflected in the voices I have heard during my first visits to the camp- See more here:

http://www.middleeasteye.net/news/pictures-life-and-death-yarmouk-992435842

Another important voice I heard inside the camp is  the one of the incredibly talented musician Ayham Ahmad who played resistance songs and gave people hope during this deadly siege. But then 'evil fighters' infiltrated the camp, told him that 'music is a sin’, poured petrol on his piano, set it alight and theatened to kill him. That's when Ayham realized that he could no longer stay in Syria, that he had to get his family to safety.

Ayham is now part of the Syrian refugee crisis, he’s trying to make his way to Germany.

The pianist has been sharing his "Dairies Of a Traveller In The Sea" on his Facebook:

"I went out with my wife and my kids... but my parents refused to leave the camp.
I went out of the camp to Damascus and it was the first time for me to make music out of the siege.
I met my best friends.... we used to meet everyday before the siege in Yarmouk camp.
And then I continued the journey to Homs and I paid a lot of money to get from Damascus to north Hamah but after that I was arrested for three days with my wife and my kids for the guilt of trying to travel in an illegal way.
The court in Homs gave me a paper of release ."

‘Boats of death’:

“I went from Antioch to Izmir and the situation was terrible, the people were sleeping in the streets and their blankets were just the sky, cause the hotels were very expensive it costs 30 turkish pounds almost 15 US Dollars, per person for each night, and no one like us just got out of a war zone can afford that !, so we took the streets as shelters for our night, and here i met the smugglers who are shipping the people to greece with an unbelievable way using a tiny plastic boat, the percentage of the people that under risk of drowning is 30 %."

'The smuggler':

I got to know a smuggler named Abu Mohammed, and he seemed as a good religious man or a man of morals if i could say so !, so i felt safer that he will never play games, or cheat us, but he was just like the other smugglers all he care about is the money, he took us to a flat where we can stay until it is time to leave, no human could ever live in that flat, a really bad flat, it was so crowded, like the whole humanity was in there, 40 people in each room, the situation was really miserable”


Ayham's only wish now is to reach Germany and start a new life with his family and continue spreading hope and peace through his music .

After being inundated by requests from supporters from all over the world, I decided to start this fundraiser campaign - although he refused. I am confident that we can reach this goal together and help Ayham pushing out messages of hope and peace from Europe to his people who remain trapped inside the Yarmouk refugee camp.


Laila Ben Allal is a Belgian-Moroccan multimedia journalist based in Luxembourg, she has visited the Yarmouk refugee camp several times. She is currently working on a book where she combines portraits, testimonials, cultural details and history to highlight the plight of Palestine refugees in Yarmouk.
