story:
Bunbury insight Food Truck Festival

Hi all, Bunbury insight here.
We recently posted an idea to our 9000+ strong audience, asking if you would like to see a food truck festival themed event in Bunbury.

The response was absolutely overwhelming, with over 2500 pledging to attend.
And we are well underway, having sought quotes for all the big ticket items, and initial council approval, and vendors, all ready to go.

We now need to progress this idea and get it off the ground.
//We have calculated that a budget of roughly $3000-4000 will cover all of the incidentals, operating costs, insurance and more. Any less than this, and we risk potentially loosing money. Any more, and surplus will go towards Homelessness local charity causes. Please ignore the total pledge price of $5000USD. 
AUD Cannot accept credit card payments, hence the currency type.

Our last limitation, is that of finance. Being a small startup, we don't have lots of cash to throw around like many established Bunbury businesses, and doing this on our own would literally send us beyond broke. We would love for nothing more than to pay for it with our own pockets, and we already are, but the fact is, that's not going to be enough.
An event of this size has it's costs - Insurance and public liability, event grounds costs, bond, application fees, risk management, lighting, the list does literally go on, and the cost goes up.

We really want to host this free event for our community, free to all, and donate any proceeds from the event at the end of the night in the fight towards homelessness.

We recognised this early on, and, not wanting to put our hand out to our audience asking for money, we approached many of Bunburys largest businesses, seeking reasonable and fair sponsorship (more than 30 to be precise.)

Sadly, not a single company responded with a proposal, with exception for a kind man by the name of Duane W at a local photocopying sales company, offering his services to assist.

And we will continue to work with local businesses to help get this initiative off the ground and seek corporate sponsorship, however, with the lack of any input from local businesses, the only alternative to see this happen, is from the good will of the people.

So we ask and propose to you, if you would like to see this event come to fruition, consider donating $1 or $2 now, and asking a friend to do the same, share this page, and lets make this a night not to forget.

story:
Our Story

Cattleman's Grocery will serve the small, rural village of Magdalena, New Mexico, Alamo Navajo Reservation and other small communities to our west. The  closest grocery to Magdalena is 26 miles. For those living on the Alamo Navajo Reservation it is a 120 mile round trip. In Magdalena, over 25% of our population live below the poverty line, so this effort will relieve the hardship to obtain fresh foods and vegetables. 

Cattleman's Grocery will have fresh meat, fruits, produce, bakery, deli meats, ice cream shop and a commercial kitchen. The grocery will also do bulk order for ranches and those living to the west of town. We will carry some organic item and other niche products as requested.

The kitchen will provide breakfast burritos, lunch specials, soups, fresh donuts for those traveling on US highway 60, a major east west route through New Mexico.

A water collection tank system to irrigate the property as well as community use on local gardens. Water is a sacred commodity in the high desert and at times scarce.

Establishing a grocery store is vital step for the renewed growth of our community and the surrounding area.

With your help we will

  • Purchase the old grocery store and remodel the charming older section for a small scale store, meeting code - $150,000.00 
  • Purchase newer energy efficient fridges, freezers and display coolers - $86,000.00
  • Install a commercial kitchen and bakery, upgrading electric -  $150,000.00
  • Exterior face lift and remodeling, pavement resurfacing to meet codes - $40,000.00 
  • Stock items for grocery store - $72,000.00
  • Water collection tanks for community use - cost to be determined
  • Fees - $2,000.00
  • There are two additional building on the property for added rental income
  • We currently have in kind services from an attorney, financial and grocery advisor, general contractor, and the county health inspector.

Who We Are

I am Richard Rumpf (aka ZW Farnsworth a Blacksmith), the project coordinator, I have experience with international corporations, maintenance supervision with condominium and retail buildings, supervision of remodeling projects, started two community libraries. At the present time I serve as a Village Trustee, Fire Chief, president of the Food Bank and thrift store, Friends of the Library and active in my Church. I am also a Blacksmith and metal artist.

Magdalena is a great little community that needs  your help to grow.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT !!

story:
Short Summary

Lady Flower Garden was established in 2011 with the goal of providing a space where education and community facilitation can enable citizens to work together in order to transition into a community food system. We work with various inner city agencies in Edmonton such as The Mustard Seed, Hope Mission, Boyle Street Community Services and Bissell Centre to create an inclusive local food security movement alongside Edmonton's Food Bank and Wecan Food Basket.


What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $10 000 to fund a summer internship at the garden from the beginning of May to end of August. This will allow us to keep the garden open to the community six days a week, eight hours a day.

story:
Green Energy Doors Open 2015

Green Energy Doors Open is a province-wide, year-round communications campaign and showcase of individual, community and commercial sustainable energy projects organized and spearheaded by the Ontario Sustainable Energy Association. The initiative aims to showcase advancements in the sector, demonstrating that Ontario is already on the path to building a 100% clean, sustainable energy system. Don't miss this year's event on Saturday October 3rd.

Radio Campaign

We are excited to announce that our thirty-second radio spot has already been produced for this campaign, which you can listen to on this site. But we need your support to bring it to air across the province.  Our goal is to raise $20,000 to cover the airtime, in order to reach as many communities as possible. In many cases, radio stations will match bought airtime with bonus spots, so your contributions can have a huge impact in raising awareness about this year’s Green Energy Doors Open event.

Here you can listen to the spot on SoundCloud 


What is sustainability?

Sustainability refers to meeting our own needs and improving the quality of our lives while ensuring the ecological system that sustains us is healthy and capable of supporting future generations.

What is Sustainable Energy?

Sustainable energy involves the effective and efficient production and use of energy from an array of distributed sources matched in scale and quality to the end use. It isn't just about more electricity. It is about producing and using energy in a way that meets our needs and improves the quality of our lives, while also ensuring that the ecological system that sustains us, our economy and society remains healthy and capable of supporting future generations indefinitely.

Who is OSEA?

The Ontario Sustainable Energy Association (OSEA) is Ontario’s lead advocate, facilitator and catalyst for sector transformation and the transition to a more sustainable energy economy. We are championing policy and regulatory change for a more sustainable society powered, heated, cooled and transported by a portfolio of sustainable energy.

Who does OSEA represent?

OSEA serves as an advocate for individuals, manufacturers, installers, developers, municipalities, First Nations, unions, farmers, co-operatives and other community organizations, NGO's and other associations supportive of, and engaged in, the full portfolio of sustainable energy solutions.

Who does OSEA work with?

Our partners include likely and unlikely allies who want to be part of OSEA's collaborative efforts to grow the pie for all Ontarians, creating a more sustainable province and who want to help tackle the root causes of social friction during the energy transition to a portfolio of 100% sustainable energy.

For over ten years, the Ontario Sustainable Energy Association (OSEA) has been championing a more prosperous Ontario and a thriving sustainable energy sector leading the charge for sector transformation while uniting community, public and private sector proponents of all types of sustainable energy.

Together we can ensure that green energy remains a priority in Ontario. Thank you for your support!

story:
The Goal

AERO (Alternative Energy Resources Organization) is asking for your help to raise $6000 to amp up our Repower Montana Program.

Repower Montana is an ongoing effort that features homes, businesses, farms, and other projects using alternative and renewable energy technology or natural and sustainable building methods. These projects are featured on our interactive map and Repower Directory, which users can search by region or project (such as solar, geothermal, hydro, biomass, wind, etc.), and access sustainability data and resources to help get their own projects off the ground and gain energy independence.

AERO is asking for your help today to improve Repower through upgrades to our website and marketing, to help us house more data and allow contributors to update and add to their listings. Help us get the turbines turning by donating today!


Who We Are

AERO is a grassroots nonprofit organization dedicated to solutions that promote resource conservation and local economic vitality. AERO nurtures individual and community self reliance through programs that support sustainable agriculture, renewable energy, and environmental quality.

AERO was founded during the energy crisis of the 1970s to promote local alternatives to non-renewable energy sources. In the early 1980s, AERO began addressing the need to protect renewable resources, especially the natural and human resources on which agriculture and rural communities depend. AERO’s members share a commitment to facing the challenges brought by change. By bringing people together, AERO offers a vehicle for collective action and a sense of common purpose for citizens within their communities to shape a more sustainable future.

AERO’s programming is grounded in the conviction that communities are the best place to create the kind of change we envision. We believe, and our programs reflect, that the best way to effect change is by empowering people in their own communities to work towards sustainable solutions.

The Impact

Never heard of Repower Montana? Well, we think you should, and funds received from this campaign will go directly to the Repower Montana Project (see below if you'd like to support AERO generally). This will allow us to:

  • Expand and upgrade the directory and website to make it more beautiful, dynamic, informative, and user-friendly.
  • Market Repower more actively and effectively and grow our outreach, increasing the number of stories we can tell about renewable energy in Montana, and promoting those resources and narratives to those who can need it most.
  • Continue our mission and legacy of supporting our AERO members in their work to craft resilient, empowered, energy independent communities.

Other Ways You Can Be Involved

  • Become an AERO Member, or donate to AERO directly
  • Submit your own project to Repower Montana! We want to hear about it, and promote it!
  • Follow us on Facebook
  • Host a Summer Sustainability Tour event in your area!

story:
Short Summary

Please watch the video above to learn why contributing to this campaign will be worth your energy.  

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $150,000 to cover our costs of increased advertising and basic operational costs for the next 1.5 years.  If we don't make that goal we will still be able to operate but not expand as fast as we would like.  Expansion includes hiring more people to be on the phone to explain how the process works as well as administrative duties.

What You Get

We have some pretty cool perks for you.  Our featured perk is a featured business listing on Positive Business Directory.  20% of that contribution will go to the non profit of the businesses choice.  If you don't have a small business you can always gift this to someone who does.  We hope you like the other perks, but most importantly know that you are contributing to something that will make a difference in the world today.  We hope to see you at the launch party!!

Efficiency is Key!

We have already done the ground work in figuring out what advertising methods work and which ones don't.  We have built the site to get the most out of each visitor.  We have set up processes and procedures for making it easy for small businesses to set up their business listing and we will be there to help them further if they don't understand how the site works.  We are done experimenting and the money we raise will be used very efficiently.  Over the next couple of years we expect to connect tens of thousands of small businesses with local non profits.  We expect to create new relationships with thousands of non profits and send them funds that we raise on their behalf.  A milestone we hope to reach in the near future is an announcement that we have raised a million dollars for non profits over the first couple years.  Wouldn't it be great if you were there in the beginning to help get that started?!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help in monetary fashion please share this page on your social networks or send out emails to those you think may be interested in supporting us.  We really appreciate it!  Be sure to check out the Indiegogo sharing tools.

story:
Massey IT Consulting

Stephanie G. Massey, M.I.S.M.

 Hello  to everyone, and welcome to my campaign. I am glad you could stop by and take a look at my business venture. I am asking you to help me start a consulting business from my home. I know IT Consulting seems to be a kind different company to start, but it is a very exciting field to be in.  Let me explain it:

IT consulting is a service where customers can get advice on their different technology strategies such as either to use cloud storage or to store data on site. It also has to do with whether a customer has a software program in use to enter data/information, and help them determine through some steps if the software programs they are now using is giving them the most 'bang for their buck' or if they may need to change the software, re-write the software program or just keep it.

Other things that have to do with this type of consulting is that in the event the software is changed, then the consultant can explain exactly what the new software program can  and cannot do before purchasing it (which can be expensive to do) so the customer can make an informed decision. It is kind of like test driving the software by being able to look at it in a diagram/drawing specifically designed for their particular business plan.

Some of the other services I offer are for managing key players, or staff specifically when they have years of knowledge in their job and have to learn new software programs to do their work. Sometimes people do not like to change, so my consulting services have special advice  and proven techniques to get people to get along and be happy campers during the changes. 

The opportunity to raise money on the Indiegogo campaign is like a dream come true. And you can be a part of this business venture. I am offering sponsorship to anyone who is willing to make a significant contribution. That means if you like, I can list your name as a sponsor on all letter head communications, business cards, and on my website when it is built:) If you would prefer to be anonymous, that is okay too:)
Basically the start costs I am asking for  are very minimal, given I will be working form home and not leasing office space. All I really need is some computer equipment, some license fees, some office equipment and advertising money to generate business. The product line I am offering is knowledge,
 
I in-vision to  build an innovative consulting business that will set a new standard. I ask you to please fund my campaign so I can begin a new chapter. 


My mission statement is here below:

Massey IT Consulting  provides state of the art consulting following bible-based principles  to connect people  with technology. (c)

I put  bible based principles in my mission statement because I want to make it clear I am an honest consultant. I enjoy helping people. My faith is very important to me and my business be one people will like coming back to. Now, back to business..

Listed below is a copy of expenses recommended for consultants that I copied and pasted to show what is generally needed. I put yes besides each item that this fund raiser will cover. Enjoy:)

  •  rent or mortgage interest/ I have none
  • utilities/yes
  • maintenance and upkeep/yep
  • property taxes/.yes
  • Internet/yes
  • telephone/yes
  • cell phone/yes
  • office gadgets/yes
  • Internet connection/yes
  • laptop or desktop computer/yes
  • printer/yes
  • shipping and postage/yes
  • printer toner/ink/yes
  • home office supplies/yes
  • paper/yes
  • stationery/yes
  • business cards/yes
  • accounting (if you don’t do your own)
  • legal services (in some cases)/yes
  • office furniture — desk, armoire, chair, shelves, bookcase, filing cabinet, lighting, etc./yes
  • business licenses and permits/yes
  • insurance — health, life, disability, liability, etc/yes
  • car — insurance, maintenance, gas, lease/yes
  • advertising and marketing/yes
  • subscriptions/yes
  • professional associations/yes
  • meals and entertainment for professional purposes/yes
  • continuing education
  • professional meetings, conferences and tradeshows/yes
  • cleaning supplies and cleaning services/yes
  • other
  • (http://consultantjournal.com/blog/setting-consulting-fee-rates  Retrieved Feb. 6, 2016)

  • My plan is to build a start-up website to save money.  Web developers ( the people who create web pages) fees which can range from 30 per hour to 100.00 per hour. My  research showed that the overall cost to build a fully functional highly sophisticated website  total of about $10,000.00.


  • Maintenance of the office area- minor repairs to the office area and residence to ensure optimal performance 3000.00. (So I can do conference videos with customers)
  • Advertising costs to generate business,  Printed brochures, flyers, travel expenses to circulate brochures, and internet advertising expenses 200.00.

  • 5%  plus 3.5% for credit card fees of all funds raised will go to pay  Indiegogo  campaign launch. Thanks Indiegogo for helping me to make this a real campaign launch:)

 I plan to deliver high quality consulting at very affordable prices.   I have listed my campaign as in demand, because once the word gets out on what exactly my venture will do, it will be in demand. And you can take that to the bank:) So no need to worry about the low fundraising amount for now. There is plenty of time for that later down the road.

  • If I do not meet my entire goal, any funds I do raise will go  to fund my new business venture.  Please help me start my new chapter. Please fund my campaign!

The Impact

My campaign is valuable because technology is a mainstay.  As a former educator, &  Visual artist I can and do "think outside the box". I am a hard worker and if you support my campaign you can say with all honesty you have helped to launch one the of best IT consulting ventures ever.  Please fund my campaign!



Risks & Challenges

There are no risks because this is a great idea, and a very in demand service already being used by millions of companies all over the world. It consulting is a big business, I just need to get started.

Thank you again for visiting my campaign, and have a great day:)
